I must say it's not as good as the older model for cinnamon, but that is tree bark so what can I expect? Otherwise, it's good. It seems one cannot expect the same quality decades down the line.

If light brown water is what you’re looking for, this is your product. Ive only used the machine 3 times, and all 3 times all it’s brewed is a light brown water. I’m using the grinder for whole beans, I have it set on Strong, I’ve tried 3 different settings for the grind, I’ve tried listing 10 cup and only put in 8 cups of water, but the result is the same every time. I’m going to go out and purchase a machine instead of ordering on Amazon. Very disappointed 😞

I purchased my first Krups F203 my freshman year of college, 2001. I didn’t need another until April 2019. I have grinding beans in this thing practically every morning for 18 years and have never had a problem.

I had to purchased a new one because the plug wore out. I don’t know of any other appliance we own that even comes close to being this durable.

This product far exceeded my expectations! Now that I can afford a nicer coffee grinder, there is no need to upgrade. I bought Krups again. Won’t need another until 2037.

This is used for grinding coffee/espresso beans in our household and it works absolutely fantastically! You do need to sort of shake the grinder to ensure that everything gets blended up evenly, but that’s has just become part of the ritual to make coffee. Even after cleaning, there does remain a coffee smell so I would recommend not using it for both coffee and spices. Just get two if you need that, because it’s so affordable. (That’s what they do on all the cooking shows on TV anyway.)

I have owned this grinder for more than three years and it works today like it worked the first time I used it. When I originally received the grinder it was a little smaller than I had anticipated and I wasn't able to grind the volume of product in a single use as I had expected but after using it for a week or so I found both the size of the grinder and the size of the bowl to be sufficient for my application and would assume the same could be said for 98% of other users. I use this little grinder to grind lots of things from flax seed to spices and it always grinds extremely well! The only drawback that a potential buyer might want to consider would be the fact that even though the bowl of the grinder and blade are stainless steel it can be difficult to get rid of ALL of the smell from grinding pungent spices out of the grinder so the smell can transfer from one item to the next. (Example. Grinding Cumin and then washing the grinder and a few days later grinding flax seed) For this reason you might consider either avoiding those pungent spices alltogether or buying an additional grinder to use specifically for "pungent grinding." At the end of the day, I believe you won't be disappointed with your purchase!

There is something about freshly ground coffee that trumps everything else in the morning.. never will I buy pre-ground coffee again!

I looked around for a while to see what kind of grinder I should buy and finally settled on this one - so happy I did! I add some beans into the grinder, toss a dash of cinnamon into there and then grind + shake until the desired grain size is reached. Doing so will keep the beans on the bottom from becoming a fine powder and leaving the ones on top coarser. I've been using this for 8 months now without any issues.

My husband and I got spoiled by a friend who made us French Press coffee, and now we make it ourselves. Our Keurig just doesn’t compare. But it’s good for a quick cup and teas. So we then decided to start grinding our coffee beans for more fresh flavor. We were not disappointed.

This thing works FAST and does a great job too. It is a bit loud, but you don’t have to hold the button long.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not worth the money, and at this price that says alot!
reviews.reviewText: I was actually very dissapointed with this machine. First, although It grinds beans well enough it doesn't allow for any variation in grinding speed. Secondly, unless you drink very weak coffee and definitely do not drink espresso, this machine barely grinds enough beans for a regular espresso holder. Once you have ground the beans, getting the cover both off (without spillage) and back on (grinds in the way) is a task in itself. Third, yes this is an inexpensive machine. But the brand I was using before was both inexpensive and better designed; over time that may have changed and the newer versions may not work as it once did. I will see how long it takes for this machine to either break or for me to throw it across the room in exasperation.
After 6 months of use the cup/lid is cracking

Wow. They're making the blades a lot flimsier than they used to. The housing seems solid, though, and the whole unit feels heavy enough that presumably it has an appropriately rugged motor. However, not having purchased a new coffee maker in many years, I was taken aback by the blade. I suspect that the Krups is no worse (and in fact, is probably better) than most others.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compact and inexpensive grinder for spices as well as coffee
reviews.reviewText:
The basics:
This inexpensive and compact spice and coffee grinder does its job well. I bought it looking for a way to grind spices, and it does so without any trouble.

Why I chose this product:
I was using a recipe that called for ground poppy seeds and I tried everything I had in my home with no success. The food processor did not work - instead, it just pushed the poppy seeds around. The blender did not work - the same thing happened. The mortar and pestle did not help at all. Nothing I tried would break down these poppy seeds. I had heard that coffee grinders work well for grinding spices. Yes, I did have a coffee grinder for coffee, but I was also aware that you do not want to use the same machine for coffee beans and spices because the spices will most likely impart a certain flavor in your coffee, even after thorough cleaning. Therefore, I wanted a small and compact grinder specifically for spices, which also would not cost too much.

How it performed:
This one fit the bill and I ordered it. To my delight, it worked exactly as I had hoped. It ground the poppy seeds up perfectly and finely. It is easy to wipe clean with a paper towel. Occasionally, in order to clean it better, I fill it up to the blades with white rice and then finely grind it. Then, I dump the rice flour out and clean it with a dry paper towel. This helps remove some of the odor from the previously ground spices as well.

Further considerations:
I could see this working well with coffee beans too, but it does not have any measurement lines on the inside of the cup for you to measure how much you are making without then using another measuring device to verify you are using the right amount.

Exact Dimensions, at the widest parts:
Height: 17 cm (6.7 inches)
Width: 7.8 cm (3.1 inches)
Cord length: about 29 inches

To know before I go:
Even though I plan on using this grinder strictly for grinding spices, I feel it was definitely worth the purchase. It’s very compact size does not take up too much space in my storage cabinets and the next time I need to grind a spice for any reason (freshly ground spices do emit such a wonderful aroma when cooking!), I will be glad I have this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does exactly what you'd expect with minimal hassle
reviews.reviewText:
It grinds the coffee to the perfect blend, just don't overdo it or you'll get more bitter coffee (unless you like extra bitter coffee).

Compact size means storing it in a small apartment is a non-issue. It's super easy to clean after grinding the coffee, just run it under some water and remove any leftover grounds/grime with your fingers.

It's a little noisy, but that's expected because you're putting hard materials into a blender at high speed, and you shouldn't expect a $20 coffee grinder to have noise-cancelling paneling, a foam mesh weave to absorb sound, or a way to silently throw around hard objects while also grinding it to a fine powder. Find a different one if you're afraid of loud noises that last up to 5 seconds, or just get over it. You're an adult.
Hope you want your beans ground finely, turns em into powder in 15 seconds. Using it for 10 sometimes yields medium lol

While shopping for a coffee grinder, price was a big influence. Although I wanted a burr grinder the prices made it prohibitive for me. This is a great option as long as you shake it between pulses. You have to be able to judge when it's the right size grind for drip coffee. It takes practice but makes great coffee once you get some practice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Truly a great product, very powerful little grinder
reviews.reviewText: Truly a great product, very powerful little grinder, I love it! As a matter of fact the grinder is so powerful that my first load of beans (that I grinded) turned into fine coffee powder after about 30 seconds. I now grind the beans with intermittent sequences and keep a constant eye on the texture of the beans. Also, I somehow thought the grinder would be bigger, I was slightly disappointed about the size, but it's big enough to make a few cups of coffee. I would recommend this product most certainly.

Maybe I don't know what I'm doing? I scope some beans into the hopper and shut the lid and grind. After grinding, grounds get EVERYWHERE. Not a simple clean up job, but not terribly messy, just 100% annoying. When you lift the lid, you basically open up the area for a mess... so design flaw? I don't know, but I'm sure there's better products out there!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little grinders for a reasonable price and small footprint for easy storage
reviews.reviewText: These are nice, compact, handy grinders for spices or coffee beans. Small enough and inexpensive enough that it's worth buying two, one for each purpose. Simple to use, and relatively easy to clean. The blades also seem to maintain their edge quite well; still no sign of needing to sharpen or replace them (not sure they'd even be replaceable...would be nice if they were; these are inexpensive enough it isn't a big deal to buy another one when the time comes, but it's awfully wasteful to do so...)

reviews.reviewTitle: Secondary use as an Excellent Pill Grinder!
reviews.reviewText:
FYI---don't know how this works as a coffee grinder, but as a Pill Grinder it works GREAT! My mom had 14 pills to take each day...and she wasn't always very cooperative with swallowing them. I have used a variety of pill crushers-including a hammer...always hoping that the next one would be the best...and was always disappointed...but, I did read a review (and I so wish I could find it) about a man who used a coffee grinder to crush all his mom's pills. So-I thought I would try it too. I ordered the "Krups 203-42 Electric Coffee and Spice Grinder with Stainless-Steel blades, Black" from Amazon. AMAZING! I was able to easily crush six pills at a time w/ no splitting and in less then 15 seconds...have pulverized pills. The grinder works so fast! If you do order it---after you have pulverized your pills, let it rest for a minute so all the "pill-dust" will settle...then use a paint brush to "sweep" the powder from the sides. It has been a life-saver. Truly, worth the $$$!!!! And thanks to the initial reviewer who suggested this! :)

KRUPS 203-42 Electric Spice and Coffee Grinder with Stainless Steel Blades, Black

reviews.reviewTitle: The Trick is: heep your grinding to a minimum: Eleven seconds, or less !!
reviews.reviewText:
Works. Grinds coffee. And the smell of molten, burned plastic is not sooo strong as others have mentioned. I can only sniff it from the bathroom. But if you have a cold, or are not very discriminant with your sense of smell (and taste as well), you may notice it even less. It is obvious that if you let it grind for over 15 seconds, something will go very, very - terminally - bad. Your coffee will obviously taste like chewing on a recently short-circuited-blackened cable, and the grinder may blow its last breath.

Since I do not want to test my own theory [have been a R&D and Design Engineer for 25 yrs], I keep my grinding to a minimum. Even though everything that is worth being done, is worth being done slowly, this case is - certainly - not one of them.

Plastic top is really flimsy, I can’t imagine it will function or not break within 3 months. Doesn’t grind coffee with any consistency, powder coats bottom of grinder, and broken beans float in my coffee. I would return it if I still had packaging!

reviews.reviewTitle: Burnt coffee and poorly ground beans
reviews.reviewText: Thought with the Krups name that this would be a quality product, but it does a bad job of grinding beans as previous customers have written. When brewing a cup of coffee, the water would get too hot and would not even touch the top 1/4 of the ground beans that had been pushed into the filter from the grinder, resulting in a very weak cup of coffee that tasted burnt every time. I’ve owned multiple grind and brew coffee makers, both mid-priced and cheaper, and have been satisfied, but this is by far the worst I’ve ever used and I couldn’t even get one good cup of coffeee out of it. Returned and purchased a cuisinart model that works a lot better.

I purchased this grinder based on the price and because of the majority of the reviews were positive. I can grind 8 scoops of coffee beans in under 15 seconds... and that's with pulsing the blades. I keep the beans and grounds in an OXO air tight container and I have to say my coffee is good!!! For those that want to know, I get Cameron's Toasted Southern Pecan Whole Bean Coffee, 32-Ounce Bag and use a Cuisinart DCC-1200 12-Cup Brew Central Coffeemaker, Black and Stainless Steel

Here are a few things you should know:

1. It needs to be plugged in.

2. I'd say max capacity is around 8 scoops of whole coffee beans. Any more and you may overflow.

3. Definitely get a grinder brush (looks like a basting brush) to clean out your grinder after each use. Or if you're lazy like me sometimes... every 2 - 3 uses. I wouldn't leave grounds in there more than 3 days though.

4. Although this product was meant for a finer grounds or grinds... you can get a slightly coarser grind if you pulse it and shake it around a bit until you get to the grind you want. I dont know how uniform it will be but it works for me.

5. It is pretty loud. Just pretend your blending ice cubes with a blender.

Overall, I am very satisfied with the purchase. One more note is that I've been using the grinder 2 - 3 times a week for 3 months and it's still as strong as when I first used it. And... I would never use it for anything other than coffee beans (I don't want to contaminate my coffee). Hopefully my review helps.

This grinder replaced one that lasted over 20 years. What I like about is the ability to pulse grind to the texture I prefer for making coffee. We also have one for grinding spices and herbs for the same reason. I've tried other brands and they never seem to work the same way this one does. Very happy with this model of Krups Grinder!

I used to have a manual flaxseed grinder but I accidentally knocked it over last month and broke it. It worked well enough but it was always an effort to grind the flax and a lot of work only produced a little bit of product. Because I couldn't find a duplicate of the one I had, and because I am such a big fan of putting flax in my food for a variety of health benefits I decided to give this one a try.

Perfect. It grinds the flax up in no time. In fact, I ended up with more ground flax than I needed so I keep the leftover bits in a container in the refrigerator. (For those not familiar with flaxseed your body really only benefits from the seed being freshly ground up and not eaten whole.)

So I've found my perfect flaxseed grinder.

Needless to say, this works great on coffee as well, but the test for any grinder is flaxseed because it's so small and hard yet this Krups grinder worked like a charm.

Highly highly recommended. And easy to clean to boot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds very well, no help on getting the desired coarseness
reviews.reviewText:
Pros: this does a great job of grinding the beans. I tried a similarly priced product from another manufacturer, and it did a terrible job. This grinds the beans very well and is super easy to use.

Cons: All this does is grind the beans. There are no bells or whistles. There's nothing to guide you on how long to grind for the desired coarseness, there's no help on how many whole beans you should put in to get the right amount of coffee grounds for the amount of coffee you want to make.

This is great, I use it for my coffee and have no complaints. The blades do a fantastic job of grinding the beans and have yet to get stuck after a month of daily (sometimes twice daily) use. If anything changes I will update this review, but as of right now, I have no complaints. It does exactly what it says and looks super sleek on the counter at work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinder worked well for a few months before conking out.
reviews.reviewText: I liked the price of this grinder. I used it for grinding spices and it worked fine for a few months. Now it just makes a whirring sound but the blades don't rotate. Although it has a two-year warranty, the hassle and cost of shipping it back is more than its price. I'm going to buy another more expensive grinder. The one I had before this lasted 10 years before conking out in a similar manner. If only I could remember the brand...

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple, and good for the value
reviews.reviewText:
Hold it on for long enough and you get a moderately-fine, but relatively consistent grind - not at burr grinder levels, but certainly close enough, and it's automatic, easy, and compact.

Totally cleaning out coffee grinds is surprisingly hard - they stick to the blades, hide under the blades, and sit in corners, especially where plastic materials meet metal materials. I wipe it out with a square of damp paper towel and that gets most of the grounds out, though.

I actually first bought this because my sister had one that I used. It was amazing and so easy to use! I decided to get one myself and I do not regret it! It has been a life saver! It cuts coffee beans well with ease, easy to pour into the filter, easy to clean and it's sleek! It still grates loud but it isn't nearly as bad as my old one. My cats will actually stay with me in the kitchen when I use this one as opposed to the old one!

I don’t know what kind of plastic is this after using one time the stuff can’t even come off and got absorbed in the plastic , see attached picture . Also the push button to start the machine is filmsy and rattle. Not a good product .

I loved this at first. I had it set to start at 3:30am so when I got up at 4am the coffee was ready! Then it just stopped working. I could hear it grinding but nothing was actually going into the filter and nothing but hot water ended up in the pot. I sent the machine back two weeks ago and still haven’t heard back if they could fix it or send me a new one and I’m still out the $120

Ok... so does it successfully grind the coffee? Yes, it sure does, BUT:

1) It is very difficult to clean and can even be difficult trying to get all of the coffee grounds out of the machine.
2) The poor design means I spill coffee grounds basically every time I use this. I thought it was just me being clumsey until I read more of the reviews. Turns out I'm not the only one.
3) Does not grind evenly. Turns most of the coffee into a powder but still leaves some larger chunks.

I like my coffee fresh, and with this grinder I can have it. I've had this grinder at least two years, and it's still going. I paid so little for it and I got my monies worth! It is kind of load when you first start the beans (it's the beans), then it's practically silent. Well worth the expense. Highly recommend

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use has markers inside coffee container no glass.
reviews.reviewText: I just received the french press and grinder last night, I couldn't wait to try it. It did not dissapoint. I also have a nespresso machine 2hich is so very convinient but, also expensive for the caps. I have tried just about coffee maker out there could never find the right one as you can see I am serious about my coffee. Just used it today for the first time, I have to say both were perfect. Just a very good cup of coffee,actually had some crema in the first cup. So much better than the glass carafe two of which have broken. BUY IT!!!

The Krups Coffee Grinder I had for something like 10 years dropped and broke - causing a household tragedy for this coffee lover. I grind my beans and use a press pot, so this was a terrible happening!

The new one arrived the next day and mornings are back to normal. This is a great product.

I'm gonna grind my beans Mama, and put them in the pot
I'm gonna grind my beans Mama, and put them in the pot
And then I'll boil some water, and make it nice and hot.

I like this machine and it's made by Krups
I like this machine and it's made by Krups
It grinds enough beans for two coffee cups.

Yea, it grinds coffee beans. No, it doesn't have a variable setting for controlling the grind size. That's right: you are not allowed to push a button and walk away to check your stock portfolio or text your pilate appointment confirmation. No sir, with this model you are outrageously forced to stand there and hold a button for a full 15 seconds and WAIT for this machine to finish the work for you! But seriously folks, it's a Krups which means it is going to do its job for a decade or more, problem free. Here is its best feature: it is VERY quiet. Who wants too much racket so early in the bloody mary morning. "Not I" said the cat, who really digs this grinder because it's as quiet as a mouse! (:

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing and simple device that makes coffee grinding easy
reviews.reviewText:
Best purchase and value for coffee drinkers. I buy my coffee at Costco and didn't have a grinder previously, so had to grind everything in bulk when I purchased it. The problem with that was the coffee seemed to go stale a little quicker than I'd like and I had to have the entire 5lb. bag ground with the same courseness.

This great inexpensive little grinder allows me to grind beans on a daily basis and adjust how coarse I want the coffee (for french press, coffee maker, etc.). Wish I bought one sooner.

Works really well and quieter than expected. The unit is easy to clean and operate. I wish the stainless steel bowl was removable but that isn't a deal-breaker for me.

I found the unit was particularly good at making a rough grind for french press & cold brew coffee and a medium grind for auto-drop. Once you try and make a medium-fine or fine grind, you end up too much fines or 'dust' in the grind.

The capacity is also surprising. I could easily grind a full cup of beans to a medium grind without any noticeable impact on the grind consistently.

reviews.reviewTitle: Completely died after less than a month
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder smoked - yes smoked - within its first use. I guess that there is something wrong with its electrical system design. Continued smoking in every use (with strong burning plastic smell each time). Stopped working after less than a month. Perhaps used no more than 10 times - that is 10 grinds.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cheap — will only last you 5 uses.
reviews.reviewText:
We have the older model of this particular style of coffee grinder in our office at work. The one at work has been going steady, working well with daily use and minimal cleaning. It's Krups brand. This one, however, is not so reliable. I have used this grinder only about 4-5 times and it just stopped working, it simply won't start up or grind any beans. I think something as mechanical as a coffee bean grinder should be able to function properly after many uses, and the similar model at my job would indicate this reality, if only anecdotally.

The unfortunate reality is that, as other reviews have stated, this particular model is not reliable and will go dead after minimal usage. Spend your money on a more expensive one.

I love this coffee grinder ! It is so easy to use and you can see how much you want to grind the coffee bean! I use it everyday since I like my coffee strong and this way grinding the coffee bean before preparing the coffee it makes a difference and the coffee taste great! Excellent quality!!

I like the bean hopper which allows you to keep it topped off and the machine does all the measuring for you. It takes a little experimenting to get the bean to water ratio right ( like any coffee maker) but once you get it locked in all you have to do is fill the water tank and push start. The only feature it is missing is the fact that it will not meter the water. Unlike the bean hopper it will use all the water you put in it regardless of how many cups you program. Not a big deal but the reason I shorted it the 5th star. Aside from that the grinder works great and the steam is kept out of the grinding area. With no moisture getting into the grinder it never needs more than a quick brushing to clean it.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... my doubts as to whether this would be as good. The price point was too good to pass ...
reviews.reviewText:
Had a Breville Machine (with grinder prior) and had my doubts as to whether this would be as good. The price point was too good to pass up—and I’m glad I didn’t. This coffee maker is fantastic. It far exceeded my expectations for the price. You won’t be dissapointed from a quality of coffee taste with this machine. Additionally, it’s far easier to clean and maintain than the Breville. So much so, that I'd buy another of this machine before purchasing another Breville (less parts = less clean up 👌🏼👍🏼).

If there is a drawback, it’s that it’s only a 10-cup maker and that it’s a glass carafe (rather than stainless steel thermal). But with the difference in price, it’s worth it!

You won’t be disappointed if you’re looking for a quality and freshly ground cup of coffee from a home coffee machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: After only a few months coffee grinder clogs up
reviews.reviewText:
It is the second machine I have owned. The first one lasted 2 weeks before it clogged . The replacement worked for 4 months and then stopped due to clogging. Fine grounded coffee clogged and caked up. Also unable to find replacement parts . Spoke with Krug's office and was told parts needed to replace grinder top cover and shoot cover were not available. Machine is warranted for 2 years from May 29, 2018 date when replacement was received. Warranty is as good as play money. However, the cost was paid not with play money but real money. Very disatisfied
with service and quality, and wish to have my money back.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great grinder that will last a lifetime
reviews.reviewText:
20 years ago I purchased one of these KRUPS grinders (This same model, except white). It still works as well today as it did then. When I needed another one for a second location, I looked around, and ultimately landed on just buying a second one. 20 years later the quality is the same, and the grinder works great.

Wonderful product, and built to last a lifetime.
First use smelled up my house of burned electrical and then stopped working less than 10 seconds of using it and got so hot had to wait an hour to pack it back up and send it back for a refund.

This coffee grinder has very sharp blades & a strong motor, and it is a great brand. You have to be careful, and pulse it, if you don't want your coffee beans to grind down to smithereens. The first few times that we used it, it ground the beans WAY too finely, which caused the grounds to go through the filter, & cause a mess, with grounds in the coffee. We ordered another grinder that has different settings, which will give us consistent grounds for the way that we make coffee.

It broke after 4 uses.

I bought this after my grinder of 6 years died. I should've bought the same brand as my other one, but that was my mistake. Complete waste of money.

I ground something as simple as red pepper flakes. After 2-30 second grinds, there were still seeds that were not ground all the way. I'm kinda disappointed. I have not tried cardamom pods yet, but I'm not expecting great results. Blade is fixed, and cannot be removed. How to clean under it is a problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cloves - Peppercorns - Dried Marjoram - Coffee Beans - Coriander Seeds - - - Yes To All, Grind or Powder
reviews.reviewText:
It works with cloves; dried hardened marjoram, coffee, peppers of all kinds. Yep, it's a keeper. Just make sure than when done with grinding/powdering heavy oil seeds or stems like cloves, the unit it well washed out with a strong soap detergent leaving behind zero oil residue anywhere.

Product longevity remains a concern based on other reviews so only time will tell regarding its durability.

UPDATE: 12-25-2017 : Five stars to two (It's Christmas or it would be a singleton)

The product purchased in 2014 died October, 2017. Twas a good run until the motor froze. Purchased a second one October, 2017. Christmas Day. 2017, when needed the most, the motor froze. That's it for this brand and model. It does a great job when it works however the motor quality and overall reliability is not good at all.

After three years mine finally gave out. It worked very well at grinding coffee beans and other spices. But it was a hassle to clean and you have to be extremely careful because the lid does not have to be on for it to spin the blades. Be careful where you place your hand and fingers!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good value for the money. compact design that fits in small spaces
reviews.reviewText:
The Good:
It works as expected.
Small footprint which also means you may have to grind beans a few times to fill up your storage container.
Clean up is easy.

The ugly:
The top design is awkward so if you fill up a bit too much, the grounded coffee will spill when you open the cap.
Expect to wipe table every time you use it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quick, sturdy, does what it say it does
reviews.reviewText: This little thing has been grinding my coffee beans daily (and often more than once a day) for the last three years, and it’s still going pretty strong. I also use it to grind spices, flax seed, oatmeal, etc. no problem. I used it once to grind nuts, which I think the instructions specifically say not to do, and it wasn’t too happy about that, but that was my fault, not the product’s. The lid is super handy for transferring the grounds to my French press. I wish the cord were longer, but other than that, a great little machine.

I had owned a previous model of the grinder for many years eventually the grinding chamber got rusty, though it was working. Then I've ordered this model. So far I'm satisfied. The only problem with all grinders of this type is that it difficult to clean. I used to wash my previous grinder, that's why it got rusty. I washed the new one but the axle got heavily corroded and won't rotate. So I've reordered a new one.

This is the first time I have been prompted to write a review before being asked. This grinder is fantastic. I ordered this specifically for grinding Flax seed to include in my diet for increased, ALA aka, Omega 3. So, I got some flax seeds and tossed about 3 teaspoons worth into the Krups. Pressed the power and BAM! Almost no noise! I was afraid this was going to be a buzz saw, but its not. Very very quiet. Not silent, but very low noise. I pulsed the power button a couple of times to distribute the seeds in the mill then let it run steady for about thirty or so seconds. The result? Flax seed flour. I put a half teaspoon in my mouth to taste it and their wasn't the slightest bit of grit! Fine fine flour in under a minute. Its not that hard to get the flour out but it does adhere to the inside bottom of the chamber. A wonderful device. If you need it, get it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not fine enough for Arabic coffee
reviews.reviewText:
This is a coffee chopper, not grinder. Will likely work well for drip, french press and other applications, but the coffee it chops is not fine enough to make Arabic (americans know it as "Turkish") coffee. Grounds for Arabic coffee must be the consistency of flour - this chopper makes at best consistency of coarse sand.

Sending back.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job quickly and fairly quietly
reviews.reviewText:
I have used several coffee grinders and this is the best, fastest and most quiet thus far. It will grind about 1/2 cup of beans at one time. To use, simply lift the top off, add the beans, replace the top and push on the black lever until you achieve the grind you want. You can use either a pulsing motion, or just hold the lever down. Compared to other grinders, I find this one a bit quieter--the sound comes from the grinding of the coffee rather than from the motor of the grinder. It grinds very quickly and it is small so it doesn't take much counter space.

Only downside is that some of the grounds cling to the lid, making it a bit messy when you remove it...you'll need to wipe the counter, but not a big deal. It is easier to dump the ground coffee directly from the grinder into your filter, rather than use a spoon to remove it. The blade is exposed and makes it awkward to use a spoon or scoop.

Not much to add. At this point looking for warranty terms and preparing it is simply not worth my time. And the blades are not easy to clean. Was happy with it until one day I wasn't. A bummer. Update: Contacted the company. They were amazingly helpful and the replacement turned out to be simple. Five stars for customer service!

This product is cheap, and works well. So I'll give it 5 stars for both good quality and good value.
I usually buy ground coffee. But my friend gave me some whole beans as a gift. So I bought this grinder with the intention of only using it a few times. Because I didn't intend to use it frequently, I didn't want to spend much money. Well, it turns out that I use this thing all the time now! My favorite part about it is how fine I can grind it. I was expecting a very coarse grind, but to my pleasant surprise, I found that I can get a very nice fine grind! Other nice things about it: small and compact makes for simple storage. It is easy to clean. It is really not that loud for a grinder. The only downside is that it seems to be a fairly small capacity. BUT, I tend to only grind 1-2 pots of coffee worth at a time anyways, just to keep it fresh. So while that is not a con for me personally, others may find it inconvenient.

reviews.reviewTitle: Consistency worse than other blade grinders.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this grinder after breaking my old Cuisinart blade grinder by dropping it on the ground. I was not expecting perfection, being a blade grinder and all, but I didn't want to spend much on a good burr grinder, and my kitchen is pretty small that having a convenient storable blade grinder made more sense. I bought this after reading mostly positive reviews, but have been a little disappointed so far. The grind is far more inconsistent than my previous Cuisinart grinder. It grinds faster than the Cuisinart, but the grounds come out very varied in size. If I grind for about 12 seconds, the grounds come out very fine (nearly perfect for espresso, though!), but going any less and some grounds are super fine, and some are nearly whole chunks. I'm not sure if it's the oval shape of the grinder or the difference in blade speeds or what, but I think I may bust out the super glue and try to piece together my old one...

I may keep this one since it was relatively cheap, and I do make espresso every once in a while - but if you're looking for a grinder to make varied ground sizes like I was (I percolate when I go camping, make drip most mornings, and the occasional latte), I'd look somewhere else.

reviews.reviewTitle: Inconsistent grind. Not ideal if you're looking to properly brew coffee.
reviews.reviewText: Sure it's easy to use, has a nice build quality, moderately easy to clean, but functionally awful. I can't recommend this grinder if you respect your coffee, even at this price point.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broken after just a few uses.
reviews.reviewText: I only got a handful of uses out of this before the sensor got stuck in the depressed position, meaning it starts spinning the blades with or without the cover on. Unsafe and low quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing Coffee Bean Grinder - Especially for the price
reviews.reviewText:
I have used this bean grinder for many months now. I was originally worried about the type of the grinder compared to the much more expensive burr grinders, but a food network coffee taste comparison between the two styles convinced my to try this one. I have not been disappointed, as it does a great job. I have also had a chance to compare it to two other brands of blade grinders - both of which were more expensive than this one. i have to say that it outperformed both of them - especially with the ability to grind beans from coarse to fine, depending on the amount of grind time given.

My Mom actually had the predecessor to this grinder for many years, and it is still working. It's a little noisy now as I think the motor bearings are worn out, but it still works just fine.

In summary, you can't go wrong in buying this grinder

I had this all of 3 weeks and it committed suicide. I mean, don’t get me wrong- it just stopped pumping the water out so no coffee🤯 Everything else worked splendidly. All beeps and blinks but no coffee. I get way out of sorts if I am deprived my morning coffee.

I called customer service which told me to pump vinegar water through the machine that no water was passing out of - yeah. Turns out some sensor or circuit overloaded and the coffee maker must be replaced. Well, don’t want another Krups. Going back to a simple Mr. Coffee and separate grinder. Sheesh.

reviews.reviewTitle: It Does What It Claims To, Reliably
reviews.reviewText: This is a good grinder. I currently use it to grind espresso beans, but I'm not sure how much longer I'll continue to use it in that capacity. It only has one speed level. That's fine for things like grinding peppercorns, dried hot peppers, or other spices -- things that you'd prefer to turn into dust. But sometimes I find that for coffee, it grinds the beans either too fine (resulting in a bitter coffee) or too coarse (resulting in a watery coffee). If you want to use it as a spice grinder, it's a great option. If you're not too particular about your coffee, it's a fine option. If you're highly particular about your coffee, I suggest you look elsewhere.

After being a Keurig user of 5 + years I am now never going back! this machine makes Wonderful Coffee you don't know what you're missing! Just be sure to clean the little Grinded catcher compartment with the supplied brush just like they say every other week to keep it running perfect you won't need an alarm clock in the morning when this thing starts up

... and it did an excellent job too!

A friend of mine who knows me as a coffee-drinker gave me some bags of coffee beans a few years ago. He evidently didn't realize that I had no coffee-grinder. I had always bought ground coffee from the supermarket, but I finally decided to get a coffee-grinder so that I could grind the beans that my friend had given to me rather than just letting them go to waste.

It's very hard for my carpool driver to take me around to look for things. So I decided to buy a coffee-grinder online. Amazon was my choice because I had bought a lot of other stuff there and was familiar with the site. When my last bag of ground coffee was gone, I decided to try out the coffee-grinder on the beans that my friend had given to me. And it did an excellent job. Amazon, you saved the day!

reviews.reviewTitle: I would have given this beauty 5 stars, but ...
reviews.reviewText: I would have given this beauty 5 stars, but somehow while we were away and nobody was using it, the motor died so we used it about two weeks total before it went bust! So it's a zero for durability (at least the one we got) but a 5 when it works as I got a more even grind with MUCH less fuss than with the hand grinder that was so highly touted by coffee afficianandos!

Pros: Can pulse and grind to the desired fineness. Use it for spices; not for coffee. Does well.
Cons: Cleaning is a little tedious. Even after, I have cleaned it out completely, when I give it a firm tap, more powder dislodges from under the blade. Have to do this over and over again. I suppose I could remove the blade each time but ...

reviews.reviewTitle: Morning does not happen without coffee
reviews.reviewText: I gave this all 5 stars except versatility. I don't know how it could be versatile. It grinds coffee... I move it from shelf to counter-top. It works very well. And grinds quickly. I enjoy how it always scares my dog. She needs the exercise. My last grinder lasted a decade. I expect this one will be similar. That's a lot of coffee...

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for Small Apartment - Single Person Use
reviews.reviewText:
This little machine is great.

Currently I use my Keurig machine the most, with the french press in a distant second. I started using the french press more for display since I didn't own a coffee grinder. The coffee grinds I would get from Starbucks would go stale in 2 weeks!

I was cruising through Amazon.com when I found this little machine for $20.

This is perfect for a person living by himself needing to make fresh coffee grinds once in awhile, without compromising any flavor from the coffee beans. Its small and light enough so you can move it around and not make it a permanent fixture in the kitchen. It can grind anywhere from coarse to fine. Surprisingly quieter than I expected. Also requires you to place the cap on top so you won't chop your fingers off by mistake.

I guess the only small, tiny gripe I have is that no part of it besides the cap is removable for easy cleaning. However, I use it as a dedicated coffee grinder, so I like to keep it dry and generally just clean the cap and tap any excess grind out if using new beans. Not too much of a problem.

The cord is also short as other reviewers point out, again not a problem for me who lives in a small apartment.

Using it with the fill-your-own keurig cup adapters make pretty good and strong coffee. Haven't tried it yet with the french press but I have no doubt it will yield good results.

Cheap, powerful, space efficient, and yielding good results. Can't complain.

reviews.reviewTitle: What a terrible design. I bought the Epica instead and am ...
reviews.reviewText: Many of these reviews must be fake. I returned within 2 weeks. It is so difficult to clean and pour coffee into your maker. You have to literally lift the whole machine up. What a terrible design. I bought the Epica instead and am very happy.

This works fine...my biggest usability complaint is that when I use it to grind coffee I have to unplug it to pour the ground coffee out into the coffee maker. The reservoir is too small to use a scoop; it's an odd design but I guess if you are using it for smaller amounts and spice it makes more sense.

The stainless steel tub is so minimal. Most of the beans or seeds hit the rest of the soft plastic part of the tub and cover, resulting in permanent scratches and some plastic in your ground. The ground is not evenly grounded. Messy and hard to clean. Not recommended

Very deep lid which is good for one cup or several. Very consistent grind if you shake as you grind. I do not recommend for consistent very course grind. You really should invest in burr grinder for course grinds for French press. All coffee grinders are a challenge to clean. I use a brush at the end of my coffee scoop. This grinder is no noisier than most.

reviews.reviewTitle: I purchased this to grind flax and celery seeds. It does both very well.
reviews.reviewText: We already had a coffee grinder, and I purchased this to grind flax and celery seeds. It does both very well; the grinding is done within seconds. The unit is moderately heavy indicating there is a fairly powerful motor inside. When our coffee bean grinder dies eventually, we will probably buy another KRUPS to replace it based on my positive experience with this product (although, I'll probably be looking at burr grinders too since I've read they really do make a difference to the final coffee product). But for flax and celery seeds, the KRUPS works very well. It is also convenient that the plastic lid works as a temporary container to transport your ground product to another area of the kitchen without needing a separate container (or having to unplug the entire unit and take it somewhere else.

This product does its basic function well. Yes it will grind your coffee. But with more than a 1000 reviews on Amazon, this product ought to do well. It doesn't. Its design is not that great for cleaning. I cleaned the grinder cup with wet cloth and some light water and immediately the water sipped into the blade gap. The blade got jammed after 2 days and it failed to rotate after that.
The design is also not that great to hold the cup full of ground coffee as it spills out the moment you open the lid.

Bought this to replace the Bosch that the ex got. I loved my Bosch SO much. My Bosch lasted forever and was still kicking and worked great. I could not find another one so I got this.
So far, my ex he or she can keep it...ha. This unit has ample power and more grinding room. Seemingly same or more power. I quit coffee as well as her/him, therefor my machine is only grinding herbs and eggshells. He or she got the good Boden Stainless steal french press as well as just a FEW other things! Alas, good riddance! I like that I can turn it upside down and clean out its chamber into the cup/lid. Smart design. Both lid and base are designed to pour as well.
A previous reviewer stated that it was hard to clean and that they were worried about rancid oils left in the thing. I just wipe it well with a dish towel or paper towel and that works for me. If I ever had a big problem with residue I would wipe with a little alcohol and then wipe with damp cloth. Even though I am doing eggshells I am not that worried about it, but I will heed your precaution and clean my unit thusly from time to time. Thanks.

I was starting to make a fresh curry, put the ingredients into this and just doesn't have the power to grind it, you can hear the churning but just made a small amount of dust inside the chamber. NOT GOOD!

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty good, not always an even grind.
reviews.reviewText:
Cheap, efficient little machine but I don't find that it grinds my coffee evenly. I usually wind up with a few larger bean chunks left in with the finely ground parts. Furthermore the motor emits a slightly burnt smell which makes me wonder how long it will hold up...

Also, the granularity is determined only by how long you run it - I can imagine you could experiment and time yourself to get the optimal grind, but I think I'd prefer a product with a "Espresso", "French Press", "Drip" setting options so I don't have to eyeball it every time.

It does however save me a trip to the store to use their grinders when I have a bag of whole beans on hand, so in that sense it's worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worst Grinder I Have Ever Owned!
reviews.reviewText: Worst grinder I have owned. The basic design is moronic and I really wish I could return it. The oval shape allows things to catch off to the side and you have to stop it and move stuff around to get it all ground up. Also, when you put stuff in (I grind dried herbs too), the cap will catch it when you put it in and keep it from being ground. And finally, when the motor runs, you can smell the oil from the motor. Not happy at all.

I bought this grinder for multiple purposes, to grind spices and coffee. For spices it's great, for coffee it's okay, it gets the job done. It's difficult to get a good consistent grind on coffee beans. If you pulse it a couple times before holding the button down for a 4 to 5 second count it does a decent job. But if you're particular about your coffee grind, save up for a burr type grinder. It's also a little difficult to clean out since the base doesn't come apart. I end up using a can of compressed air to dust out the big stuff and a damp paper towel to wipe out what's left.

The unit itself is very well built, rugged and should last a long time from what I can tell. It appears to be identical to the one my parents have been using for 30+ years, which was the whole reason I bought this model in the first place.

reviews.reviewerName: To the Right of Attila the Hun
reviews.reviewTitle: Lasts for years. It may be loud. but what do you expect for $ 18.00?
reviews.reviewText: Over the years we have used this brand (Blade Grinder) and have never been disappointed in the quality of the grind. I grind the coffee to powder for a great ,strong cup of coffee. Is it loud... yes it is you just need to remember that this is not a high dollar grinder. Well worth the money. I have had them start to make an extra strange noise after many years of use. So I order a new one. It's $18.00 and works great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Reliable, works well, not too loud. If the coffee beans have an oily coating, the ground coffee will tend to stick in it
reviews.reviewText:
If the beans are oily, you may need to use your finger to get all the ground coffee out, doing so WHEN THE DEVICE IS UNPLUGGED. Maybe you could hit the side of it, but I think that's how I wore down my last coffee grinder.
Note: According to unsourced wikipedia content, Krups is an entirely different company from Krupp, which had a less than savory history from back in WW2. So if this is correct, you can buy this device with a happy conscience.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why did I finally buy a coffee grinder?
reviews.reviewText: I like to buy coffee in quantity when it's on sale at my local grocery stores. I used to use the store grinder but one store removed theirs and in another store I had the unfortunate experience of adding the residue of a previous users spiced product into my own pure Colombian beans. Yuck! I had to discard the whole bag. So I thought about getting my own grinder but hesitated because I know that loud noise would only contribute to my slight hearing loss. But then I came up with the bright idea that I would use earplugs, just as I do to filter out my husband's snoring. After checking out the on line Amazon reviews I selected the Krups, which is a brand I trust. I decided to go with a small grinder in the interests of saving counter space and because I am the only coffee drinker in my home. I'm completely satisfied with this product and look forward to grinding fresh beans first thing in the morning.

reviews.reviewTitle: I use this grinder all the time
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this grinder because I wanted to have fresh ground pepper around my kitchen. I use it for so much though: black pepper, red pepper flakes (really brings out the heat), spices that I've toasted whole, super-fine sugar and salt. The only draw back I've noticed is that to get all the chunks out of your spices you really have to grind them for a while. If the motor runs for more than 5 seconds or so it starts to smell a little funny and I'm afraid I'm going to burn it out. To avoid this, I usually pulse my spices to get them really fine.

Tip for getting your spices out: turn the whole grinder upside down, tap the sides to loosen the spices, and let it sit upside down for a minute to let any dust settle (really important if its black or red pepper - not trying to breathe in that dust, ouch). Then remove the cap and its must easier to use what you've ground.

I bought this to actually grind koi food pellets and other hard foods to make a powder mixture for goldfish and koi fry. The food is solid and this thing turned it into a fine powder with ease. It is stored away for the next spawn and was a great buy. If it can handle these pellets, spices and coffee should be no problem.

I bought this specifically for grinding spices. I did not want to use my regular coffee grinder as it will give my coffee some of the spice seasoning flavors...yuck! Plus I will probably use it to grind some Bhut Jolokia and Carolina Reaper peppers (mortar and pestle is a lot of work, and I am getting lazy), and I definitely don't want my coffee tasting like that... doubly hot coffee LOL.

This grinder has plenty of space to grind a fair amount of spices, I am not doing huge batches so it works great. It will not grind really thick pieces of cinnamon bark, but has ground up most of the cinnamon I put in it, just had to fish out the really thick chunks. It handled my garam masala mix just fine. By the way, if you have not ever ground your spices, it is really the way to go, you so much more flavor out of them!

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working after a month - UPDATED
reviews.reviewText:
Unit stopped working after a month. Specifically, the grinder would start to grind beans, but would not pass the grinds to the filter unit. Repeated cleanings of the grinds pathway from the grinder to the filter unit did nothing to resolve the problem. Customer service indicated this problem couldn't be troubleshot over the phone, but did offer to replace with a new unit provided I shipped the old one back to them. Nevertheless, it's a headache to have a product like this essentially fail after only a month.
UPDATE: Got a second unit, which also failed after a month. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT.

I love this machine! I had to make a mixture of all kinds of stuff! It did the job well- and fast!
Hibiscus leaves, rose pedals, chia seeds, almonds, wheat, elder flower, Even bee pollen granules!!! And it didn’t once over heat! This saved me 2 days worth of hand grinding!!! Great machine!

there are a ton of grinders so I went with name brand since for a few dollars more theres no screwing around. It exceeded my expectations compared to my last grinder since motor solid, fast and decent coffee reservoir, I pulse mine 15 times while I shake it for a course grind since I use a pour over. smooth like butter coffee!

The safety on/off failed, in the “on” position, so the blades now spin with the lid off when the grinder is plugged in. Very dangerous. It worked okay before that, though it’s not easy to open the lid without spilling some grinds, and getting all the grinds out is tedious. Didn’t grind very evenly, either.

Bought this to replace the workhorse grinder that I bought years ago at my local Benny’s store - one for dried herbs/spices/flaxseed, one for coffee beans. The coffee grinder developed a short recently, so I returned to Benny’s to replace it, and to my dismay Benny’s had run out of them in advance of closing all their stores. So I ordered this grinder. After two days of way-too-loud coffee grinding, my husband took apart the old grinder and fixed the wiring. On researching further, Amazon has the brand Benny’s used to carry for half the price of this one. Will order that next time.
I bought this grinder approx 9 months ago. It’s still working well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lasted under 2 years with very light use
reviews.reviewText:
Bought in June 2017. I used it only to grind cardamom about once every 3 months. Today I dusted it off to find that the blade no longer spins, but the motor motor makes the "stuck" noise. Maybe the brake wont release to let the motor spin. Maybe the long wait between uses allowed the parts to stick?
For 10 uses, this machine cost $2 per use. At that price, I've have rather used the pestle and mortar.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job, great for price.
reviews.reviewText: Prior to purchasing any kitchen electronics I always do a lot of research. This blade grinder is rated the best by most websites including America’s Test Kitchen which I consider to be my religion. That being said, it is ok. The grind is a bit uneven, less so if you pulse rather than hold down the button. I would recommend filling whole beans to the blade only (which is about 3 tbp). The more coffee there is in the machine, the more uneven the grind. The grinds also cling to the plastic top so it is very messy whenever you open it but that seems to be common with blade grinders. You get what you pay for and for this price, I can live with the inconveniences. I have never used a grinder before but reading the poor reviews for other blade machines I am happy with the purchase. If you intend to grind fresh coffee every morning it may be worth it to invest in a burr grinder. When I upgrade, I will use this for spices.

reviews.reviewTitle: There are better grinders out there for the money
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is completely dependent upon how long you hold the button. Others I have used have settings for the amount of coffee in the type of grind. This one is guesswork. In addition I use the grinder to grind spices and there is no way to remove the bowl for cleaning so you get taste transfer from one thing to another.

reviews.reviewTitle: With so many GREAT reviews... Here's another one!
reviews.reviewText: Decided to up my game on my coffee addiction. I decided that since I drink and enjoy coffee so much that I might as well join the major leagues by getting a grinder. I've always, up until now, have purchased pre-ground coffee (which has its various grades as well). But after reading some articles on how to get coffee to taste great to its optimal potential, you need to brew the coffee not long after it's been ground. Anyway, enough about the reasons why you should get a grinder. If you're even reading this out of the 600 other reviews, you already know that a grinder is for you. As for which one, well for this price from a well-known company in the coffee industry, your search has come to an end. This is my first grinder but let me tell you, I was impressed on the power and speed in which it grounded up some coffee beans! As for design, I was equally impressed on how the cover has a little notch attached to the button to trigger the motor once the cover was attached to the unit. This is a great safety feature so that it's extremely difficult to activate the blades with the cover off. To sum things up, if you need a grinder... look now further, here it is. Add it to your cart and just get it!

Good work horse for grinding all kinds of stuff, from coffee beans to rice and Einkorn "berries" (to make coarse flour for crepes and bread) !
Just remember to grind no more than 50 grams at a time for no longer than 45 seconds, then allow it to cool for 3 minutes and you shall use this grinder for many years.

We threw out our Keurig to start drinking fresher coffee. This grinder is easy to clean and works very fast to grind whole coffee beans. It’s a little loud like a food processor but can grind enough beans for a coffee maker or French press in about 15 seconds.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compact, portable, and fast; add this to your inventory if you're a coffee lover
reviews.reviewText:
Pros:
- Compact and portable
- Easy to clean
- High durability
- Powerful and fast; turns coffee into dust
- Requires only one finger to operate

Cons:
- Loud motor, which could anger your spouse in the morning

I felt the need to contribute a testimonial after I read a review claiming this grinder doesn't play well with permanent cone filters, which is simply not true. How fine the coffee is ground is entirely dependent on how long the grinder's button is pressed.

For coarse coffee, simply grind it for less time by "pulsing," just like using a food processor. The motor is only active as long as the button is pressed. For very fine coffee, keep it pressed until you pulverize the beans.

I grind my coffee for use with a permanent filter as well as a French press. It does take some skill to coarsely grind the beans versus just holding the button down for a fine blend. But after a few tries, you'll get it down. Just practice with some cheap beans.

The grinder is easy to maintain since the liner that holds the beans is made of metal and is enclosed. With a quick rinse and a paper towel you can wipe it clean and it's ready to go for the next morning.

This is my second grinder like this. The old one's cover broke a large piece off, however it still works. The good part is it is reliable, grinds coffee well, also other choices similar to seeds or dry cereal. Not so well with anything with moisture in it, like fruit or chocolate.

I have been using this product for years now and it is still going. We are heavy coffee drinkers and only use beans and its been going strong for at least 3 years now which is just crazy! If you are in need of a grinder this is the one to go with!!

I really don't like this grinder. I've had it for years and I'm on Amazon to buy a different one but I felt I had to review this one. The cup inside is not round and if you have a good coffee with oil it will stick in the little corners and on one whole side! I have to dig it out with my finger every time!

reviews.reviewTitle: used 4 times and stopped working! But Customer Service very accommodating
reviews.reviewText: Had my last coffee-bean grinder about 10 years. I don't use often, and this one stopped working after 4 simple uses (in 5-6 months). Extremely disappointed and now turned-off to this brand. However, I've now spoken to customer service and, if I follow their instructions, they said they will replace the defective unit.

This grinder is fantastic - for the price. I'm sure there are some hardcore coffee drinkers out there who would cringe to hear that, but for the regular ol' coffee drinker, this thing is fantastic.

I use this grinder 2-3 times per day. Grinds the beans quickly, but you do have to hold the button and there is no 'grind' control. Hold longer for a fine grind, hold shorter for a coarse grind. Not that big of a deal for a $20 grinder.

It can hold a good amount of beans, enough for me to brew a full 12 cups without a problem. A few grinds I've had in the past were a little low on capacity, but the KRUPS handles it well.

Good weight, feels sturdy. I'm sure I'll get years of use out of this thing, plus it's $20!

POWERFUL! I bought this grinder mainly to make my own flours. I made quinoa flour today from raw uncooked seeds, what a pleasant surprise to found out the incredible power of this little grinder! It grinned the quinoa to a find powder, so thin that I made pancakes without the sandy texture wow! I LOVE IT. It's fast, powerful, affordable, easy to use.

I bought my first one in 1972 and it never failed but I broke the lid so 42 years later I was forced to buy another. The only difference is the location of the switch which is actually better situated than my first. Not many, of any, appliances last this long in my experience.
Purchased this last December as a backup grinder. Opened it and used it a week and the plastic cracked in the lid (reason we tossed the other one). Buy Something Else!

Terrible terrible coffee grinder. it is super messy and the coffee will epill everywhere no matter how careful you are. If your looking to just grind spices in small amounts then it's great. Terrible for coffee just awful!!! Better off getting one that catches the coffee...

Made well, but ultimately dissapointing. The cup is too secure, unnecessarily so. It seems to hold more than most, but its shallower so youre going to drop some grinds. The oval base seems like a good idea, until you got to dump the grinds into the filter, and the taller opening drops them past the filter.

If youre like me and one cup = one heaping tablespoon, avoid this. Its capacity is worse than the plain coffeemate that still works great (but barely holds 8 w/o spilling)

Love this coffee pot! The only thing I wish were different is that the container holding the beans was bigger and the little compartment that needs to be cleaned out was a little easier to access. Otherwise great coffee pot/grinder! Highly rexommend!!
Does the job! Great price for a very good grinder!

reviews.reviewTitle: It's great! I use it to grind some spices like ...
reviews.reviewText: It's great! I use it to grind some spices like cumin and coriander at home. It works really well. However, that missing star is because I wish the container was detachable so I can remove it and wash it properly. Also, the plastic cover changes color with time. But it does the trick!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great but not easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: I love how this works to grind my flax seed. It is quick and easy to use. I do find it difficult to clean afterwards, partly because of the static electricity of the casing materials. It might be easier to clean with coffee instead of spices. Overall, this is a great little grinder. The cleaning is the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect fix for annoyingly loud coffee grinders
reviews.reviewText: Had to order a different coffee grinder as my wife likes to have fresh coffee every morning and all I can hear is the loud ninja grinder karate away the new grinder is even quieter when you hold it and will powder the coffee for espresso excellent blender

reviews.reviewTitle: and the returns policy is only good for 30 days
reviews.reviewText: The motor burned out 5 weeks after I received it, and the returns policy is only good for 30 days. So ... I'm not happy. My previous Krups grinder lasted for 7 or 8 years, so it is possible I received a defective product. If I had purchased this at a brick-and-mortar store such as Bed Bath & Beyond, I could at least exchange it. Something I will keep in mind for future purchases.

reviews.reviewTitle: 15 seconds and then burnout - very dissappointing
reviews.reviewText: I waited eagerly for this grinder to arrive and got about 15 seconds usage out of it before smoke and a burning smell started to emanate from the device. It now doesn't work. Suffice it to say, a waste of time, money, and energy. To be avoided.

I use mine as spice grinder. I have grind all kind of spices, as big as cinnamon sticks and as small as caraway seeds. Everything grinds wonderfully, as spices needs to be grind to very fine almost powder like.

The reason for deducting one start as there are opportunities for improvement. I wash it in between grinding jobs, i hold it under my arm as a baby and just wash the top grinding container very carefully, making sure the water as little as needed but the water goes through to the inside of the machine. I have to put it down upside down for the little water to drip out and dry before using the machine and it could easily be a day or 2. If the gap between the main body of the grinder and the grinder container can be closed by super glue or something it would be the best grinder ever.

My previous Krups grinder had the seal, I used it until the cover broke and I got this one. It does the job very well.

Update August 2013:
It is dead. The last wash killed it. It lasted an exactly 12 months.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds baby fish food into a fine powder.
reviews.reviewText:
I have baby goldfish and koi fry. I grind their food up to a fine powder with this grinder. Works better than expected for making powdered baby fish food.
I have not used it for coffee or anything else so I cannot comment on how it works for coffee.

The first thing you will notice when using this grinder is that offputting burned plastic smell. That smell is actually called ozone that is produced arcing in the electric motor.
Another thing I noticed was the tight fit of the cap. So after grinding I turned the unit upside down and removed cap. That prevented stray coffee grounds from getting all over my counter top. Since I already have a manual coffee mill, I used my mill brush to clean the coffee grinder.
I bought this grinder for the times I don't feel like spending eight minutes turning the crank on my coffee mill, so I imagine I will get quite a few years of use from the Krups F203 Electric Spice and Coffee Grinder.

Super easy to use! It would be nice if there was a removable portion because there are always some of the coffee left in the bottom. I ended up getting a fan brush to really clean it out after every use and it’s really no extra trouble. The blades are extra sharp and the only trouble we have is making sure to not get the coffee too fine.

I don't like the oval shape and it gets too hot. I used a round Mr. Coffee that my friend had lent me, which was similar in every other way but the shape, and it worked great. This oval Krups grinds my already-ground Folgers more finely (Folger's doesn't grind it as fine as I like it), but it gets hot and it cakes the coffee into the oval sides, so I have to scrape it out with a spoon every single time I use it. The Mr. Coffee didn't get nearly as hot and I could just dump the contents out without having to scrape them out. I paid a great price for it, but it isn't worth the hassle and I wish I'd purchased a Mr. Coffee instead.

reviews.reviewTitle: Small, but powerful and works fast!
reviews.reviewText: This is a great grinder! It's powerful and works fast. I will say, it is a little small, but I wasn't looking for a large grinder. If you're planning on grinding a lot of beans at one time, this grinder might not be for you. Otherwise, it's very powerful and will grind your beans to dust in less than 20 seconds. I like to grind in 5-6 second intervals 3 times depending on the bean and how it grinds. I'm a barista and I like my espresso to be as fine as dust when I pull a shot, and this grinder does the trick!

I love this grinder! In fact, I loved it so much this is the second one I purchased (as a gift). I am an avid coffee drinker and love to brew my own. It is very true that grinding your own beans improves the flavor immensely. I decided to invest in my own grinder and did a lot of research before selecting this brand. Most of the complaints are concerning the cloud of coffee dust that flies out when you take the top off - I noticed that happening when I grind my beans very finely - ie, for an espresso maker. Grinding for a lot time does create a vacuum but there is an easy fix - if you wiggle the lid slowly to let some of the air in, the cloud dust does not occur. As for me, when I am in a hurry in the morning I forget and end up with a little spilt coffee granules but its no big deal. The motor is only a little noisy when you first put whole beans in but once the beans are broken down there is less rattling. Also if you are wary of waking up roommates/spouse/etc I find that if you pick up the grinder so it is not vibrating against the counter, it also creates less noise. The blade is pretty sharp and I can grind beans enough for 1-2 cups in less than a minute. I am definitely going to buy a 3rd (for myself) to grind spices.

Grinds beans to a size comparable to a can of Folgers grounds, but finer. The grounds are a lot more uniform than other grinders I have purchased for a similar price. If you want fine grounds, spring for a burr grinder, but if you enjoy coffee more than the average bear but aren't a connoisseur, this grinder is a good compromise. I also recommend buying a small brush to help get the grounds out of the grinder. I bought one with a wooden handle to dislodge the packed ground that form just outside of the blade's arc, then flipped the brush around to sweep them out. Seems to work well that way. My only complaint is that every time I use this grinder, there is a faint "electric motor" smell to it. But don't worry, mine hasn't caught fire or anything, just gives off a short-lived odor.
Excellent weed grinder! Ha ha

reviews.reviewTitle: Do NOT buy if using for espresso machine...
reviews.reviewText: This SUCKS if you are buying it for an espresso machine. It only has one setting (push here). I have tried to grind my own beans, using a cheaper coffee grinder (instead of a burr grinder) bc I wanted to save $30. However, if you are buying this to grind beans for espresso, make the investment and buy a burr grinder. It is a major pain in the butt to try to experiment to get the right grind. If it is too fine, the espresso comes out too bitter. If it is too coarse, the espresso machine can shoot out water. I am going to be returning this...

We bought the Krups 203-42 Electric Grinder to grind coffee beans for use in our French Press.

It is not capable of grinding coffee beans to a consistently sized bean particle that is anything but a 'fine grind'.
Even then, there is an appreciable amount of 'coffee dust' in the result.
Fortunately, the fine grind works best in our French Press and the use of a three inch filter cuts down on the dust going into the finished coffee.

So, for occasional use, when a custom ground pound of coffee is not on our shelf and a container of coffee beans is, we use it. Otherwise it is about as useful as a $20 bill sitting in our cupboard.

For other than this limited use, we would not reccommend the Krups 203-42 as a coffee bean grinder.

I've purchased two of these grinders over a 3 year period.
I am not knocking the product at all, I am actually complimenting it by letting you know that our original was replaced with an identical unit.
It is not Krups fault that the original one died, we just wore it out.
We drink LOTS of coffee and I have used this grinder solid for about 3 years.
For a 20 dollar grinder, under constant use, to give me 3 years of service.........I am okay with this.

Highly recommended coffee grinder. It will do anything you want to do with a coffee bean. Fine or course, it is up to you and how long you grind.

I love this grinder, it works very well to get the perfect granularity to brew with. It is about as loud as any other coffee grinder. Beware though, the grinder isn't circular, but oval. Doesn't make much of a difference, but definitely threw me off when it arrived.

This coffee grinder is awesome! I don't actually use it for coffee, as I do not drink coffee. I do use it for spices and for making powders out of dehydrated foods like strawberries and blueberries. It can make an incredibly fine powder. Only drawback is that there are no settings to make something more or less coarse. You need to rely on yourself to know how long to grind for.

I bought this to replace a Cuisinart coffee grinder that gave out after about 10 years. Given all I've heard about Krups and it's reputation I expected this to be a better grinder. I was wrong. First of all, it took quite a while to figure out how to get the cover off. There was nothing in the instructions. I finally realized that it pulls straight up. However, the fit to the body of the machine is so tight that I had to fight with it to get it off. I have a fair amount of arthritis in my hands so this posed quite a challenge. Next, it did an OK job grinding. The grind was inconsistent as opposed to the Cuisinart which was pretty uniform. Third, due to the design, when you remove the top, coffee grinds end up all over the place. What a mess! Needless to say, I returned this. I don't think I'll be buying any Krups products based on this experience.

reviews.reviewTitle: No control over the grind and loud, but dependable
reviews.reviewText: From a professed coffee snob... You won't be disappointed and it's a great price. I like this grinder because it grinds fast, but be warned because your usual count to 20 would make espresso grind and not drip, so back off on the count. Things I don't like, it doesn't help you to control all that grind, you have to hold it down (no automatic setting for drip, espresso, etc.), and it's loud as hell. I will likely save this for spices and buy a replacement for my old Hamilton Beach grinder which I should have done in the first place.

reviews.reviewTitle: It just works and that's good enough for me.
reviews.reviewText: It's simple, affordable, and it works. It seems to be very well made and the simplicity of the design means it's attractive and non-offensive enough to leave out on the counter. My typical application is grinding a couple cups worth of beans at a time which doesn't stress this grinder at all. I do occasionally grind a pound or so at a time to make batches of cold brew and though the motor does get a little hot it doesn't show any signs of wearing out. I haven't tried to grind any spices so I can't speak to that functionality, however for coffee beans I'd definitely recommend it.

Have used once

Purchased to grind herbs (rosemary) - works great plus very quiet

Clean up is simple but you can’t remove blades or metal cup to wash, but you can wash the clear plastic lid

Use = push the button until you get the grind that you want

For price I paid it does what I want

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder for a great price
reviews.reviewText:
Bought this for a friend for her birthday-- I don't drink coffee, nor do I know much about it but I do know that freshly ground coffee beans are much better/whole beans stay fresh much longer. This means that grinding your own beans when you're ready to drink a cup of coffee is far superior to buying them ground/or grinding them at the store. I read a million reviews for a few different products and decided this was my best shot. SO, bought this for her and she couldn't have loved it more. She uses it very often, with no trouble. I got the black one because it's better for cleaning, she said it's pretty quiet, and it will grind the beans pretty fine, but with a little practice she is able to get them ground the way she wants them.

Definitely recommend this little grinder, might even buy one for spices for myself!

This is the second time I purchased this model; the first time it lasted a couple of years, the second, only a few months. While I probably could have requested a replacement, I honestly feel like I would have just been waiting for that one to break. Bought a different make/model and would not recommend.

We purchased this grinder for our espresso machine. I like how the machine functions and it grinds the beans very fast. There were a few times we had some bean chunks, but that was most likely me putting in too many beans. The only thing I dont like is the leftover coffee grinds that get stuck to the bowl underneath the blades. I've tried turning the machine upside down and patting the bottom to get the grinds out, but I always return to scraping it out with my finger or spoon (with the machine unplugged). If there was a feature to remove those grinds I would give it 5 stars. Otherwise, great economy grinder.

It does the job, however after grinding the beans there is about a tablespoon stuck to yhe bottom and with the blades being right there, you have to use your finger to loosen up what's stuck on the bottom. Eventually it comes out, but not right away. But I mean I guess it works if you dont mind getting coffee under your nail every night.

reviews.reviewTitle: Must have for your kitchen. But can not use it more than twice a day.
reviews.reviewText: I have bought this recently (about 2 months ago) and I'm using it more for grinding spices. It's a definitely must have product in your kitchen. It grinds spices very finely. I just wish I was able to use it couple of times in a day. One can use it about 2 or 3 times in one time. Than you have to wait and use it back else it gets little heated up and starts smelling too.
