Other than that it's a great product to buy. I would definitely recommend this product for the price in comparison to the ease it provides.

This is the second one I purchased. My first one lasted a couple of years, however the blade was always getting stuck and I had to manually break it free before it would work again. Then there was no way to take the blade off and clean the oils out so it eventually stopped turning altogether. The last one I bought in Jan and now it's spins but something happened that makes the blade only work if there are no beans in it. Crazy. I will call the manufacturer and see what they want to do.

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought this to grind cinnamon originally and it grinds everything great as long as you do hard things like cinnamon ...
reviews.reviewText: I use this for my spices as well as my coffee. I often buy cheaper priced dried spices at the supermarket and find that they are way too big. I bought this to grind cinnamon originally and it grinds everything great as long as you do hard things like cinnamon bark in small batches and shake it around a little so the sticks don't get stuck. As for my spices, once I grind them not only are they better consistency for cooking but, it brings out the flavor in them more once I run them through this grinder. Its a noisy thing but, what grinders for this price are quiet? I cover it with a tea-towel when I do a lot of grinding and that muffles the sound.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Quality Grinder. Would buy it again if I needed to get another one.
reviews.reviewText: Good little coffee grinder. I have ground also spices in this. Works good. I have used it daily for the last 3 months. Seems to have slowed down some with the grinding, not as sharp as it was but still does a good job. I would recommend this just the same. I like the stainless steel cup, keeps things clean. The plastic cover got stained from the coffee some, though I cleaned it regularly but it does its job well. I would buy this again if I needed another. Fast shipping too.

Until I got this grinder, I never had freshly ground coffee before, always pre-ground. I decided to try whole bean coffee one day and at the time i did not have a grinder so I just grinded the coffee at the store i bought the coffee from. It had better taste then the pre-ground, so i decided to switch to whole bean and even buy my own grinder. This was rated the top seller so i bought it instead of trying to figure out which one worked better.. I have had this for almost a year and I love it, It works great, its not super loud, its easy to clean, and i will never go back to pre-ground!

I had this exact one 10 years ago! I was grinding spices before it was popular... I dated a chef and he “borrowed it”; good bye grinder. This grinder is exactly as I remembered except...... the coffee and spices don’t stick! My old one, the ground pods stuck to the inside. I love the quality of the grind and the sound. You can hear the sound of how coarse or fine you want your coffee and or spices. I know it sound crazy but you will know when you use a couple of times what I’m writing about...,

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked well, but didn't last very long
reviews.reviewText: We purchased the Krups grinder after our previous one (Oster brand, I think) broke after 20+ years of use. We mainly used it to grind black peppercorn and other spices, may be couple of times a week. After about year and half of use, the blade came off from the shaft and the unit became unusable. It did a pretty good job of grinding, when it was working. The fit and finish were good too, but seriously lacked in durability based on our experience.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great quality and does what it says
reviews.reviewText:
My last grinder got moisture in it and got very nasty inside the unit. I like to grind herbs and also coffee. This works very well, but be careful about grinding anything that could have moisture. It could seep into the unit as it is not sealed.

These are great quality units and last a long time

It's a fine cheap grinder, but is clearly not made to last. I work on motors daily and I can smell the motor windings burning up when operating the grinder. It doesn't completely grind the beans and is difficult to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: 6 months after bought I’m out of coffee maker
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely loved it until at six months old it started clogging and not dripping. Despite my faithful cleaning and vinegar cleansing it still broke.
Exactly what I was looking for! Grinds my coffee like a boss and quickly! Not too bulky and not an eyesore on my counter.

Got divorced and had to buy my own.... this one is even quieter than the one I used at what was my home. Great product. I like a finer grind so I hit a few seconds longer. Don't know how you could complain about this thing for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use. Easy to clean.
reviews.reviewText: I never ground my own coffee before, so this was a new experience. I did the research on griders and found this one to be the best for the price. It was and it is. Super easy to use and great for grinding just enough grounds for a 12 cup pot of coffee. Easy to control the texture so if you need it ground for a press you can do that easily and if you needed it finer, its great for that as well. I've used for chopping nuts for holiday cookies and it worked great for those as well. It is very easy to clean. I just use a paper towl and wipe it out after every use. Certain beans have more moisture in them, so I usually leave the grinder out for the morning to air out when grinding those. Great grinder at a great price.

The top fits very satisfyingly into the base - I do 3 pulses of about 2 sec each for coffee grinds then flip the grinds into the lid, scoop the amount I need into the coffee maker and put the remaining amount in a zip lock. The machine is light and loud, but expected for what it does. It feels like it has quality materials.

reviews.reviewTitle: Blade stopped rotating-hardly used it ten times
reviews.reviewText: I am so upset - I bought this product Nov 2018 and hardly used it at all. It was working pretty good but all of a sudden stopped working recently-about four months only since purchase/use!!! The product return and support time ended just last month ( about three months since date of purchase).

This think is junk . Bought this for the wife and it constantly is jammed and needs to be cleaned out after every use. This was a Christmas gift to and has only been used a handful of times . Not worth the money. I will be returning the item

Better off with a cheap version from Walmart .

reviews.reviewTitle: Water does not saturate all the coffee.
reviews.reviewText: Water drips out in such a way that about 1/3 of the coffee in the basket will not be saturated with water. Using a paper filter in the permanent filter helps, as does only making 4 cups at a time. Definitely expected a better product from Krups. Wouldn't reccomend this at all.

This is a pretty good grinder for its price, no complaints, it has a button on the top which is easily accessible for grinding.
It grinds my coffee beans to fair grounds, there aren't any large piece left once I'm done with it.
it also grinds spices nicely, doesn't leave large chunks at the end. It's a simple design, I have no complaints.

However, it does give off of burning smell if you hold down the button for too long, and the metallic smells stays around for a while. I suppose it serves as a warning smell for users so you don't burn out the motor.

Otherwise, I love this little guy would recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's ok overall but it doesn't grind that fine and I can't put extra water.
reviews.reviewText:
It was easy to use, easy to clean, not much to maintain.
However, it would be nicer if it could grind finer.
Also, it doesn't let you put extra water for next time's use. It would use up all the water everytime.
*Update after 2 weeks of using *
I am changing it to one star.
The Grinder always gets stuck. I am very disappointed. But it's too late to return. Wasted money.

Great grinder for the price. I have two, one at home and one at work. Usually gets used daily. Might not be as nice as a burr but gets the job done if you just give it a little shake during the grind to make sure it's an even grind

reviews.reviewTitle: You get what you pay for. Worked for a total of five times and the. Stopped.
reviews.reviewText: I had high hopes for this coffee grinder. It worked well for three months and then the motor stopped working. I used it a total of five times in three months. Very disappointed. I ended up getting a refund on this one and buying a different brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Having a quality product you can depend on.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to grind spices and it works great! I always appreciated Krups appliance quality. Easy to use and clean.

I ordered aug 2. 2019
Today is oct 23 2019.
With light, normal use, this piece of crap Burnt up in less than 3 months!!
Krups should send me a new one!
Don’t buy!!!!!!!!!
I wish I could give zero stars!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke in just a few Months
reviews.reviewText: The Krups Coffee Grinder worked fine for a few months, didn't use it that often and then one day it just stopped working. The blade doesn't spin - really poor quality. DON'T RECOMMEND!

I own one of these that is probably 30 years old. It is still working although the mechanism that turns the grinder on appears to be wearing out at last. I only buy coffee beans from a local roaster and I only buy Krups grinders. I own one here and one in my summer home. I am now buying 2 more: one to replace the 30 year old one and one to grind spices. Simply the best.

reviews.reviewTitle: Thank you Krups for such a wonderful product
reviews.reviewText: I’m a spice lover and this li’l blender is a hidden gem i accidentally discovered. Extremely happy with the results. It’s surprising how quick this works in blending spices, coffee beans into fine or coarse powder of your choice. I bought a second one for my mom since I love the way it works.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great for me, but I'm ordering my second. First one broke after 1 1/2 year.
reviews.reviewText:
I love this machine, It works great to grind down my vitamins (horse pills size) so I can add to my powder drinks.
It's probably too fine for coffee. I guess it's good for espresso.
Mine broke this week after using it every day for 1 1/2 year.
It's small so great to not take up counter space. For less than $20 is very good.

Mine just broke after 2 years with a good maintenance routine. I believe this grinder would've lasted a lot longer if I used it more frequently, but after a few weeks of pause, the blade got stuck and that's the end of the machine. This coffee grinder works amazingly otherwise.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good, but only for a while...
reviews.reviewText: I liked this product when I first got it, and it worked well for a little while, but the motor died just a few months after purchasing. I like the size of it, and while it worked, it worked great, but it died suddenly and seemingly without cause. I prefer the kitchen aid one I have now with a removable grinding cup which makes it so much easier to clean than this one which is all one piece.

reviews.reviewTitle: Convenient, but not for coffee lovers
reviews.reviewText: Coffee does not taste good. Not sure if it is from the materials that the product is made from, or the residual coffee that is left over from the previous day's brewing, for which there is little remedy. The design means that about a tablespoon of coffee stays in the chute and does not get pushed out until the next day's brewing, and anyone who knows coffee understands air is not good for coffee. It uses more beans to get the same amount of brewed coffee as compared to a basic coffee pot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't fall for shiny things... make sure the equipment works. ------- KRUPS knows how to grind!
reviews.reviewText:
This replaced the long missed KRUPS grinder my parents got me 25 years ago.

An ex wife wanted to get a stainless one so we ended up with a piss poor replacement that looked good on the outside but was a mess. (like her)

Just like the new GF -- I am happy to have a new KRUPS grinder in my life. They both are well put together pieces.

reviews.reviewTitle: Less mess for spice and herb grinding
reviews.reviewText: I recently started growing and drying my own stevia (it is very easy as the plant is so hardy). When I tried to grind my dried stevia in my KitchenAid Coffee Grinder, it blew stevia bits everywhere so I decided to try the KRUPS 203-42 Electric Spice and Coffee Grinder with Stainless Steel blades, Black because the top-cap fits INSIDE the bottom rather than AROUND the bottom. I used the same stevia grinds that I had gotten from the Kitchenaid and the Krups 203-42 did not blow stevia anywhere; when I pushed down to grind, all the stevia stayed inside. Upon opening the lid, I was even more pleased to find that the Krups have given me an even finer grind than my KitchenAid. Also, the Krups 203-42 seems well made as well as stylish. Thanks Krups! Thanks Amazon for the great price and delivery!

Have had this coffee grinder in the past and it worked flawlessly. Not this time however. Unit stopped working completely after less than 5 months. Tried different outlets...all to no avail. Very disappointed in its quality. Switching to a Cuisinart coffee grinder!

This is another excellent product I would have been dubious about save for the wonderfully good rating amazon's customers gave it! The blade doesn't look much at all like a blade and appears to be poorly suited to grind up material placed in the device, that is until you see it in action! It actually creates a vortex of air and guides the material into the blade causing it to be ground up in quite a quick order. I was extremely impressed with how efficient and well this design works! I use it daily to grind up toasted flax seeds as well as herbs and other things like dehydrated tomatoes.

I only wish it wasn't against the directions to use warm soapy water to immerse the bowl of the grinder when washing it, if that was listed as acceptable to do it would be pretty much perfect!

I highly recommend this product!

Grinds beans to a fine powder very quickly. Make sure you are using it with paper filters and not a washable plastic one, as I'm afraid the powder would be too fine for the washable filters.

There are no settings or speeds, you just put the beans in and press down. A few seconds later you have a fine powder. Ideally I would want some kind of setting, but I don't need it. If you just want to grind some beans for your pot coffee, this is the way to go. No deduction in stars due to price point.

Pros:
+Fast grinding
+Finely grinds beans
+Great value for the price
+Simple press-and-go
+Easy to clean out

Cons: (Not enough to change rating)
-No settings

This works great, the only drawback is that the well for the grounds is so tiny you can barely scoop it out with a tablespoon. What I found easier is to dump out the grounds straight into a plastic container with a pouring spout (one of the ones that came with my zoku pop accessory kit) which makes it a lot easier to "pour" into my cold brew coffee maker (the part that holds the grounds).

I am allergic to most grains so when I bake I use a lot of nut flours. But buying nut flours can get a little pricy, especially if you don't need a lot of one type of flour since nut flours can spoil if stored to long. This works great for making small batches of nut flours and I have been using it for over a year now so it has held up great for the price. It produces a decent texture, great for muffins, cookies and breading on meat. But it is not as fine of a texture as most store bought flours, I found this to be an issue with breads. Overall I really like using this grinder to make my own nut flours and in the long run it has saved me a good bit of money. I would like if it were a little easier to clean.

I recently read that free range chicken egg shells contain the highest source of calcium available. A close friend raises hens so I not only enjoy delicious eggs but I have those calcium rich shells. I bought Krups Spice and Coffee Grinder specifically to grind up the eggshells. It does a fantastic job turning the shells into a powder which is then sprinkled onto food. (NOTE that should you use your grinder for eggshells, you need to know / research safe and healthy ways to handle farm fresh eggs so as not to contaminate your grinder etc.)

reviews.reviewTitle: This electric grinder is simple and effective, coffee lovers this is for you!
reviews.reviewText: This electric spice grinder is perfect for my daily java needs. It grinds up the coffee beans quickly and consistently with the right kind of grain, it's cost point is just right, and it is super easy to use and clean. I would definitely recommend this grinder for anyone who makes coffee frequently, or if you have any other spices in need of fine tuning. Great product!

This coffee grinder is exactly what I expected it to be with one exception. It's slim profile was a welcome surprise! I already have a million appliances on my kitchen counter so I really like that it is so slim and compact. It doesn't take up much space and fits perfectly tucked in between my toaster and my knife block.

When I first tried it out I thought it was odd that I couldn't control the grind size. Then I realized that it's all in how long you hold down the grind button. The longer you press the button, the finer the grind. I can get a coarse grind in about 4 seconds and a really fine grind in about 10. It's super quick and easy. So weather I'm using a standard coffee pot, or my French Press, I always get the right grind for the job.

The cord isn't super long, but it's not super short either. I found it was adequate length to give me several options in positioning it on my countertop.

My only complaint (if I had to come up with one) is clean up. It's kind of a hassle. However, I think this is indicative of all coffee grinders and not just this one. I just took a wet paper towel and wiped it out which seemed to work well enough.

Overall, I am really glad I bought this one and would definitely recommend it to a friend. For the price especially, I can't imagine anything better.

I absolutely rely on reviews to help me figure out which products to buy so I hope this review helps!

reviews.reviewTitle: It looks nice and grinds coffee beans
reviews.reviewText:
It looks nice and grinds coffee beans. The size of the grind is far from uniform. This is expected as there is no mechanism to remove particles that are already small enough. The grinds acquire a static charge and get everywhere. Perhaps a burr grinder would work better in this regard, especially if the entire housing were metal.

My goal was better flavor by grinding my own. I noticed no change in flavor, compared to store ground, vacuum packed coffee. I don't claim that there is no difference, just that I don't notice it when rushing at 6 AM. I'm sticking with pre-ground for now.
It stopped brewing coffee after 1.5 months of use.

It is easy to use. It makes some noise when it is grinding, but what do you expect? My only objection is that when I set the coffee strength to strong, it isn't as strong as I like. It is still a decent cup of coffee, though.

I've had this grinder for a couple of months and I'm very satisfied. It might take you a couple of tries to get your coffee or spices ground to the consistency you are looking for but that is one of the reasons I like this model. If you pulse it a few times you can have coarse black pepper or grind until you are down to a VERY fine powder. Perfect for cooking. I also use it for coffee and have had no issues. I would have to disagree with other reviews that say it is hard to clean or that it is poorly constructed. I just lightly rinse out the grinding bowl and lid when I'm done, hand dry and it is clean and ready to go again. I also haven't had issues with cross contaminating my coffee with spices. All you have to do is clean it (and that is not difficult). Good Value.

I bought this grinder based on the high number of great reviews. This was a replacement for another grinder that broke after less than a year. I admit that I did not read through the negative reviews, nor did I realized the things that I liked about my previous grinder.
There is no inner removable cup for the beans, so you must tip the entire unit over to empty it. More importantly, it is a nightmare to clean. The instructions state to brush it out with a brush. Nope. I also grind up enough beans for a few days, so it takes quite a few times filling up the grinder since it is a small capacity. Every time I took the clear cover off to empty and refill the grinder, coffee gets all over the counter.
I used this once this morning, and am back onto Amazon to pick out a new grinder!
The grinder did grind the coffee beans well, but there is more to a grinder than just the grinding abilities.

I bought this to grind my husband's dehydrated ghost, Carolina reaper and jalapeno peppers. I was able to get a nice fine grind. Because I ground peppers with this I wont be able to grind anything else. I would definitely buy this product again when our current coffee grinder dies.

reviews.reviewTitle: Use it good in first 30 days. Then it's useless
reviews.reviewText: Died after 3 uses.

reviews.reviewTitle: grinds coffee, kinda loud but that's good for waking up the house in the morning
reviews.reviewText: easy to use. wish I didn't have to hold the button down, but its only for 10 seconds. cleaning is less than easy...there's seams in the construction that catch the coffee dust, kinda hard to get it truly clean. whatever...i use it daily so it's always a little dirty.

reviews.reviewTitle: Had this for over 12 years...still keep coming back to it, regardless of the broken lid!
reviews.reviewText: We had purchased this grinder before our son was born...He's 12.5. The lid broke long ago (buying a new lid today after searching and seeing that they do actually exist!) and since then we have bought every grinder under the sun to try to replace it (before internet shopping was so easy-- it was whatever the department stores had at the time) and we keep coming back to this old beast (being afraid to throw it away). Even though we have to turn it on by sticking a fork in the button, it's quieter than anything and faster than anything we have tried. The Bullet is excruciatingly loud and the grind is not even! Mr Coffee motor seized up after so many uses as did the Cuisinart. This thing works as good as it did the day we bought it. This is the 200W motor, not the 160W motor.

This coffee maker/grinder is easy to clean and easy to use but I am very disappointed that I have to clean out a reservoir of coffee grounds EVERY DAY otherwise extra grounds made from grinding will throw off the amount that you need for the amount of cups of coffee you have set it for. The coffee maker makes good coffee but the quirky extra grounds is a hassle. I spoke to the manufacturer and she told me it had to be cleaned out daily. Noise level is about what you'd expect for a coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: A little noisy, but works great.
reviews.reviewText: Works great! It’s a little noisy though, something to keep in mind. Can grind about 3 tbsp of coffee beans at a time and not more but it grinds very efficiently. I’ve been using jt for a year and a half. I really don’t mind the noise though.

reviews.reviewTitle: fantastic grinder - still working perfectly 5 years
reviews.reviewText: My family has one of these and been working perfectly since day 1 for the last 5 years. Grinds quickly, fairly loud, haven't needed to sharpen blades yet. Can sometimes collect ground coffee under blade after grinding fresh beans. Well worth it.

Guys, do you want to buy a spice/coffee grinder with weak motor? Do you like to spend your money on a cheap quality? If you do ...please go ahead and invest in this cheap product. Mine died after 2 uses.

reviews.reviewTitle: Burned out after a few months
reviews.reviewText: Used this 1-2 times per day and managed to burn out the motor after about three months.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pros -fast -quiet -efficient fine grind Cons -grounds get stuck to base (easy to ...
reviews.reviewText:
Machine has worked fantastically, be aware coffee grounds get stuck in the bottom under the blades.
Pros
-fast
-quiet
-efficient fine grind
Cons
-grounds get stuck to base (easy to remove)

reviews.reviewTitle: The only spice mill you'll ever need!
reviews.reviewText:
I buy and use whole spices from a health food store. It is fresher and cheaper than packaged spices on the grocery shelves. It allows me the flexibility to purchase exact amounts for a particular recipe without wasting the unused portions.
Instead of buying individual spice mills I wanted one mill that could do all types of grinding, coarse or fine.
I went to America's Tedt Kitchen website to read their reviews. This product was 5 star rated. Knowing I could trust their experience and review I purchased the mill.
It livesup to its claim! It has a removable cup for easy pouring and cleaning. It's the only spice mill I need. And yes, it does awesome with coffee beans, nuts, etc.
I highly recommend this product! It is easy, quick, and produces an even grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: A classic, and even better than before...
reviews.reviewText: I had to buy this to replace one that finally gave up the ghost...after 30 years. Yes, I bought my first one in the early 80s and I'm so glad they're still being made. This new one is slightly different, but in only good ways. It is faster and quieter and the blades seem slightly more substantial. Oh, and the cord is shorter. Probably it wasn't made in China back in the 80s, but this one is, so I hope to get at least half the years I had from my original grinder. I use mine only for grinding coffee beans and it's perfect for that, which it accomplishes in about 5 to 6 seconds. Perhaps I'll buy another just for spice grinding, not sure yet.

Very easy to use. Nice little grinder. I used it for poppy seeds and almonds. 1 or 2 of the almonds just didn't get ground, but the rest were perfect. Would give more stars but the blade doesn't come out. So to clean you have to stick your fingers in with the blade and hope you don't get cut.

reviews.reviewTitle: there's nothing like them for the price
reviews.reviewText: I used a Krups grinder at my first job in a corporate office and let me tell you, there's nothing like them for the price. I've used other brands in the same price range and they just to live up to the standard Krups provides. I bought this one as an addition to my kitchen after missing freshly ground coffee and I am so glad I did. I do a good job of keeping the tub and blades clean after every use to prolong the life of my machine and to ensure a quality cup every time I grind. No recommend this product, as well as the good maintenance of it (for the sake of your brew).

reviews.reviewTitle: Solid but nothing to write home about
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is extremely simple and easy to use. The level of grind you get is directly related to how long you hold down the tab and while I find that I have to do it in short bursts and shake it occasionally so I don't end up with partial powder and partial whole beans, I've been able to get a good process in place for grinding to a consistency for my french press. I've used this 6-7 days per week for the past four months and it's held up like a champ. For the price it's fine.
Love this coffee grinder. We had a different brand and it broke after a few years, but it always got coffee grounds everywhere on the counter. This brand doesn't do that. Quick and easy.

reviews.reviewTitle: MUCH better than our old blade grinder coffee maker
reviews.reviewText: This coffee maker, while not REAL quite, is quieter than our old blade grinder coffee pot. It grinds beans to a finer grind and now we use about 25% less beans and have better tasting coffee. We are going to buy another one to keep in our motor home.

I used one of these nearly every day from 2008 to 2017. It worked great until it broke a few months back and I bought a $25 Cuisiart at the grocery store. It basically had the same specs as this Krups but I could only get a Folders-grade grind out of it. After a few days of buyers remorse I got another Krups off Amazon and all is right again. Don’t waste money on another brand.
HI. This Krups coffee maker is the same as my Capresso coffee maker. Except for a few minor cosmetic changes. The best part is it"s cheaper too buy!! I would recommend to a friend. Thx. Richard

I would have given this product 5 stars but, unfortunately, it only worked for around two bags worth of grinding coffee. I went to grind a bag yesterday after having not used it for a few months and the motor was completely locked up and wouldn't function. Very unfortunate.

After grinding, coffee must be poured from entire unit (no removable container), grounds do not empty easily, cling to lip and inside and out. No little cleaning brush included. It’s a mess.
Also timing for grinding is complete guess work. There is no timing mechanism you have to hold the button and guess.

Outstanding product. It’s always a tough decisions when there are so many options. The price is great and it’s a solid product. Only small downside is that it’s small and can’t grind too much coffee at one time. Overall I’d def purchase again.

reviews.reviewTitle: KRUPS Sprice and Coffee Grinder - Seemed to be used on arrival ?
reviews.reviewText: We purchased a NEW coffee / espresso grinder as it got rave reviews. Upon receiving it, it looked like it had been used and the blade doesn't work. I have requested a return / replacement item and will update once the new item ships to me and i am able to test a working / new item. I have nothing to grade the other features, such as easy to clean, noise level and easy to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Made a great superfine almond flour!
reviews.reviewText: I tried using this product to make fine almond flour, and it turned out great. I ground my store bought almond flour (which had a lot of big pieces of almonds) together with powdered sugar to prevent the almonds from turning into butter. After 30 minutes of grinding and sieving, I finally have superfine almond flour for macarons! My only concern with the product is when I use it for grinding for around 15-20seconds at a time, it heats up quite a bit and the motor smells like it's burning, but I found that when I let it rest a little bit, it's fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Product ok but waaaay too much packing material . Check yourself
reviews.reviewText: I gave this a three star rating . It's ok . Not really what I would call the highest of quality . What I really want to complain about is the amount of packaging this came in . Complete unadulterated waste . Total neglect for the environment or the carbon footprint . Pic included to show how much wasteful packing material was with such a simple product.

reviews.reviewTitle: OK but too small for us.
reviews.reviewText: We bought this to replace our Cuisinart and, after 3 days' use, we've decided to replace the Krups. This grinder seems solidly built and certainly grinds beans quickly and effectively. However, its volume was far too small for our needs and grinding routinely results in a portion of the grounds (about 1/5 of the cup's volume) adhering to the bottom of the grinder cup. Because the cup itself is not removable (a high volume lid substitutes for a removable grinder cup), this requires using something to loosen the grounds from the cup and turning the grinder upside down. The whole process is messy and, because we prefer more volume, we have to repeat twice for every pot of coffee. From other reviews, I infer that we prefer a larger volume of grounds than do others and so perhaps the volume won't be a problem for most.

Originally received one as a gift and likes it so much I bought one for my father as a Father’s Day gift. Very quiet operation and grinds up coffee beans with ease. I do wish it was a little easier to clean, it is difficult to get around the blades.

I bought this for our coffee. Our old one finally gave out after 20 yrs! I hadn't realized how noisy the old one was until I used this one. It is not too loud and grinds the coffee beans to the exact fine grind we like very quickly! We like it a lot!

An older model but works splendidly with seeds and oatmeal. Super easy to use (my parents learned how to use it in <1 min). Gets job done quickly! Clean up was a little frustrating when we accidentally tried grounding up roasted nuts and they turned into nut butter. Oops! Hard to get into blade crevices
Love this. The only reason I gave it four stars is because the cord is confusingly short. Still a great value and am happy I own it.

I never new coffee grinders were so cheap. There are different types and some people don't prefer this type as it spins and shoots the beans to the sides causing the grounds not to be uniform. But, for me, this does what I need at a great price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well, cheaply priced, not cheaply made.
reviews.reviewText:
Much cheaper in the long run. Bought 8 lbs. of coffee for $40 from whole foods. No pre-ground will compete with that.
Someone said you can't course grind. That is FALSE. Now, course grounding does tend to leave half a bean or two, but just scoop those out if you want course ground.
I like strong coffee, so I just lean on it until it's fine ground.
Anyway, if you can beat the price, you won't be getting the quality. This thing runs smooth and I'm very confident it'll last years to come.
I consider myself to be pretty picky about quality. First thing I did was to see if the blades were loose. Nope, of course not. It's Krupps, European, they don't mess around.
Oh yeah, and it's safe as heck. You push the top to activate the blades. No chance of stuff flying out or fingers going in.

looks no further, this coffee make is great. holds beans enough for about 3 pots worth, filter change is easy, water tank is wide enough to pour into fast and without spillage. it also isn’t super loud when it’s grinding. the coffee taste is fine, it’s not a espresso machine with a frother so don’t expect latte style creaminess.

May 8, 2012 -

After buying and returning at least three Capresso burr grinders due to motor failure, for a couple of years I ground my coffee at the store. Within warranty I still had to pay about $30 to Capresso for another one each time.

Then I saw this on Amazon at a lower price and with good reviews. I like it just fine, putting in three of those small conical scoops of beans into it, grinding for about 15 seconds, and pouring plus digging the resultant powder out with a tiny stiff brush. I use the paper filters and am very happy with the result. I judge that this design will last forever, because it works like a blender.

I just put a spare Krups in my cart for a spare. Belt and suspenders, you know.

I love this product! For a grinder it is pretty quiet compared to other ones I have used. It is also easy to use and grinds the beans up pretty quick! I tip it upside down for the grinds to go into the "cap" then pour the cap into my French press otherwise I make a mess.

Do not buy this grinder. Motor locked up after 7 weeks. Junk. Even when it was working it was very poor leaving whole beans. Look for something else. Also skip the brand that starts with M and ends with R and is white in color.

This was my second one. The first one lasted a couple of years. This didn't last at all. I didn't use it much and put it aside for a couple of months. Tried to use it the other day - dead. Do not recommend.

An OK grinder. The blades are set low so all beans get ground. My previous grinder would miss some beans because they would hide under the blades. It is easy to overgrind, resulting in a third of the grind being powder that needs to be scooped out with a spoon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish it comes with cleaning brushes
reviews.reviewText: The grinder is much better than the 10 bucks substitute from Walmart. Works sound and quiet. The only complain is a bit difficult to clean the blade area as suggested. It would be nice if a cleaning kit can be accompanying the product.

I have had three of these coffee grinders over the past 25 years. The first lasted over 20 years and I only replaced it because I felt the blades were getting dull. When the new one arrived I was pleased with how well it worked and of course it looked much better than my decades old one, but unfortunately, it was short lived. It worked for just under 2 years and then started smelling like something was burning each time I used it. I just received my third, and am hoping this one will last closer to 20 years than 2! I do have to say all of the grinders have worked well to grind coffee as well as spices, nuts and seeds.

reviews.reviewTitle: Started smoking after a handful of uses
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this coffee grinder a few months back and used it a few times. It's not easy to clean at all; cap can be washed but you basically have to wipe out the inside with the blade to clean it. Grinds coffee fine, noise is annoying as usual but that's expected with most coffee grinders.
I just moved into a new apartment and went to use this thing. It started smoking after three seconds of use, with the smell of something burning.

Complete waste of money.

Normally I do not write reviews but felt compelled to do so for this product. Would not recommend this product! I have only had it for a year and have used product, maybe a totally of 15 times (that is probably generous) and it is broken. Went to grind beans today to make a latte and it would not work. Motor seems to be ceased up, would not spin. Got it to spin and then it started smoking. This bean grinder has barely been used and it now broken. Will have to invest in a better one I guess. Would not recommend buying this.

reviews.reviewTitle: The grinder is oval. The blade is round. ...
reviews.reviewText: The grinder is oval. The blade is round. Coffee beans in the part of the chamber not reached by the blade do not get ground unless you do A LOT OF SHAKING AND JIGGLING.

We love a grind and brew coffee maker and this one is perfect for our needs. Our last one would get water or humidity inside. This one is easy to use and easy to clean. So far we are very happy and hope it lasts for many years.

Bought over a year ago and still holding up great! Have not seen any noticeable decline in performance. Use it mostly for grinding coffee, but have used it for chopping pine nuts and some basil. Blades are still sharp! Would purchase again.

Purchased this unit to replace an older, worn-out unit of same make and model.
Use: Daily for grinding whole coffee beans; occasionally for grinding nuts, spices, etc.
Pros: Unit is simple to use and takes up little counter space. Appearance is clean and easy on the eyes. Recommend black as it doesn't look dirty after grinding coffee. Reliable. Not expensive.
Cons: If you require a thoroughly consistent grain size in your ground coffee, seek another more expensive device. Difficult to clean after using it for grinding nuts or spices. Loud enough to stop conversation throughout the room. Unit gave off "burning electrical insulation" smell when used during the first week, so I watched it carefully and prepared to return it as defective. Then the unit quit putting out that smell and has been performing well since.
Summary: I would recommend this unit to a friend.
CWG_2009-10-15
You feel the power when you are grinding your morning coffee. I only use this for coffee and it does a wonderful job.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent product, I use it for powdering dehydrated fruit.
reviews.reviewText: This is so quick and sharp. I've only used it once so far, but I was grinding dehydrated lemon slices (with skin) into a powder, and it did an excellent job. It's a bigger size than many others, which is very handy. I would def buy again and might buy another for spices. I might buy this for giftd, too. I can't believe it's so inexpensive.b

reviews.reviewTitle: It worked perfect. I hope it lasts a long time
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to grind seeds for smoothies (Chia seeds to be exact). It is more cost effective to buy "whole" seeds and grind yourself. It worked perfect. I hope it lasts a long time. I gave it 4 stars because it is tedious to clean. I grinded all the seeds and stored in refrigerator in container. I have a supply to last me awhile, so I will not have to clean it that often as those who use it daily for grinding coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quick and easy full bean coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText:
Does a great job grinding coffee. I think the grind is pretty consistent and quick. I wouldnt suggest using it to grind herbs as the blades are blunt.
(I did see this grinder at Wally World for $14
Missing parts, didn't work properly. Grinder broke within 3 days. Save your money, buy something else.

Super powerful coffee grinder! This thing powers through it in like 15 seconds. Its smart that you cannot open the thing unless you unplug it... could totally see myself accidently blending a finger up (gag) because I'm clumsy. My dog hates the noise of this for some reason... its high pitched unlike a blender or a vacuum. He freaks out whenever I pull it out of the cabinet. Poor little guy.

As I don't drink coffee I can't attest to how well it grinds beans, but as a spice grinder it's first-rate. I've used it on cinnamon sticks that were almost as hard as rocks, and it reduced them to a fine powder in no time...quicker than anyone could if using a mortar and pestle. It's so powerful that it will even turn granulated sugar into a fine powder, much like the confectioners sugar used in icings. It's a bit of a hassle to clean, but a brush will usually remove any residue in a matter of seconds. The stainless steel cup inside makes the cleaning a bit easier too.

It's solidly built, takes up very little counter space, is relatively quiet (considering its function) and quite a welcomed addition to my kitchen. It's a safe bet that you'd find it a worthwhile purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: overall a great great grinder and works absolutely amazing
reviews.reviewText:
this is perfect for a FINE GRIND!! will do it fine as possible and fast as possible. also grinds up anything else you want really. not recommending you throw anything and everything in there but i've used it for other DRY items such as almonds, other nuts etc. works amazing.
the speed is very fast and again seems to turn anything into dust asap.
pretty quiet so not bad for morning use while others are sleeping
so easy to clean. ease of use is 5 stars for sure.
again only downside is if you dont like it fine watch how long you grind for as it will get to a fine powder relatively fast.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well, but design is a little lacking.
reviews.reviewText:
This little grinder works really well for the price. I deducted a star because its' not very easy to clean and there's only one setting so grinding your coffee for the first few weeks is more of a guessing game than anything else. Also, the cord is quite short. In most normal kitchens this may not be a problem, but since I live in a teeny, tiny manhattan apartment, cord length matters. As a result of the short cord, I have to set the grinder on the windowsill to use it because that's the only place the cord reaches.

When all is said and done, I probably would still buy this grinder again because it works well and it's small but powerful.

This is the fastest coffee grinder I have ever owned over a long time grinding beans, with a number of different grinders. It does have the usual unfortunate loud crunch and whirl sound but your beans are ground in a matter of only a few seconds. If you can tolerate the noise you will probably love it. I don't know of a quiet grinder so I guess this goes with the territory. The grind is fine for the typical pour over type pot that I have been using since the late 70s, they are automated now but the principle is the same. It might be hard to get an even coarse grind due to the high speed of the blades. That would be a drawback but people don't use percolators much nowadays, (and for good reason.)

This did not last very long at all until the switch failed to work, meaning it would grind on full speed whenever plugged in. Not soon after, the insides smoked and the bottom of the grinder completely MELTED. Do not buy (I got the blade grinder by the way)

I have had this grinder for almost 3 years now.
I mostly use it to grind coffee beans. It’s just perfect. Very uniform grind.
Cleaning is so easy.
No rust at all.
I even grinded cashews, star anise, bay leaf and some spices. Really great !!
I bought another one recently to gift it to a friend.
Such a great item.

The first Krups grinder I bought lasted several years, then the blade stopped turning although you can hear the motor running. Well even though it was difficult to clean, I got years of use out of it, so I bought another. This one only lasted about 6 months, then had the same problem. I won't be buying a third Krups grinder.

Rated product lower based on the noise level. It is deafening. I have a 10 yr old Mr. COFFEE grinder that is considerably quieter. This Krups grinder certainly does the job just be prepared to startle your entire family awake!

The lid chipped and cracked about a week after we got it, but it's holding together, everything still works well, and it's so much quieter than the magic bullet I was using, so I'm overall pretty happy with it. The only thing I don't like is that it can get pretty messy emptying it if you're not careful.

It dose the job but it's hard to get all fresh coffee out after grind. It can be messy, have to unplug it shake it over coffee maker. Have to rim finger around inside to get stuck grains Out. For the price it'll do but not the best design.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great to grind Chia & Flax seeds.
reviews.reviewText:
I use it to grind Chia and Flax seeds. It reduces them in powder in no time. Seems to be efficent and fast. I suggest you to fill it only with half of the product you want to grind because once the product is grinded it somehow increases in volume and you will want to avoid overflow and mess.
I would definitely suggest this grinder for home usage.
One little negative note: the power cord is short. On the manual it says it is to avoid the cord to get tangled or so...I say it is to save money on the cord on their side...

This is my third one of these little gadgets over the last decade. They work amazingly well for something that costs a pittance, staying sharp a good long time and efficiently grinding coffee (and nothing beats freshly ground coffee!) day after day.

reviews.reviewTitle: Get the Melitta 80391 Coffee Grinder for $10 More Instead
reviews.reviewText: This is OK only based on price. I bought this grinder and you had to guesstimate the fineness of the grind, hold until it was done and make a mess while trying to get the coffee out of the chamber. So I looked again on Amazon and found the Melitta Coffee Grinder (model 80391) and it addressed all of these issues for $10 more and looked much better to boot. It has a fineness adjustment, on/off switch, adjustable length cord and removable coffee chambers that this doesn't have. Not sure why this grinder has son many more reviews, must be the price. Save yourself the cost of having to purchase another one and just buy the Melitta first instead.

UPDATE (7/21/14): Still going strong after nearly 20 months of use almost every day. I love a good bargain, and this is one!

I was using a hand-powered burr grinder prior to this, which gave me a very even grind but was a lot of work. I was leery of a blade grinder but this is giving me a very even fine grind for my pour-over coffee. Have been using it daily since it arrived. I use a "pulse" method of grinding until I get the grind I want, and brush it out carefully after each use with a 1" soft bristle brush. Clean it with a soapy sponge every couple of days. Very satisfied with this so far (daily use--sometimes twice a day--for about a month now). It seems like it will be durable, but if it isn't, I'll come back to update this.

I've used several versions of this grinder and recently replaced one whose motor is dying after about a decade. No complaint there. But I was very unhappy to find that Krups has drastically shortened the cord, from 52" on the old grinder, down to 29" on the new one. This is awkwardly short, and a source of daily annoyance. Dumb decision, Krups!

120V!!! Brought this grinder to Ukraine, pluged it in the socket and it started to smoke and burn, because we have 220V! I've never ever in my life seen an american appliance that doesn't work in Europe! I have bought many other things and all of them worked in 100-240V range. Massive disappointment!

The Krupp's grinder I purchased just over a year ago has now given up the ghost--the third one to do so in about five years, bought for a kitchen I don't use more than seven months a year. I don't use them for coffee grinding; they're there for spices and small amounts of nuts. These machines are absolute junk, and the only reason I keep purchasing them is because it costs more to have them repaired than to buy them, which seems, more and more, to be true of small appliances in general, but this is a particularly egregious case. Silly me--once upon a time Krupp actually meant superior quality. What I replace this one with might well not be any better, but it won't be this brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: It grinds it super fine, perfect for my vaporizer
reviews.reviewText: I do not use this for coffee, I use this for herb, and honestly, I never want to go back to a manual grinder again. It grinds it super fine, perfect for my vaporizer. It's pretty loud, I wouldn't buy it if you are trying to be discreet. I'm not sure how it works for coffee, but for my needs, it was perfect.
The grind is far too coarse, even on the Lowest setting , I have stopped using it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loud and hard to clean, but that will be any grinder. works well!
reviews.reviewText: Loud and hard to clean, but that will be any grinder. works well!
Great spice grinder for the money
Purchased in October and used on average once every two weeks for grinding whole beans. So, maybe 10 uses. It has just died. The motor is whirring but the blade won’t spin.

Took the recommendation of the American Test Kitchen. So happy with my purchase. Wicked easy to use and clean. Grinds my coffee with ease, fits enough beans for a full pot of coffee. Nothing like the smell of fresh ground coffee; makes a big difference. Can't beat the price of this grinder.

Well... I never had one before so I can't compare it but it does what we were hoping it would do, grind our coffee beans, and it does so perfectly. It nice and small enough to fit in our cup board and Krups is a brand I trust. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewTitle: but I'm so glad I did
reviews.reviewText:
I was a little hesitant about purchasing this due to some of the negative reviews, but I'm so glad I did! It grinds great, no problem with chunks of beans left behind. And if has no problem grinding as many beans as you can fit it. I haven't tried grinding seeds, so don't know how it would hold up there - but for a daily pot of coffee or 2? This thing is awesome - and you can't beat the price!

(Note: I grind in 2-3 pulses for less than a minute total.)

Excellent Product Highly Recommended! Switched To Whole Bean Coffee Perfect Little Grinder Improved My Coffee Quality Taste Aroma Combined With Quality Beans A Must Buy For Any Serious Coffee Connoisseur A+

I absolutely love this cold brewer. This is my second one and I just cannot say enough about it. The first cold brewer I got was a simple glass pot with a mesh screen and while it worked well, you couldn't leave it in the fridge for 2 weeks like you can with this unit. The ability to take the filter out and seal this jar for up to two weeks is simply awesome.

I'lol definitely be getting this guy again for gifts for my coffee loving friends

I picked this up as an inexpensive test to fresh ground coffee each morning. If it didn't work out and was more hassle than it was worth, then I would only be out a few bucks.

Well, 3 months later and I can't STAND anything but freshly ground coffee now. I'm turning into a coffee snob!! I've even gone to a perm filter to get more of the amazing, fresh flavor through to my cup and it all started with this little monster.

Pros: inexpensive, durable, efficient, small foot print
Cons: after grinding some effort is needed to get all of the grounds out of the basket, but it's not bad at all.

There are probably better grinders out there, but I am very pleased with this purchase.
Very easy to use, just put the beans into the grinder and it’s very low noise level. If you are just make a small batch of bean this is very ideal machine

reviews.reviewTitle: Loved the grinder when i first received it
reviews.reviewText: Loved the grinder when i first received it, that was one time I used it. Two years into owning it I have only used it at the most 5 times. So, in the past 2 years no more than 5 uses and those times I've only used it to grind herbs to make tea, so it is not grinding anything to heavy. I turn it on to grind dried chamomile flowers and it just starts to give out a smoky smell and i notice the blade is not spinning and smoke is coming out where the cord is connected to the device...I'm so disappointed only a handful of times used for small batches of dried herbs. and it just gives out?! So disappointed.

We can now brew 10 cups of hearty half-caf every morning, for which we use one cup (8 oz by volume) of freshly roast beans. Second-by-second, this grinder is a little noiser than our previous three grinders (2 Mr. Coffee, Black & Decker), but it's more powerful and quicker. Our old grinders were all too small and we had to grind two batches. So, considering the time-integral of noisiness, this grinder is actually about 40% quieter. The cord is a little short (29"), but it still gets 5 stars.

First time I have used coffee beans . In fact bought by accident thinking it was ground coffee. I hate returning things so I purchased this little coffee grinder. I was surprised at how easy it was to use and so fast ! It was fun!

I bought this based on the Krups name but I have my doubts as to it's durability.If you look at the picture on the top there is a black tab. This is the on/off switch. It is attached to the cup .It has this tiny tab than pushes down into the base to start the mill I see that breaking off easily.So since I foolishly threw out the packaging I'm going to keep this and be VERY VERY CAREFUL with that cap

Compared to my previous coffee maker (which was of a similar design). The brewed coffee is not as rich in flavor even with the bold setting and the brew is a reasonable temperature but not hot even with the temperature set to hot. Filling it with water to a certain level requires a person to look down through the top of the machine which can only be easily accomplished by being over 6 feet tall

Great little coffee grinder. The key with these little electric ones is to flip them over when you're almost done to force all the grounds into the lid so when you take the lid off (while still upside down) the bottom and blades will be nearly clean and all the coffee is handily in the lid instead of the grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not for Grindering Spices Very Fine
reviews.reviewText: I wanted something that would grind a little finer than this one does. If you are using it to grind coffee I would give it 5 stars. My need is for something that will grind spices very fine almost to a powder for making chai tea. Granulates are still too thick/heavy and will settle to the bottom of the cup after grinding on this machine. I do have several other machines I could run it back though hope one of them grinds it finer. I cannot seem to find one that grinds micro fine “powder-es”.

i had one of these a hundred years ago and it has not changed. i bought a mill grinder for coffee beans and then i learned that for rough ground beans which you use in a bodrum french press an electric blade grinder is good enough. for sure it leaves some large chips of bean and some finer grains all mixed in. you do not get a consistent grind, though if you carry on grinding you will get a more consistent grind, but then it is getting too fine for french press.
so, it is cheap and reliable and grinds to rough grade in seconds. saving me time on the slow mill grind.

I bought my first Krups grinder 27 years ago. We used it every day to grind coffee, sometimes twice a day, and it finally gave out this winter. Naturally, we bought another Krups and it works fine. This new one might outlast me.
If you love fresh ground coffee, this thing is a god send. Easy to use, easy to clean and does and excellent job and producing and size grain you wish. Highly recommend for coffee lovers.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product especially for the price!
reviews.reviewText: I thought this product would make more noise but it is surprisingly quiet. The most noise you hear is the coffee beans initially when they are spinning around before being broken down. You can see the grids as you use it so it is very easy to choose the texture you want. It looks exactly like the product in the picture.

Fill the hopper with beans. Set the strength. Push start. It’s that easy. The mesh filter rinses clean easy. I brew Tarazza Costa Rican whole beans and everyone who visits has nothing but rave reviews for the coffee I serve.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... needed something to grind stuff up whenever we felt like it. I used to use another brand for ...
reviews.reviewText: We use alot of spices in our food and needed something to grind stuff up whenever we felt like it. I used to use another brand for $5 cheaper but that only last about a year before it dies. Wanted to try another brand and see how well it holds up. Havent used it for too long so cant say how long it will last but this grinds stuff faster and to a better powder than the other one. Doesnt get as warm as the other one either which is great.

It's a Krups. Works great, easy to clean, lasts for years if you don't abuse it. My 3rd one over the years. Have one at work we've been using for 3 years and still going strong. And we grind alot of coffee.

Dang, what a difference freshly ground coffee makes! I went out and bought this one based on the positive reviews but I gotta say, this grinder is merely okay. I use a coffee cone dripper so I don't want my coffee ground too fine. But, the grounds are in uneven sizes if i don't grind it for as long as I should for a automatic coffee dripper.. so that's minus a star. Another star was lost because it doesn't come with a brush. Lots of coffee grounds get stuck in the blade area and that's going to make your coffee taste subpar so make sure to get one and dust it off! I use a pastry brush and I wouldn't recommend it because the bristles are too soft. Any sturdy bristled brush should work though!

This little guy is very powerful! I bought this to grind oxidizing powders down for making rockets... and it turns it into a very very fine, almost impalpable powder. DO NOT grind any type of metal in this, not only will it dull the blades, but it could burn the motor up and then it will no longer work. Also, this is very fast, it only take about 30 seconds to produce very fine results. PS... Use this only for one thing and do not rise out the main part at all. The lid can be rinsed out but be sure it is completely dry before the next use.

We bought this same grinder years ago from Williams & Sonoma and recently bought another off Amazon to use exclusively for spices. Holy smokes! I'm not sure what happened but this is significantly louder than the first!

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as I hoped, but it's okay
reviews.reviewText: I wasn't as impressed with this grinder as I wanted to be. It leaves chunks of the bean even when I move it around to try to get everything ground. I have stopped using it for coffee -- I have my coffee ground at the store where I buy it. I may use this grinder for spices, or when I get gifts of coffee beans. It will grind up coffee for sure, so it is definitely *not* a piece of junk! I'll keep it around for emergency grinding purposes, but I will continue to get my coffee ground on the "big machine" at the store.

Works as I thought. Easy to use. Looks nice on my counter. I bought it grind seeds, flax seed, sesame seed, etc. as well as any fresh herbs I grow in my garden and let dry for use in cooking. Only 4 stars because the stainless steel part doesn't come out for cleaning. Its easy enough to wipe clean with a wet towel. I would recommend it.

Love this machine! The only thing I would change is the carafe, it's not very "spill proof" you have to pour very slow to not spill the coffee but that's not a huge deal. This machine is definitely worth the money.

Pros:

It will grind coarse to fine dependent on the time you spend holding down the ON button.

It grinds quickly with a strong motor. I have had the older model 4 cup for over 15 years and it still works.

This model is slightly larger and can take more beans, likely for at least 8 cups.

It feels and sounds like the older model, so likely it will be very reliable ... my old 1980s bought model still works well. AC motors are far better than DC battery models: strong, powerful and reliable. Black is a good color, hides dirt better!

Cons:

The cord is far shorter than the original, and it can be a minor hassle if AC sockets are not in easy reach. The cord has no storage area but being shorter, is less in the way.

The grinder cover can be dishwashed, but the metal bowl cannot be removed. You'll need to clean out grounds with a spatula or brush, just like the older model. The bowl is not a tightest fit like the older model. There is a tiny gap between the plastic body and the bowl that could leak fine grinds, over time, into the housing that later gums up the motor.

Like many things plastic, the cover-lid will eventually break with use. Overtime, my older grinder lid edges chipped away. Recently, a crack appeared on the top, but not bad enough to leak grinds. It would be best if the lid were made of metal. Add a small glass window to see the grind, and the grinder could last forever. The wear on my old grinder cap is a reason for buying this new Krups grinder.

These are small prices to pay for a good product.

Perfection for this grinder? Change the following:

Removable dishwasher safe bowl
Metal lid with glass window
Stowage area with self retracting cord

It may cost more, but will last forever.

This is one wonderful coffee grinder. In just seconds -- in mere single digits of seconds -- it reduces big ol' gnarly coffee beans to fine dust, ready to put into the filter. This fast-grinding is a real plus if you live with other people who don't get up so early in the morning, because you don't make coffee-grinding noises for more than a few seconds, and your slothful housemates can sleep in.

I've been through several coffee grinders before I got to this one. The first had a switch go bad, and for years I was turning it on with the point of a ballpoint pen. Even then, it was very slow (and noisy) in grinding coffee: 20 seconds of grinding left me with something about the consistency of gravel. The second grinder (whose brand-name, by the way, is the same as that of a very well-known chain of coffee shops) mysteriously gave up the ghost -- just plain quit working, with no warning signs. But this Krups grinder looks like a keeper. I've been using it for several years now, and I have nothing but praise for it.
It's a blade coffee grinder. Hold it for a few pulses and it grinds up the coffee beans. It is a bit loud but if you want a quiet one then a manual one would be better suited for that.

Nothing fancy here. It's a simple coffee grinder that gives a consistent grind without leaving coffee on the top. With my old grinder, coffee seemed to stick on the top due to static. When removing the top, coffee got onto the counter no matter how hard I tried to tap it down before removing. The design of this grinder eliminates the problem. I am very happy with this for coffee.

I bought one of these about 4 months ago, and I have not used it often, but the blade was connected to the shaft by plastic rather than metal and I have no idea why, because it seems to have stripped out that plastic and not the thing is useless. I don't se anywhere to buy a new blade, nor can I see any way that I would be able to hold the shaft still while screwing on a new blade if I had one. It was nice while it lasted, but really I am disappointed with this outcome of it becoming useless after only 4 months of occasional use, apparently due to something that should have been completely avoidable.

I bought this because I had a Krups coffee grinder that I got in about 1988, and put in out travel trailer last year. This one works as well or better than the old one (which is still working, by the way). I've never been disappointed in anything I've purchased from Krups!

reviews.reviewTitle: Fairly sturdy but holds on to smells
reviews.reviewText: So this is a pretty good spice grinder. I can't always get it to grind finely. It is really difficult getting strong smells out which is a little lame when it is made to grond strong smelling stuff. It has lasted pretty long.

I love this grinder. So happy to have freshly ground coffee everyday. Although it is not the easiest to clean. I'm going to have to buy a small cleaning brush like the one that is shown in the instructions on how to clean it... you would think they would provide this little cleaning brush smh. Still love it and I just wipe it down with a slightly damp paper towel for now.

reviews.reviewTitle: WARNING - This arrives in a plain cardboard box!
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is fine for the price. It has a very small capacity - you'll need to do it in two batches for a full pot of coffee grounds. Also, it arrives in a plain unmarked cardboard box, so if you're giving it as a gift, it won't look very nice. I think this bit of information should be more prominent in the item description.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this. It's so easy to use
reviews.reviewText: Love this. It's so easy to use, sturdy and gets the job done asap! I've used it so far to grind the hell out of my flaxseed haha. Great product at a great price. The only downside is the clean up without getting water in parts you dont want it. It's been quite easy for me since I can use a wet napkin but if you're doing some wet I would suggest only gettting water in the top part strategically.
Bad quality

I have used this for several of my homegrown herbs and spices. Other choppers, grinders, and food processors do not cut the product small enough. Nothing like getting a giant chunk of red pepper in your meal. Not with this little power house. The Krups F20342 mills even sage into a perfect powder. No strings, no chunks, no mess. Easy to clean with a pastry brush or a quick wipe with a damp paper towel. works great with peppercorns and cayenne peppers. Even mills the seeds. I have only used it for dry herbs and spices. I have yet to try it with nuts or garlic.

I dig it!
I used this grinder daily for 10 years before it quit working. The new one is powerful and only needs a few seconds of operation to grind. Coffee wipes out easily for brewing.

Watch out before getting this. I got this to grind whole beans for my french press. I went looking through the manual and this was built to make espresso type coffee grind (they recommended one of their burr-type grinders for coarse grinds). However, if you watch your grind carefully and shake the beans in a bit in between little spurts of grinding, you can make sure it doesn't get too fine. I made a couple of french press coffees after I got it, and it's been fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quiet grinds good but lid is hard for me to get on and take off.
reviews.reviewText: The lid is difficult to remove pinched my hand when putting back on grinds good and quiet.

reviews.reviewTitle: Difficult to get correct strong brew.
reviews.reviewText: Almost impossible to brew strong coffee. Trying to get the combination pf coffee plus water is not easy and itvshould be.

reviews.reviewTitle: You're better off grinding beans with teeth.
reviews.reviewText: I would not say I hate it, but it's close. The tapered design is not terrible, it is horrible. Let's say you were grinding coffee beans for a pot of coffee. Not a cup, but 8 cups or more. when you take the lid off, the coffee comes with it. No retractable cord, push button gets coffee grinds stuck in there because of the design. This has design flaw written all over it. I have to do small amounts of coffee beans, usually two times to make a pot of coffee. In the picture, see the beans? That is actually what happens and where it happens. That was not product placement, that is a warning.
Used it to grind coffee beans. Cleaned it up and put it aside. Doesn't work from the second use! :/ I can hear the motor go. but the blades dont turn!

I don't know why this grinder is a best seller. I have used it twice already, and I am greatly disappointed with the grind I am getting. I thought the first grind was a fluke, since it was new, but the second grind produced the same results. I had to grind it waaay to long to get the desired grind. When I poured the grounds into my french press, there were still big pieces of bean. To make things worse, there was so much powder stuck in the bottom of the grinder, I had to wipe it out with a little towel and got mess everywhere.

I had an $8 grinder that worked perfectly for about 2.5 years, but it finally died.

This grinder is mediocre at best.

I am very suspicious of the high rating and best seller status. I should have gone with my gut and spent the extra $20-$40 on a burr grinder. Buyers remorse is definitely what I am feeling.

If anything changes, I will update this post, but I'm not holding my breath.

**UPDATE**

I have had this grinder for about a month now. I have gotten used to it, and I dont get giant grounds anymore. Dust is a problem. It takes me more time to clean the inside of the grinder after use, than it does to grind the beans or press the coffee. I seriously think the high rating on this product is artificial.

This does exactly as described. Only complaint is that it grinds the coffee a little to fine if you grind it a little too long. I end up having to scrape little fine grounds out of the bottom with my finger. But I’ll do anything to get a good cup of coffee in the morning. Ultimately I am very happy with this grinder.
Performance is brilliant with easy to use and powerful to grind quickly coffee and spices. Fully satisfied with the product and the only issue is having a some sound but not too noisy.

I love this grinder! I've had my home grinder for over 20 years, and it's still working great. It is a straight forward grinder...no strange twisting to get lids on, dials for grinds, bells and whistles -- just very very simple and it works great.

It gets used at least once a day, and frankly I abuse it...I grind super-fine for an espresso machine, and tend to participate in the grinding process for some odd reason by shaking the grinder up and down a few times while grinding. Honestly, I don't recall if, 20 years ago, I decided that super-fine needed that, but it's what I do all the time, even if making a coarser grind for the odd drip-cone cup of coffee. My shaking has been, I believe, responsible for a wire inside coming loose, so once when it stopped working I opened it up, found the loose wire, and reconnected it. Very simple wiring inside. Blades are still sharp, the lid has a few chips in it but so do I after 20 years.

I'm reviewing this product now since I'm going to buy a new one soon, to have in the wings should my old one simply give up the ghost one day after I shook it just a bit too much...and I can't bear the consequences of not being able to grind my morning beans if that happens. I've shopped around a bit and looked at what is out there these days, and decided I'm just going to go for exactly the same one -- don't need the Star-Trek Enterprise model coffee grinder (in fact, I bought one of those once for a field station, where it got used less than once-a-day, and it irreparably died after a couple of years....so I bought a Krups for the station instead and it's doing fine).

This has been in my home for 2 years, used every day exclusively for coffee. The job is quick and although I bought a brush I find that my finger is faster to get the ground coffee out from among the blades. Since coffee contains oils, for me it was better to have another grinder for nuts and a mortar and pestle for spices since spices are used generally in much smaller quantities. The grind is consistent, however unlike the professional grinders in stores that produce many degrees of grind you get 1 which is not as fine as very fine--somewhere between fine and medium which works for me.

But very effective. I bought the Proctor Silex and this one, for my house and office respectively. Although this thing is as loud as a lawn mower, it is effective and efficient, as it grounds evenly and quickly. I have used it 94 days since getting it on May 4th, the electric motor made a funny smokey smell this morning, but it did not effect the integrity of the coffee.

This little tiger can turn coffee beans into powder if you wish. It only does about 1/2 cup of beans at a time, but has them reduced to fine granules in 10 to 20 seconds and a powder in not much longer. My only complaint is that some of the ground coffee sticks to the sides or bottom (about 1 teaspoon of it). Tapping the unit helps but still leaves some. I usually give it a quick wipe with a clean finger to free up the coffee that has stuck. I expect it has to do with moisture in the coffee beans. There's a stainless steel bowl in the bottom and plastic sides so I don't know what more could be done about this problem. Of course, it's not much of a problem and I would guess that most compact units like this, if not all of them, probably have the problem.

Let me start out by saying that burr coffee grinders leave me out in the cold. We've had three. The most recent one was a Cuisinart burr grinder. In each case, the motors on the burr grinders burned out after a few months. On the other hand, the blade coffee grinders last for years. We just bought this one after our previous blade grinder lasted for five years. The Krups grinder works very well. Yes, a drawback is that there's no control over how coarse or fine the grind is. Coffee aficionados would probably say to go for a burr grinder, yet to the contrary, this Krups grinder helps create a rich, bold cup of java, keeping all of the coffee drinkers in my house happy.

I have had this coffee grinder for over 10 years and have used it every day to grind my morning coffee. I have never had any problem with it and it grinds coffee very finely (if you want), and evenly. One of the most reliable appliances I have ever owned. A great value. Have owned other brands including grinders built in to the coffee maker (a HUGE mistake). None of them remotely compare to this. I just bought another one for my weekend house.

reviews.reviewTitle: it's a great product. I have a French Press and should've ...
reviews.reviewText: For what it's advertised as, it's a great product. I have a French Press and should've bought a burr grinder so that I could get a coarser grind. This grinder doesn't have any settings that allow for that; it's controlled by grinding the beans for a shorter or longer period of time. I find that grinding them for a short time doesn't produce consistent grind size, but I also wasn't expecting that. Grinding the beans for a longer period produces consistently fine grounds. Sure, I spill a little powder on the counter when transferring them to the press and I worry that cleaning the machine with the nozzle from my faucet will damage the motor, but for $20 and an impulse buy, this is a great little bean grinder.

Bought our first Krups grinder and used for a few years. It just stopped working one day. So decided it was a fluke and ordered another. We have had it since July 28, 2018. It is now December 22, 2018 and this one has stopped. Smells like the motor burned up. I am thinking these need a bit of quality control. Very disappointed. I wanted to try my new coffee beans!!!

My first one of these coffee grinders was purchased almost 20 years ago. It is still going strong. I only chose to replace it when my husband took it out to the garage to grind shelac flakes. I replaced it with the same type. Now, I am shopping for a new one to keep up at our cabin, and I have been looking at fancier ones that have different grind settings, but will probably end up with this grinder again. You can't beat the price. This appliance is worth every one of the few dollars you will pay for it.

Using this nearly every day, sometimes multiple times a day, for 2 years now, and it still works just as well as when I bought it. Yes it’s noisy and yes you should probably hold the top down, but it’s a simple solution that doesn’t take up much space. It’s uncomplicated, inexpensive, and it works well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bought for herbs, spices and such.
reviews.reviewText:
I didn't buy this for coffee, but herbs and spices for my soaps and bathbombs. I've only used it once and that was for dried orange peels. This little baby crushed those peels like nobody's business! They were all finely ground and made perfectly natural exfoliant for my soap. I would like to say that the cup that holds the blade is NOT removable, so buyer be well aware of this before purchasing. It's no biggie for me because I just used a piece of wheat bread and that cleaned it right on up. I still recommend it.

The speckles in the soap picture are the orange peels. They feel so good on the skin!

I can't really complain about it, it does what it's supposed to. Great purchase for the money. I wish it was easier to clean, but hey! a little bread crumbs can't hurt anybody (I grind pieces of bread to clean it).

A grinder that can be used for beans as well as for spices. I use it for both.
The grind is coarse because you do not have a choice. If you try to control the grind - you will be left with pieces of beans.
Cleaning is a hassle - because the grind leaves residue and has to be painstakingly cleaned, again this is not a hassle but if you use it for spices and coffee- could be as spice grinds could end up smelling like coffee and viceversa. You can use a brush for this purpose.
The machine is not loud but the sound while grinding could be lower.
I love the machine, as it does what it is supposed to.

This coffee grinder/maker does make a delicious cup of coffee BUT it also makes a very loud high pitched beeping sounds both when it finishes brewing and when the hot plate turns off. This is slightly disastrous for a family trying to keep anyone asleep in the morning.
