My husband gets up earlier than all of us and now either wakes us all up or has to forego a much needed cup of coffee to avoid the beeps. If anyone knows of a way to get these beeps to stop please share! Thanks!

reviews.reviewTitle: Depends on what you’re looking for
reviews.reviewText: This is easy to use but not easy to clean as the part with the blade is attached to the cord so I can’t immerse it in water. Also I wish there were course med fine crush options

reviews.reviewTitle: Inexpensive, and does the job expertly
reviews.reviewText:
Made large amounts of milled flaxseeds in this, and a little bit of ground cashews (trying to make cashew butter). The cashew butter didn't work out (more like a powder, and is hard on the motor), but does a great job with the flax.

Somewhat of a hassle to clean (not their fault), but put some water in the chamber, run it, empty it, and dry it out with a paper towel. Keep pulsing the motor then toweling it to get it really clean/dry, otherwise water hides in and under the blades.

Not recommended for nut butter, but perfect for seeds and coffee beans.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quieter than other grinders I've used
reviews.reviewText: Bought the Krups F203 Electric coffee and spice grinder for nutmeg and it works terrific. Not too loud; gets the job done quick and nice powdery texture. Would think it would work even better on coffee beans because they are so much softer and smaller then nutmeg.
This coffee grinder is great my coffee tastes so delicious, it is also so easy to use easy to clean no regrets in buying this krups coffee grinder it's perfect

reviews.reviewTitle: I save beans and enjoy fresh coffee throughout the day!
reviews.reviewText: Small, compact, perfect size. Works excellent. Easy to use. Doesn't take up room on the counter. As a single guy it grinds the right amount for me. I use to make a big pot every morning and throw half away. Now, I make one cup at a time with my french press. I save beans and enjoy fresh coffee throughout the day! I'm HAPPY!

For the price, the quality and durability of this grinder is excellent! The noise is significantly less than my old grinder and I don't have to go in the garage in fear of waking up the household! Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewTitle: (Blasts "Adore U") PS I wish they could fins something other than that white plastic to hold the blade- I hate having my food co
reviews.reviewText: "Where have you been all my life?!" The one thing I found bizarre was that it says it can be used for nuts in this listing, yet the instruction manual specifically stated for use wih coffee only- if this fails on me, I will return as false advertising- until then... (Blasts "Adore U") PS I wish they could fins something other than that white plastic to hold the blade- I hate having my food come into contact with plastic, especially in a grinder.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
Seriously, don't buy this machine! First of all, coffee is OK but is not really good. It is a cheaply made machine.
Grinder broke down in 3 months. Dear seller, you should either lower the price of the machine or provide with a repair.
Honestly, I am very disappointed and will have to throw my money in the garbage.

I loved this grinder, it was perfect for my spices until it randomly broke one day. The blade doesn't turn anymore but I hear the motor running? So, it was good while it lasted. I'm not going to cheap out on a grinder again. And I'm passed the available dates to return it, so I can't even get it replaced.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great blender, does dull after many uses
reviews.reviewText: Great blender, does dull after many uses. We use this coffee grinder in the office, and I would say after about 300 grinds the blade starts to dull and you have to run the grinde longer to get the right texter of coffee grounds. This grinder is so cheap though, you are better off grinding daily until the motor dies and then just buy a whole new one. Since blades costs $10 when the whole grinder itself cost $20, sad isn’t it?
Ever morning I grind my coffee fresh, and watch my 2 little fur friends scramble across the tile floor during operation. Functional and entertaining.

reviews.reviewTitle: Used once and now blade won’t spin.
reviews.reviewText: Used once and now it won’t work! Too late to return. Super disappointed in this. Had to give it a one star all the way ☹️

reviews.reviewTitle: Best One Out There for the Price
reviews.reviewText: Had a Krupps grinder for years and it finally broke down. Actually I broke it. The new one seems better - is quieter and I expect it to last years grinding my coffee.

I didn't realize the very small amount of beans one could grind. I was looking to grind a few days worth of coffee at a time. It looked like a nice quality machine, but I didn't try it and returned due to the size.

I've been making espresso at home for years, using an older model Krups grinder and was seriously looking for what I believed would be an 'upgrade' in buying recommended burr grinders. Loads of research later, THIS is the grinder most recommended. For the price - it is phenomenal. NO, it does not have 18 settings to grind coffee beans. NO, it will not shut off automatically if you "over-grind." However, if you can count down by seconds, check once or twice, and get the timing right for the grind you want, NOTHING beats this grinder - not for the price - not for the results.

reviews.reviewTitle: Durable, reliable, and easy to use.
reviews.reviewText: Great product use every day for grinding my coffee. Used it also to grind up spices. Takes a feel to it to grind it to how fine you want it. Durable and reliable. Great purchase would recommend to anyone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not worth the money I spent!
reviews.reviewText: Very disappointed in this product. The first one I had for years and was very happy with it before it froze up. I could understand that as I used it so much and had it so long. This one I have not had six months and it has already frozen up so I cannot grind coffee with it. Very disappointing to say the least! My rating on this one would not even be one.
I bought this to chew up and spit out dried ceramic paint. It works great for it. Haven’t tried it with coffee beans but if it can pulverize dried ceramic paint, it should work just fine for it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best one on the market, don't listen to them!
reviews.reviewText: I've tried the others and this is the most simplest way to see your coffee and grind it without too much fuss. I use it over and over again and it never fails. I don't grind my coffee to dust so it's a great way to control how you like your grind. Really the best one on the market. I've had one for a year and left it when I moved and now it looks like Mr coffee is too primitive.

If you are some sort of extreme coffee aficionado, this might not be your grinder. But, if you are like me and just want something to grind coffee for your French press, this is your grinder. I've had mine for years and bought this one as a gift for my dad. It works great is easy to clean and lasts forever.

reviews.reviewTitle: This coffee grinder is great, stainless steel blades you are the one that ...
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder is great, stainless steel blades, you are the one that controls the coarseness you want for your coffee beans with putting your finger on top for the grind to begin, let go,see how your beans look, this has the see through plastic and after a few grinds you know exactly how you want your coffee beans 2 come out and before I bought this new one I had a Braun coffee grinder I bought over 20 years(still working),basically same design, these little machines last a long time and are very dependable. I found it easy after the beans are grounëd to unplug the grinder, turn it upside down, take off the plastic lid and pour into whatever coffee maker you are using ,very easy and no mess.

Honestly - it works ok - used it to grind up some Starbucks bean coffee for use in a Kurig - worked out "ok" - not great - but it was WAY cheaper then a proper grinder - so if your looking for a "ok" & cheap grinder - this works well enough - not even REMOTELY close to a pro grinder - but - I knew that going into this purchase - all the 4 & 5 star reviews are fairly accurate in the way this little grinder works - it's cheap ... & it works ...

reviews.reviewTitle: Even grind, not easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: I tried using a manual grinder for coffee. What a misguided idea. Unless you want to sit and mindless grind for 20 minutes to get enough for a single cup of coffee, go electric. I do about 2 scoops for 15 seconds (10 seconds on, 5 pulses) to get a nice grind for my Aeropress. The grind is consistently even. I do wish there were an easier way to get the coffee out---I always end up spilling it in an attempt to pour the coffee from the grinder into the cap (and sometimes another spill happens between the cap and the press). A more funnel-like design at the tip would be appreciated in the next iteration of this product.

Arrived a day early!! I researched this on line through a consumer web site. #1 buy for quality etc. Grinds fast, whole coffee beans, fine grind in under 15 seconds. Easy to clean. I would recommend this as a great buy. Second Krups kitchen implement I have purchased......I am sold on Krups products. Well made, works as advertised, and more.

A few things I don't like about it- the loud annoying beeping when you push the buttons or when it's finished making coffee, the beans aren't uniformly ground as they should be with a conical grinder, all the grounds don't get wet as the coffee brews.
Overall, I like it. It was one of the few coffee makers I could find that had all the features I was looking for.

Grinding my own beans, right before brewing in my new percolator is the only way to go. I'll get rid of my
K cups now. This little grinder is awesome.

I’m not a coffee drinking but my boy friend is so I bought him a coffee maker with out a grinder not realizing he would need one.... so here came the addition! He loves it and it’s easy to clean. It makes a bit of noise and since we have a small apartment he’ll usually grind his coffee a head of time so that he doesn’t make a lot noise in the morning.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent Grinder - Best I've Ever Owned!
reviews.reviewText:
My son and daughter in law bought this coffee grinder for my wife and I around 6 years ago. Still working perfectly and I make fresh ground coffee every morning. Since course ground coffee tastes richer and not bitter I like the touch feature that allows me to grind for however many seconds I want.
Great coffee grinder works fast and is really easy to clean small for storage - we take it in our RV on vacation. Definitely one of the best grinders I've ever had and I would recommend it to anyone who likes fresh ground coffee in the morning. Very good price for a superior product!

I bought this item for the purpose of grinding clean (washed and air dried) egg shells as a calcium supplement to my dog's diet. I was very impressed at the speed with which it accomplished the job, Money well spent!

This thing is AWESOME! It grinds amazingly fast and efficiently. Don't do it too long or your coffee will turn to dust. I love the oblong shape that makes it easy for me to pour the grounds into a container after use. The parts are really well built and super easy to use. It's sleek and small enough that I can just slide it behind my Keurig when I'm not using it.

I bought this for my husband so that he could grind coffee beans for espresso. It does not grind finely enough for espresso. He sent it back. However, I have nothing bad to say about the ease of cleaning, noise or ease of use. We didn't keep it long enough to clean it more than once or twice. It is easy to use and it is quiet.

I loved the krups coffee grinder so much I started gifting it to friends as Christmas gifts. Its so quick and easy to get your ideal amount of fine or coarse ground coffee beans. It's perfect for coarse cold brew grinds and it's basically effortless to clean! I've used mine just about every day for almost a year and its still grinding like a drunk girl at the club. 10/10 would recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great, small, grinder (for coffee beans and herbs)
reviews.reviewText:
PROS:
- Very, very easy and simple to use
- Versatile: I've used it for coffee beans and spices
- Great size for almost everything I needed
- Easy to clean

CONS:
- I could have used a small hand-held blender to do the same thing

BOTTOM LINE: If you prefer buying coffee beans and likes grinding them yourself, this is for you! It's small and works very well.

Don't waist your money. Works great for 2-3 days then stops. Bought the first machine thinking maybe faulty machine ordered another one only for the same thing to happen again within 4 uses of the machine. I never write reviews so for me to write one says how bad the coffee machine is

Had to replace my old Mr Coffee grinder and this was the best looking one to buy but It is only mediocre. No matter how long you grind the beans for you will only get out a portion of what you put in. And what I mean is that the ground coffee all sticks to the inside and you have to wipe out most of it with a napkin after each grind. I don't like that you cannot remove the inside basket either. It grinds the beans to a nice texture but I would not buy this again.

I use it to grind my weed, and it WORKS! In seconds. Great product and very affordable. The only negative is the cord on this thing is literally 18 inches so it's for a countertop, thus I use it on the floor most times lol.

reviews.reviewTitle: These can bounce off the floor multiple times and keep working
reviews.reviewText:
I had one of these that lasted for years. They are super tough. The only reason it had to be replaced was that the wife likes to play basketball with the kitchen appliances. She walks through the kitchen and knocks toasters, grinders, blenders, you name it on the floor and walks away. The old grinder still works. This last time she bounced it off the floor though, it hit at just the right angle to snap off the pin in the cap that activates the grinder.

I hope this new grinder is just as tough as the last one.

Hi All - I purchased the KRUPS F203 about a year ago... it no longer works.

We didn't even use it that much... when we did and it worked, the product was great - its not huge but that worked for us. After about a year when we plug in the grinder and push the 'on' button with the cap on, it just hums and does not grind anything. Frustrating that it would break in a year without even a ton of use. I would recommend another coffee grinder

Top latch made of plastic broke off too easily. After a short fall from kitchen counter-top to floor, the latch needed to activate grinder snapped off. For a product used daily in kitchen, it seems too fragile if it can't survive one fall from he work surface to the floor. Product is now useless to me, and ready for a landfill. This seems wasteful...it lasted only a few weeks.

This is a classic grinder. Been through about 4 different grinders of various styles in at least as many years. I remembered that I had an old one of these for about 10 years as my main grinder till the depressing switch broke. At which point I took it to work where it is still in service (you need a sharp object to activate the switch now.)
In any case, I am giving up on fancy grinders for now and returning to this simple and effective workhorse.
It is quick. Grinds the same amount of coffee in less time than others.
Cleaner than others. I somehow manage to get less grounds scattered on the counter with this guy than with others.
Grinds enough for my coffee pot. (It's a bit too small for the bigger workplace coffee maker.)

When I decided to buy the AeroPress coffee maker (see my review) a couple of months ago, I also needed to buy my first coffee grinder. Again, relying on the positive Amazon reviews, I chose the Krups 203-42. It's a handsome, sturdy tool and I find it easy to use, easy to clean. With a single button, in seconds, I can grind the beans to any texture I want--from regular to expresso; however, there's no controlling guide, just intuition. I don't find this a problem. Although some others have suggested multiple use options, I'm not sure I'll use it for anything other than coffee beans since I've already discovered the beans are very oily and would probably pick up spice scents not apparent--even after a good cleaning. At this price, I think it will be wiser to buy another for the spices.

reviews.reviewTitle: HYPED PRODUCT - DOESN'T WORK FOR LONG
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this Coffee grinder exactly one month ago and it is already inoperable. I only used it 3 times per week on the average
and initially it seemed to work well. Now, the motor just hums but it won't grind. What a waste of money!

It is little and just right for all the fresh coffee one wants to make. Weigh out your beans, grind them to the desired fineness and make a cup of coffee you can not get unless you enter an expensive coffee shop.
I’ve finally gotten around to review this little thing! I have had it for over a year now and it still works great! I use it mostly for nuts. It gets them chopped just how I like it!

I use the grinder daily because nothing beats a good, freshly ground, cup of coffee. While it does a fine job grinding and is reasonably quiet, finely ground coffee gets compacted at the bottom of the grinder. To dislodge that ground coffee, it would have been nice for Krups to include a small brush. I can see someone accidentally chopping off a finger...luckily my previous grinder, a now defunct Braun that faithfully ran for over 20 years, had one that I could continue to use. So to the folks at Krups, please include a brush!

reviews.reviewTitle: Solid little grinder, but not for coffee snobs...
reviews.reviewText:
Pros: works for general grinding purposes.
Cons: no control over the degree of grind. If you are a coffee snob, you should get a hand grinder so you can control it more.

Overall: if you just want an everyday grinder for coffee beans. This is a fantastic device. Tried and true. No problems.
Broke after 3 months, can't get info on returning product. Kurds won't respond to emails.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love my Krups Grinder! It’s a great product!
reviews.reviewText: I love my Krupa Grinder. It’s busy grinding my coffee beans every day. It’s a durable and highly well made product I wouldn’t be without!

We use a burr grinder at home but needed something small to take when we stay at our vacation condo so we can continue to enjoy freshly ground coffee. I bought this based on good reviews and found it to be exactly what we needed. Very impressive at grinding a consistent fine grind for espresso shots in less than 10 seconds. Would do a great job of any type grind you would want based on grinding time being either more or less. We bought to go with an AeroPress which makes perfect shots for espresso or by adding hot water, a great cup of coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very powerful coffee grinder. I use mine almost every ...
reviews.reviewText: Very powerful coffee grinder. I use mine almost every day, and the motor is strong enough to turn whole beans into powder in seconds. I have used mine for as little as one cup, to grinding several batches worth for the week. My only real complaint is that it is very loud, but all electric grinders are.
Being that I’m not an expert at grinding coffee, I should have gotten a grinder with fine, medium or course settings. With this one you kinda just wing it and hope your grinding is consistent.
After 15 uses, the button got jammed and there's no way to shut it off unless I unplug it.

Love the product. Does a well and able job in grinding the coffee. Just make sure you have a container to pour the the coffee into once it is grinded. Otherwise you will have a hard time scooping out the coffee. The blade at the bottom is close to the top making it difficult to adequately scoop a tablespoon of ground coffee.
I put mine into a jar and then scoop it out after that.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder for the most part
reviews.reviewText: Great grinder for the most part. Efficiently grinds, easy to clean and nice size for the value. However I wish that it had a setting to differentiate between coarse grind and fine grind. I use a fine grind in my daily coffee maker at home before work, but tend to grind some coarser grinds to take with me to work for my french press. The grinder does very well at making a coarse grind, but it required me to grind and remove the lid to check, and repeat until desired consistency is found. Can be hard to estimate the grinding time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mainly used for black/white pepper seeds.
reviews.reviewText:
Since last year's Black Friday she missed out the opportunity to purchase a grinder and this year she didn't find anything on it for sale. Christmas is coming in 2 weeks so bought this as a gift for my dear aunt. Delivery was promptly and on time as expected. Packaging was good. Just tested out this grinder about an hour ago and it was absolute amazing at its job. My aunt's main purpose use of this product is for her black and white pepper seeds.
Operational use of this is very easy. Once you put in the amount of pepper just push the clear top cap down for it to operate. The longer you hold down the more finer the peppers gets. From start to finish, it took me less than 20 seconds to complete.
Amazing grinder. Glad I bought this for my aunt and I hope that she will loves it too.

This is one the best grinder for fine grinding of things which are difficult to grind in conventional grinder. I use it to grind poppy seeds and making paste of spices like cumin, coriander, garlic, ginger..etc to make Indian dishes.
If you are grinding something dry then it's fine but if you need to mix some water then while closing the lid some water will come out which is quite messy. I have made small hole on the top of the lid which solved the problem altogether. the hole is small enough not to let ingredients come out while grinding but big enough to get the air out while closing the lid.(check the customer image.)

Washing is little difficult as some ingredients get stuck inside and difficult to clean properly.

It does the job, but needs some improvements: 1) The grinds can be inconsistent 2) tough to scoop grind and clean the unit due to the physical layout out and static electricity from the plastic parts 3) messiness due to static electricity and hard to open container.

The price is right, but burr style grinder with removable container would be better.

reviews.reviewTitle: I want to return this NOW!!!
reviews.reviewText:
This maker only ever worked periodically from day one and i called Krups and they offered no help exept unplug it and plug it back in DUH? and then that day it worked. Now it wont grind , brew or do anything I want to return it but Amazon says I am past my window I should have sent it back day two . But now I need help I purchased this in April of this year .
I want to return it for a refund NOW!!!

Perfect for grinding the right amount of beans for our French press for two cups of coffee. Grinds the beans perfectly. Although my husband is bothered by how hard it is to clean (the grounds stick to the bottom and walls) and I told him for the price it’s what we got.
This has lasted longer than any other grinder I have ever had so far.
Few things have the same quality as they did 30-some years ago. KRUPS is still getting people up and out with a good cup of coffee. Recommend.

Worked for a few months (and we don't grind coffee beans often) then completely quit on us. Makes noise but the blades don't spin. Read online it's a common problem, and yet they still sell this piece of plastic crap.

This is my second Krups coffee grinder, and I bought the second one because I thought the first one was losing the quick and sharp chopper upper agility of a world class machine. But guess what: The second one is no better than the first. Everything remains the same, so I'm working on becoming ambidextrous so I can grind twice as many beans... no, that's not true, except it is the same, a really fine machine. I fill up the well and get enough grounds for a couple of days, which is all you really want to have unless you like your grounds stale. I might point out that my coffee maker is Krups and so is my personal size espresso machine. I'll probably give one of the coffee grinders to someone in the family and get them spoiled on the superior attributes.

It broke on me after one year of use. I didn’t drop it or anything. The switch just stopped working. It doesn’t go off when you release the lever. I thought Krups was à trustworthy brand. I guess that’s what happens when these companies get everything made in China. These things are supposed to last years.

Worked fine on first 3 times and not function when I was about to use it for the 4th time. I went by the reviews and got this product, however it did not live up to the hype. I see similar reviews now on the product. Mine might have been a faulty one. Initially it made sound but was not grinding. After that, totally stopped working.

Would like a refund or replacement!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great! Cleaning it could be easier
reviews.reviewText: Best grinder I could find for spices and coffee. They can improve the product by making the metal housing with blade detachable so it can be dishwasher safe. otherwise, you have to use a moist towel or bread to clean it up. Or grind white rice in it from what I've researched. Great little product to grind up fresh peppercorns for my dry rub on my barbecue! My wife accidentally put water in it to clean (that's a no no!), but I dried it, shook out as much water as I could and then blew a fan on it overnight. It still works! So, I like that it's not a delicate tool but can take a bit of abuse, esp. right after you bought it!
Have had other grind and brew coffeemakers but we love this one. We use paper filter basket. The water absorbed in paper filter causes a stronger coffee so we add an extra cup of water to compensate.

reviews.reviewTitle: You actually can do a coarse grind~
reviews.reviewText:
I don't like too fine of a grind since I am using a Yama vacuum coffee siphon. It seems to gum up together and make a nice soup so that it takes too long for the brewed coffee to filter down into the carafe. So to make a less fine grind, merely grind it for about 10 to 20 seconds less than you would normally do. You can hear the sound as you grind getting less and less 'grinding' and just the motor and blades spinning. You want to stop it when you look down and see some nice coarse grounds but you can still hear the grinding sound. I know it sounds very non-technical.... but it works.

Otherwise, it does very well for a fine grind (useful for those who have metal filters or use cloth filters). Even though it grinds finely, it's inexpensive and of course, in my opinion:

>>>>> There is no better way to enjoy coffee than to grind it directly before brewing!

I have done several side by side comparisons with fresh, one day old, two day old, and one week old (stored in mason jar) coffee beans in a french press (for consistency) and the difference is huge. Day old coffee you lose some of the more powerful and fresh aromatics, but the inherent nature of the coffee is preserved. Two days you lose a tad bit of the acidity, a little more aromatics, and some of the body. After one week the actual flavor has changed and it gets a somewhat stale taste. Aromatics are not only reduced, but changed.

So the verdict: grind just before brewing, even if your beans have been sitting in a vacuum bag for weeks. The inherent flavors, aromas, and texture are all in the core of the bean. The actual roast and surface oils are all you risk changing/losing from un-ground beans. Store unground beans in a sealed, preferably vacuum sealed, container or zip loc bag. DO NOT STORE IN FREEZER!!!!!!!! Just put in a cabinet in the dark.

I know it seems like a bit of trouble to do all of this, but if you don't care about the flavor of the coffee, then you probably wouldn't be looking at a grinder anyway...

----------

Update 10/18:

So the grinder ended up with a problem: for some reason it wouldn't turn off unless unplugged. I checked the little button where the lid pushes down and it was fine. Moved okay, was not depressed when the lid was off. So I took the bottom off and loosened the screws on the small circuit board under the plastic piece that forms the little button. Apparently the piece was just pushing tightly on the little see-saw lever used to hit the board and activate the motor. So two turns later it wasn't running 100% of the time while plugged in. Presto!

Oh and a funny, comedic note. I found out the hard way... I had put the beans in before plugging it in, hadn't put the lid on yet either... So I got a coffee bean explosion! And I had to chase my dog out of the kitchen because he apparently likes Stumptown Guatemalan... So know I either put the lid on before plugging in or put the beans in after it's plugged in and I make sure the problem doesn't come up again!

We have been using a Krups coffee grinder ever since I can remember. My first white one lasted for ages,and we are now on our second. I bought this as a backup, just in case, because we grind our own beans. And they are great grinders. For those of us who aren't yet into the artisanal coffee-grinding stage (I see all kinds of very cool and "different" coffee grinders on Amazon), this is a well-made, basic, no-nonsense choice.

I'm not a coffee guru, but this little grinder does the job. A friend sent several bags of whole bean coffee for Christmas which is a first for me, so didn't want to spend a ton of money. This grinder is quick, easy to use, and does the job in my opinion. I researched on how to use a blade grinder first vs the more expensive burr and found not much difference if done properly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very disappointed. After coffee is ground when you take off ...
reviews.reviewText: my first grinder was a Mr coffee (liked it much better), ordered this one because of amazon saying #1 seller. Very disappointed. After coffee is ground when you take off the lid (which is hard to lift off) coffee gets everywhere. Just not a good design. Over priced in my opinion. does not grind enough for 12 cups either like they advertise...

reviews.reviewTitle: Your basic grinder that actually does what it's supposed to do
reviews.reviewText: This unit replaced the unit I originally purchased in 1992. Of course I could have purchased a $500.00 conical space grinder with whisper technology and granular recount that would allow every speck of coffee bean to experience total nirvana while being ground to exacting and perfect texture in a manner that is efficient and humane while being soothed by scenes of its native land and local music but I really just needed a grinder to grind my coffee so I could drink it. Nuff said

reviews.reviewTitle: Powerful grinder but not for me
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is very powerful but just not for me. There is no grind level and You have to hold the cover lip until you think it’s done. And the design make it very difficult to clean.

Let me clarify that I’m not a coffee expert. This is my first coffee grinder. I needed a basic coffee grinder and this works great. I will say it’s a pretty strong machine, I think it would be better if it had suction so it could stick to the counter as a safety measure but I’m not complaining. It does the job!

So glad to off the pods , get up to a hot pot of fresh ground coffee, great machine . Only small issue was the chute from grind blades to filter gets messy and the cover does not remove easily for access to swept coffee grounds down the chute. But certainly not a reason not to purchase. Easy to program and great tasting coffee : )

reviews.reviewTitle: Hard to clean, but I still use it
reviews.reviewText:
I have a love-hate relationship with this thing. On the one hand, you haven't lived until you've had fresh-ground pepper and cinnamon and coriander in your cooking. Buying whole spices and grinding them yourself is not only cheaper but it's so much tastier.
On the other hand, cleaning this thing is a huge pain. The lid comes off and is dishwasher safe (don't remember if it says that specifically but I've run mine through the dishwasher a dozen or more times), but the unit itself comes into direct contact with the spices and does not disassemble. That means wet paper towels and 5 minutes of cleaning after each use to prevent buildup and contamination. Not awesome. I still use it, and it still performs perfectly after almost a year. That really says something, as the market for these appliances is saturated with semi-disposable trash. I'll keep using it until it dies because it works so well, but I wouldn't buy another one to replace it I don't think. Find one that's easier to clean.

This is an excellent grinder, i use it to grind my coffee beans fresh every morning. It is very well built and perfect size for my needs. I don’t think you can find anything better at this price point.

I use for coffee grinding, sometimes spices. It's hard to clean so I would not mix the two, my mistake. Otherwise it performs well -- you just have to shake it while pulsing it so you get a consistent, even grind. It is not very loud which was a concern also.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for making quality espresso grind!
reviews.reviewText: I love having full strength coffee. I bought this, so I can make my coffee espresso grind before drip brewing it. The only downside, is that if you run it too long, there will be "packed" areas inside the grinding chamber. Make sure you unplug the device before loosening up the packed areas.
I have yet to mess up with this. Perfect grind every time so far. Easy to use and clean between types of coffee. It is not too noisy, but it is not silent and does not bother me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does what its supposed to do.
reviews.reviewText: I do like the grind to cup coffee it makes, but the carafe leaves a lot to be desired, it is very tight getting it in and out and the top of it leaks everywhere when you are pouring from it if you do not raise the lid on it

reviews.reviewTitle: Product breaks to easily and warranty is non existent
reviews.reviewText: Product breaks to easily and warranty is non existent. The grinder stopped working after only 4 months and Amazon won't fix nor will the manufacturer. Seems like just another product made to work just long enough so they don't have to fix and you have to buy another. VERY UNSATISFIED.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does a very nice job with coffee beans
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this grinder way back in oh-nine. It has been used every day since and is still holding up well. I use it to grind coffee beans a couple of times per day. I do a very fine grind, not as fine as espresso but fairly close. The grinder is not overly noisy about what you would expect from a grinder. I expect this to last many more years to come as it has faired very well up to now. It cleans up very quickly and easily, a pleasure to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuts through stone and dried clay
reviews.reviewText: I used this for a research project in college that involved grinding dirt to a pulp to test for organic matter content. This thing can grind through dense Texas clay soil and limestone bits (when some of the samples dried they were as dense and well pack as large rocks). The blade grinder powered through the clay and stone. I highly recommend.
I bought this in March of 2017. Today, it's dead. I use it to grind erythritol and it's always been great. :( Guess I'll have to order a new one.
I like this coffee grinder it was a replace me to one just like it and it worked for 15 years no problem. I hope this one will work that long. they are fantastic.

I use it to grind flax seeds before putting them into smoothies and other things, and to grind fresh herbs. No problems at all. Easy to wipe clean in between uses so there's no flavor contamination. It can smell kind of "motory" if it is used for an extended period of time (on days when I'm grinding bunches of whole dried herbs to refill jars), but it doesn't seem to have affected it at all and if I just use it for a reasonable amount of time there's no problems. Does everything I want it to, it's easy to use, and the price isn't too bad.

reviews.reviewTitle: it works well with cardamon and pepper seeds
reviews.reviewText:
easy to use on very fine seed. If you want things to be finer, you just shake it around a little bit to redistribute the seeds and grinder some more.

I wouldn't use it for coffee beans, just finer spices and it will work well.

It compact and easy to use. In seconds my coffee was ground to perfection, then after that it was ground a little too fine for my coffee maker. Practice makes perfect! 4 stars instead of 5 because I find it difficult to clean the bottom of the grinding pot. I grind rosemary for dinner then after I grind coffee for the morning. I have to rub the cloth around, pushing the blades in a circle to clean under them. There must be a way to make it easier to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working in less than 2 months!
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this grinder on 27-Dec-2018 because I was looking for a simple spice grinder and this one had good reviews. I only used this item to grind salt, pepper and seeds, not more than 10 times and it already broke in less than 2 months. It was a very good grinder to start, but VERY short lived!!!! Now have to buy a better one that lasts longer!

My identical decade-old coffee grinder became useless when the small plastic actuator pin inside the clear lid broke. A factory replacement lid costs more than this entire first-quality Krups product, which arrived early, well-packed and exactly as advertised. Would buy again but hope I don't have to!

reviews.reviewTitle: Lasted less than ten uses. Ridiculous.
reviews.reviewText: I really wanted to love this grinder. And I did at first. I have owned it for 9 months but I do not drink coffee often so I have used it maybe 10 times. And this morning when I tried to use it, no go. When you press on the switch to begin the grinding process, it hums like it is engaging the motor, but the blades will not spin. Nothing I did could make it work. Very upsetting since I only used it at most ten times and cleaned it properly after every use!
This coffee grinder is great, it's more powerful to a simar one I had before. Will turn your coffee in to flour if you don't pay attention.

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought one of these for my work, and ...
reviews.reviewText:
I bought one of these for my work, and while it sees far more use than a normal household appliance would, it still holds up fairly well, despite some of the users having the "It's not mine, so I don't care if I break it" attitude... I typically order a new one about the time the one at work breaks, and then it's delivered in time for me to use it at home for a while before I decide to bring it into work...

And yes, I've bought about 2-3 of these, and I know they work fairly well...
Pretty basic product. I am not a coffee expert, but it ground the beans successfully. I then used these beans to make coffee. Coffee tasted fine! Success!

If you are buying this for coffee and you actually care about coffee save a bit more and buy a burr grinder. The grind on this is very inconsistent. Some of your grounds will be espresso thin, and some will be big and chunky. This messes with your flavor profiles, brew consistency and depending on your filter will pass some grounds to the bottom of your cup.

Buy a Baratza Encore burr grinder, you won't regret it like you will with this.

Plus, the motor is crap, it burns out and smells like it is burning after moderate to heavy usage.

I've tried cleaning it out. I've prayed to the coffee gods. I even adopted a stray cat.

And the grinder still doesn't work, after owning it for a month it just stopped working.

I'm not happy. This thing wasn't cheap.

This is like the standard coffee grinder. Every place I've worked, and anywhere else they would buy a coffee grinder, this is the one they have. It's great at what it does. Plus it's super affordable.

I use this for grinding spices and dried chiles. It works really well for what I use it for, but it can be a bit of a pain to clean out when you're done (so your next grind doesn't taste like your previous grind).

My suggestion is to rinse out the lid with warm water and wipe clean. Wipe the grinder out with a damp paper towel and then dry. Once you've got the big chunks out, fill the grinder with 3-4 Tbsp of white rice and grind that up. Repeat the cleaning methodology above and you should be good to go.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent, more powerful than it looks
reviews.reviewText: Excellent. I don't drink coffee but I use it to grind hard nuts, espec. almonds. Doesn't seem liek it would be powerful enough for that--almonds being very hard. But it works really well. However I don't think I would use it for more oily nuts, like walnuts.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not so great for the press.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this grinder as a gift for my husband who uses a French press. He really enjoys the fresh coffee idea and grinding his own breans. The only complaint is that there isn't a setting for fine or course ground. It is only fine. He still uses it, but he has to use a strainer when he pours his coffee, or there are a ton of grounds. If you are buying it for a traditional pot, then it would be perfect.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent Grinder Not A Burr Mill
reviews.reviewText: This is a nice compact grinder for the price. The issue with blade grinders is that you do not get a consistent grind. I have tried to pulse the grinds in order not to burn the beans or get them too hot. No matter what I tried though I felt the quality of the grind was just not all that great. I had an opportunity to borrow the Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill from a friend of mine. This grinder is a burr grinder and does not heat up the beans. The grinds are consistent and the coffee comes out great. The price was also well worth it at only $40 it is barely twice the price of the blade grinder. I have since returned this product and got the burr grinder.
This seemed like a great little coffee grinder; very fast and efficient. But today, it quit working. I got it in June and it's now January, with only light to moderate use. Very disappointed.
Beans do not grind evenly. Bottom ones over grind and too ones are still whole.

Cheap and Effective. you cant beat something that is tried and true. My parents have had one of these for over 13 years and it has never broken down or had any problems and i recently purchased 2 as gifts as well as owning one myself. If you are in the market... look no further.

I bought this coffee grinder 6 month's ago to replace an identical Krups grinder I purchased over 20 years ago. The original grinder worked great and would still work except that after so much use the power cord frayed open next to the grinder body. I tried to fix it but it became too troublesome - especially in consideration for the replacement cost. The only difference is that this new grinder has a shorter cord. This is not a serious problem. It works well.
grinds well for an inexpensive grinder. it has no adjustment for the grind, just use it a little longer for fine grind

reviews.reviewTitle: Reliable and strong grinder for coffee beans
reviews.reviewText: Like the fact that I can get an espresso grind out of my coffee beans using this little grinder. You cannot vary the grind size, but just grind away longer.

reviews.reviewTitle: It works well but isn't user-friendly.
reviews.reviewText: My main complaint is that the grounds get caught under the blade and don't easily come out without digging around for them. The natural desire is to tap the device against a sink or bin or something but that would likely damage it. I bought a brush and that just seems to push them in deeper so it's a finger job which could get dangerous with the sharp blades. The motor gives a bit of a burning smell as it operates too which doesn't fill me with confidence.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Price, Well-Built, Simple to Operate!
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a no-frills, "best buy" grinder. This was the recommended winner. Good price, Well-built with plenty of power! I also bought a French Press, which insists on "coarse grinding" your beans. I'm trying to follow the directions: (so far, so good,) BUT some of the beans don't get ground up when I grind for that short a time...around 15 seconds.

At first let me say that I'm a 'coffee-holic' and, as such, grinding my own beans is a must. That said, this puppy did it well enough for use in my single- cup Aeropress (which I love) and I've been totally satisfied in that regard, no question. But that's about it.

Then why my 2 star reasoning?

- The top fits tightly, which is surely good while during the grinding process, but then because of that, pulling it off to get at the grinds when completed is a real bitch for no matter how carefully I do it, fine grinds end up all over the kitchen counter top.

- It is verrrrry difficult to pour the ground beans out once the job is done. The grinding chamber is not removeable so I have to unplug tgrinder and lug the whole thing over to the sink so that I can hopefully pour the grinds directly from it into the coffee maker. I say"hopefully"because most of the time only about half the ground coffee comes out this way. The rest I have to remove with a small plastic spoon (don't wanna damage the blades with a metal one). And even then, quite a bit still sticks to the inside of the plastic grinding area so I hafta flip the spoon and using the other end, kinda scrape the remainder out.

- Again, because it is one-piece and therefore not water immersible, you can't wash the grinding chamber out to clean it thoroughly. Not good.

Well there ya go. Those are my reasons for the 2 star rating and now it's back to the drawing board as I'll be ordering another different one. Prob'ly will take a chance with either The Mr. Coffee or the Epica, both about the same price and both having decent reviews re: doing the job, removing the finished grinds and cleaning the whole thing up. In any case, c'est la vie with this one, I guess...

For the price, it's very good. The only negative with the product is the non-round shape of the grinding chamber. The coffee tends to collect at the "corners" in copious amounts and requires the user to scrape away with finger or whatever. I have an older Braun grinder that is round and don't have as much of a similar problem. It happens on the round one, just not as much.

For grinding coffee and spices, there is nothing better. Have been using this grinder for 40+ years - only a total of three including this latest purchase.
Great purchase, fast delivery.

reviews.reviewTitle: Krups coffee grinder is a beast
reviews.reviewText: I bought this and the comparable Hamilton model because they both had good reviews. I have to say I dont use this for coffee. I take a lot of big pills and have a hard time taking them so I wanted something powerful enough to grind them into a power so I can mix with a shake. The hamilton barely even touched the the pills but the Krups was GREAT. It turned it in to a fine powder. If it can do this to the horse pills that I take then I can only imagine what it could do to anything else, a must buy. I would pay more for it. I bought this in 2009 and its still going strong

reviews.reviewTitle: Powerful, a little loud, but amazing
reviews.reviewText: I hear this go off from my bedroom every morning. It sounds like someone started a blender, but it's only the coffee grinder. I have used it on the weekends to make the morning coffee and it powers through cup after cup of beans without any issue. I ended up grinding about a pound of coffee in one sitting and only had to slow down to empty and refill. There may be better grinders out there, but not at this price. It's a must have...at least if you don't mind a little noise.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job, but hard to remove coffee
reviews.reviewText:
This does the job it is intended for, which is grind my coffee beans, but it's hard to get the coffee out. You need to tip the entire machine as the part that captures the coffee is attached. There is also no setting, you press a button down to grind and release to stop, so you guesstimate when it's done
Pro, it's very fast and only takes a couple of seconds.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is surprising how a new grinder works so much better than an aging one
reviews.reviewText: Grinds very well. I do spices, coffee and bread crumbs. This on replaces another I've had for ten years. It is surprising how a new grinder works so much better than an aging one. It has the start button at the top which makes it easier to hold in than the ones that are on the front. I would recommend this product. It is small and efficient at a good price.

On a mission to replace my last coffee bean grinder I spent considerable time reading reviews of the top-rated ones. I finally decided on this one. Big mistake.

The KRUPS F203 does, indeed, grind coffee beans. But trying to transfer the grounds to one’s coffee maker results in a huge mess. (I wouldn’t know but perhaps this highly rated grinder would be appropriate for grinding spices. But it’s way too messy for daily grinding of coffee beans.)

Summary: I quit grinding coffee beans shortly after I started using this grinder. Thanks to this purchase, I’m back to buying pre-ground coffee. Gimme my old grinder back!

Recommendation: against all reviews, do not buy.

reviews.reviewTitle: No need to spend more for a grinder.
reviews.reviewText: Great grinder. I can control the fineness of the grind easily and it grinds all the beans in the grinder to a consistent size. It's not the easiest to clean because it says that it can't get wet so I use a wet paper towel to get the inside clean. That never gets it completely clean and leaves some residue behind but it hasn't affected the taste of the coffee so I don't think it's a big problem.

I use this twice a day, every day (bought it around 6 months ago here on Amazon). I choose this over other coffee grinders because there were very few low-star ratings compared to other grinders.

I'm happy and have yet to be disappointed in the near 365-times I have used it so far.

One note though, it's a little hard to clean the main container. It doesn't bug me to have a few extra coffee grinds just sitting in there after using. If that bugs you, buy a hard brush and just brush out over the sink. Problem solved!
Grind the coffee well. Not the most even of grinds.even with shaking it up to try to get a better grind. But for the cost this thing works perfect
Great coffee grinder, works like a champ on a daily basis, I bought a second one to grind fresh spices, the grind bowl design allows whatever I grind to move freely and grind evenly.
Very noisy first thing in morning and it uses so many beans for 6-8 cups of coffee! The strength and taste I’m still working on after all this time ! Still not enjoying a good cup of coffee

I don't how this does for coffee beans because I don't use it for that. I rarely drink coffee, and when I do it's instant. LOL! So for me it's about grinding other things like seeds and spices. And it works like a charm on flaxseed so far. Though there's no moveable parts and no instructions for cleaning the chamber. But I supposed you could just wipe it out with a damp cloth. I hight recommend this for a seed and spice grinder.
Just what I needed for small batch grinding of my Ethiopian coffee beans. I like the ability to control the grind size by viewing the process.

Very good. I use it for spices. the clear top does get scratched up very fast even when you grind coffee, which I use another one of these for.

it can be hard to clean the inside since you cannot get it wet. A damp paper towel does help.

The unit does seem to retain the smells of what you grind

reviews.reviewTitle: I use this to grind flax seed - your body can't absorb the omega 3 from the flax seed if you don't grind it
reviews.reviewText: When I make a smoothie I don't have to grind the flax seed - I can put the flax seed and almond milk in my Vitamix, run it on high for 10 seconds, and the blender pulverizes them. However, once a week I grind some flax seed (which I keep in my fridge to maintain freshness) and put it in a metal container so I have it to add to oatmeal, cold cereal, etc. I use this to grind the seeds, then use a brush to clean it out, then wipe the inside with a paper towel to get the oil out before putting it away.

This is the first one of these I've bought, and I wanted to buy KRUPS because I have other kitchen equipment made by them, and they work pretty well, as does this. There have been a few times when I felt that it could have done a better job, but it may be because I didn't hold the button down long enough. I'm not entirely sold on the concept that freshly ground coffee is better, but it was worth trying. I have not used it for any spices.

It does what it is designed to do but the clear lid is very snug and you really have to pull which inevitably cause the coffee grinds to spill. I had a similar model from years back and did not have this issue.

reviews.reviewTitle: But it gives no guidance for how fine to grind for different types of coffee/espresso
reviews.reviewText:
It does exactly what it says it does. But it gives no guidance for how fine to grind for different types of coffee/espresso. I have been trying to use it with my espresso maker - and it has been trial and error - I had to through 3 batches before I had drinkable espresso.

It came without any instructions of any type - just a brown box.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grounds very evenly for a blade grinder
reviews.reviewText: Does a great job at evenly grounding coffee. Not quite to the level of a burr grinder, but is really excellent for the price.

None better for the money. Have bought several of these over the years for friends and family, and all have been rock-solid. You can easily control the grind with a little finesse. Perhaps not the perfection of a burr grinder, but soooooo much easier, faster and cheaper.

That's what it sounds like. It grinds up the coffee beans pretty great. Obviously you can't change the grind resolution, that's not the kind of grinder this is. For making freshly ground french press or pot coffee though, it works great.

Do not buy this coffee grinder. I bought it to replace my old Braun coffee grinder that I had for over 20 years. This coffee grinder broke after 3 months of use. It will not turn on if there is beans inside and it will only sporadically come on if it is empty. I am returning it. Very disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: This coffee/spice grinder does not include advertised scoop.
reviews.reviewText: The pictures at the order site showed a measuring scoop and another device which were not included with the grinder. A previous order of the same grinder (which I like) came with a scoop and a small brush. Don't be fooled into thinking you'll receive anything other than the grinder, even though the pictures indicate otherwise.

After 2.5 years of daily use, this baby was running strong. Recommended for the coffee connoisseur who can't live without fresh grind, mmm, smells so good! Also good for grinding spices, herbs, seeds, and nuts. Great kitchen tool.

Excellent grinder!! I have two and this is a gift. I have one for coffee and one for spices and herbs. I love that it grinds a small amount at a time because this way, your products remain fresh when you grind a little at a time if it is used frequently.and it does not get stale, especially the coffee and some herbs and spices. Great little grinder!!

This is a li'l powerhouse. I love this grinder and it can hold up to a full pound of coffee. Well, it would've handled more, but I only ground a pound at a time and usually less. I love this grinder. Well worth the money.
I bought this to ground freshly roasted coffee beans and it works well. It only grounds enough for a pot each time, so if you wanted to ground a larger quantity, consider a larger grinder.
Easy to use for small batches of coffee grinding. Works fast, intuitive to use, easy to clean. I'm super happy with this. A little noisy, but no worse than other coffee grinders.

Very noisy, I don't like to run it early in the morning before my spouse is up. Compared to an old model the cutting blade seem lower to the bottom. I have to grind and extra minute or two to get all the beans.

Great quality. I've had these for years but unexpectedly had to be moved to Boston from my home (NYC) for medical treatment and I don't have access to any of my belongings. I've purchased very few kitchen utensils but two of these were a must - one for spices and the other for coffee. I love toasting then grinding coriander and I'm very particular about how my dark espresso fair trade coffee beans are ground.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broken on arrival. Took too long to open, so now I am stuck with garbage.
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for a family member, who did not open it until late March. Broken on arrival. The heating element doesn't work. Since we took too long to open the package, we are now stuck with useless junk. This Krup is krap.

reviews.reviewTitle: 2 years later and still works like a champ!
reviews.reviewText:
My wife and I make coffee at least twice a day, that means for two years this grinder has been used over a 1,000 times to grind coffee beans. It has done a terrific job so far. If you are a "coffee master" who wants the perfect coffee, this is not for you. It is hard to make the exact grind with this machine. But for me, it gets the job done. It can also be used to grind dry spices. I don't recommend it for wet spices and herbs as they will just stick to everything since they are...wet.

Overall, it has worked very well for me and my family. I love it, and would recommend it to anyone.
Works great and is by far the best value for what it does. It even works in sub-par conditions as I’ve seen soldiers using this model in the field
Does exactly what I need. And it doesnt take up space.

reviews.reviewTitle: Blade version works, would buy another if this ever bites the dust.
reviews.reviewText: This review is for the blade version. We use this daily, and works reasonably well. Usually we put 3 tablespoons of coffee beans in it, power for 5 seconds and keep going. The consistency isn't perfect but we aren't that picky. I would buy another as it's small, does its job.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best coffee maker we ever had!
reviews.reviewText: We had an older model for many years, this one is terrific! Has all the features of the old model that I really loved and more!
So easy and safe to use. Not too loud, I use it in the main floor while people upstairs are sleeping and no one complains. Easy to clean and pretty on the counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: There is no way to change the setting or get them to be really fine. (I'm not even looking for espresso ground)
reviews.reviewText: I am going to use this for spices only. For coffee the grounds are still too course. There is no way to change the setting or get them to be really fine. (I'm not even looking for espresso ground). It also spills easily when you take the lid off to get to the grounds. I have to do really small batches and it takes forever. I'm really sad about this product because I had such high hopes with the reviews. My old grinder was much better.

In fairness to the product I bought this to grind eggshells into powder (calcium source for my dog's homemade diet). I also wanted to grind dried beet pulp (same reason). Unfortunately the motor starts to get hot after just a few seconds, so I can only grind for a moment. Then stop. Then grind again, etc. If I grind even for 5 seconds I will start to smell the motor and that burning smell gets transferred to whatever I am grinding. Also, no matter how long I grind (in spurts) the end result is very uneven with about half of it powdery and the other half in granular bits.

It grinds EVERYTHING really well and clogs less than others when grinding moist nuts like walnuts. It's harder to clean because a a small crease where the metal meets plastic; I need to use a fingernail or knife to scrape it clean unless the material was really dry.

UPDATE: The motor just died. I don't recall dropping it or immersing it, but who knows? I ordered another one and took off a star.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great, easy to use, and, really inexpensive.
reviews.reviewText: Excellent, easy to use grinder, especially for the price. It's noise only lasts for 10 seconds. Grinds perfectly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Parents Own One, Now I Do!
reviews.reviewText: My parents have owned one of these for years and I finally have my own. Durable and great for grinding coffee beans for fresh coffee. Not too loud and easy to wipe clean. Get it while it lasts because I couldn't locate this model in store at Bed, Bath and Beyond, makes me think they are replacing with the newer one (not as great of reviews on BB&B website) and will no longer stock it.

The only problem is once you take the lid off you ALWAYS spill some grounds everywhere. I have tried every trick to not spill some of it and nothing works. Besides that it's a great little bring but very poorly designed
Just got mine arrived at good condition definitely recommend this I got this not to grind coffee but dried shrimp is amazing and has sharp blads thanks alot

Working great so far. My wife likes it more than our previous electric grinder (though we have never tried any of the high-end ones-- the previous one was a blade grinder, as well). We normally only use it for our coffee in the morning, 2-4 cups. Not really much to it, but hope it lasts longer than the previous electric blade grinder (1 year).

Had one of these many years ago. Went to another brand and worked through issues. Back to this tried and true. Cannot give it enough stars. I use this to grind up my herbs for chili, fresh ground cumin, ground jalapeno, ground casaba peppers... You name it. It works.

Perfect for Turkish or Expresso Blend.
Keep in mind you can only fill this with about 3 oz of beans.
Your average coffee bag is 10 ozs, so if you plan on grinding a whole bag of beans.
You will have to do a few reps of grinding the coffee bean.
I held the button down for a couple of seconds, and repeated the process 3 times and I made a Turkish blend.
The motor is powerful enough for the price, which can not be beaten.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is absolutely the best bean grinder out there
reviews.reviewText: This is absolutely the best bean grinder out there!! There are so many fancy grinders that are waaaay more complicated than a bean grinder needs to be. This grinder is perfect! Simple and easy to use/clean. We've had it for 2.5 years now and use it almost every day! Great purchase!
Since the blades do not come out, cleaning can be a little more of a task. But it's worth it for the price and ease of the grinder. I was able to use it for coffee and then use it to grind spices.
My first coffee grinder, very nice! You have to get used to how long to grind the beans. Been using it for years without issue.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... a uniform ground for coffee if you want a finer ground. Pulsing longer will only result in a ...
reviews.reviewText: This product does not produce a uniform ground for coffee if you want a finer ground. Pulsing longer will only result in a fine powdery ground that settles to the bottom while coarse grounds continue to rattle above. I believe this is simply a result of the design of the machine. The chamber is also not sealed or waterproof, as I found out while trying to rinse it out with a small amount of water. It leaked into the motor part below and took several days to dry out. Worked fine after being dried out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super easy to use and clean!
reviews.reviewText: Super easy to use and gets the job done fast! Love that he top is clear so you can see exactly how fine you want the coffee and exactly when to stop grinding. One top full of grinding is enough coffee for me for 3-4 days. Awesome! Also, it's extremely easy to clean.

The workhorse of my house. I’ve had this for a few years now, and have been using it to grind coffee at least twice a day that entire time. Perfect 12cup brewer bean capacity! I also love that I can use it for any type of grind I need, from espresso to French press, to even using it to make my own cold brew grinds. I’ve also used it to pulse things like oatmeal, and it hasn’t failed me yet!

reviews.reviewTitle: If it breaks, there is no repair facility in the USA.
reviews.reviewText:
Excellent coffee maker. Easy to use. Brews wonderful coffee. BUT if something goes wrong:
1- The Krups website is useless.
2- Replies to email questions take days to receive.
3- There are apparently no repair facilities in the USA.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good blade grinder unit for this price range.
reviews.reviewText: Motor sound a bit shrill, as compared to the Krups I had several years ago, but it ground my espresso beans to powdery in 2- 15 second bursts, unlike the other brand I tried. This is a good unit for the price. It has a deep well for added capacity and does not tip easily.

Literally grinds beans in seconds. If you want a coarser grind, then be sure to do a few pulses at a time because this works so fast that you'll end up with a fine grind in no time. Haven't tried it with anything other than coffee beans yet, but as good a job as it does with those I imagine herbs/spices would be great too. Definitely recommend.
This grinder works great and it easy to use. I am able to place grounds into Keurig reusable K cup with disposable filter. I save so much money thos way and always have fresh ground coffee

reviews.reviewTitle: It's easy to remove the ground coffee by tapping the whole ...
reviews.reviewText: I just received this coffee grinder. People were complaining about noise. But I can't complain about the natural noise of grinding coffee. Others were complaining about ground coffee being at the bottom of the blade. Again, this is natural. It's easy to remove the ground coffee by tapping the whole grinder. It's not a perfect product, but it gets the job done.

I purchased this to grind nuts for baking and it did an OK job but pretty much pulverized some of the nuts, leaving others in big chunks. It is all but impossible to thoroughly clean it as the cutting parts cannot be immersed so I expect the nut remnants I was unable to completely remove from under the blades will become rancid and the unit will be a waste. Not so good.
I've used krups for years and wore out 2 krups in the last 15 years and purchased another. Enough said!!!!
very hard to get the top on and off. tight fit and if you have any problems with your hands forget this product. messy to get coffee out. difficult to use.

What a tiger! Effortlessly and quickly grinds the morning cup of java. Not terribly noisy, but noisier than an alarm clock if you have sleeping roommates.

NOT RECOMMENDED IF YOU NEED A COARSER GRIND. It does fine grind perfectly, but coarser grinds end up with fine grounds mixed in with larger chips - neither fine, nor the right coarseness, and certainly not consistent enough for preparation styles calling for medium to coarse grinds..
I’ve owned a couple of these over the years and they’re very durable, they last well and the motor has never burned out. I’ve always been happy with the grind of my coffee.
Love my little grinder. It doesn't take up much counter space and does exactly what it is supposed to! I love this and I am so glad I bought it.
I have had one just like this one for over 20yrs still works gave it to my daughter, so I could get a new one...can't go wrong with this coffee grinder it is the best by far...
Works great for grinding up coffee beans, which is all I’ve used it for... so far. You gotta be careful, though, unless you like coffee powder instead of grounds.

reviews.reviewTitle: but it will make fine grounds in 10 seconds
reviews.reviewText: This product has held up well for me the past few weeks. It is built with high quality plastic and sharp blades. It holds about 1/2 cup of coffee beans at a time. I sometimes pulse to make coarser grounds, but it will make fine grounds in 10 seconds. Couldn't imagine a better product for the price

I bought this based on other reviews - this is my first grinder I've ever bought so I don't have much to compare with... we grind coffee and it grinds well. It's very simple and easy to use. It's a little difficult to clean because you cannot immerse the blades or main canister in water and they're all one piece, lol. It's a little hokey, but it's fine for us, I just wipe it out thoroughly after each use with a damp cloth. I'd recommend to occasional grinders... I'd hesitate to recommend to die-hard grinders...
This product’s lid is on the inside therefore when you take the lid off after grinding, everything goes everywhere. Poor design.

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the best whole bean coffeemakers I've ever used.
reviews.reviewText: Excellent coffeemaker. Easily programmable and adjustable for perfect coffee taste. I really like the fact that you can store the whole beans for several brews of coffee at once and don't have to get the coffee bean bag out each time you brew. Easy maintenance.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for coffee, better for spices
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because it’s the one they use on Beat Bobby Flay, and now I get why. It’s super cheap but awesome at its job.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hard to clean for a spice grinder
reviews.reviewText:
As people have mentioned before, this product does a good job grinding spices, but is very difficult to clean. The particles become stuck to or embedded in the plastic lid. Whatever spice you ground ends up "contaminating" the next spice you grind. I've read that grinding a half cup of rice will help... but why would I want to waste a half cup of rice every time I want to grind some spices???

All-in-all it works ok and I'll make due until I come across something better enough to compel me to replace it.

Grinds well. I've only used it for whole bean coffee, so I can't attest to other things like spices, but it grinds quickly and easily. And you can decide how fine you want to grind by how long you hold it down.
I took a great care of it, after few uses the cover had many Hainline breakages. Then after about 10 uses it quit working

I had my KRUPS coffee grinder for years, and was always happy with it. Eventually, it gave out and we went looking for another Krups grinder. After reading a few reviews, we decided on the Krups F203, which appeared to be essentially the same as our previous one. As it turned out, it ground somewhat finer than our old Krups, but that was not a problem. We have now had the new grinder for a year, and we are very happy with it, and would recommend it to anyone.

Hey...I've never had a coffee grinder before (other than the antigue versions I have sitting around my house), but from now on I'm buying beans and grinding them myself....why? ...freshness....you can smell it when you grind the beans ...plus...I don't trust processors. I figure this way I'm getting the real thing...this little unit works great, I guess (as I said, I've never had one before)...since it's a dry process, I just wiped it out and washed the lid...nothing to it...only takes a few seconds to produce enough coffee for two full pots....it's fun !!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Lately the power contact has been off occasionally so I looked through Amazon's selection and settled on the KRUPS Because of th
reviews.reviewText:
Bought a Cuisinart grinder from Amazon many years ago and it has served me admirably. Lately the power contact has been off occasionally so I looked through Amazon's selection and settled on the KRUPS Because of the good reviews and its similarity with my Cuisinart. GOOD CHOICE!!
Zipped through four measures of beans in no time. Well made and I hope it lasts as long as the Cuisinart.

You get what you pay for, in a good way. If you don't need a 100% consistent grind (i.e. if you're not a barista or a coffee snob), buy this grinder. You can get a really nice consistency most of the time. I should know, I used to be a barista.

Hard to get a "perfect" grind. Despite pulsing to allow the beans to settle, still leaves some broken but unground coffee beans. Grind long enough to get all the beans and you have espresso powder, not the grind needed for drip. This replaces a Capresso (which had replaced an older Krups) - I liked the Capresso's capacity and grind better, but the workmanship on the Krups is much better. Unless you are going to spend big for a burr grinder, this is the one to get.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stoped working in a few months
reviews.reviewText: I was so exited at the begining but stoped working in a few months. It’s making a noise but not working. Disappointed

reviews.reviewTitle: 3 Usos y ha dejado de funcionar.
reviews.reviewText:
He recibido el producto y a los 3 usos ha dejado de funcionar.
En los primeros usos el producto despedía humo con un olor muy fuerte. Luego del tercer uso, ha dejado de funcionar.
Subo un video mostrando el número de serie del producto a modo de verificar que es el producto adquirido en estos días, y que el enchufe funciona correctamente con otro electrodoméstico.
El producto me ha desilusionado.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ok unit, easy to clean, mild coffee maker.
reviews.reviewText: This unit replaced a breville coffee maker with grinder, definitely a step down in flavoring strength, coffee is weaker and only 10 small cups. Very easy to clean, instructions are ok, difficult to to brew successive pots of coffee. Miss my cantankerous breville.

reviews.reviewTitle: Powerful and looks smart. Grinds coffee beans and my flax seeds nicely ...
reviews.reviewText: Powerful and looks smart. Grinds coffee beans and my flax seeds nicely every single morning without fail. I highly recommend!
This is my 2nd Krups coffee grinder of this model. The first lasted over 25 years and I am a daily coffee drinker. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worst coffee brewed and grinder stopped working
reviews.reviewText: Worst mistake I’ve made. I haven’t had a good cup of coffee since purchase. Weak weak weak! Now I’m stuck with it. The grinder failed a couple months in. Junk. How to I give zero stars?

reviews.reviewTitle: Was worth it. Simple and stalwart.
reviews.reviewText: Powerful little thing. Wasn't sure how it would do for the price, but it hasnt failed me yet. Almost 1 year of daily use.

all in one, take a while before you have your grinding quality for the taste of coffee. very easy to handle. Coffee is hot for a long time, much better than other machine. I love the machine, the taste of the coffee is perfect for me, I never want more a other coffee machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent grinder to chop up my apricot seeds (B 17 - cancer preventer) for my morning whey protein shake.
reviews.reviewText: Excellent grinder to chop up my apricot seeds (B 17 - cancer preventer) for my morning whey protein shake.

I use this to turn Saffron into powder. I love it!
It's good quality, a trusted brand, and it is working very well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buyer beware. While the Krups is sleek and attractive ...
reviews.reviewText: Buyer beware. While the Krups is sleek and attractive, the clear-plastic cap fits snugly INSIDE the cavity where you place the beans. So, once you grind the beans and go to pull out the cap, bring along a sponge because inevitably coffee grinds spill. It's also difficult, once you've ground the beans, to get the cap back on if it's too full. I wish now I had kept my old grinder which wasn't as sleek but had a cap that fit on the outside and didn't require the mop-up action.
I liked it until I saw sparks out the bottom after one month of use. I smelled electrical burning then it quit working

Bought this for a Christmas gift and it died 3 months later. The blade just stopped turning. Was hoping the other reviews I saw on this were wrong but they were not. Too bad because it worked great for the first couple of months.
I do not recommend this product and will not be buying the brand again.
Only used a few times and it has stopped working

reviews.reviewTitle: This device does a great job of grinding coffee
reviews.reviewText: This device does a great job of grinding coffee. Drop the beans in, pulse it a few times, and you're good to go! It's easy to maintain too; just wipe out the inside with a paper towel every few uses and you shouldn't see any problems. It's been getting daily use in our home for almost six months and is showing no signs of slowing down.
Model F203 broke on the third use. Motor burned up and made a terrible smell. Definitely don't recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Used only 4 times and the blade no longer turns
reviews.reviewText: I only used this four times and the blade no longer turns. I am outside my return window so I wasted the money. I was surprised as it received good reviews and Krups is typically a good brand. Disappointed!

The oval shape of the hopper allows the ground coffee to clump up at each end making it difficult to get the ground coffee out and to clean the unit. Also a bit noisy. I had a similar grinder made by Black and Decker that I used for many years before it finally failed. Unfortunately, it's not made any more. I expected more from Krups.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, cleaning/getting grounds a little abnoxious
reviews.reviewText: Works extremely well. Only thing I don't like is having to dump it upside down to get the grounds. Next time I'll try to find a bottom loader of sorts. Also grounds get stuck under the blade so I have to dig them out with a tine fairy spoon.

I gots me a dehydrator for Xmas...so I immediately put it to work dehydrating various chili peppers (jalepenos, habernaros, etc.). This grinder was exactly what I needed to pulverize the dehydrated peppers into a powder...which then could be sprinkled on anything. Anyway, the spice grinder works really well. Careful not to remove the lid too quickly after grinding the peppers because the pepper powder will go airborne and your nasal cavity and sinuses won't like it! Mine however love the stuff... Whoop!!

reviews.reviewTitle: This one is not for me!
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is on its way back to Amazon. My excellent HB 80374 coffee grinder broke after 2 years of use. It worked well but the previous one quit in less than 2 years so I decided it was time to try a different coffee grinder. Most of the reviews for this Krups model F203 were very good. For me it simply didn't work. I dumped in the beans (maybe half full) and pressed the button to grind. Counted 5 seconds and tried to see inside. Couldn't see a thing. Pulled off the lid and had a nice spray of coarsely ground coffee beans all over my counter. Sighed and wiggled the lid to get it back on. Pressed and counted another 5 seconds.
