Took about 5 minutes to pry the lid off this time. When it finally came off, I had more grounds all over the counter and some on the floor. And it still wasn't ground quite finely enough for my electric drip coffee maker! Decided I'd likely never be able to remove the lid again so I'd better quit and clean up. One can wash the clear top, but brushing and wiping are all that one can do to clean the blade area reservoir. Perhaps my kitchen has a greater degree of static than other places, but brushing the coffee grounds did not seem to remove them at all, even though I was holding the grinder upside-down over the sink. A couple damp paper towels eventually got it clean. I cannot imagine this hassle and mess each time I grind coffee, even if I managed to grind it to the necessary fineness in one try. Am going to try a conical burr grinder next. It promises less static, easy cleanup, and a consistent grind!

I have purchased Krups coffee grinder in December 2018. I have used it about five times since. It is no longer working. Very disappointed with this purchase. I had so much confidence in Krups that I threw away the box. It has a warranty for 2 years I hope it can be replaced.

I purchased my previous F203 some 22-25 years ago. We used it daily and sadly it died recently. I was surprised that it is still available. I purchased the replacement recently. It looks almost identical and performs equally well. This is a quality product and a great value!

So convenient and easy to use. Does a great job of grinding flax seeds which is what I bought it for. Price is great for this little gem. Will have to see how long it lasts. Obviously need to be very gentle with the trigger mechanism in the lid to make it last. I use a very soft bristle paintbrush to brush out the compartment after using it and then just rinse the lid in the sink. Again very convenient.
Our old one died after many years of use. Got this one and it is just grinding away. I haven't found a better grinder for the price yet.
This thing broke down on me after less than 10 uses. The motor will run and make a sound but the blade will not spin. What a waste of money. Better off buying something else.
It is simple design not fancy, but does its job. Can be little noisy, need some sacrifice if you wants your good coffee. :^)
Having an electric spice grinder is a must. Bought this to replace our old one I ruined by cleaning it with water. It works just great!

The grinder worked really well while it lasted. This was our second one. The first stopped working in an year. We really liked the function and performance and thought we could try another one but unfortunately it only lasted 3 months with very light weekly use. Now it won’t even startup.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's even better than the older model
reviews.reviewText: We have a 12 year old Krups grinder that is still working well and wanted another one for our camper. We were delighted to find the same model. The current version has a shorter cord (I like that) and my husband thinks the blades are better. But that could be because our old baby has been working hard for a long time. The old one will travel with us in the camper and we are thrilled with the new one for our kitchen. Love that it now comes in black, too! Super product for a great price.

I purchased the Krups F203 electric coffee grinder about two months ago. Prior to purchasing this grinder I had done considerable research and read dozens of reviews of various blade and burr grinders in many price ranges. I decided to purchase a hand-grind burr grinder that I returned to the vendor after only two uses because it was too difficult to use. I then purchased an electric blade grinder that I returned to that vendor when after only two weeks of grinding beans for one cup of coffee per day it began to produce an inconsistent grind. One of the blades was bent! That's when I re-read the numerous reviews for the Krups F203 grinder. At the risk of sounding like Goldilocks, this grinder is "just right." I love it! It's extremely easy to use and to clean and it produces a nice consistent grind for the pour over coffee method I use. I wish I had purchased this grinder in the first place!

reviews.reviewTitle: We have fresh coffee once more!
reviews.reviewText: This is a simple machine that I purchased to replace the one that broke, same brand just 15 years old. This isn't fancy, but it gets the job done.

I use this for spices more than coffee and it works great! I make my own small batch spice rubs and this grinds each spice perfectly and is very easy to use. However, cleaning it can be a bit of a challenge because you can't remove the inside to thoroughly wash it. I use pastry brushes to dust it out before wiping it out by hand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very disappointed. Had another grinder for 25 years that this ...
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this in January 2015. Only used 5 times to grind beans and once to grind peppercorns. Will not work. Engine humms but no blade rotation. Took off the blade and cleaned it and no luck. Used 10W40 and no luck. Very disappointed. Had another grinder for 25 years that this one replaced. Feel taken.

I have bought several of these grinders for both coffee and herbs and spices including requested gifts when the recipient has used my grinder. . Unlike many other grinders, the lid nests deeply into the base, the grinder can hold a lot and not spilling contents when opened. Simply invert the grinder letting everything collect in the lid before opening.

reviews.reviewTitle: Krups Grinder: Grinds from Coarse to Fine
reviews.reviewText: We use this Krups grinder only for coffee. The longer it grinds, the finer the grind. Very nice. The only drawback at this point is the static electricity that builds up and makes the ground coffee stick to the top and to various places within the grinder's receptacle. I have to spend an extra 30 seconds with a brush to clean the stuck coffee off. This is clearly not a big problem, but it is an annoying one.

I love this grinder! Being from New Mexico, we drink a lot of Pinon Coffee. I had always heard it was better fresh so we decided to try this mixer based on the reviews. It's great! (The coffee and the grinder.) My husband also likes to use it for his protein bars to grind up the flax or chia seeds. He says it works perfect!

This a time saver for me. I toast my cinnamon for added flavor to my baking needs. This Krups Spices and Coffee grinder is great.
Put the amount of spice you need ground up and hold your finger on the button and Voila! Ground whatever you want or need.
The grinder comes in colors but black was mine.

Not bad for the price. Still going strong. I only use it for coffee so I don't have issues that some have wrote when it comes to using it for coffee and spices. If you do both I recommend getting two of these.

I already had one of these, and I needed one for work, so I bought a second one. $20 is a pretty good price for this grinder, I've had the first one for several years now and it's still running strong. Easy to clean. I put the beans in the plastic lid first, then I attach the body to the lid while it's upside-down. This is to make it easier to attach the two, otherwise, it you put the beans in the body first, you have to jiggle it to get the beans out of the way of the lid when attaching it. I know that probably made no sense at all.

Great quality kitchen fade tool.
Used it for a week and discovered a few things. I am not one of those coffee freaks. I enjoy old fashioned Maxwell House put quickly into the old
fashioned stainless steel Percolator and ten minutes later, after barely allowing me time to take the dog out for the morning go, I pour myself
a cup. But that's me. This is a great kitchen tool to use in the kitchen for other uses though.
This is my 4th Krups grinder and I love them to their death with grinding dried herbs, roots and all things hard...along with coffee beans. They take such a beating!

What else can you expect from a simple coffee grinder. It does what it's supposed to. It is not too loud, grinds down to the right thickness in about 9-12 seconds for a regular drip/filter coffee maker. If your coffee beans are in the freezer the grounds will stick a little to the lid and sides but you can sweep them in with your finger. It would be nice if a little cleaning brush cam with it but for the price you can't god wrong. Feels durable and can be worked 1 handed as I am getting the dirty filter out of the coffee maker.

My wife and I use this to grind our coffee beans and have them in the morning. So far it works great and it looks really nice too! I like that it doesn't take up too much space in the kitchen, and it looks really sleek. Doesn't hurt that it doesn't break the bank, either. For how good it is it's really affordable compared to some others I've seen!

This is the easiest grinder to use!! I absolutely love it!!
I highly recommend it to anyone who likes to grind their own beans.

reviews.reviewTitle: ok but slightly too small for 10 cups. 12 cups would absolutely need two batches.
reviews.reviewText: Slight drawback: it's not quite large enough for 10 cups the way I like it. Use the lid as a measure and mound as high as possible into a hill and it's almost right. But then you have to pulse the grinder about 40 short bursts; not run continuously because it is too full for good mixing; the bottom beans would overgrind and overheat without the pulsing.

I bought this to replace my previous KRUPS coffee grinder we actually bought at a garage sale some 8 years ago and I believe the woman had it almost 8 years prior to selling it. So 16 years isn't too shabby for a mechanical contrivance of today.
When our KRUPS petered out, we had to get the exact same one. It's been working perfectly so far. Hopefully this new one will get another 16 years or more of service as well! Good times.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinder had coffee ground remnants inside!
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this a couple of months ago, but just now took it out of the box to use it this past weekend. There were coffee grounds in it!!! I guess it was returned and the seller sent it to me in that condition. I needed it, so I cleaned it out and used it. Seemed to work fine on my peppercorns and I didn't have any issues with it, but I just thought it was kind of gross that I opened up a "new" item and it had obviously been used.

The best. Had one before. Lasted me 20 years - literally. Finally died. Bought another and it's just as good. It only grinds one size, so it's not a burr grinder or something. But if you're not too snobby about your coffee, you'll love it. You can control the coarseness of the grind by how long you grind. I've been working with it long enough that I know how to get coarse or fine grain as the occasion calls for it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Price looks cheap, but this is a high quality item, works works works!!!
reviews.reviewText:
Ordered the competitors $27 double blade whiz bang device with 2 containers, after 2nd try, that thing broke.

This thing still works after 20 grinds. The blades are very sharp, beware and I love the sound it makes when your nearly done.

*Almonds killed the competitors machine on 2nd attempt, this KRUPS grinder shreds almonds :)
Broke after only a year. The switch inside broke and the thing would stay on if you removed the lid. Definitely not safe!
Works as expected. Good.

Grinder is completely useless after one bag of coffee. The motor makes a sound when I try to use it, but the blade doesn't spin, and smoke will come out of the base.

Not sure why this was rating so highly, even when it was working it wasn't that great. You can't remove the inside so it makes it very hard to clean.
Works great! I was given a bag of unground coffee and bought this to grind it. Does a good job! My only complaint is cleaning it, they don’t make it easy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lid Design could be improved but good
reviews.reviewText: Experienced grinder user--Pros: grinds fast, smoothly & fits fair amount of coffee beans (primary use); Con: Lid configuration is bad/wastes product (grounded product) when pulling out because it secures into the grinder (versus securing/snapping on top). I had not encountered this lid design & do not like wasted grounds, product, etc. It's still a good grinder thus far (used daily, less than 1 week).

this was my first, after a lifetime addiction to coffee. they are a classic design and work very well. i don't know if it is just mine or all of them suffer this, but it is difficult to get the last of the coffee out of the grinder without making a mess. you have to put your finger in the cup to loosen the last bit, or bang the bottom, neither of which is comfortable. anyway, since they all look the same, i suspect they all have this issue. i'm told that they are good for grinding spices, too!

I purchased this product less than three months ago, used it almost daily for grinding flax seeds for 20 seconds or so, and today it stopped working completely. According to my fix-it-all husband, it is beyond repair as the motor has stopped working. Very disappointed.
As the title describes, this item only worked for 4 grinds before it stopped turning, only creating a buzzing noise and smelling bad.
Small compact works great
Perfect for what I needed it for! It's a grinder so I expect it to be noisy ... sounds comparable to every other grinder I've ever used.

reviews.reviewTitle: then this is perfect. I've also used it to dabble in grinding ...
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this to make cold brew coffee in large batches, but should've realized how small its capacity is.

If you are buying this to freshly grind beans for a pot of coffee in the morning, then this is perfect. I've also used it to dabble in grinding my own Italian herbs. The blades are sharp; I find just a few pulses does the trick, but I like my beans coarsely ground. If you want very finely ground, then hold how the button for a second or two (seriously) and done.

Getting the grounds out isn't hard; I flip it over and remove the cap, which makes a handy receptacle for the grounds. It's a bit difficult to clean and I wish the blades were removable. All in all, though, I'm pleased with my purchase.

I had one of these before from Krups, and on that model, the cord wrapped around the bottom for storage. This updated model doesn't have that feature and it's a shame. The cord doesn't have anywhere to go and this is a product I prefer to store in the cupboard when not in use. That's the only reason for 4 stars instead of 5. Otherwise, it works great for grinding herbs and spices, which is what I need it for. Shipping and price of product were right on target.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love it! Have had it for a few months
reviews.reviewText: I am not a coffee drinker, so I bought this specifically to grind flaxseed, nuts, etc. I love it! Have had it for a few months, and it works like a charm. Somewhat noisy, but I only use it for 10 seconds at a time, so no big deal. To avoid a mess, after grinding I turn it upside down and tap a few times to get as much as possible into the lid and keep it upside-down, using the lid as a cup to hold the contents. A quick wipe with a damp paper towel and it's ready to go again.

This is a great little grinder. My only complaint would be the blade part is not removable so I have to hold over the trash can and wipe with paper towel to clean it. I find this to be common with all the grinders I looked at though.
Excellent construction. Works well. Minus one star as there's no way to empty it other than turning the whole thing upside down and banging it into the pot.

The inside chamber for grinding looks quite small, but it does grind enough beans for about 8 cups of coffee at a time. NOTE: if you pulse grind and remove the cover to check of the grind is fine enough, you will likely have trouble getting it back on w/o making a mess. Also, in order to properly clean the inside of the grinder chamber it is best to use a brush.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fresh ground coffee is a must
reviews.reviewText: This grinds coffee like nobody’s business. If I am having coffee from home it has to be fresh ground. This is perfect. Easy to use too.

Love this for grinding fresh coffee. It works so fast, is pretty quiet, and sturdy. We actually have one that we have had for about twenty years and it still works great! We bought another for our second home! Great value!

Overall I like the machine.
However the beans can stop feeding from the hopper into the grinder so I have to agitate them to keep them moving during the grind.
Be careful removing the filter basket holder, the drip stop can snag and bust off.
Works well actually! 5-6 scoops of beans is enough to just barley fill it and make a 10 cup pot! If filled I’m sure it will do a 12 cup pot!

Good for making just drip coffee if you don't care about consistent grind size
Side note: I know a lot of chemists who use this to grind up compounds in their lab, and they also note the inconsistency in grind size

I've had this grinder for about 2 months now, and we use it virtually every day. It works just fine for grinding our daily coffee. The longer you leave the button depressed, the finer the coffee is ground. After a while you sort of learn by sound when the coffee is ground to your liking. Take the clear lid off, dump the ground coffee into it, and then pour it into the filter in your coffee maker. Simple.

UPDATE: December 2016 - Out little grinder is still working away as good as it did the first day we used it, and we use it almost every day!

Quality grinder! Have tried multiple brands this one is by far my favorite. Grinds my coffee beans quickly and it easy to dispense. Very smooth running. I have a separate grinder for spices so the oils from from the coffee beans don't mix with the spices. I am hoping this works for an extended period of time since I have experienced some other brands stop working quickly. Seems like it will with its performance so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful purchase and I would buy again if I needed a second one!
reviews.reviewText: This grinder works great whether you like course or fine coffee. It lasts a long time and is really easy to use!

Bought this February of 2007, I've used it everyday since(well unless I'm on vacation- not one of those freaks who takes his coffee supplies with him) and it is still working. I was prompted to write a review because the grinder just started making a few odd noises so it may be on its way out. I knew I had had it for a while, but was pleasantly pleased to see its been almost 8 years. I will be buying this one again because it was so trouble free.
Does the job of grinding beans well but the two drawbacks I've found is the short power cable and shape of the grinder makes it not that suitable for pouring out the grounds.

After 3 mths usage. Nice grinder. Works well, seems to be well built, good cup capacity, on off system great compared to previous grinders I have had. Only down side is no built in cord storage. Would buy this unit again and recommend to friends.
This is a great grinder for seeds, nuts, and I guess coffee, though we haven’t used it for such. Easy to wipe clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great! Then you try to use it for something it's not designed for.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this in November to grind spices and it worked like a charm - a quick, fine grind. Wipe it clean, done. Then last week I had a brain-whatsit and used it to pulp some ginger and garlic. It's wasn't meant for that, so even though I washed it out thoroughly, when I came to use it today the spindle was jammed solid. Shame on me. Moral of the story - don't use a screwdriver to hammer nails. It's not like I didn't have a hammer (a Microplane) two feet away in the utensil drawer.
I bought this small coffee grinder in 2010 and 8 years later it still works perfectly. I keep a small spatula with it to get all the ground coffee out. Very happy with this grinder.
I was pleasantly surprised by how well this grinder worked on both coffee beans and spices. Great product for a great price. Small and easily portable as well as easy to clean.

I've had this product for about a month. I have used it 2-3 times a week since purchase. The product is described as being able to do course to fine grind based on time, and the instruction booklet that comes with the product even says it grinds evenly. This is not the case. I bought this to use with a cold brewer, which requires a courser grind. I grind for about 3-4 seconds, and I would say 75% of the grounds are the correct size. The other 25% fills the spectrum, however, from a fine grind to whole bean. Literally, every time I grind, I'll have to sift through the grounds for 6 or 7 beans that have yet to even touch the blades. I have used the device on a variety of surfaces, at work and home, and it consistently fails to grind evenly. It does the job, so I won't be returning it, but it does require extra steps if you want to get the most out of your coffee.
Easy peasy coffee grinder. You can make it coarse or fine just with the push of a button!

Wow! What a difference this grinder makes. Just replaced old grinder with this. This is powerful, fast, and grinds
wonderfully well. Very pleased.

reviews.reviewTitle: My Worst Owned Coffee Grinder to Date.
reviews.reviewText: If you can use this contraption once without making a moderate mess, please contact me and tell me the secret. If not, you already see why you shouldn't purchase.

Ok I am happy with the way this grinds. I can turn almonds into almond flour, grind pepper corns into ground pepper, etc etc. Great. But I can't remove the blade or the metal cup area to wash it thoroughly. It is currently very very difficult to wash without being able to remove the parts to wash them. If anyone here knows another way to wash this thing, or if there is another model that has removable washable parts, please let me know.

I used to have a Mr. Coffee IDS77 Electric Coffee Blade Grinder with Chamber Maid Cleaning System that broke. I am almost glad it did. This thing is eons better. Not as noisy, grinds faster and more effectively without having to resort to pulse to not mess the grinder up. I'm pleased and hope it's durable. Good compact size but does fit quite a bit of coffee grounds at a time without spilling up when opening to pour after grinding.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, grinds in no time!
reviews.reviewText: Very easy to use, portable, grinds in a few seconds. However, although I knew prior to purchasing that it doesn't hold a lot, it could really use it. And the cord could use an extra couple inches, it is a bit too short.

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought this July 23. It's now Dec 12 ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this July 23. It's now Dec 12 and it's broke. Where the blade connects to the shaft is stripped out. I used it 2 times prior to this to grind spices - this was the third time. I literally got two uses out of it.

reviews.reviewTitle: The only thing I don't like is that there are no instructions and it doesn't ...
reviews.reviewText: The only thing I don't like is that there are no instructions and it doesn't let you determine the grind you want. So, you kind of have to guess if it's medium or fine! I just googled a picture of what I wanted and compared. It is hard to get a consistent grind though, but I may not be using the proper amount of coffee beans as I didn't get instructions.

This is my second Krups coffee grinder. My first one was still working (I bought it 20 years ago), and has been put away as a backup, but I doubt I will need it. Sturdy, very sturdy, I bought this one because I wanted a black one. I don't think you could find a better spice and coffee grinder,

reviews.reviewTitle: I typically have nothing but good things to say about Krups but I’m disappointed in ...
reviews.reviewText: If I could return this I would. I typically have nothing but good things to say about Krups but I’m disappointed in this product. No matter what I do I end up with coffee grounds in the carafe. I feel that it grinds too much coffee for the setting. There’s an icon that appears on the display and nobody has any idea what it means.

This is my first "fancy" coffee maker. Very easy to use and brews quick!
The grinding is a bit loud (as you'd expect), but it blasts through the beans in seconds.
I use this at work. It does not have any settings, but it works great. Really enjoy how it grinds quickly. Very powerful and great quality for the price!
I use this for grinding peppercorns, whole seeds, cloves, nutmegs, etc, into powder for spice mixes. Faster than a mortar and pestle by a wide margin!
Great little grinder. We use it for grains to make baby food and it does the job!

This grinder does a great job grinding the coffee for use. The only problem is getting the coffee out of the grinder. The top is a very tight fit and take some effort getting it off to the point that coffee is spilled in the process. I have used it four times and it has not improved yet. Hopefully it will get better the more I use it. We have had many Krups products ( coffee machines and grinders) in the past with no issues, so this one was a surprise.

I love my spice grinder. I used it to grind spices I grew in my garden over the summer. Stevia, basil, lemon balm, sweet mint, sage etc. Just to name a few. All grinded perfectly. I did use an art brush to clean well between uses.
The coffee grinder works in that it grinds coffee. There isn't a ton of uniformity in the grind, along with it can be loud and can be messy at times.
I have abused this little thing and its still works great, cleaning isn't that great but its worth it
This has been a kitchen champ. You can (but shouldn't) grind an entire nutmeg in this. It's very strong, small, and easy.
This may be early for a review but we are very happy with this purchase, it appears to be made very well and we had our first cup of coffee this morning and it was delicious

We maintained it as instructed, but the grinder stopped working after one week. Cheap plastic parts are not durable. It just makes noise but doesn't grind the coffee beans. Then it proceeds to brew hot water. Don't waste your time and money.

reviews.reviewTitle: love this tiny powerful little grinder
reviews.reviewText: love this tiny powerful little grinder! easy to use, grinds well. i use it for coffee beans and also assorted nuts, chia seeds, etc. wish I could immerse t when it needs to be washed, but no big deal to just wipe clean
This is a great grinder. It is very loud but it’s a grinder. Easy to use and store and take traveling!
Durable and easy to use. We used this for 10-12 years when it finally died. We replaced with the same model

Daily use (for coffee beans) for almost a year. No issues. I love this grinder. Good price, also!

I use a damp cotton cloth to clean it out, then a dry cotton cloth to wipe it down afterwards. It's really not difficult to clean.
Great bang for your buck! Grinds coffee beans up nicely for half the cost of those fancy coffee bean grinders out there

reviews.reviewTitle: When the unit arrived ir would not turn on. ...
reviews.reviewText:
When the unit arrived ir would not turn on. The problem was with the internal switch which would not be engaged by the small plastic stub in the cap. I had to wiggle a small object (I used a wooden toothpick) in the slot to free up the switch which then engaged properly and the unit then turned on and has been running satisfactorily ever since.

It is clear that there should have been an operability test at the factory that would have revealed the problem. I think most purchasers when faced with a brand new device that would not turn on would have sent it back.
This is my first coffee grinder....ever. It grinds the beans well. It gives me the brain juices I require to people on a daily basis.
Have been using this for quite sometime and it definitely great to have one always fresh coffee every grind!
Makes quick work of rubs and spices. Much quicker than a mortar and pestle.

We love this coffee pot. Makes the best coffee every time. The only drawback is once in a while coffee beans get stuck and then it only grinds a little bit of coffee so your coffee is weak. Need to move around the coffee beans in the container and don’t completely fill it up all the way. It seems to work better that way and the beans don’t get stuck. Overall I would rate this at five. Excellent coffee Pot! 👍🏼
This grinder is perfect. I have tried other ones that cost more but don’t grind as well.

This stopped working at all after a few grinds. The motor would make noise but the blade would not turn.
I am sending it back to Krups. At least they are sending a prepaid return box.
I am not keeping my hopes up that the next unit will work any better.
Yes. My unit is made in China.

reviews.reviewTitle: You sent me a grinder designed for 120 volts power ...
reviews.reviewText:
You sent me a grinder designed for 120 volts power supply. The mains power here in Australia is 240 volts. The unit burned out after about 10 seconds! You kindly sent me a replacement and you confirmed by email that the grinder would, this time, definitely be of a type suitable for use in Australia.
It wasn't. The replacement unit was, again, for 120 volts supply. You kindly gave me a refund, for which I thank you.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good compact grinder, hard to remove contents
reviews.reviewText: Good coffee grinder, makes quick work of beans. A little noisy but it's a very compact bean grinder. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that after grinding the beans up rather fine they don't want to come out completely. A significant layer sticks to the bottom. Shaking the grinder with the beans in it after grinding does help a little, but you pretty much have to unplug the unit and swipe the bottom out with your finger if you want to get most of it out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Small and Just What I Needed
reviews.reviewText: I use this to grind up Flaxseed to put into my food for joint and muscle pain. Both works great!

reviews.reviewTitle: Quit after about a dozen uses.
reviews.reviewText: We used this product only occasionally and over the period of a year or so. After only about a dozen uses, it locked up and refused to turn. Of course the return and warranty are long gone.

reviews.reviewTitle: it worked great... and then it didn't
reviews.reviewText: had this product for a little under a year before it just stopped working. it worked pretty well before (though some grounds would inevitably end up finer than others toward the bottom), but now the blade does not spin and it just makes a humming noise, despite always washing carefully. There doesn't seem to be a warrantee on this, so I will be stuck buying a different (hopefully more reliable) brand.

My 25 year old Braun grinder finally needed to be retired. Tried a burr grinder and, believe it or not, didn't like the quality of the grind. Maybe I'm just to conditioned to have complete control over my coffee grind. The Krup's grinder seemed like the right choice for me and very reasonably price. It's smaller, lighter, and importantly, much quieter than my old grinder. So far I'm very pleased.

Pretty simple device (which is good). It's either on or off, the switch/interlock is pretty robust. My only complaint is that the cap fits very snuggly into the body and requires a little force to remove which leads to the occasional spill. Robust grinder though - should last many, many, years.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have liked using this grinder
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this in March of 2012 and it died today, 3 years later. I was grinding cinnamon sticks and guess it was just too much because when I opened the chamber the blade was no longer attached to the base. Was very strange and seemed dangerous. In general, I have liked using this grinder, but I don't think it was the best quality. I'm reading reviews now and I think I will purchase a different brand to replace this one with.

Effective and powerful grinder. Loved that the pricing is cheap. Used it for grinding coffee beans and able to get it to it for fineness that I need (for a French press).

Only thing to note - if you intend to use this grinder outside the US, you’ll need a transformer to convert the voltage to 110V which is the only voltage it works at. (Most other appliances now are able to work at either 110/230V)

I used to own Krups for grinding coffee and tried this model again. I owned two and both broke within months. I did not immerse and have no reason why they would break so quickly. Will never buy another one.

It's still going after at least a year. The design makes sure nothing breaks and it can't start if the cover isn't on. The grounds, especially the shiny oily ones, always stick to the inside so you can't be afraid of wiping the inside out.
Had a 20 doller grinder from wall mart this this DESTROYS that! Super happy I spent the money and got this! Motor in it is super powerful.
Grinding coffee beans allows the freshest coffee. This small grinder is a must for every kitchen.

I've been using it for a few months now. Very pleased. Fast and easy to use & does a great job. After grinding beans, flip it upside down and give it a few gentle taps to get all the free flowing grounds into the transparent cap. That simple technique prevents grounds from emptying all over your counter when finished grinding. Get another one to grind spices if that's your thing.
Purchased this to grind flaxseed. I don't need a large amount at one time, so this is perfect size to use and store. Easy to use and clean. Would recommend.
It grinds only for a little then it stop working
Cute and doesn't take up much space. Very efficient and works well. No issues. Not too loud and very practical for my french press
Bought this based on recommendation from my sister who had this brand forever. Does the job well, very light & small so it doesn’t take much space in your cupboard

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinder beans don’t fall into basket
reviews.reviewText: Had this coffee maker for six months and now the grinder does not work properly. The coffee stopped feeding into the basket. I’ve vacuumed it, cleaned it with the brush and tried multiple ways to have the grinder work properly and it still does not work. Beans get ground but somewhere between the grinder and the grounds basket the grounds get jammed. Maybe my expectations were too high given the price.
Does a fantastic job on my spices. Not as loud as my Hamilton beach grinder.

We got this because we are gluten free and hate spending tons of money on flour like rice flour and oat flour. So we use this to grind our rice into a nice fine rice flour, same with oats. It is spectacular. Works better than any flour grinder i have ever used. We don't drink coffee, but I'm guessing if it can grind rice into a fine powder, it will work great on coffee beans too. We LOVE it. Use it every day, and think it is great.

Replaced the last one we had for many years. GRINDS FAST. I mean fast. My 2 scoops take about 3 seconds or they are overground. One star missing because the cord is now much shorter. Had to find a different place to store it right next to an outlet.

reviews.reviewTitle: Uneven grounds, tough to remove grounds from machine
reviews.reviewText: Not a fan of this product at all. Yes is grinds coffee and spices, but in order to get the grounds out of the grinder, you have to move the blade out of the way manually to get the grounds out from underneath. I don't like having to touch the blade. Also I found the gounds for coffee super uneven. So if you are trying to do a french press or pour over - forget it! I wouldn't recommend this!
Really uneven grind. Hard to figure out what you're going to get out of it. Ended up going with a manual burr which is much better.

reviews.reviewTitle: It grind coffee nicely. I used it to grind spices once but ...
reviews.reviewText: Will give it 4.5 starts. The little machine was designed elegantly and efficiently. It grind coffee nicely. I used it to grind spices once but it takes me a while to clean it and get rid of the smell. I will only use it for grinding coffee. The star it lost from me was the burning smell when I grind my coffee. I only grind half cup each time.

Great little grinder, this is my second one for the office and I've had no issues at all. There's no grinding selection or anything, but you can just grind it for more or less time to get your grind as fine as you want it.
No issues this makes the second one purchased, and no issues with both of them for doing flax seeds and coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Got this for grinding herbs, spices and dehydrated foods into powders.
reviews.reviewText: Been having fun using this to grind ingredients for addition of healthier foods to our diet.

In the past 2 years we've gone through 5 coffee grinders and so are now looking to invest in a decent Burr grinder. Meanwhile, this is the only one that hasn't broken in any way, we were given one a year ago to replace it that broke, and then another one at christmas that didn't last three weeks (neither of which we can return)

So yeah - this grinder keeps coming back out of the cupboard and being used again. Tough, efficient little thing that takes up very little space, for the money it's the best IMHO: only problem I have with it is, it's actually a bit small.
Great product. Buying this for a friend as she like the one I have, and finds it very useful...grinding coffee beans or chopping nuts.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best grinder I've found for this price
reviews.reviewText: Best grinder I've found for this price. I use it to grind up nuts and spices for my Cockatiel's treats. It works very well on the harder spices like cinnamon too by grinding it into a fine powder. The only thing you can't do is wash it out. Which is disappointing if anyone is allergic to any of the things I put in the grinder. I use some bread or rice to clean it out and haven't noticed a different taste after that, but I think I'm just super cautious with it.
I got this for my husband who loves coffee. I wanted to order him a Kauai brand which only comes in whole bean, so I got him this coffee grinder to go with the beans. It works great!

reviews.reviewTitle: and it works great. The grinder is sturdy and the design doesn't ...
reviews.reviewText: I got this today not to grind coffee but my seeds, and it works great. The grinder is sturdy and the design doesn't look bad either. On the negative side, it is a bit difficult to open it and, for the price, it should come with a brush to clean it after using it, especially, since you can not just put it in the dishwasher.
A very good grinder for coffee beans. Produces consistent grind. Easy to clean. A tad noisy though. Great price.
It broke after just two months :( it won’t spin. Tbh cleaning is a pain since the bottom is attached to the motor.
I read some negative reviews before I bought it. This is working for me perfectly. I only use it to grind coffee beans. I would recommend it for that purpose. Very pleased with this purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: This grinder is perfect. I haven't had any issues and maintenance is ...
reviews.reviewText: Coffee just tastes fresher when you buy it whole bean and grind it. This grinder is perfect. I haven't had any issues and maintenance is easy. I only grind enough beans for one or two uses.If I don't use all the grinds, just put the top back on since I'll likely use them the next day and the lid seals pretty tightly. To clean, I just wipe it down with a damp cloth or paper towel. I haven't owned any other grinders to compare, but this has worked perfectly for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best portable coffee grinder I have found and has far ...
reviews.reviewText: Best portable coffee grinder I have found and has far out-lasted numerous other brands in it's class. I am on year 6 with this one and I use it every morning.
The way it works is the way you want it to work. It's that simple.

This Krups grinder does an amazingly good job and is an outstanding buy for the price. I grind whole coffee beans for espresso and get the perfect grind after a few seconds. There's no adjustments for how fine or coarse you want the grinds, but over time you'll figure out what works for you. I've had mine for nearly three years, use it nearly everyday, and it still works perfectly. Unless you're looking for a professional grade grinder, this one serves its purpose exceedingly well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder for a great price!
reviews.reviewText: Great grinder for a great price! I drink french press coffee, so it's nice that I can grind it coarse for that purpose. I like that the top is clear so I can see through it, sometimes, however, I have to take off the lid to get a better look at how ground they are as the grounds often get stuck to inside of the lid due to static electricity.
Purchased based on other reviews and recommendations that this was the best. Great product. Works exactly as expected. Would recommend.
I love grounding my own fresh spices especially after I dry roast them. This does the job and its priced very well.

I originally purchased a manual coffee grinder here on Amazon and used it a couple of months before it broke. I was surprised to find an electric one this affordable so gave it a try. It's seriously amazing. In less than 30 seconds, my 12 oz of coffee beans are perfectly ground and ready to use. My husband has used this for rosemary and thyme as well and though it was harder to clean, it worked efficiently as well. I would seriously recommend this. It's amazing and has held up for months without any change in function!

This item works great so far. I decided to freshly grind my fair trade organic coffee at home after doing research on how much volatility previous grounded coffee uses when its time to brew as opposed to freshly grinding when needed. They loose up to 40% of their volatile oils. After grinding I use a french press and the coffee is amazing! I will not go back to the coffee pot again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beware. Read all the revoews before buying.
reviews.reviewText:
Not working out of the box. Doesn't grind or brew. The small screen light up though, I can set the time. So it's a useless coffee maker that I can probably use as clock.

I should have read the comment before buying this trash.

My husband and I just started drinking coffee and a friend recommended this grinder and so far we love it! easy to use. pretty easy to clean. My only trouble is trying to get the grinds out without making a mess on my counter every morning but maybe thats my problem? Anyway, it gets the job done for a great price.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... buy it again - the grinder is very noisy-sounds like grinding metal or was not assembled correctly
reviews.reviewText: Will never buy it again - the grinder is very noisy-sounds like grinding metal or was not assembled correctly. The electrical cord has no support at the base of the grinder and will wear against the case and expose the electrical wire causing an electrical hazard. The last three I purchased had the same cord problem and exposed the electrical wire and stop working. Cord cannot be repaired so the grinder quickly becomes useless. Krups grinder used to be the best on the market, but not longer. I should be recalled as a safety hazard.

Great for grinding all kinds of things:

Spices
Nuts
Bread crumbs

Great little grinder and gives just the right amount of grind for two good cups of coffee depending on how strong you like your coffee. The only down fall is the power cord is a little short but not by much. This is a minor issue just a little bit of a pain since the outlet in my house is not in the most optimal spot resulting in my wife having to lean of the counter a little to operate. 1 month later and still working great.
I grind coffee and spices. However long you hold it down is how ground the product is. Don’t buy if you are a professional chef and need to know consistency, but for normal everyday use, it’s great.

We use this coffee grinder where I work and I was so impressed with it that I bought one for my boyfriend. 6 months later and it's still going strong at both my work and home. The BF was just saying how impressed he is with the little thing. It's not very large, but it is powerful and gets the job done. When it finally wears down, we will be buying another one. Thanks!

This little grinder is a great value. I own a grinder from another company (that I am equally happy with) that I have used for years for grinding spices, so I knew the style I wanted. This one is a great match and it does a great job. We purchased this at the same time as a new coffee maker for serving guests of an annual retreat we host in our home. It's been a great addition and I love being able to serve everyone coffee from freshly ground beans.

Perfect little grinder for the price. Some people prefer burr grinders, but this is compact, powerful and easy to clean. I make cold brew once a week, grinds the coffee in seconds (it's pulse only) and clean-up is super simple. Highly recommended.
Had one for many years and it worked great. This one seems just as good.

reviews.reviewTitle: good for fine grind and sturdy enough
reviews.reviewText: Consistent with the older versions of the same grinder but not as well made- lighter and cap fitting to start the grinder doesn't have the same solid feel the older Krups had- been using about 3 years and I'm used to it now. Grinds well for a fine grind for drip coffee- leaves too many unground or partially ground beans if you need a coarser grind. This has been mentioned in other reviews and I agree. For my purpose it works well.

Absolutely love this grinder! I bought this one solely for the purpose of grinding flax seeds. A previous reviewer said this worked well for their flax seeds, which is why I purchased it. I usually put in about 2 TB and they are finely ground in less than 10-15 seconds. I highly recommend this product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Dead after 9 months...not even a grinding issue
reviews.reviewText: Bought this 9 months ago, and we barely use the grinder, just the coffee brewer. The actual system will not brew coffee anymore. We tried resetting and following online trouble shooting, but it will not recover. Never buying Krups again. Avoid this mess of a machine at all costs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lasts forever and simple to use.
reviews.reviewText: I had one of these for years, just can not find it now. This grinds coffee as fine as you want. Also does spices. Simple to use. Pull off the top, put in coffee beans and push down. Empty and wipe out the inside with a paper towel. Does not do a large amount, but works fine for me.
This has worked perfectly for my coffee & spices (even my smoked nutmeg & hazelnut). This quick little buy has held up. Kudos guys!
My last Krupp’s coffe grinder lasted 30 years until my daughter but nutmegs into it. This one is quieter and has greater capacity. For the price it was the best.

It is rather loud while in use. I have owned owners that were much quieter. We use it for coffee beans, dried herbs, dried peels and egg shells. Have never had any issues with performance. I recommend.
Ive been using this grinder for some time now. Still works great. Grinders fine or coarse depending on how long you hold the power button down. Easy to fill, use, and clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: The only bad thing is when you get done grinding the coffee ...
reviews.reviewText: I use mine for coffee. The only bad thing is when you get done grinding the coffee is that it gets stuck in the bottom corners and you have to use you fingers or a small spoon to get it out. If I was buying one again for coffee I'd buy a more expensive one and have a hopper on it along with measuring settings so you can have consistent cups of coffee.
Compact grinder, unfortunately it stopped working after using is 3 times

Much better than the Black & Decker one I tried. I use it to grind raw green coffee beans which may be harder than roasted. The blade is very close to the bottom of the cavity, meaning a better grind.
It grinds ok, but the way the lid fits into the base pushes the material up the sides and makes the lid hard to get off. Poor design.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great to start off, Stopped Working in under 3 months
reviews.reviewText: Worked great for 3 months. I used it maybe once every 3 weeks, to grind my coffee for work. Last time I used it, it took a while to work. After 2-3 failed attempts, it finally worked. However when I went to use it just now, nothing. Tried several different plugs, still does not work. Very disappointing product. I had high hopes for it as KRUPS is a good brand.
I have to give this one star. I bought 2 months ago. This is 5th time that i used this grinder. Unfortunately it stops working... Not sure what went wrong. But it is really short lived...

This works well. I grind my spices for all of my recipes (a great cooking secret, by the way--you get more nutrients and flavors out of every spice). It grinds to a fine powder quickly and easily.

The top fits very snugly so sometimes I have to pull kind of hard and yes, some spices may fall to the counter when I do this but the machine works so well that I don't mind this.

Quality grind. Not terribly hard to clean but if you were using a grinder for coffee and a grinder for spices I would just recommend getting 2 so you don't have to clean them all the time.

Have had this grinder for a few months now. No issues. The quality seems decent.

Grinds coffee quickly and efficiently. Perhaps a touch too quickly. It takes a bit of practice or skill to get the right fineness of grind. It's easy to grind a bit too long and end up with powder. Of course pulsing the grinder (as recommended) helps.

Cleans up easily with a brush or paper towel. Nicely compact.

Would recommend.

Item looks nice. However, when I used it at first, I smelled electrical wire burning after grinding for about 15 seconds. At first, I thought it was because it was brand new, so I tried it again. The item continued to emit electrical wire or plastic burning type smell EACH time I use the product. I will not purchase this item again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent customer service and excellent product
reviews.reviewText: After owning and using this grinder regularly for 16 months, I noticed that the blade started sticking, which required me to force the it loose before grinding. I called Krups and found out that this grinder is covered for two years, so they shipped me a pre-paid label and promised to replace it free of charge if they were unable to service it. Excellent customer service and excellent product. Two thumbs way up!

Now, every morning I grind my fresh coffee and smell spreads over all apartment.
This is huge difference to use a coffee grinded a week ago from freezer or fresh one.

I ordered this b/c I was wanting something to grind up almonds and Golden flaxseeds for my new "Wheat Belly" diet. A lot of people seemed to complain about how hard it was to clean. I didn't have any problems. Of course that products I'm using don't leave a lot of mess behind. The only downside is that I couldn't get all the almonds to completely grind up. I tried different amounts in the container to see if that was the reason..nope! lol Everytime I've ground them up I've had to pick out chunks or whole almonds.

reviews.reviewTitle: Too many steps to select right coffee strength
reviews.reviewText: After much research I purchased this machine believing it would be top if the line. I have owned 2 different types of grind & brew coffee makers in the past & the KRUPS is by far the least user friendly. While the varied options of brew strength & fine or coarse grind sounds cool, it took about 2 weeks to figure out the right mix to create a good cup of joe😞.
I bought this for work and it delivers. I use it mainly for black peppercorns.

I bought this to use strictly for grinding spices and herbs as my food processor did a fair job, but not as good as I would ahve liked.
WOW!
Was I pleasantly surprised when bay leaves were reduced to powder in no time flat! Usually, it takes a good while to get them past the crushed stage, let alone ever get to powdered.
The oblong shape makes it easy to pour from the lid, which was an extra perk.
This is such a powerful little unit, it will take a fraction of the time to make the seasoning mixes I keep on hand.
And yes, I would buy it again in a heartbeat.
Highly recommended.

Love this little grinder! I don't use it for coffee, however I do use it for grinding raw pumpkin and flax seeds as a dietary supplement. It works perfectly, grinds the seeds as coarsely or as finely as I choose depending on how long I grind them for.
I bought this for a gift for my brother in law to grind beans for making cols brew. So far it's working fine.
Nice little coffee grinder for a great price. Does the job well. Not very expensive, and worth the price. Enjoying fresh ground coffee every day!

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointed, but will deal with it
reviews.reviewText:
It's okay; no problems-I just prefer my Braun round coffee grinder over this
oval-shaped grinder. The round design is easier to empty ground coffee from
and easier to remove if it sticks due to oils in the beans.
Disappointed, but will deal with it.

Worked well for about 2 years. Then it crapped out. Motor stopped working and then it started smoking...so it’s definitely done. Will probably spend more money for a higher quality coffee grinder in the future.
Very nice....Love it. Can now buy coffee beans and grind them up......THANK YOU SO MUCH

The first time I used it, I accidentally spilled all the grounds all over the floor. Since then, I've learned how to use it and before this, I was using a hand-crank grinder. This is vastly more convenient than that. It grinds almost as well, but it does it in fractions of the time it takes for me to manually grind the same amount. For that, I can't recommend this enough.

My wife and I have used several kinds of grinders in our coffee drinking career. We started with a grinder like this, moved onto coffee makers with built-in grinders, then decided last year to get a bur grinder. We had heard that bur grinders where what you needed if you really wanted to bring out the taste of your coffee. Well after spending quite a lot on a good quality name brand bur grinder it ended up breaking after just 4 months of normal use. We have since gone back to this grinder and will never stray again. We never did feel that the bur grinder provided better taste, we believe that is simply a myth.
Using exclusively as a spice grinder. Grinds fast. Holds quite a bit. Grinds all sizes, from mustard seed to big pepper corns.

reviews.reviewTitle: It worked great, but I only used it a few time ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this in Sept. of 2015. It worked great, but I only used it a few time a year. After only 2 or 3 lbs of coffee and a few flax seeds it gave up the ghost. Why can't we buy any quality products anymore.

I use the grinder on coffee beans and it works great. It does every thing from coarse to fine grinding. The size is relatively small, so it should not require much counter space. This is a winner for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Incredibly small to be called coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText: We needed a coffee grinder, and this is way too small for coffee beans. MAY well work well, just too small.
I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because it's the second or third one I've bought over the years, so I guess it isn't super durable.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awkward interior shape does not match blades
reviews.reviewText: This grinder gets the job done, quickly and quietly. The main issue with this machine, is the interior is an oblong shape while the blades work in a circular shape, this means that there are parts of the interior where the blades cannot reach and whatever is being blended tends to get stuck in the untouched areas. Would be a much more effective product if the interior was a circle that matched the blades.
This is a great way to get fresh coffee at home. It grinds it up very well and quickly. It isn’t too loud and can grind it until it is very fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not perfect, but worth the effort
reviews.reviewText: I use my grinder for preparing small amounts of chai spices. Cloves and anise seed take a bit of doing to get them really ground finely, and I usually end up pulsing so long I smell the motor heating up. The top did become foggy after just a couple uses, but I can tell by the sound what's going on inside. I empty and clean it with a basting brush used just for that. Having freshly ground spices is worth the effort.
Used it once, so far so good, a little tricky to clean around the blades without getting the whole thing wet.

I love making Indian dishes, however biting into whole spices isn't fun. This grinder pulverises hard spices like cinnamon and cloves into a very fine dust. I know some reviews said clean up is a bit of a hassle; since the container is not removable this can make cleaning the device troublesome. However, I use a powder make up brush to remove particles and Lysol disinfecting wipes when necessary. Definitely recommend this product...

reviews.reviewTitle: Krups coffee grinder stopped working in about a year
reviews.reviewText: Nice grinder — I used mainly for grinding spices. It stopped working a few months ago. Love the krups brand but sadly will not buy again.

I supposed that the power spec was just same as 220V in Thailand.
Unfortunately, this power unit is 120V.
When I plugged in, spark fire and smoke happened.
No voltage information was given in web and mail.
It might be better not to ship this item to the countries where 220V is used such as Thailand to avoid customer accident and loss.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super large basin for lots of grounds
reviews.reviewText: Super large basin for lots of grounds. I have a 24 oz French press and, if I fill the basin with grounds, the coffee is super strong. Grinds extremely well and extremely fast. Great product. My only qualm is the cord doesn't roll up in the base like my previous (RIP) grinder.

I bought this to take store-bought coffee beans and grind them into espresso-ground coffee but while this can be achieved, due the nature of how it grinds, the friction quickly creates heat and will sometimes create uneven grounds before it gets too hot.
El molinillo funciona muy bien, poco ruido al moler y muy efectivo. Recomiendo este producto. Es importante señalar que funciona con 110 Volts, por lo que no es apto para los 220 V de algunos países.
First-time users fear how to use such devices. But it's too easy to be famous.

Works like a charm, grinding spices down to a fine powder that is easy to tap out and easy to clean up with a damp paper towel. I have a burr grinder for my coffee and it's quite a chore to clean...many pieces to remove and dig around at with a brush. I was told burr grinders give more "uniform" grind, which it does...but I've found that with my spices, it seems very uniform with this KRUPS 203-42 and I'm tempted to use it for coffee some time.

Small. Efficient. Effective. Easy clean-up. Not too loud. It works perfectly for what I need it for.

Now there are no settings on this product. The longer you hold the button down, the smaller the grind. So you will need to do a little trial and error to get the perfect grind for your taste. But this was not a problem for me. Plus you save lots of money being able to by these 1 button coffee grinders as opposed to the multiple setting grinders that are $100 plus.

Works well for coffee a
And nuts. A quality product that lasts for years👍👍👍

I've had lots of coffee grinders, but this is the first one that gives a consistent grind size. No large chunks and no hopeless powder in the same grind.

I've only used it a little while now, so will have to see how long it lasts. Sure wish the blade was replaceable. The plastic part on the blade hub was what broke on my last grinder, one I paid twice or more what this one cost. So far so good.

Work great for a few weeks then stopped completely. Lasted just long enough to not be able to return it. I don’t usually write reviews but this is very frustrating, I’ve never had a coffee grinder break. Get your act together you’re supposed to be a leader in coffee.

This is the second Krups coffee grinder

that I've owned.

The first Krups was used every day

for about fifteen years.

The only minus I can think of is that there is a cavity

below the metal receptacle that, through

the crack between it and the plastic housing,

becomes over time, filled with old, stale

coffee residue. I noticed this when I took

the old one apart.

Other than that, it's great. The new one grinds

much faster than the old one.

Purchased this Feb 2014 to grind enough beans for one pot of coffee daily. It just quit working 7 months later. I have a similar Krups grinder - about 20 years old - which still works and therefore thought the manufacturer produced dependable products. Apparently not. Thankfully I still had the old one in a cupboard and am using that again while I order a new, more expensive, grinder. I think most would agree that "planned obsolescence" seems to be a more and more prevalent approach these days toward corporate profitability - disgusting.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and to store
reviews.reviewText: Makes noise, but nothing unexpected. Works great... very easy to use, clean up and store.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor quality—you get what you pay for
reviews.reviewText: Stopped working after less than a year—blade becomes stuck and motor (and I) cannot dislodge it. There is a 2-year warranty, but I’m disappointed that Krups customer service makes it a lengthy ~monthlong process to receive a replacement.

This is the perfect spice grinder for me. I grew cayenne peppers last summer and dried them ams this is grinder holds 3oz to grind. Prefect for the small jobs. I did not want a large grinder. This is easily stored ams perfect size. Now I have my own grinder cayenne peppers. Which means this summer I'll be playing more herbs to dry and grind! Love the way it's built ams love the brand name!

We bought this so we could start drinking fresher coffee (it actually does taste better IMO). This thing does the trick and quickly. The only downside (which is probably apparent with all grinders) is that there is a certain part in the bottom rounded edge that the grounds will build up and not want to come out. Cleaning is a bit of a hassle to get under the blade etc but not impossible. It takes up a small footprint on the counter next to the coffee maker and looks nice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great model for a great price
reviews.reviewText: Very simple basic coffee grinder. Does exactly what it advertises, without breaking the bank. Coffee grounds are evenly-ground, and the noise isn't terrible. The grounds do usually get built-up in the basin, and I have to tap it to loosen them up, which is a little annoying, and sometimes there are some grounds you just can't get out of the thing.

I can't speak first hand on this because it was a gift for my parents but my dad said it has done really well and he enjoys his fresh coffee. I appreciated how quickly it arrived and how affordable it was! Plus I didn't have to leave the house to do Christmas shopping ;)
Very easy to use and take minimum space, although, a little bit noisy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Yes, I love this grinder. It's part of a morning ritual.
reviews.reviewText:
I've just finished grinding my second bag (2.2 lb) of coffee beans. This Krups grinder makes a fine coffee powder for a delicious cup of joe that cannot be beat.

The grinder opened a new world of coffee to me. I grind beans before every mug to ensure optimum freshness and flavor.

Yes, I love this grinder. It's part of a morning ritual.

reviews.reviewTitle: Monday Morning with Wal-Mart coffee, Not Sunday Brunch with the Jamaican Blue
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this thing's great granddaddy about the time it first appeared in the 1980s; I still have it and use it. The design is little changed except that in the new one the chamber about which the blade whirs is more rounded; the pulverized powder does not stick as badly to the sides. But there is the rub, it still does stick. This necessitates the application of a forefinger to dislodge the precious tiny granules from under the blade - owie alert!! Why does Krups not include a small brush that might reside in a holder on the side? Why don't I look for said brush somewhere myself? And this brings up another problem; the coffee is either too fine or too course - no in-between. This can make the coffee either a bit more bitter than it needs to be or a bit weak. How do you solve this problem - buy a good burr grinder for a lot more dough. If you are a real coffee aficionado (or affectianado), pop for a better grinder and the blissful beans from Orens for Sunday brunch. But those grinders are slow and expensive. This thing costs less now than it did in the 80's when adjusted for inflation and on a Tuesday morning when you are in a hurry, the noise (akin to the run-up of a 747) wakes you up before the coffee even starts brewing. Bonus! Our kat leaves the room meowing in complaint at the high frequency. But that means the grinding process is fast - in 10 seconds you have disintegrated every bean into something the consistency of fairy dust and you are ready for that soothing glug-a-luga sound of the drip coffee maker. Just add some cream if it is a little bitter. So for a cut above the ground Folgers in the three pound tub, buy this thing and some whole bean 8-O'clock and have a decent cup of joe for just slightly more money.

So bottom line - yes, it is well worth the money. Buy it, just don't expect more out of it than it can provide.

reviews.reviewTitle: I am very pleased with this grinder
reviews.reviewText: I am very pleased with this grinder. After one attempt I found the correct amount of time to grind for a perfect cup of coffee with my Keurig. My previous grinder would leave a sludge at the bottom of the cup. This grinder is perfect with no sludge. It is easy to clean and depending on the roast of the beans there is very little static cling on the lid. The bowl is just the right size for grinding a small amount of beans that when stored will be used in a short period of time and still be fresh.
Works great. Just what I was looking for. I was replacing my old one so it’s basically the same.
Absolutely love this coffee grinder. You can grind as long as you wish. The consistency of the grind is completely perfect.
I love this machine, it grinds coffee down with the greatest of ease and very easy to clean... I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND TO ALL OF MY FAMILY AND FRIENDS!!!

As coffee grinders go, it's quiet and efficient. There's no grind settings, just and on/off switch. Doesn't take up much room on the kitchen counter and the cord is the right length so it's not in the way when the grinder is not in use. I haven't used it to grind spices, but I'm sure it would work well. The unit is fairly priced and seems well constructed. I'm pleased with the purchase.
Love it. Its easy to use, easy to clean, and works great. It takes abit of getting used to to find your grind that you need but otherwise it couldn't be simpler to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for coffee, flaxseed, nuts, etc.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this 3 years ago and it's still working great. I use it mainly for coffee but on occasion for grinding flaxseeds and nuts like almonds and cashews. I have a French press and this grinder isn't so good at getting a coarse grind (if I try for a coarse grind it usually ends up fine with a few chunks). But I also have your run-of-the-mill brewer and it gets a really nice fine grind for that. Very easy to clean the lid and base.
Good grinder for the price. The bean grind size as a bit inconsistent, but this is to be expected with this style grinder. Shaking the grinder when it runs seems to help make a more consistent grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: Noisy but does a good job of grinding coffee beans
reviews.reviewText: Works great for grinding coffee beans. Strong powerful motor (almost too strong, it's noisy and scares my cats). This sure beats grinding beans by hand though. I wish there was a way to clean this, but there's not.
Great product and a reliable coffee grinder. I had puchased the same grinder years ago and it lasted for years. Was happy to purchase it again this time around.

Works great for grinding my coffee in the morning. Fast, and simply. I have used a burr grinder in the past, but it always jammed, this works better for my purpose. It's a little difficult to clean, but I only use it for coffee, so no problem unless you plan on interchanging spices/coffee/nuts/herbs/etc. often.

reviews.reviewTitle: Could do a hell of a lot better with 20 bucks
reviews.reviewText: Only grinds enough for one pot at a time, no removable reservoir, hard to remove grinds from

This grinder does a good job for a blade grinder.
The grinds are consistent in size, but if you grind too long you get a powder.
This problem exists for any blade grinder though.

This particular grinder is a breeze to use, and has a built in safety so you don't grind your fingers while cleaning.
It is also very easy to wipe out with a damp cloth, which makes cleaning very simple.

Buy this unless you want to spend big bucks for a really nice grinder.

Does the job it is intended to do! It will grind the beans to a very fine powder in probably 20 seconds. It's exactly what I was looking for... just a simple, relatively inexpensive grinder that will do its job and not break down. Seems to be very solid quality. After 3 months of use, I'm very pleased.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds coffee beans but not as good for nuts.
reviews.reviewText: It is sleek in design and grinds coffee beans great, from coarse to fine, but cannot grind nuts coarse; it's either fine ground (paste like) or leaves the nuts whole, there's no middle ground, pardon the pun. I bought this item so I could grind pecans coarse for my toffee recipe, but because it doesn't have the ability to do this, I've decided to continue to use my manual nut grinder. I will still keep this product for grinding coffee beans, and only for that.
Love how easy it is to use, big ut us slightly trickier to clean—not impossible, but the fine granules get lodged under the blade easily.
This is perfect for what I need. I use it to grind coffee beans. That’s it. Easy to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product, built to last with some design flaws
reviews.reviewText:
I gave this four stars because the product does what it is supposed to do. HOWEVER....

* It is difficult to remove the lid without grinds / spices going everywhere

* It is difficult to clean the blade area

reviews.reviewTitle: We had one for 10 years and never a problem.
reviews.reviewText: It lasted up until some one used it for pepper corns. The taste never came out. Other wise it lasted years.

reviews.reviewTitle: Used once, didn't work after that.
reviews.reviewText: Totally misleading product reviews, used once and it never worked again. Spent hours cleaning out the coffee grinder, trying to figure out why the coffee maker would not work and ultimately gave up. Disappointed to have this happen on Christmas day, no more Krups product.
Use this little powerhouse all the time for grinding coffee beans. No complaints.

The coffee grinder is now manufactured in China, our old one was made by Braun in Germany. But the performance and workmanship was just as good as the old one that finally died after 40+ years. This one was $18 something, less than the original one.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this. I ground my coffee beans and get ...
reviews.reviewText: I love this. I ground my coffee beans and get to enjoy a real cup of coffee

reviews.reviewTitle: Light easy to use and convenient
reviews.reviewText: Have used these krups grinders for years and year and give them away all the time. Cannot beat 'em.
Quickly grinds coffee. Easy to operate and easy to clean.
Gave this to my daughter for a housewarming gift - she loves it!
Bought this to grind coffee. It's easy to use and clean. Does a good job grinding.
Last Krups grinder lasted 20 years with everyday use. So glad I was able to replace it with identical item!

Grinder broke after only a few months of use.
Super loud also.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not worth the money since it stopped working after only using a few times.
reviews.reviewText: It stopped working or unable to propel the blades in less than a year. We only used it maybe 6 or 7 times. Do not buy this one since we now have to buy another grinder. We purchased this May, 2016 and it is now April, 2017. Not worth the money spent on it.
Overall this is a great grinder for the price! The only complaint I have is that the grounds get stuck in the bottom of the grind area and must be scraped out to prevent further caking.
This coffee grinder worked well for about 5 months. We took extremely good care of it but it all of a sudden stopped working. Very disappointed that it just stopped working on us one morning.
I have two of these and bought another for a family member. I prefer French press coffee and use it to grind whole beans. Been using it for years and still going strong.

This is a nice quality grinder, I feel like it would last a long time. But, just like all grinders of this type it gives such an inconsistent grind. Some of the grounds will be dust, some will be about right, and a few beans will just be split in half. I think it would be better for grinding spices rather than coffee. It just seems like they could come up with a better design, perhaps a 2 or 3 blade system, like the ninja blender??? I wish I would have bought a bur grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: I've been known to burn up a few grinders by different manufacturers and so far this one is awesome. If it can handle what I'm d
reviews.reviewText: I use these to grind up fuel for amateur rocketry and it is very taxing on the motor. I've been known to burn up a few grinders by different manufacturers and so far this one is awesome. If it can handle what I'm doing then coffee should be no stress at all on this grinder.

Bought this for my husband for a Christmas gift and it still works great. Grinds the coffee beans in seconds! I noticed at the time of purchase that you could also buy an add-on brush to clean it. I would actually recommend this because the ground coffee towards the bottom tends to "stick" and I have to use my finger to get it loose. I think the brush would help pro-long the life of the grinder as well.
Had it for just over a month and it broke... hopefully this new one I ordered lasts a little longer at least!
At $19 this was a steal. Grinds everything from coffee to spices perfectly. But it’s not a work horse it must be used with a bit of finesse and gentle handling.

I've bought better grinder.
No coarseness selectable knob...
Unevenly outcomes...due to guessing works.
Debris'd fallen all over countertop every time I'd open the lid....
Not for my gravity dripping system....
Heavy fine grinned past ended settling at bottom of my cup...

Use this grinder for spices the last one I had was Krups as well had it at least for 15 years got it for free with order of Gevalia coffee, finally it broke so I found this one on Amazon, so far so good lets see how long its going to be around hopefully its still same superior quality

reviews.reviewTitle: This thing is great. Way better than that piece of garbage that ...
reviews.reviewText: This thing is great. Way better than that piece of garbage that I… well, threw into the garbage. It actually grindss coffee. If you are looking for a coffee grinder, then you have come to the right place. It has the perfect combination of price, efficiency, and… Sorry, I guess it only has those two features. It's a coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: The strong smell of burnt rubber
reviews.reviewText: Got this coffee grinder. I tried to grind sugar works good, but the strong smell of burnt rubber from the wire. I will hope that the grinder will not burn.

I loved the idea of having the grinder part of the coffee maker! Too many times programming it for the morning only to find a extremely weak cup of coffee due to the beans getting stuck in the grinder. Decided to send it back and just grind my beans at the store.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a good grinder for a good price
reviews.reviewText: It's a good grinder for a good price. Just don't put too many beans in it at once or you'll end up with a very uneven grind, which can be irritating when making coffee with a french press. It's a nice, small size... easy for storing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product, especially for the price!
reviews.reviewText: Love it, especially for the price! It works as a standard, one speed grinder. Great for pulsing the beans to a coarse grind or fully blending down to a finer grind. It’s slightly inconvenient to clean, but that’s with any electric appliance. Would definitely buy again, glad I purchased!

I bought this to grind herbs with, I was getting tired of crushing them. It works great for this and takes no time at all doing it. I would think it would work just as good grinding coffee beans. I seems to be built very well and not out of flimsy cheep plastic ether because I dropped mine cleaning it up and it did not get a scratch on it and works like new. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a good grinder.
Read a lot of reviews and saw a lot of videos about different grinders, and finally decided to buy this one. It is great for the price.

This grinder is excellent! I had bought the Melitta grinder but not only did it have a lot of useless features, like grind setting and number of cups, it also died after the second use! I don't need those fancy features anyway - as anyone who has ground their own coffee for any length of time knows, you can tell by the sound the beans make how fine the grind is.

At first, this product would have been given a 5 star rating. Purchased 2 for my daughters last Christmas to go along with a French press coffee maker. One of my daughters has had no problems but the other has only used hers about 6 times and it just completely stopped working. Thought a coffee bean or something was causing it not to function, but my husband looked at it, who can fix anything, and found no reason other than the motor stopped working. based on this I would not recommend it. I purchased a kitchen aid grinder to replace and am hoping for better quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: It broke after only using it a few times
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this a while ago but used an older one for the longest. We finally started using this one, but it broke after we used it maybe 5-6 times. Very poor quality.
Stopped working after 7 months. Sounds like the motor is fried. Waste of money.

We use this same coffee grinder at my workplace and it has been running strong for over 2 years of daily use. Clearly I decided to get one for home use. You can grind your beans as rough or as fine as you like. Cleaning it is simple and it's small enough to be stored almost anywhere. Easily recommendable.

I think mine was open before. Amazon will do this. But was now used.
