Works, well, not too loud, unfortunately in US this is the only normal grinder that will not overheat, not too loud and looks elegant enough to stay on the counter for daily use. Bodum has overheating issues I heard. This one is made in China, which is good since last one was made in mexico. Don't know if plastic will get cloudy have it for a week only.

The Krups F203 is a powerful coffee grinder and does a good job grinding the beans into a fine grind. The length of grind affects how fine the grind is. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is, there has to be a better way of getting the ground coffee out without using your fingers.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awful product. This is the second one I bought ...
reviews.reviewText: Awful product. This is the second one I bought . Both times the motors froze up. One time after about 6 months and this time froze up after only 3 weeks. Missed the deadline sending it back by about a week. Do not buy this product !

reviews.reviewTitle: if you like grinding your coffee
reviews.reviewText:
I never knew grinding coffee was a thing, if you like grinding your coffee, use this.
I'm assuming it gets the job done because I bought it as a gift, quite a while ago.

I'm sure I would have heard something, by now, if it didn't live up to its purpose.

Not a huge fan. It grinds stuff at different levels of courseness and then a bunch of really fine ground stuff gets stuck on the bottom. I'll keep it in case I ever buy whole bean coffee again, but not thrilled with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very useful for the home cook or barista!
reviews.reviewText: Part of getting a great cup of coffee out of your coffee maker is fresh ground beans. I can really tell the difference that's why I love this Krups grinder. I like it so much I purchased two; one for coffee and one for spices. A few quick pulses give you a coarse grind or you can give a steady pulse to grind fine enough for espresso. Fresh will always taste better and grinding coffee or spices really brings out the flavor in both.

Just a few short months after purchasing the coffee grinder it stopped working. This our second grinder just like this one that stopped working. Looking for another grinder to ensure it no longer breaks.

reviews.reviewTitle: A bit disappointed as the lid goes inside the base so when ...
reviews.reviewText: A bit disappointed as the lid goes inside the base so when you try to open it, grounds scatter all over the counter leaving a mess. I've found that holding the grinder near to me and wiggling gets it off with a little less mess but really disappointed since it has such great reviews. It will do for now as it does grind well but the grinder has to be full to get a good grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like that I can buy whole bean coffee and grind ...
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is quite practical. I like that I can buy whole bean coffee and grind just enough when I want to have a cup of java.
I use this for grinding herbs and other kitchen food items. It has done everything I have needed it for. I would order again as a gift!!

I use this for espresso beans and it works pretty well, It's not completely uniform, but pretty close, for this kind of machine. The coffee does get stuck in the bottom of the grinder, but I just use my fingers to easily get it of and pour it into the lid. I then pour that into my portafilter. I grind it for 10 sec intervals, shaking in between, for about 70-80 seconds, in case anyone is wondering.

reviews.reviewTitle: It has VERY BAD quality! Stay away!
reviews.reviewText:
It has VERY BAD quality!
I bought this TWICE in ONE year, and GOSH both of them were broken suddenly in 6 months.
The customer service rep at Amazon did not take care of warranty, you have to go to the stupid company website to file warranty and find a repair store, which is nowhere near where I live.

Anyways, I highly suggest you consider other products than this one!

Ok, this is the first coffee grinder I have ever bought, but why had no one mentioned how messy it is?!! Are they all like this?

No matter how much I tap the lid every time I open it coffee grounds sprinkle around. I guess I could open over the sink every time, but rarely seem to remember nor do I think I should have to do so to avoid cleaning up coffee grounds ever morning.

Does the job but makes a mess!!

I bought it to grind my whole spices and it works great for it. I learned to keep a small paintbrush near it so it was easy to brush out the remaining spice and to clean it. I use a rag with vinegar to wipe it clean it between grindings. It has enough power to grind allspice, peppercorns, cloves. Warning once you grind fresh, you will never go back to store bought.

I hated this product and shipped it back immediately. It is louder then the Hamilton grinder I had, didn't grind all the beans and messy...very messy when you open it. I absolutely hated it and ordered another Hamilton.

reviews.reviewTitle: i was not satisfied since beginning but still continued to use it
reviews.reviewText: the grinder did not even last a year! i was not satisfied since beginning but still continued to use it. The quality was no way near to me previous Krups grinder which lasted so much longer. Highly disappointed!!
Works well. I grind the coffee beans for 2 cups each morning. Works well for espresso machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is garbage will break almost immediately fork
reviews.reviewText: Unused this grinder maybe 5 times in the 5 months times we had it been buying ground coffee lately. Took it out this morning for some fresh beans I had bought and it just makes a humming sound and doesn’t work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bad design, price is way to high for quality
reviews.reviewText: The pitcher didn’t reach the release on the filter so the filter would fill with water and over flow had to modify it and take the whole release out and now it’s just an open hole from filter to jar

I got the idea of buying a Krups coffee grinder to pulverize dog suuplements and treats from another Amazon review by someone who needed a way to grind up his dog's treats.

My dogs suddenly turned against the supplements they got every day for years. I figured that if I ground them up with treats and mixed them with the food the dogs would eat them. The Krups coffee grinder works beautifully and the dogs eat everything.

Hurrah for Krups! And now for another cup of tea.
We use it as a spice grinder. They work well. My mom has even dropped hers several times and it kept working.

Best little coffee grinder out there, we borrowed o more expensive one from a friend before buying this one, and I'm so glad we saved money and went with this one as it works perfectly for grinding my specialty coffees for making one pot at a time. The cord is a little short, but it's manageable.

It's misleading and false advertising to have 2 entirely different products under one listing and all 10,000+ reviews lumped together. With that being said it should be made clear that I'm reviewing the blade grinder, not the burr grinder that is also offered in this listing. The blade grinder is poorly designed. Once the coffee is ground it is impossible to get the grounds into the coffee maker without spilling them (and wasting them) all over the counter/floor because as soon as the lid is removed the grounds spill- whether it's upside down or right side up when you remove the lid, it doesn't matter coffee will go everywhere. I tried pouring the grounds directly from the grinder into the coffee maker as well as pouring them from the lid into the coffee maker- mess either way. If you like cleaning up coffee grounds whilst having your morning cuppa joe then this is the grinder for you. Enjoy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder for the home espresso drinker
reviews.reviewText: I had bought a grinder about a year before that worked ok, but got clogged and eventually died. This machine works far better with a deep well for the beans and has a ton of power. Also just feels better built to last. My only grip is that there are no auto time settings so you have to hold the button down.

reviews.reviewTitle: Product changed in last 20 years..for worst.
reviews.reviewText: Died within 6 months. Looking for a new one now. Had the same product 20 years ago,,,,and it worked perfectly for many years. Sadly, this product is not the same. Hope to find another brand I will LOVE for many years to come.
Could not find anything like this at Bed,Bath,Beyond. Just love the way it works!!!
Grinds very nicely. May be a little Loud but it's a workhorse so I can deal with a little noisy gribdibg once in a while. Very happy with this purchase.
This grinder replaced the Krupp’s grinder that I used for thirty years. I will use the old one for chopping nuts.
Works great. Only thing is the clean up on the inside. Either I dont know how it removes from the base or it just dident lol. I use it for herbs and spices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great quality and price is amazing!
reviews.reviewText: Such high quality for the price! I use this one solely to grind spices but you can tell this thing was made with love and hardware! Probably will get another for people who drink coffee haha.

It works well. I don’t get the burning smell most others do but then again I don’t set it and forget it lol. I pulse it for 2-3 seconds at a time. Even if you want the grind to be fine, it doesn’t take much for this thing to get it done. I highly recommend if you’re looking for a grinder.

Very nice unit. Grinds very efficiently and is reasonably quiet. Some thought has gone into the design of this grinder. I would recommend it to anyone wanting to grind coffee, herbs or certain spices.

reviews.reviewTitle: I also felt like it wasn't very powerful and I sent it back
reviews.reviewText: The canister part of this coffee grinder is just so small but that may be normal for a coffee grinder. I also felt like it wasn't very powerful and I sent it back.

MY SECOND ONE. BOUGHT THIS SAME COFFEE BEAN GRINDER 10 YEARS AGO AND IT'S STILL GRINDING MY FRESH COFFEE BEANS. (AWESOME). SAW THIS KRUPS AGAIN ON AMAZON. SO BOUGHT IT CAUSE THE PRICE WAS RIGHT FOR ME. THIS WAY I HAVE TWO OF THEM, KIND OF A BACK-UP FOR ME AS I COULD NOT MAKE IT THROUGH THE DAY IF I COULDN'T HAVE MY MORNING CUP OF COFFEE USING MY FRESHLY GROUND COFFEE BEANS. THE NEW ONE IS AS GOOD AS THE FIRST ONE. DECIDED TO USE THE NEW ONE AND KEEP THE OLD ONE AS A SPARE. AS TO MY MORNING COFFEE, AS ARTHUR G. USE TO SAY, "GOOD TO THE LAST DROP".

reviews.reviewTitle: Takes forever to empty all grounds.
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this machine as a replacement for my wife's beloved Braun grinder which is apparently not made anymore. She likes the shape and the similar blade action but it is a pain in the A** to clean. The grounds stick to the bottom and sides and takes longer to clean all the grounds out than it does to grind in the first place.

Won't be buying this item again. Too bad.
My husband enjoys using this spice grinder for his coffee beans.
Good little coffee grinder grinds it up fast in nicely
Ordered in March , used it twice a week, it’s already broken !!!! Less than half year ,, poor quality!

Our first coffee grinder, we're really happy with this purchase and use it daily. To get a more even grind, I sometimes 'shake' it as it's on. We've also used this to grind egg shells to a fine powder (used for making dog food). Happy with this product
these run forever. used to make grain flour and spice grinding. works good so far.
Nice little unit a little hard to clean though wish it could be disassembled more to clean under the blade

reviews.reviewTitle: So noisy that I need to use ear plugs to ...
reviews.reviewText: So noisy that I need to use ear plugs to protect my ears when using it. Impossible to transfer the coffee after it has been ground without getting coffee all over the counter. Grinds a small amount of coffee. I believe this is one of the most popular brands, but I don't know why.

This is sleek, small, and great grinding coffee beans, nuts, or seeds. I bought one for myself and one for my grandma in fall 2013. Mine died two years in, right after the warranty was up. My grandma's died yesterday; she used it daily. I bought her the same kind, since paying roughly $10 per year for this is worth it.
Bought this to grind peppercorns. Love it! Does a great job.
Bought it & Use it. The grounds get stuck from time to time. Knock em out on the granite and sweep it into the filter or for storage the following morning. It's a simple device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working after a few uses
reviews.reviewText: I used this for grinding spices. It worked great. After using it less than 5 times it just stopped working. Now it only makes a humming sound.

reviews.reviewTitle: I've had it 2 years now and it works great. Hold down for fine grind
reviews.reviewText: I've had it 2 years now and it works great. Hold down for fine grind, or use very short pulses with power button for just a few seconds for a more coarse grind. You'll figure it out with use on how to get the grind you want. Can't beat it for price and durability.
My husband loves this! Like a kid with a toy!! It is small, perfect for him and I to grind beans for a couple of cups of expression!

The product does the job and grind spices well. The power button is easy to use. The only thing I dislike was that the lid turned opaque from transparent in one use. I tried to clean that but that didn’t work. Not sure about the durability since I just got it a week ago.

I bought this to grind spices and it was the highest rated at America's Test Kitchen. It worked great for about 3 months of intermittent use. After that it wouldn't start - it just hummed but the blades wouldn't rotate. It was brushed out after every use so there wasn't debris clogging the mechanism. I returned it with no problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: knowing fresh is best. This product made it easy to do
reviews.reviewText: I was nervous about this product, as I have never ground my own coffee, but have always wanted to, knowing fresh is best. This product made it easy to do. Fairly easy to clean. And my latte was wonderful. So much better than starbucks. :) I am going to buy another one to ground nuts, seeds, and such. Very happy with this purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great coffee grinder! Easy to use
reviews.reviewText: So I usually buy the 40oz bag of coffee beans and grind them at the store. The taste changes after I’m down to about half of the bag ( obviously) . So I decided to buy this grinder for that reason so I can have that initial fresh tasting coffee and I gotta say best decision ever! It works great , should have bout it sooner!
Loving it! Loving it! Where have you been all my life?

reviews.reviewTitle: Good all around, clean up a bit annoying
reviews.reviewText: Cleaning is a bit annoying, but otherwise it's great for grinding spices.

reviews.reviewTitle: pretty damn good for the price
reviews.reviewText: no issues, works like a work horse! for the price I paid, cannot be happier. nothing fancy, does the job. I bought it for my office and use it to grind beans 3-4 times every day. never disappointed to this date. It doesn't create a fine dust grinding, it's not a burr grinder, but for a blade grinder, phenomenal. Wouldn't pay a penny more for anything else unless you're going to get a burr grinder.

I bought this almost a year ago and it stopped working and just humms. And it is my second one- the one before I loved as well but it would freeze up, but I would push the blades and get it going again but with my current one moving the blades does not help. Wondering if they have a warranty of a year because I am almost there.

I purchased this to make baby cereals. It performs beautifully and quickly. It ground my grains to the perfect grind for my baby's cereals ( Rice & grains). It is super easy to clean- just use a brush ( like a clean make-up brush) and a bit of blowing air and a quick wipe out. I highly recommend this product to others using it for the same purpose.
I have not used this for coffee ( not until I am finished using it for baby food grains)

reviews.reviewTitle: Appliances are not what they used to be.
reviews.reviewText: Very cheaply made compared to one before. Plastic replaces metal

reviews.reviewTitle: So it becomes very tedious to have well ground nuts
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to grind nuts for baking. It works okay, for that but you have to do small batches, stop a lot, clear the grinding chamber and then grind the nuts multiple times. So it becomes very tedious to have well ground nuts. Also it is very hard to clean, particularly if the nuts are at all moist.

It starts like this: my parents grind coffee every single morning. I watched them do it all throughout high school. I didn't really understand what the difference was, nor did I really care all that much about it. Then I got to college and bought cheap, pre-ground coffee from the store. Then I understood. I haven't gotten around to buying this, and my own coffee beans until this year, but I will say that this is perfect and allows me to grind and brew much better coffee than offered in the pre-ground section at the store.

Note: I've had this grinder for about two weeks now. First grinder I've owned. I've only used one other grinder (my parents, which is pretty old). In other words, this is a simple review, with no professional coffee maker/brewer base to it. I'm in college, to say the least. Just trying to be a little sophisticated, or something like that.

As far as the construction of this grinder, it's perfect. Yeah, it says you can grind other things inside of it, but I don't bake or anything so I have no need for it, other than grinding almonds for my oatmeal in the morning, which turned out to be one of my best decisions next to buying the grinder itself. It's a solid machine. Doesn't make too much noise for my five suite mates or apartment roomies or whatever you want to call them. They also use it for their own coffee as well. It holds the perfect amount of beans, and grinds them very well and efficiently.

Functionality- its perfect, for me at least. I just want to grind coffee so it can taste better. That's it. I'm not into the whole "fine grind, coarse grind" thing. I don't particularly care if the coffee beans are ground to a dust. It still goes into the coffee machine, in the filter, and I don't find chunks in my coffee. Sometimes it misses a bean or something, but there were like thirty other beans in there that got ground up so I'm not really missing much in my mind.

Lastly- cleaning the thing. Cleaning is not a fun thing. I don't do it frequently, partially because it's not needed and partially because it's somewhat of a pain, as it would be with any grinder. The coffee sticks to the bottom of it sometimes, meaning I gotta get in there and rotate the blade to get to it all without cutting myself. This is not specific to this grinder, but just is a general statement about cleaning grinders in general. Not a big deal though; it's well worth it in my mind. The clear plastic piece is easy to clean, though. No issues with that at all. A little hot water and it's all good to go.

Again, I'm no coffee connoisseur, but this does what I need it to do, and I get better tasting coffee because of it. I'll update this review if something goes astray. Hope this helps somebody!

Great for the price. Not too noisy, not cumbersome at all, takes up very little space. My only complaint is that it does tend to get rather messy when my husband grinds the beans as he insists on tipping the whole thing over to get the granules into the clear upper chamber because "the beans tend to get stuck underneath the blades". I would chalk that up to mere user error, but who knows...

reviews.reviewTitle: capacity is almost double what I would have expected.....
reviews.reviewText:
This thing handles flax seeds really well....grinds them quickly and evenly.......and holds about DOUBLE what I would have expected from a unit of this size....

I am awaiting a grinder cleaning brush via Amazon to see how easy this thing cleans......eventually, I will use it to grind coffee, but I do not expect any problems....

Glad I purchased this one....

reviews.reviewTitle: The power cord is to short!
reviews.reviewText: The grinder works great, but the power cord to short. We bought this grinder to replace another KRUPS grinder we had used for many years. The old one had a 48 inch power cord that was long enough to reach our outlet. It seems the decided to skimp on this new model and only put on a 26 inch power cord with is not long enough for us. I am very disappointed with this unit!
I use it every single day and it does wonderfully. Super fine grind if you grind it long enough.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little grinder just keeps on working!
reviews.reviewText: This is my second one, not because the first one quit, but because I'm renting a furnished apartment. This is a power horse. It looks great, takes seconds to do the job and will be on my counter for many years. Other models (both more and less expensive) have broken after a few uses and the hassle and cost of the horrid warranties, makes them easier to throw out. Do yourself a favor and just buy this one, ...once. I would recommend this to others...or buy it as a gift...or have a spare in the glove box of the car...at the office :-)

An effective grinder of coffee beans. The combination of the aroma of freshly ground coffee along with the whirr of the blades let's one know that "Yes!", morning is off to a good start. Since this German-named item was actually made in Germany rather than China, we let our Eurocentric leanings make the choice from among the seemingly endless choices available for such a basic kitchen accessory. So far, so good.

Just bought this because my steady old Bosch finally pooped out. Delivered right away, This grinder makes an annoying high-pitched sound, but does do a good job, and I've had some really nice cups of finely ground coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome for us straightforward coffee people
reviews.reviewText: Don't have a coffee grinder? Get this one. You can't beat the price and it gets the job done. A huge improvement over pre-ground coffee. I've had it a few months and use it several times a day. No issues. I did take off one star because the grind isn't 100% consistent (meaning I sometimes fine some slightly bigger pieces) but hasn't affected my coffee.
It makes a mess because the cover does not go on the outside of the grinder & you can’t remove the grinding bowl to clean it. It grinds as well as the others, but it’s a pain to clean.

This grinder grinds well but it does not grind uniformly. There's always a gang of large beans defying the blade. There is an off and on switch but no other controls. By the time you get all the beans ground up some are too fine for the coffee press mesh and you have pour the coffee through a strainer. This might be better for spices or for coffee used in an automatic drip machine.
This worked really well for a few weeks and suddenly stopped working. Not sure what went wrong. But it was very useful when it was working.
It works like a professional coffee grinder I like it alot great coffee grinder
Worked just a described. We've enjoyed grinding our own coffee. Its fast and works perfect every time!

reviews.reviewTitle: Not the best for flax seed for smoothies
reviews.reviewText:
I can speak only to the "spice grinder" part: I got this to grind flax seed with for smoothies, but then discovered that my Ninja blender works even better, and without having to clean up (since the other ingredients are just added afterwards, without having to dump the flax out at the end).
I have no idea how well it works for coffee or anything other than flax for smoothies.
Grind your coffee in seconds

reviews.reviewTitle: I'd use it to make special herbs and spices
reviews.reviewText: I use this to grind herbs and make special seasonings. It has worked perfectly for me.

I am kinda a name brand snob when it comes to my kitchen...so when I needed a new coffee grinder I was immediately looking for a certain brand that matches my other kitchen electrics, or the "best coffee grinder" on the market... I was surprised to read, when compared to grinders who cost upwards of $250-, this lil Krups won???!?!? Well, let me tell you, I used to own a grinder that I paid $150 for (on sale), and this one is waaaay better!! The only con is you have to hold the button down when it grinds, and it doesn't have an automatic setting for the grind coarseness...but if you like a darker brew...just grind a lil more, a lighter brew...leave it a lil coarser... great machine and great bang for the buck!

This is a very nice basic coffee grinder. It has to be cleaned out with a small brush and tissue after each use, but it's small and easy to use.. The blades are not removable, so the unit can't be abused, but after several months of use, it looks like this machine is going to last for a long time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for herbs/peppers. Terrible for coffee
reviews.reviewText: I believe this should only be advertised as a spice grinder. It does a great job with fresh herbs and peppers. When it comes to grinding coffee it leaves a lot to be desired. The grind is very inconsistent. When grinding coffee fine enough for espresso there are bits that get ground so fine they stick to the bottom of the housing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good for coffee and spices
reviews.reviewText: The grind of the coffee is not very uniform for a coarse grind unless you shake the grinder as it's running. For a more fine grind, it works better. I also have one that I use for grinding spices. I can have only a few pepper corns in there, and it still works perfectly. It is very easy to clean, and seems to last a very long time. I have had these for about a year now, and they don't even a scratch on them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best in class. Better than $60 grinders.
reviews.reviewText: Best coffee grinder on the market. Grinds coffee fast and evenly. I have owned four over the years, used for extremely heavy grinding of various substances. (not just coffee). I have never had one die even under extreme abuse. Other grinders I've owned break or burn out within weeks, these are nearly indestructible. I even dropped one in dishwater and it still works. HIGHLY recommended.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great as a spice grinder. Functions perfectly after 3 years
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this for three years now and it still works perfectly. It grinds my spices down to dust, which is what I want. Its the first grinder I've ever owned so nothing to compare it to. I mainly use it for grinding cumin and coriander and it does that with ease. I love it. My only issue is that the plastic cover has inexplicably gotten cracked in three places and a little stained. Doesn't affect the function though. The inside is easy to clean by just wiping out the base and the cover can be washed with your dishes or just wiped out. The scent of the spices does linger in it but that doesn't bother me and may be hard to avoid with such aromatic substances regardless of the device you use.

This was a gift for my daughter. She loves coffee and wanted to grind her own beans. Krups Coffee Grinders are the best. I've had the same one for over 35 years and it still works great and is easy to clean. I highly recommend Krups products.

I bought a new coffee machine and milk frother so a grinder was a must for me. I was skeptical because of the price. I was considering buying a $80 grinder but this is definitely worth every penny. It doesn’t fit a lot of beans but it is easy to use, clean and store.

This product does what it claims, it grinds up coffee. However, for those who are looking for a better cup of coffee, you need a grinder that will produce an even grind. This grinder produces 3 levels of grind, too coarse, just right, and too fine (from top to bottom, respectively). If you drown your coffee in creamer and sugar, then I would suggest this grinder. But if you are looking for a quality cup of fresh coffee, brewed in pour over devices (i.e. Chemex, kalita wave, v60, etc), French press, or aeropress, this is NOT the grinder for you. Save up your money and buy something that will give you the level of quality you are looking for.
Absolutely love this little grinder. Able to grind down my coffee beans into fine powder. Also works on spices.
My 20-yr old KRUPS grinder needed replacing. Nice deep cup on this one. KRUPS is well worth the cost.
Works great, a little hard to get all the grounds out since you can’t get it wet

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds nicely, but lid could be more functional
reviews.reviewText: Grinds coffee nicely and fast. However I'm not happy with the lid. If I grind coffee for two cups and want to leave some in the grinder, it's fairly difficult to close the lid again. Also opening it spreads some ground coffee on the counter always.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very nice product, and it does a great grinding job
reviews.reviewText: Very nice product, and it does a great grinding job. The only thing is that it is a little difficult to get all the grounded coffee out. You have to tip the grinder upside down to shift coffee to the clear cup, or you have to maneuver with a spoon around the blades. Maybe I'm doing something wrong, but I cannot recall this problem with my previous grinder (I don't remember the brand.)

reviews.reviewTitle: Constantly gets jammed, only works in very small portions
reviews.reviewText: This thing has to be used in very small spoonfuls at a time. The motor is too weak to handle the bin being nearly full and beans get stuck jamming the blades. It's a pain to keep grinding in such small portions. You're better off using a hand grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job at a good price
reviews.reviewText:
I wanted to add more spice to my cooking and this one does great work of spices. I tried to use my food processor and even my vitamix to grind up spices but I found that this little powerful device will grind things to a fine consistency .

It has a good motor which will give a new machine smell the first time you use it but goes away after like 5 minutes . The lid also acts as a bowl for catching spices too. I would buy this again

But if you're doing spices and coffee just brush it out

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought this back in November 2016 and it's been ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this back in November 2016 and it's been working as expected since. I've used it for coffee beans, pine nuts, pecans and spices and haven't had any issues. Hoping it will last a long time.

reviews.reviewTitle: works good for the first 3 months
reviews.reviewText: This worked great until it died after 3 months of very light use - about once a week for a few seconds. If you do the math that means it died after less than 5 minutes of actual use. Very disappointing, don't buy!

Good basic grinder, it doesn't grind as evenly as a more expensive or Burr grinder but if you shake it while you grind it does okay. It seems to be loud, but it doesn't wake up my roommates from the kitchen so I suppose it's quiet enough! I use it with my french press when I'm feeling fancy (i.e., not every day), will probably upgrade eventually but it's pretty good for casual use.
After only a few months, the item doesn’t work anymore. The motor is shot.
Excellent product.. works well, almost too well. I literally turned my first batch of coffee beans into dust because I left the grinder on too long.
Very quiet and quick to grind coffee beans! Only negative - cleaning is hard because of the blades. I ended up wiping it with a damp napkin to protect my fingers. Other than that, awesome!

A little on the noisy side but no real
Complaints. It’s quick and has a good grind, I would totally recommend it.

I would have preferred a white coffee grinder, but one of my kids informed me that black was in. I find black a little depressing. White is more buoyant. My family coffee drinkers wanted Krupp’s.

I don’t drink coffee myself, but the family thought it was fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: First impression(2 mornings use)of Krups F203 Elec. Spice/Coffee Mill
reviews.reviewText: This unit is the latest of 6 that I've had over the last 25 years. I like its lightweight, small, oval design and quiet sound(especially in the morning), compared to many others. One feature I do miss is being able to coil the cord around the mill or retract it inside. I've found that it grinds coffee beans well into a powder, extending a VERY EXPENSIVE pound of coffee-R. Bishop

This Krups grinder works amazingly and I've tried better brands like KitchenAid and wasn't as impressed as I was with this one! Grinds things to a very fine powder! So far I've ground coffee and cinnamon sticks (separately) and in both cases I was extremely happy with the results! Cinnamon was a soft, fine powder with no big chunks or pieces left in the chamber. Also the whole coffee beans were perfect espresso grounds in a matter of maybe 30 seconds. Totally worth the money!
Excellent little grinder. We have one at my office, and it's been working great for years. So I bought one for home to grind my flax seeds. It just chews them up like they're not there. Fantastic.

reviews.reviewTitle: It does a great job for my french press and is easy to ...
reviews.reviewText:
I am using this to grind coffee. It does a great job for my french press and is easy to clean up after with just a lightly damp cloth. Depending on the bean i just hold for 3 to 5 seconds and they are ready.

The cord is a little short I could use another 1/2 foot or so.
2018 Christmas gift for my dad, and he LOVES IT!! Uses it EVERYDAY! Glad to see him using it so frequently and loving it as much as he does!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good grinder, but make sure this is what you ...
reviews.reviewText: Good grinder, but make sure this is what you want. I ended up getting a burr grinder because I wanted a consistent coarse grind for my French Press. This grinder is not a burr grinder. It is good at grinding coffee finely. It's not really meant for a coarse grind.

I bought this grinder not for coffee but to grind grains such as flax seed. It works absolutely fantastic. It doesn't hold that much at one time, I'd say around a half cup of seeds, but within a couple of seconds the seeds are ground completely. It doesn't take much time to grind a good amount of seeds or beans in multiple half cup cycles. If you are in the market for a bean or seed grinder, this is the one.

This has always been my go-to coffee and spice grinder. I have two (one for coffee, one for spices), and I've given several as gifts. I had to buy a new one because one of my 20+-year old ones stopped working (a wire in the cord broke). I'll actually fix that one of these days and downstream it to one of my kids, where it will probably last many more years.
I also use it for flax seeds. Nice reliable unit that is both easy and safe to use.
Absolutely awesome and great quality. I would absolutely recommend this product and seller!

Use this every day to grind coffee for an espresso maker. Works great. Only thing that would make it better is if it were larger to hold enough coffee for two espressos. I expect this thing to work for years.
I use this primarily for grinding coffee and it does a fantastic job. Would recommend! Great product at a great price.
Don’t buy it! Bought 2 and both had grinder fails. Took too long for the company to replace. Great product if it worked.
Ordered as a gift, was smaller than it looked but worked fine.

So far so good. I wish the power cord was a bit longer. I feel like the plastic cover will eventually break. I've had it 4 months and so far so good, but I will update if/when the lid breaks. Without the lid, it will be useless as the lid is required to activate the grinder. It is a very tight fit, and seems like weak plastic material that will eventually break.
I never thought that I would use one of these, but it is great grinds my coffee beans to my standard. The price was great also.

I bought this as a gift for my son. He uses it to grind fresh spices and dried herbs for his cooking. Picky little devil!! Note that if you use it for spices and for coffee, you should clean it out between uses. Do that by grinding a few tablespoons of raw white rice and then wiping it out. I have a similar model myself, and it's lasted several years so far... Krups is a reliable brand.

The grinder works well for what I bought it for; Spices. It turns every spice to powder in 15 seconds or less albeit not perfectly even. I do not find the uneven grind to be an issue. There is one thing that bothers me. In order to dump the spices you have to work close to the power outlet. The cord is short, you can't detach the cord, and you can't remove the bowl. I would buy this again for my purposes but some may find these issues too much.

reviews.reviewTitle: Reliable and economical, does the job and then some
reviews.reviewText: Oddly enough I am using this for pulverizing fish food into a fine powder to feed my bamboo shrimp, but I have one in white that my Mother gave me that is about 35 years old that works as good as this one. KRUPS is a great company and this grinder is an awesome investment. Use it for coffee, spices, or grinding fish food to feed to bamboo shrimp (lol). It does the job, whatever it may be.

Lid fits so tight that it's hard to remove post grind. And when you do remove, grinds get all over your counter. We need to clean the counter after each grind. Poorly designed. Looking online for a replacement.
I bought two and use one for coffee and the other for, ahem, herbs and such. I am very satisfied with these.
Does the job but cleaning it is annoying since too much residue is left in afterwards due to its design. Not to mention the waste. I guess for $20 you can’t ask for much right? Lol
cord a little short, but otherwise no problems after a few weeks of using it every day

reviews.reviewTitle: Same as the one it's replacing
reviews.reviewText: We have several of these in different locations. They work. A bit of a nuisance to have to clean with each use as it has "nooks and crannies" but a small paint brush does get to them. They've been reliable and work for years. I didn't give it the "I love it" rating because I would buy something else if I came across something that appealed to me more. But these are good, work well, and are reliable. And the cost is okay.

reviews.reviewTitle: This grinder worked fine for 6 weeks and then just stopped working entirely
reviews.reviewText: This grinder worked fine for 6 weeks and then just stopped working entirely. Was never dropped or damaged. Can it be replaced, seller?

Love this coffee maker. The sound of it starting up in the morning, and perfect every time............And then the grinder stopped working and now it just a coffee make. Only lasted 3 months before it burned out. Make sure you get an extended warranty on this unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Blade Jammed After A Handful Of Uses
reviews.reviewText: This product stopped working after a few months of occasional use. We probably use the grinder about once a week, if that. All of a sudden, the blade is jammed and won’t spin, though the motor is on. Very disappointed.
I use this product to finely grind my senior dogs kibbles since they are too hard to chew. I like everything about this product except it's a little loud.

Perfect for grounding up coffee beans and weed!
The noise isn’t very loud and it’s a easy clean up! Made a fanatasic Christmas gift!

I can't seem to get the cover off without spilling grounds all over my counter.

I'm not completely inept, but I'm open to the possibility that I am opening this grinder incorrectly.

For now, I'm giving it a 'meh' rating until I receive divine inspiration on how to open the darn thing without having to dust off my counters and floors afterward.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good value, quieter than they used to be.
reviews.reviewText: I had to replace a coffee bean shredder after many years of use. After pricing them, I decided to get a traditional coffee grinder. This one works just as well as more expensive devices, and is a lot quieter than the one I had back in the day.

Our former Krups finally died after 19 years with us. This updated one seems less sturdy (made of lesser materials?) and is an odd shape, making it difficult to just hold it over the top of the French press and drop the ground coffee in. I am not looking forward to having this one for years before it dies. Sad, but a necessary kitchen gadget.
A little loud but excellent product for the price works great
Second coffee grinder purchased and no complaints here. Works like a charm and coffee is easily ready to use in no time.
This is really a great coffee grinder. It's a little hard to clean but it's easy to use and works really well.
I love my coffee grinder! I wish I purchased it way earlier. Freshly ground coffee every day in just minutes!

I thought this looked a little chicer than my cuisinart grinder, so I decided to downgrade that one to use as a spice grinder and get this for coffee. The lid sticks a little and for some reason the coffee ends up kind of packed down in the bottom so it doesn't all come out without some scraping with a spoon; this means I usually have grounds to wipe off my counter after I use it. It's a minor annoyance, but I thought I'd share since these are the things I like to know when I'm shopping around for appliances.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds perfectly & keeps on keeping on!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I moved to my own Granny unit and left the other one in the main house. My old one is still going strong after more than 15 years!
Hard to get grounds out without making a huge mess. It does grind nicely.

It does great with whole beans and for such a small product, it really does make coffee beans to grounds perfectly. Great for a small amount of coffee beans. Cleaning isn’t too bad but it’s never perfect because of the blades and not being able to wash it directly with water.

The automatic grind then brew feature does not work consistently. Sometimes great coffee, sometimes dishwater. I would have returned it but it was a gift to parents and I only learned recently they were not using it because of the inconsistent brewing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good but lasts less than 6 months.
reviews.reviewText: Good for grinding coffee and spices. Shame it doesn’t last long. Died after 5 months.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very cheap and easy to use and so is the cleaning surprisingly
reviews.reviewText:
Very cheap and easy to use and so is the cleaning surprisingly.
How I clean it: I grab a power towel sheet and tear a piece off so I can use it to get rid of the loosely coffee grounds.
I tear off another piece and pour some water to get rid of the harder parts, specially around the blades. Then I finally use the remaining paper towel to dry the base.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works but results are not as great.
reviews.reviewText: Difficult to clean and turns hot if used multiple times. Sizes of the ground coffee beans vary. It is ok for people who drink once in a while a coffee from fresh ground beans. Regulary grinders please invest more money
Works as expected. Fresh grinding makes good coffee tastes better. If a fine product is desired make sure you shake the grinder a few times.
Absolutely the best coffee grinder , quick and efficient
Great little grinder. It’s easy to use a feels like it will be around for a while. Quality

reviews.reviewTitle: There's no easy way to clean it out though as the grind ...
reviews.reviewText: It's a powerful grinder! It pulverized my coffee in no time. There's no easy way to clean it out though as the grind area is integrated into the electronics so you can't rinse it out over the sink.

reviews.reviewTitle: does what the other reviewers says it does
reviews.reviewText: My mom got me a different grinder that she loved. The one she got me doesn't chop flax seeds, and that's what I wanted it for. The minute I got this home, I tried it on flax seeds, and it does a great job. Simple and easy. The only drawback, which doesn't really matter much to me, is that you have to turn it upside down to get all the stuff out of the lid, which serves as the cup. No biggie.
No chance at getting a consistent blend. I used it for coffee beans and there was everything from fine powder to half sized beans.
Good quality, nice grind. Worth it.
This grinder works great i just wish the steel basket was taller. Makes a fine ground coffee.

it's easy to use. However, it is not easy to clean around the blades. Noise level is high, but this is to be expected.
It does what I needed and that is to ground whole bean coffee.
Sturdy grinder for coffee and dried fruits.
This is a great little grinder and fantastic value for the price. Not much to say but works as designed!
Krups makes a good grinder. I had my last on since 1991 and it still worked to this day but I think the motor was slowly giving out so I decided to buy a new one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job, but could be designed better
reviews.reviewText: It does the job, I just wish it was designed to be able to get the grounds out of the grinder. The clear plastic top goes halfway into the body of the grinder. When you remove it you get grounds potentially falling out and also stuck in the cover. The grounds that stay in the grinder are hard to completely sweep out.
I don’t drink coffee I use this for eggshells for my worm composting bin and it works great! Powderes a dozen up in a few seconds

Use it to make coffee three to four times a week. I also use it to make my own spices including my own chili powder. Tip: make sure you clean it very well after making chili powder. Grind white rice granules several times and rinse in between. Unless of course you really don't like your roommate and he enjoys coffee.

Replaced a really old grinder of similar type by Cusinart, This one works great and I like it since it has a larger capacity for beans so I can grind more at once. Of course the grind depends on how long you hold the button down. I like mine ground fine for an espresso machine. Some powder tends to cake under the blades. I have developed a habit of holding it up when I push the button and tilt it sideways back and forth during grinding to facilitate mixing. One would do well to count the seconds for the grind you like so to be more consistent over time. I believe it takes about 10 seconds to get to a fine enough grind. After done I put the gound coffee into a small can making a day or two's worth at one time so it is always fresh. One needs to use their finger or another object to get the caked product out of the bottom but it is not a big deal. It is easy to clean with a paper towel around the inside tapping the remainder out. I found a small brush which I use to get grind out of the crevasses. Overall I find it is a great value and works well for small portions.
I received two delicious bags of Geva coffee beans for Christmas and decided to purchase this grinder. Work well and provides fresh ground coffee as the need arrives! Highly recommend!

For the cost, this is a great grinder. I love beans, but I hate using the store’s grinder. This gets the job done. I felt like I was at a lodge the first morning I made coffee after grinding beans. The bottom grinds require some digging, but whatever. Great value.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Little Grinder - does the job
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Krupp's mini blender - apparently last for years. - Grinds my coffee just the way I want it. Get a second one for spices and such - the plastic remembers that cumin smell.
It is everything the description says it is.

Finally retired this grinder after purchasing a larger fuller featured coffee grinder.
NEVER failed me and did the job for many years. Highly recommended.

This little coffee grinder is terrific! I was skeptical at first that it would work efficiently and adequately - so I'm happy to report it definitely gets the job done!! Plenty of power AND easy to use/clean up! Love it!! And I've found it easy to get a more course grind OR a fine grind. The pulse control button can be tapped intermittently to get the grind you prefer.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Coarse Ground Coffee IS Possible With This Grinder!
reviews.reviewText: I've never had a problem getting a coarse grind with this grinder. Just "pulse" it instead of letting it grind away. Check the grind between pulses until you have the grind you want. If you find you are getting powdery residue, just grind less coffee beans at a time. I've been using it for years with no problems - Happy Grinding!
love this. it is strong and blades do a fabulous job. definitely worth the money.
It worked great for about 9 months. Now it makes a sound but blades do not turn. Looks like motor is shot.
Coffee really tastes much better when grinding the seeds at home. Easy to use and clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice, love it, strongly recommend it.
reviews.reviewText: Very good, the best coffee powder maker, also useful to powder other ingredients used for cooking. Love it, this is the second one I have, the previous one lasted at least 8+ years.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Little Coffee Grinder That Could
reviews.reviewText: We had a grinder like this for over 20 years but the blade just wore out. We replaced it with a "superior" model by another manufacturer and spent over twice as much for the item. It ground coffee but was impossible to transfer the coffee to pot without a mess and difficult to clean. We finally gave up and bought another Krups and again it works great with ease. My husband is blind and can again make the coffee without a mess.
I love the size of this. It’s great. I don’t like how difficult it is to clean though.
I have used it for coffee beans only. The motor still runs and the lower part of the grinder gets warm, but the blades do not move. I am going to try to return it.

reviews.reviewTitle: This was perfect and handled the task without missing a beat
reviews.reviewText: Had some Guatemalan Coffee that needed to be ground. This was perfect and handled the task without missing a beat. Easy to adjust based on time from couse to fine

Works like a charm. You can control how coarse or fine it is based on how long you keep the blades spinning. Very elementary in function, which is also its greatest strength; simplicity = convenience.

reviews.reviewTitle: Surprised at How Awesome this is
reviews.reviewText: For the price I wasn't sure what I was going to get. This has exceeded all exceptions. A great grinder that withstands time and easy to clean.
Grinds it perfectly and fine. worth it!

I bought this product to replace a coffee grinder (I use it for spices) that I gave away as a gift. This product works great. I use it to grind my own spices, as this preserves the flavor of the spices and bulk spices usually are cheap. A whole bag of dried chipotle peppers costs the same as one small McCormick's preground jar. Anyways, the only con to this product is the cord is smaller than my original one.
Can't grind a lot of beans at once but just enough for a days worth of coffee at a time! Great for the price!

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not grind beans to a consistent size
reviews.reviewText: I bought this grinder for use with my espresso machine and french press because I was looking for something small and economical, and this had glowing reviews. After a few uses, however, I'm completely unsatisfied and will be getting a manual burr grinder instead. This grinder cannot achieve consistent ground size- what that means is that some of your beans will still be in very large chunks, while most of the beans are pulverized. That is literally the one important hallmark of a coffee grinder- that it grinds the beans to a consistent grind. Maybe the inconsistent results are fine for people using a drip coffee maker, but if you want to use this grinder to brew a precise cup of coffee, definitely look elsewhere.
Grinds the beans really nice. Easy to wipe clean. Small enough to keep on the counter or put in a cabinet.
Works well. Great you can control how course or fine your coffee Bean is ground. Better to do it for individual servings.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not the greatest layout for this type of machine.
reviews.reviewText: I really like this product, I just wish it had more of a spout for dumping out the ground coffee beans. You take the lid off and have to be super careful and still get coffee all over the counter. Other than this its a great product that works well.

reviews.reviewTitle: I don't know how this got such great reviews. I'm unable to take the lid off ...
reviews.reviewText: I don't know how this got such great reviews. I'm unable to take the lid off without grounds going everywhere. It's a complete mess.
The oblong shape is a bit harder to unload than some circular shaped machines I have used. Works fine.

It came today, I had tes it by grinding coffe beans. It did a great job, so far happy with that.

One think to mentioned is that. When I wanted to get powdery texture of coffe it took a little longer with breaks to give the engine bit of break but I could smell bit of the engine - not anything alarming but I did notice it

I've been using it pretty consistently for a while now, and it's still going strong. I use it mostly to grind my coffee however coarse or fine I want to. It also gives me the ability to put whatever I want to in with the coffee, so I can customize the flavor. Cinnamon, almonds, coconut, flax seed, whatever strikes my fancy. Good price for a great little grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Spice POWER in a tiny machine!
reviews.reviewText: I use this little gem to reduce Celery Seed to powder form to use in cooking. Tuna Salad or any salad for that matter just tastes better with an aromatic infusion of Celery. Pretty much all the dried leaf seasonings, spices and herbs are more effective after being reduced to powder form. This little machine does the job at a reasonable cost.

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple, but stop working within 3 months.
reviews.reviewText:
Simple, but stop working within few months with very light load. We used it twice a week for two cups of coffee. Just stopped working.
Customer support is supposed to send us a return label to send the product for evaluation. Seems to be it's a lengthy process. Will update this review on the results.
Grinds coffee quickly and very finely if needed. Doesn't take up too much counterspace. Great price for a good quality grinder

I bought this Krups coffee grinder because the same exact one hat I had finally died. It was about 15 years old and had worked great for me. The original one was made in Mexico, the new one in China. They seem to be the same, except for one critical thing: The new one has a much shorter power cord! So, if your counter top outlet is not convenient, then this coffee grinder may not be the right one for you (unless you want to add an extension cord). I find that I have to un-plug the grinder first, after I grind my coffee beans, so as to empty the chamber, rather than maintaining the cord and plug in place. I find this extra step annoying. Other than that, it grinds great, is very powerful, and the oval shape makes pouring the ground coffee from the unit very easy and nearly spill free.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t waste your time or money...
reviews.reviewText: This coffee machine worked great for a couple of months. Then if started to get clogged when grinding beans to the point it will not grind anymore. Don’t waste your money in this machine. There are far better options out there.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for grinding spices...not so much for (french press) coffee
reviews.reviewText:
I use this for grinding coffee and spices BUT I would only recommend it for grinding spices because obviously it does not grind constantly for coffee. If you plan on using it for coffee, then it sonly good for coffee maker coffee that needs to be finely ground. For anything else, like French press, the grinds are not consistent.

It works great with flax seeds and larger spices or seeds.
Very small and that's great!!

reviews.reviewTitle: This grinder will produce both fine and course grind from whole coffee beans
reviews.reviewText: This grinder will produce both fine and course grind from whole coffee beans. I prefer a fine grind and have used two other electric blade grinders that cannot produce a fine grind like this Krups no matter how long you grind. This one works really well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, but something aren't so great.
reviews.reviewText: Works great. My only problems with it is you have to fill the cap and turn it over to attach the cap. If you just fill the bowl you can't get the cap on. To open it you have to turn it upside down again to gwet the grounded coffee beans in the cap and it's messy.

I bought 2 of these at the same time, one for me, one as a gift. The grinder did not work on either. On mine, it worked 3 or 4 times then stopped. On the one I bought as a gift, it never worked. Shotty quality, expensive coffee maker for it not to work!

I've used Krups coffee grinder since 1968. They've never failed me. My only issue has been with the courts after while, as with any electrical appliance, it could begin to fray in places that you don't want it to. But the grinders themselves
Used it for Indian spices and grinding coconut, very effective. Also ground coffee beans. Cleans well by grinding a piece of bread.
Mom needed a new one and this one was perfect. I plan on getting a second for non spice grinding. I wish the cups were removable so they could be washed

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for adding flaxseeds to smoothie
reviews.reviewText: This is great for grinding a tablespoon of flaxseeds to my daily smoothie. I am using this as a way to increase omega 3 to help my dry eyes. I am happy with the cute size and ease of use. No complaints.

reviews.reviewTitle: This thing stops functioning again and again
reviews.reviewText: The motor of the grinder stops functioning. The rotor doesn't run. I use its with utmost care yet, every time I use not the motor gives trouble and finally stops running. This has happed not once but twice !! Total waste of money.
Used mine to grind up nuts. Do not over fill as wont grind some. Use bread slice to clean but still have to wash to remove oil.
how the heck do you clean this thing? it works fine. the grounds aren’t what i need them to be, but it’s good enough.

I loved it first. The top is oval and the blade covers a circle. Coffee grounds get stuck on two sides,which extra space coming from the oval shape. Every time I open it there is coffee ground everywhere. I just have to remember to open it on top of the sink so it doesn't go everywhere. I lowered the rating to one star because I have to buy a new grinder.
Bought to grind sugar into powdered sugar substitute

Works like a charm. We've been using it for several months now. We grind Starbucks French Roast. There is a layer of coffee that accumulates in the bottom of the grinder, but I think that reflects on the type of coffee rather than the grinder. I need to look for a tine brush to loosen up the oily grounds!
Aaaaamazing product for the price! Grinds so fast and super well!
As advertised. No problems.
One of my favorite products to use especially for hair recipes!

Probably the best of the blade style grinders. Oval shape seems to produce a more even grind then the round shaped grinders, but still not as good as a burr type grinder. Cheaper & easier to clean though. Static electricity does cause some coffee to stick to inside. (use a soft brush to remove)

KRUPS F203 Electric Spice and Coffee Grinder is a efficient, powerful grinder.

The only negative comment that I have about it is that it does not have a coarse, medium, and fine grind setting, it grinds until you stop grinding.

So, you will have to learn how long to grind the coffee to get the texture that you want.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great and grinding dry chili peppers!
reviews.reviewText: Made my own chipotle peppers (smoked red jalepeño) with it. My peppers were dried at 200F for 24 hours so they were crackly dry. RUN THE GRINDER OUTSIDE BECAUSE THE POWDER IN THE AIR IS KILLER!

I use this every day for my morning cup of joe. It works for my needs. The grind is not super even, but that doesn't bother me. I have also used this grinder for chia and sunflower seeds and it worked great! Love it, love the price.
This is exactly what I wanted. It grinds great and is the perfect size
I use this to grind my flax seeds.
Easy to use and compact. We love that we can grind as we go!

I've had two of these grinders (one for coffee, one for spices) for many years. They work consistently and do an excellent job grinding foods of all different sizes. They're easy to clean (just use a basting brush to sweep the powder out from under the blade. They've lasted so long that I don't know when I'll need another grinder, but I would definitely purchase another one of these if needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: My life is way better now
reviews.reviewText: I find it very grindy. It makes noise. I use it everyday. It makes me reasonably happy and okay about coffee beans mostly.

Many (many, like maybe decades?) years ago I had a Krups grinder that looked exactly like this one. I used it for years and years and, despite gross negligence (on my part, I didn't take care of it, banged it around) and multiple apartment moves, had the same grinder which worked perfectly every time. Blades never dulled either. Was a small miracle of sorts.

Then in a move I LOST the old Krups grinder and went Krup grinderless (bought pre-ground coffee) for years. Last week, I accidentally ordered 5 pounds of BEANS instead of grounds and figured ok now is my excuse to get another Krups.

Well this Krups seems even more well constructed than the last one. Like decades ago, I look at my watch, time 5 seconds, and whatdoyaknow, it makes exactly the same coarse grounds it did decades ago.

Only thing I would differ with some of the reviews is that 'it's not loud.' It's SO LOUD, I get a kick out of scaring the cats right out of the kitchen when they are bothering me to feed them in the morning.

So I have my old friend the Krups coffee grinder back and am very pleased.

:)
Really noisy and doesn’t grind coffee very fine
Not as loud as I thought it would be it grinds the beans extremely fast.. I only have to do a couple of burst when I'm making my cold brew.. for cold brew you don't want it to be too fine.

We owned and loved this same compact coffee grinder for decades, and when it finally died we needed a replacement right away (we don't do Starbucks). Our local stores are awash in grinders, but only the bells and whistles kind. Thank goodness Amazon had the little grinder that could, and shipment was fast. If you want a shiny piece of sculpture for your kitchen counter, go ahead and pay $200 or more for your grinder, but if you just want aromatic, perfectly ground coffee buy this humble little machine.
I just replaced a different brand that I had for about 10 years that stopped working. Hopefully this one will last just as long.
Grinds coffee beans very fast with a minimum amount of noise. Some ground coffee does get stuck on the metal around the blades but is easy to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for grind small amount of the coffee beans, but not for herbs
reviews.reviewText:
I like this product for many reasons - small, sleek looking, light, strong. The material feels fantastic holding in hands, definitely in good quality. It is also very safe to use among small kitchen appliances, as you would have to have the lid fully closed to operate the blade. We use it every morning for coffee, and it does a good job grinding coffee beans into fine ground.

It is not very easy to clean comparing to a food processor, because the base, where the coffee beans go into, cannot be rinsed under water. The instruction suggests to wipe it clean with dampen cloth. Since I could not figure out how to detach the blade from the base (the manual also does not indicate how, so it is probably not possible), I have to use a paint brush to sweep the inside. It is not a problem for us since we only use it for coffee beans, but if you also want to use it for herbs and spices, the sweeping can be some work.

Speaking of grinding herbs, it is a perk of this device and part of the reason I bought it. But it does not chop the herbs as fine as a food processor. If you try to mix small amount of herb and olive oil, most of them ended up hanging on the sidewall after it starts, so the mixture cannot be chopped anymore. Maybe for bigger batch of herb, it will be more useful. But for the fresh herbs for two-people dinner, I actually have to use a bigger food processor.

Overall, it is a nice piece. I like the look and feel of it, and the price is reasonable even I only use it for grinding coffee beans. If you want to grind herbs though, you might want to look for another product.
Good basic grinder. Nothing fancy and does exactly what you’d expect. Can grind coarse or very fine and everything in between. No complaints.
Great product for the price. We’ve had one for years and had to get one for a friend.
The biggest flaw in this design is after you grind it, removing the lid without spilling is a little tricky which should’ve been lot more easier.

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought this as a replacement for an older version ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a replacement for an older version of the same model I inherited from my mother. The motor in that one finally burned up. The second time I used this one, I smelled the motor beginning to overheat as I was grinding enough beans to fill a small coffee can. The jury is still out on this one.
Works great, not too loud, good quality, looks good.
Awesome little grinder..I use it every few days..its exactly as shown and ships fast...I do recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent price for what appears to be a quality grinder.
reviews.reviewText: Fresh ground beans in an instant. I like the easy access and clean up design of this grinder. No unnecessary parts or features. Just a fast grind, Isn't overbearingly loud either.

I think turning it upside down to empty it is not really what I wanted. I should have ordered a unit that has a drawer so the grinds do not spill each time you remove them. It does a pretty good job of grinding though.

reviews.reviewTitle: I was delighted to see Krups reviews atop all other grinders
reviews.reviewText:
Quality and durability in the name.
I have relied on a Krups grinder for many years, now looking to make a purchase for my daughter, in need of her own. I was delighted to see Krups reviews atop all other grinders, assuring me that this is the right one for her as well!

reviews.reviewTitle: Very handy when too tired to hand grind the beans ...
reviews.reviewText:
Very handy when too tired to hand grind the beans.
I don't know if it's me but this grinder seems to remove all the aroma out of the beans when compared to using hand grinder.

This item arrived sooner than anticipated, was well packaged and fits my needs perfectly. I bought it to help mitigate the high cost of k-cups but it is useful for anything I need ground like sea salt that is just a little too chunky, nuts and dried herbs. Doesn't take up much space. Took a little practice to get the timing right because it will grind ingredients to a powder if you aren't careful.

My first coffee grinder and still perfect. Its size is also great for a college dorm. I leave it in the floor's kitchen and use it whenever I feel like making coffee. Depends on how long you hold the button, you get anything from a very fine ground to a coarse ground.

Same experience as YR. I bought this just over two years ago (there goes the warranty) for use as a spice grinder. It was used very sporadically, maybe a total of 20 times to grind several tablespoons of things like cumin seed. One day last week it just died. Still makes noise, but no movement. Worthless.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not to submerge this in water
reviews.reviewText: It is a strong unit, I use it for my Sichean peppercorns and it does the job nicely.
Great grinder for the price.
Love this, does all well.

reviews.reviewTitle: I threw some heavily dehydrated tomatoes through it and made a great powder of that and some peppers I tried separately
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to grind spices and dried items from my garden. I threw some heavily dehydrated tomatoes through it and made a great powder of that and some peppers I tried separately. I never knew that tomato powder was a thing till I tried to find uses for it online.

I bought this to grind my chili peppers I dry out each year. It did a great job. If you grind till things are a fine powder it can take a bit to clean. however after getting a small brush (like a hobby/model paint brush) it was easy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Started using in March 2017, after using 2-3 times ...
reviews.reviewText: Started using in March 2017, after using 2-3 times, the grinder stopped spinning. You can hear the noise, but the grinder no longer works. Amazon said to contact the manufacture.

reviews.reviewTitle: A must for fresh coffee brewers!
reviews.reviewText: Great addition to the kitchen, a must have for all that prefer to grind their coffee for a fresh cup each day. Works extremely well, I was impressed how effortlessly the coffee was ground leaving zero chunks to deal with. Only down side is cleaning the base completely where coffee is ground. All in all, I would highly recommend to others.

reviews.reviewTitle: Unsure of quality or durability only had a short time
reviews.reviewText: Not had long enough to rate quality or durability but I like it so far (only used 3 times)

Great tool to have if you love fresh coffee

1. oval shape for easy pour... that makes soooo much difference! I have an old Braun which is round - no bueno (easy spill)
2. super sharp blades - be careful... I'd recommend getting a brush to clean out after each grind
3. nice size - one easy grip, and pour... which is just bit shorter

Bit noisy, but most portable burrs are - no big deal.
Gift for son in law. He seemed pleased and uses it often
Did not purchase

I couldn't resist buying this after longing for that fresh ground flavor that can only be experience for the first few cups when I buy it already ground. The taste of fresh brewed coffee brings such comfort and this little grinder works like a charm. It's a fine grind and a little loud but works fast and creates little clean-up. Ahhh... coffee tastes freshly ground when brewed at home every time.
I love this product is excellent for my use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does well with grinding. Is a complete pain to ...
reviews.reviewText: Does well with grinding. Is a complete pain to remove grounds and to clean. We have chosen to return to pre-groind coffee because it was too much of a hassle to grind.
It isn’t very easy to use, the coffee grounds get under the lip of the lid. Horrible to clean

Wanted one of these for a long time-

KRUPS F203 Electric Spice and Coffee Grinder, wanted one of these for a long time and saw this on sale and grab it. It works well and grinds great!. Powerful motor for a small grinder. now I make the freshest coffee every day. Buy coffee in beans for cheaper and grind away.

We bought his grinder in August. We’ve had it less than 6 months. Used it about 4 times to grind spices with good results. However, the motor is now bound up and has stopped working! You can hear it turn on but the blades don’t spin.
Works well. Not always a consistent coarse grind if thats what you use it for.
Bought this for my girlfriend to use at work & she loves it!!!
Durable and works great!
Good product for grinding coffee. Works well, and does the job. I’m happy with how it works.
I use it to grind coffee beans. It works fast and grinds very well.

At this price this is a great grinder. I have only had it for a month, but so far it works very well.

I have used it mostly to grind up herbs/spices like fennel, cut/sifted burdock root and milk thistle seed. Great for small quantities. If you are looking to do larger quantities you may want to look at a larger machine.

For small amounts it is fast and easy enough to clean.

I know there are hundreds of reviews here saying it is great and a few saying otherwise. Time will tell if it holds up and keeps working well.

reviews.reviewTitle: It grinds your beans to any coarseness you want by just giving the power button a few taps or press firmly to get a fine grind. Makes at least 2 cups of coffee ...
reviews.reviewText: I have used these for years and they perform and outlast other products that are more expensive. It grinds your beans to any coarseness you want by just giving the power button a few taps or press firmly to get a fine grind. Makes at least 2 cups of coffee at a time. Great Buy!

Bought this to grind spices, not coffee. It works great, though you have to shake it a bit while grinding to make sure the grind is even. Perhaps that is standard with coffee grinders in this price range, because we do that with our other coffee grinder too. Contrary to another review I read, I have not had any trouble cleaning the grinder after use. I have ground pepper, coriander, cumin seed, and cardamom (the cardamom seeds were even a bit sticky because I removed them from their pods by hand). After use, I just wipe out the container with a wet paper towel. The blade is sharp and can't (as far as I know) be removed, so I have to work around it carefully. Grind longer, maybe even a whole minute, for a finer grind.

This is a great investment and it has made my foray into Indian cooking a lot easier. Oh, the cord is 28 inches, which is an issue in my kitchen (too short to reach the inconveniently placed outlet). However, it's so light and uncomplicated that I just take it to whatever free outlet I can find.
Small capacity, wasn’t as I expected

reviews.reviewTitle: Sturdy design with sharp blades and powerful motor
reviews.reviewText: Awesome grinder - perhaps one of the best I've ever purchased. Although the design is manual-based (not automatic), the blades are sharp and driven by a powerful motor. You can get the perfect grind in under 25 seconds (15 for a drip machine).
Works beyond great. So easy to use! It’s a bit loud but it’s a blender so what else would you expect? 😂. Great price too

I try to experiment with different beans, and ground levels to suit the Indian Coffee Filter; this was referred by a friend of mine and since the day I got this the process of making coffee has been more enjoyable. But would suggest to be careful while washing the main unit!
Handy item to have to grind spices. Love it. Works very well.
Very good products!!
Easy to use and install. I use it often!

Pros:
One step to grind and make fresh coffee.
Easily to use
A perfect size: not too big that fits under the cupboard
Not needing a coffee filter
Timer is nice,. We set the timer and it grinds when it is set and makes coffee.

Cons:
The coffee pot doesn't pour without dripping around, which is annoying, I am constantly wiping the counter.
This does an excellent job grinding eggshells for homemade dog food! That’s all I know.
Good value for money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds In Less Than A Minute
reviews.reviewText: When filled to the top and patted-down so as to add more coffee beans, I yield approximately 12 tapbelspoons of coffee ground. The compnay states this grinder can make 12 cups of coffee (standard measurement dictates 1 cup = 8 oz.)..Which means the company's measurement is 1 tbsp. per 8oz. cup. Personally, I use 2 tblsp. per 6oz. cup.
Grinds anything you have!
I am using this product more than 3 years. Every morning I grind my coffee and it still works well.
Use it for coffee everyday. Love it. Can’t complain. Have had it for a while now no issues.
I thought it would be loud like a blender. Not so much. I also like that you can pulse the grind depending on how coarse or fine your desire is.
Love this grinder. Can adjust the grind side but how long you press down.

Great for coffee grinding! Have not tried it for spices. Strong cord and lid. I've used it almost daily for 1.5 years and it is still grinding away! Grinds quick although a little loud. I'd be happy to buy this again.

I was skeptic because it seemed to be much more affordable than other products I've seen that do the same thing, but I'm very presently surprised! It works great, easy to use and is easy to clean. Very happy with this purchase. I have already recommended it to friends.
Good for a hasty but satisfying morning brew
This product stopped working after only two months! This is a piece of junk!
Easy to use every day and easy to clean up. Great grinder

It's a great coffee maker. The automatic freshly ground coffee tastes very good everyday. You should be aware of two things before buying

- the grinder can be set to automatically start which is nice! But it's loud! Just be aware.
-you can't use flavored coffee due to the oily film- it causes the grinder to clog.

reviews.reviewTitle: It grinds beans quickly and easily. Very good quality for the price

I actually have owned this grinder for a few years. It grinds spices very well. The blade is super sharp and creates a very fine grind. When it comes to using it for coffee, it lacks a bit. We use a french press style coffee maker and need our grind to be coarse and even. When using this grinder, we have to use quick pulses and shake the grinder to encourage even distribution of the coffee beans. It's very easy to over grind in this grinder, which creates a very fine grind and not ideal for a french press. If you're using a traditional style coffee pot with a filter, this wouldn't be such an issue because the filter will catch most of the sediment created by the finer grind. One issue we've always had with this grinder is the general mess it creates. The grinds stick to the lid. So once the lid is removed they tend to fall out onto the counter. Overall it's a very reliable grinder. The entire thing is very easy to clean with a quick rinse under the faucet or wipe down with a damp towel. I wouldn't hesitate to buy it again if I needed a very simple, easy to use grinder.
