I got into grinding my own beans through my old roommate. He was a barista and a big time coffee lover. He brewed using a cheap 5 cup Mr. Coffee and an ancient grinder (literally over a decade old). But his coffee always tasted great. He always attributed it to one variable; freshly ground beans. He explained to me that coffee does expire (something I would never having guessed growing up with my parents using the same Folgers tin for a month). It doesnt go bad, but loses all its flavors. He also showed me how much cheaper whole beans are. So with this, I decided to buy my own grinder for when I moved out. This KRUPS model fit the bill perfectly. Relatively cheap, solid brand, perfect size, and ease of use.

Couldnt be more happy. It does one job. But it does it extremely well. There are no variable speeds or grind settings as on more expensive models. But you really dont need them. If you want a finer grind, you simply leave it on longer. Too easy. It feels super sturdy and well built. Im guessing this unit will last a very long time.

It is also good looking. No reason to put it away as it lends a nice touch to any countertop.

I bought this just for grinding coffee but Im sure the sky is the limit for its potential uses. Spices, nuts, it will all be no problem for the power of this little grinder.

Would recommend to anybody looking for a great coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, a bit hard to clean
reviews.reviewText: I chose 4 rather than 5 stars because the unit is a bit hard to clean. I use my grinder primarily for coffee, but on occasion have used it to grind spices (like nutmeg) as well. Unfortunately, since the compartment housing the beans isn't removable, cleaning the residual grounds can be a bit cumbersome... unless you like EVERYTHING to taste like coffee. Also, I noticed when grinding different coffee beans, if the grinder wasn't cleaned sufficiently, you can taste the old coffee beans and a slight burnt taste. The cleaning instructions tell you not to submerge the entire unit in water, but it's hard to get it the coffee oils out without really wetting the grinder. I've seen some machines with removable compartments for easier cleaning and I think that would have definitely been perfect for this. Aside from that, it's a great grinder and at a very reasonable price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for grinding coffee, but partially inconsistent
reviews.reviewText:
the Krups has a lot of nice features, but one nagging problem that makes it a pain to use- I have a French press, and it requires the grinds to be no smaller than a certain size- to get that ideal zone, you need to only tap the grind button two or three times- the problem is you get large unground beans as well, so to grind a bag of coffee, you put in a handful, grind it, set it aside, grind another handful, set it aside, etc.

After you grind enough, you need to filter the results with a fork to scoop out the unground beans and regrind them. It makes a simple task take forever. If you don't do this, you risk overgrinding and ending up with grit in your french press.

Now, the good news- it's designed to keep you from grinding off your finger, which is good because it's fast, sharp and powerful. Cleaning it is relatively easy- a damp paper towel along the inside is usually sufficient as long as you do it often. It's relatively small, so it's easy to store.

Do those good features outweigh the uneven grinding? I'm not entirely convinced.
I use this for grinding spices not coffee. Works great. Easy to clean.

This is my second Krups coffee grinder. I used the first one for probably 10 to 15 years. It was getting very dull so I replaced it with another just like it. The price is great and the product does everything that I wanted it to. I usually grind at least one pound of coffee each week, plus often times flax seed. It's been a great grinder. I hope my second one works as long as the first.

I currently own 3 different blade grinders and they all suffer from the same problem which is that they do not grind coffee evenly so that you end up with large chunks of coffee among the finer ground particles. Burr grinders are superior but they cost about 4 times as much as a blade grinder and are quite a big larger. My only problem with this grinder is that once ground, the coffee tends to stick to the wall so that it take time to scape it out.

I work as a chef and we use coffee grinders frequently for grinding spices. Because there is no commercial-use version of a spice grinder (or at least not an affordable one), we are always burning through these standard coffee grinders. I have used many different ones and have seen many of them die after short, abusive lives. Professional kitchens are not kind to equipment of any kind. Things get beat up or neglected. And coffee/spice grinders are usually the most susceptible.

However, this Krup grinder is one of the most hearty I have used. As long as the plastic lid/cup doesn't crack (I've only seen that happen once), this thing will last forever. It is durable, grinds spices to fine powder, and is reasonably easy to clean. There may be other coffee grinders out there with bells and whistles, or flashy designs, but if you just need something to grind your coffee (or spices) and isn't going to die in six months, this is it. Strongly recommended.
grinds coffee really fine

I use the KRUPS to reduce to powder my 'oven dried' eggshells and banana peel strips for my bucket tomatoes. Roots make quicker use of the powdered shells (calcium) thwarting blossom end rot and the powdered peels add potassium and phosphorus that mixes well throughout the soil.

As others have mentioned; dont fill it more than half again the depth of the inside metal lip, be mindful of the little plastic bit on underside of the 'push down to pulse black tab when cleaning, and an inch or two square of torn bread pulsed at end-of-use is good to clean powders from the 'not immersible motor section of the KRUPS.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... this less than a year ago based on the great reviews. Now it doesn't turn
reviews.reviewText: I bought this less than a year ago based on the great reviews. Now it doesn't turn, just hums without turning the blade. I attempted to see if something was lodged and was able to unscrew the blade, but no success. It' simply doesn't work now. I have used it very sparingly since I am only a "coffee on a special occasion" user or when friends visit. Very disappointed in the short life span of this product.
I have a manual grinder and wanted something faster, this does the trick.

I have had this coffee grinder for just over 2 years, and it stopped working one day without an apparent reason - I wasn't grinding anything particularly hard, nothing got stuck, it just stopped. When I removed the coffee beans, the motor would engage and the blades would spin, but any time something was in the chamber, the motor would still come on, but the blades would not spin. I had my husband take it apart (it was conveniently just past warranty) because it appeared the motor was working fine, and he found that the gear that allows the blades to engage is just a small plastic piece that had been stripped. For another 15 cents per device, this piece could have been made out of metal and would have probably lasted until the motor gave out. I am not a particularly frequent or abusive user of this grinder, so I am pretty disappointed in the longevity of the device given that both of my parents both have similar coffee grinders that have lasted for 10+ years. I imagine that's just part of the plan for more sales/they just make everything out of plastic now. *sigh*
Prior to it breaking, it functioned fine. It's more of a dust and boulders situation than a consistent grind, but for those of us that just want a cup of coffee, it's perfectly fine. I like that it's compact. It was pretty loud, but I think that's standard.

Compact. Grinding easy to store

reviews.reviewTitle: Not too great and grinding chocolate though because the chocolate gets stuck ...
reviews.reviewText: This thing is badass at grinding coffee. Not too great and grinding chocolate though because the chocolate gets stuck inside the bowl and you have to clean it out with a damp cloth, but the blades are sharp and I don't think they come out.. It's great but you have to take good care to clean it and not get the internal parts wet!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and clean up is a cinch
reviews.reviewText: This is a handy little appliance. We use it once a week for our Sunday morning coffee. Easy to use and clean up is a cinch. Good value for the money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for the Discriminating Coffee snob on the go... Errrrr Or Camping/RV'ing
reviews.reviewText:
Got one for my Camper? Yeah I know my Camper... But Wife must have fresh bean...She's a coffee snob...

It's loud... Neighbors while camping sometimes look at you like : "Really Dude?" But Wife is happy, thus, I am happy....

But it's compact, and cleans very easy so it's a plus in that regard..
It’s easy use & get the job done pretty fast, but it’s a bit loud
Great value for the price. Expected this product to be "just okay" but was surprised to see how much more it was than at first glance. Really pleased with it.
A gift and they were pleased!
Does what it should. Grinds up my coffee just perfect.

I have a Jura Capresso Espresso/Cappucino Machine....a small one. I also have a Jura grinder. Unfortunately the grinder has finally retired itself after many years. Since I am on a tight budget, I decided that maybe, just maybe, I could find an affordable grinder. And this is it! Does a great job, although a bit noisy. No difference in flow for my espresso machine. I love being able to control the fineness of the grind and have even adapted so quickly in the sound of the grind to know exactly when the beans are ground, without looking in the reservoir. For the money, I can replace it every year if need be. I love this grinder!

Got this to grind dried herbs. Works great. By pulsing I can get from minced to fine dust. Clean up is not too bad. Got to admit that just using a paper towel (damp/dry) to get the herb dust out is not extremely easy, there is a ridge inside that holds the dust. But this thing does exactly what I want and I can't be unhappy about that.
Loved it.
Easy to use
Good like a "Krups" should be!.

The Krups coffee grinder grinds the coffee well.
Tip: Once you finish grinding, unplug and turn the grinder upside down and tap the machine to make sure the grounds dump into the cap before you open (in the upside down position). Otherwise some of the grounds will spill out.
I miss my old Braun grinder that died after nearly 20 years of use. It was made more sensibly with a very thin cap that prevented grounds from spilling out.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is all you need, for coffee or black pepper
reviews.reviewText: The last one I had lasted more than ten years and that was dropped to end its service. Powerful motor and the finer the grind the longer you do it . Let me mention if you want to keep it clean go for the brush to clean. Periodally I will dip a q-tip into water and clean some build up from areas the brush has trouble with. This as others have posted is simple, well made and will last, enjoy.
A little loud but I have had this product before so was expecting it. Produces a great espresso grind. Really great product for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: These things are indestructible in my world.
reviews.reviewText: Reliable as always ... this is my third in 30 years. #1 stayed with my Mom when I moved (it now lives with my brother and is still grinding) #2 has been repurposed as a herb grinder and #3 happily grinds coffee. These things are indestructible in my world.
It crushes the beans with no mercy but then it gets a bit too crushed unless you pay attention to it lol...
It grinds coffee very well. It does what the add said.

Bought a hand grinder about two years ago and it works great, but takes a lot of effort. This electric grinder gets the job done much faster with no effort. It's a little bit loud, but the speed more than makes up for the noise.

If you're in the market for a grinder don't look any further. Quick and easy review:

PROS:

-It is small and portable
-Clean and professional look
-It grinds and it grinds well. So far no issues.
-Easy operation (simply press down the lid button
-No batteries to worry about
-Cheap

CONS:

-It does not make me breakfast in the morning
Gets hot a little quicker than I’d like but does a good job at pulverizing dry herbs

reviews.reviewTitle: bad design. This grinder is in oval rather than ...
reviews.reviewText:
In short: bad design.

This grinder is in oval rather than circle. The problem is the ground coffee remains the narrower sides of the oval when I take it out of the grinder.
Easy to use easy to clean. Very good for small batches, otherwise just use the large grinder at the store.

Bought the Krups because of its great reviews although I doubted it's capacity. I can report that it grinds enough beans for 10 cups of coffee which is our daily consumption. The only downsides is that you have to control the grinding time and that cleanup is a pain.After my two last grinders it seems to be very good and powerful..now let's see if it lasts!

PERFECT AS A SPICE GRINDER! When recipes call for ground flax, or you want the absolute freshest ground allspice, pepper, etc., this is a dandy tool. I have never used it for fresh green herbs, as I have a mini-chopper for that. We have a second one dedicated to coffee grinding.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does a good job grounding the beans though
reviews.reviewText: Hard to clean, the top was almost impossible to get off at first, it has gotten easier to get it on and off after using it more, but still a little difficult and causes ground coffee to spill out when pulling it off. Does a good job grounding the beans though.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds really well. Cleaning is hard, as no ...
reviews.reviewText:
Grinds really well. Cleaning is hard, as no water and soap should be used. So little spices get stuck around the blade.
I hope they can design one in which the container comes out.

This grinder grinds really well, and has a very sturdy design. The reason it gets 3 stars is because this thing is a serious pain to clean after each grind. The blade gets in the way when wiping down the chamber, and isn't removable. It's a good grinder for the price, but I miss being able to throw the grind chamber in the dishwasher with my old one.
Others said it makes the best coffee - they were right!

reviews.reviewTitle: Way better than grinding them by hand using a mortar and ...
reviews.reviewText: I use this to grind herbs and roots down. Roots go to powder within seconds. Way better than grinding them by hand using a mortar and pestle.
I’ve used this everyday multiple times a day for a year works great.
Very easy to use.
Fast and easy to use!
Perfect for my french press preparation as I only need to run it for a second or two.
This is great for fresh ground coffee and spices
Love this little coffee grinder! No complaints! Great quality!

It's a sturdy grinder. I use it for coffee and recently used it to grind Chinese 5 Spice and it worked really well. If you clean it well, there will be no taste of spice in your coffee or the other way around.
Bought this for co-workers and used in our break-room for those who enjoy fresh coffee. I don't drink coffee. My co-workers enjoy it very much. So, apparently, Well worth the price.

One of the best product I bought from Amazon.
I use this everyday to make fresh coffee

Nice product. We had an older model, it worked fine we just donated figuring it wasn't going to be used, that one pushed the clear top to start. This one seems the same except you press a black tab that sticks up a bit above the clear plastic. It is pretty quiet when grinding almonds and turns them to flour fairly quickly.
This worked fine but then suddenly stopped working and I only bought it 8 months ago. Total scam.

Just took it out one day and it didn't work. Started heating up but the blade wouldn't spin. Probably bc it does not have a seal tight system so some of the coffee got into the grinder and messed up the wires inside.
Noise level is not irritating. Fast delivery.

reviews.reviewTitle: What would I do without this?
reviews.reviewText: I use this mostly for spices. I grind my own fresh black pepper, red pepper, garam masala, allspice (pimento), raw cocoa (into cocoa powder for hot chocolate)... you name it. It works really fast and gets the chunks powdered in no time. It makes sense to have one for spices and another for coffee/chocolate, but I do clean mine after each use to ensure the spices don't soak in. It does get a little hot if you use it consistently for a long time, so it helps to use it in bursts so that the motor gets a chance to rest. Try it out!

reviews.reviewTitle: Been using it daily (sometimes twice daily) for over a ...
reviews.reviewText: Been using it daily (sometimes twice daily) for over a year and it's still going strong, even after using it to grind spices and psyllium husks in addition to my coffee.
We first purchased one of these several years ago. We decided to start grinding spices with it and it works perfectly, so of course I had to get another one for any coffee beans. Works great.
Love this little grinder. Very good price. Grinds anything I put in it with no problems at all.
I purchased this item to make my saffron spice . and it works greatttttt
This is nice. My wife has been using it almost daily for several months and it still works like a new unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds seeds nice and fast, cleaning it is awkward
reviews.reviewText: I grind chia and flaxeed with this unit. It grinds them nicely in less than 10 seconds. The only negative about it is cleaning it. You can take the cap off for cleaning, but the blade doesn't remove and it says you can't submerse the unit in water. So I unplug it then scrape as much out as possible with a spoon (I saw someone say they use a brush to get under the blades). Then I use a damp paper towel to wipe it thoroughly.

This Krups coffee grinder is so easy to use. No assembling required. You press one button and you are set. For a grinder less than $20, I think it did a pretty good job. You won't have the option to grind for brewed coffee or expresso, but you get what you've paid for. I am happy with this grinder and I recommend to anyone who wants easy fresh coffee.

ps. I never used it to grind spices/herbs. I am not sure how to get rid of the scent since it is not washable.

I "tossed" my first Krups grinder after a steady 10-12 years use. I think the blades got dull from a bag of cheap coffee I tried. I then moved to a couple of other "recommended brand" grinders and was disappointed in their bulk, the designs and cleanliness, not to mention high prices. I returned them.
I went back to this Krups grinder a couple of years ago and love it! Simple, efficient, easy to use, easy to store and clean.
I use it at least three times a day.
Works great
Bought several of these grinders. Good value.
Ok

reviews.reviewTitle: It is probably okay but I used it to grind ...
reviews.reviewText: It is probably okay but I used it to grind my herbs and one of them is a bark which is really hard and it kept getting caught up in the blades. It worked really well for everything else.
Recieved this today and already used it, great product can't believe I lived without one this long.

Second one of the Krups I have purchased for coffee and seed grinding. The first lasted several years and still works, but is showing wear which is expected based on the amount of use. Nice product for the money!
Easy to use, easy to clean. Works well with coffee beans or spices. It is a bit loud
Must have if you’re a regular shooter. Fast and easier than manual reloading.
Good for grinding spices

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't have a cord wrap like the one I had 20 years ago
reviews.reviewText: Grinds quickly. Doesn't have a cord wrap like the one I had 20 years ago. Why would any manufacturer leave one out??
Clearly, quality has deteriorated. Had a Krups grinder for years that worked very well. Purchased a new one and it quit working after 2 1/2 months
Us it for powdering salt and pepper. Works great!
This thing is GREAT. I wanted something to render dry spices into dust for making appetizers and TJX does it well. Kind of an obnoxious sound but not enough to take away a star.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice for quick and dry product
reviews.reviewText: Its is same as picture shows. Easy to handle. Little noises they i expect. This averagely easy for cleaning. Overall its is nice
Very easy to operate and grinds quickly
Does the job
Bought this as a gift

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great for Flax seeds but demote a star for plastic exposure.
reviews.reviewText: I really wanted a fully stainless grinder for flax seed but saw mixed reviews on other stainless grinders with separate stainless cups that suggested the flax seeds got caught under the blades. I didn't want to take a chance. Not so with this one. I think its because of the high 200W motor. It really shoots the flax around thoroughly grinding to a meal and is controlled by short bursts that I execute with the top switch.Very pleased. I would give it a 5 if it weren't for the fact that its mostly plastic. Even the stainless well is not very high and doesn't reach the top or the mill. I wish manufacturers would reduce plastic exposure. It is well made and this is probably why it ranks as an Amazon Best Seller.

reviews.reviewTitle: Okay- lid hard to get off
reviews.reviewText: Overall a seemingly solid coffee grinder- gets the job done. The lid is very tight fitting and is extremely frustrating to get off- as grounds fly out everywhere. You have to be quite careful every time you open the lid.

Can't clean this thing!!! Built-in crevices and edges on the grinder hang on to powders. Have to use a toothpick to clean!!! it grinds beautifully...even the bread I used to try and clean it with! But a nuisance and pain to clean!!!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Does a good job at a great price.
reviews.reviewText:
So far so good. I can't speak to the longevity of the product but it grinds coffee really well, is pretty quiet while grinding, and was a good price.

If it lasts more than a few years at the price it's probably more than a five star product. I would recommend it if you want a good, simple, easy to use coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Coffee grounds are hard to clean out.
reviews.reviewText: This is almost the identical coffee grinder as a wedding gift 30 years ago. So when that one finally broke (the lid's locking mechanism) I was pleased to see what looks like the same grinder. And it's close, but with this new one the coffee packs in tighter making it harder to get all the grounds out. It's also black instead of white making it harder to see the nooks and crannies where the grounds are hiding.
Excelent
Love
My previous krups lasted at least 10 years

Was recommended this grinder by a family member who’s had his for 10 years plus. Easy to clean and use, and would recommend this product. My coffee tastes so much better using freshly ground rather than pre-grounded!
This item works great but is jarringly loud.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good grinder but unpleasant high frequency sound.
reviews.reviewText: This grinder works well, but the sound is high-pitched and LOUD- I'm afraid of hearing loss! I read other reviews about the loudness, and thought that all grinders are loud, but this one is a higher frequency than others I've owned.
Coffee grinder works well. Takes about 5-10 seconds per grind. The grind is consistent in size and I love the smell of fresh ground coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: A lot of power for a small grinder.
reviews.reviewText: I use this everyday to grind fresh coffee beans and I can’t live without it. The longer you jold it the top down the finer it gets. It’s a little bit louder than I’d like because I get up before everyone else.
Purchased item to grind up egg shells for calcium powder.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you want the best cup of coffee in the morning, grinds your beans with Krups!
reviews.reviewText: Best coffee bean grinder ever!
Lasted 18 month before motor stopped working

reviews.reviewTitle: I think the grinder is fine.
reviews.reviewText:
Pros: inexpensive, fast, and quiet
Cons: unevenly ground coffee, difficult to get the grounds out of the grinder if the beans are oily

Given the option of doing it over, I would spend more money on a burr grinder. I will keep this as a backup grinder. Also, if you aren't using a press, I think the grinder is fine.
Mmmmmm coffee

My wife makes AWESOME coffee with Peet's Coffee & Tea Whole Bean, Ethiopia Yirgacheffe, 10 Ounce. She FINELY grinds it and its the base coffee I ever had.

I am sure the beans are the magic, but this grinder gets the job done!
Purchased as a gift. Evidently not for coffee but for hops? What?? Works great. Thanks

reviews.reviewTitle: When you only want the best....
reviews.reviewText:
Just what I wanted to get, the best. I love being able to read the reviews, know that each product has been tested, and pick out the best, and here it is!!

So thank all of you who have gone before me, for your patient pressing of your fingers, testing of the time, and drinking all that coffee!!! :-)
Works great
Didn't even need to read the instructions, it was so easy to use, easy to clean and the coffee beans come out really fine. Love it!!!

The Krups name may be new to many but it has stood for high quality in Germany for a long time.

This is a high quality product, with heavy plastic clear cover that doesn't quickly scratch and become opaque. It also has a powerful motor with sharp blades that gets the job done fast.

I use mine to grind the 1/4 cup of flax seed I add to my oatmeal every morning. I also pulverize dried spices with it.

Because the large capacity grinding bowl is shaped like an elongated "D" rather that a circle, it is slightly more difficult to clean. But the shape allows for a natural pouring spout that help prevent a mess on the counter. Use a very slightly moistened cloth to clean.

All-in-all the best quality inexpensive blade type grinder I have seen.

I love my grinder! Easy to use, grind your beans to your liking, no difficult settings. Good for regular coffee makers or pour overs. Probably not the best machine for espresso grinds but good for regular every day use. I find it's not super simple to clean but just clean off after every use. Would recommend

reviews.reviewTitle: but it did an amazing job. I have some mustard seed that I ...
reviews.reviewText: To be honest I've only used my grinder once, but it did an amazing job. I have some mustard seed that I wanted to make into a powder for cooking and it took maybe five seconds to turn into a fine soft powder. It wasn't too terribly loud, but it still makes enough noise to scare the pets and kids off. Clean up wasn't too bad, just be careful not to cut a finger when cleaning.
My husband loves his new grinder!
This is well made. I am very happy with this product.

While this will not meet the standards of serious grind-snobs, it is more than adequate for most people who prefer grinding their own beans at home.
I have had mine for years and have never had an issue with it.

Just remember that this is just a blade grinder and will result in inconsistent grind, but it is a great leap from pre-ground coffee.
I love the size

I owned this krups spice grinder for all of 15 or so years. Had to replace it because the plastic was worn and it was not making
contact for the grinder to work. This one is not as good in my opinion, I doubt it will last as long and the metal blades are rather
flimsy plus it makes more noise. Having said all this it is serving me well so far so I will hope for the best and reserve any further negative opinions since it is grinding my coffee well.
It does a good job. Nothing fancy just does it's job.

You can get a coarse or fine grind with this. It does what it says it does.
Been using the product for about a month now without any issue.
If you are in the market for a french press to pair this with I recommend
the Grosche Madrid Premium French Press Coffee and Tea Maker
- a luxe but totally affordable combo. You won't be disappointed.
Mine has stopped working. Amazon tells me I bought it September 24, 2016. So it has lasted less than a year. I don't think I have mistreated it. It was great while it was working.

This grinder works and goes beyond my expectation. It is my first grinder and even though I knew something must exist to grind stuff, I wasn't aware of the grinder until I got this one. I grind everything I can lay my hands on at home to see how well the grinder will grind. My family have enjoyed my cooking because I now grind spices better. It can grind dry fish from Africa, Egusi, Ogbono. How come I didn't know of this product before now is amazing to me. I would recommend the product to everyone.
I does what it says it will do, not perfectly, but well enough.
Good and cheap grinder. Serves my purpose. I use it often and no complains. I just wish it had a way to keep the plug and cable neatly tucked away.
Works great, grinds in seconds

reviews.reviewTitle: ... coffee grinder about a year ago and used it pretty regularly since then
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this coffee grinder about a year ago and used it pretty regularly since then.
It has been working superbly so far and I have had no problems. Grinds the beans in a jiffy - like less than 10 seconds.
I usually don't grind the beans 10 seconds straight though just because the engine might overheat, but give it a 1 or 2 second break in between grinding just to be safe.
Love it
Easy to clean, easy to use. Compact size without compromising power/speed. Quiet motor! Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great until it worked. Warranty not useful
reviews.reviewText: It was great as long as it worked. Less than a year after buying it (and still under warranty), it stopped working. The warranty information on the amazon page and the Krups site are both unhelpful. I live nowhere close to a service center and postage on sending and receiving it is higher than the price of the grinder, so looks like I'm out of options.
Grinds the coffee beans up very well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does what it is intended to do.
reviews.reviewText: Works great. Needs to come with scoop to use with coffee beans.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty spendy for coffee that doesn't taste any different to me.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a gift for my husband, and he thinks it's great. The only problem is that it's really hard to open up the latch to clean the tube that carries the ground coffee to the filter. Honestly, I can't tell the difference in taste from the coffee we grind at the store.
Great gift
super easy and good quality

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Big item in a Small Package!
reviews.reviewText: I'm loving this little gadget. I use this to grind up coffee and even condiments/seasoning for powdery like substance. It's great.
This is the third one of these I have had and they are just great. I use it every day and it lasts for many years. It is a simple and good coffee grinder.

Used maybe 35-40 times maximum.......with coffee beans and turbinado sugar only. Stopped working after 7 months. We are not huge coffee drinkers, thus little usage. I did not pay the $3.95 for replacement insurance, and did not feel I should need to.
A bit loud, but good
Good and inexpensive
Best coffee grinder! Our whole family has one of these---that's 4 of us! It's perfect! Small, powerful. We use ours nearly every day!

Love this. Works great. Not too loud in my opinion. I work wonky schedules and my significant other has used this without waking me up. I feel that the hopper could be slightly larger as it's fairly full on a 12 cup coffee level. That being said, it's easy to measure a full 12 cup pot

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great. Nearly identical to one we bought in 1990s ...
reviews.reviewText: Works great. Nearly identical to one we bought in 1990s (which is good--that one lasted all these years and is still working fine). Only difference is the cord is about 3 feet long now: old grinder cord is about 6 feet.
Good product

This is a nice little grinder. It is fast & leaves a very fine even grind for our french press. I had a Cuisinart grinder prior to this & though I liked the 10oz cup size I hated the uneven ground coffee at the end.
Small but mighty! Great little machine for the cost.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great coffee grinder for a great price!
reviews.reviewText: I've used this coffee grinder for about a year now without any issues. I feel like, for the price, it is the best coffee grinder you can buy. I've also ground flax and chia seeds in it without any problem. If I have to repurchase a grinder in the future, I'd definitely stick with the Krups brand!

If you need to grind small amounts of something, this works quite well. I use it for coffee (it seems this isn't what most use it for), and it works great in that role for making enough coffee for about 2-4 cups (depending on your cup size). I've also used it for grinding herbs (in the kitchen, not smokables), and it works well in that regard also.

reviews.reviewTitle: KRUPS F203 Grinder is a great coffee grinder for the price
reviews.reviewText: KRUPS F203 Grinder is a great coffee grinder for the price. At least that's what I use it for. Haven't tried spices. Doesn't take long to get a fine grind. About as loud as you'd expect an electric grinder to be. Could be easier to clean. The lip inside the grinder definitely harbors fine particles like others have said. Still wouldn't trade it for another grinder, though.

I grew up with my parents grinding their coffee with the earlier model of this grinder. I was very happy when my dad gave it to me when I moved out. After 20+ years of use it finally died. The last two years it did its job even with a crack running down the casing (dropped too many times over the years). Other than an increase in watts & a color change to black, this grinder is the same exact one that I grew up with. It grinds nice & even every time in a matter of seconds. The increase in power makes me wonder whether this one will last as long as my previous one, but even if it only lasts half the time it will still have been well worth it. I hope they never change or stop selling this classic.

Cons: 1) It's loud, but you only have to listen for a couple seconds. 2) It grinds pretty fine. For me this isn't a problem, but some people may not like that.

I had one very similar but broke down after 15 years of use and thought that a burr conical grinder would be a better choice/upgrade for my Aeropress, but after trying out a couple, I've found the consistency of the grinds to be inconsistent. Didn't work well at all with my Aeropress. So that's why I went back to my old one. This looked almost identical to my old one and the reviews were good , so I picked one up. And I have been satisfied with it ever since. I just hope this one will last me another 15 years. I use a fine to a very fine grind, and this does a great job. Cheap in this case, only applies to the price, and not the quality. A perfect marriage for my Aeropress.
I use it to grind spices, mainly mustard and peppercorns
Works great, pretty easy to clean.
Great. Good power, I was a little worried it's be difficult to get a course grind on coffee because of the power it might go to fast but hasn't been a problem. Grinds spices and coffee equally well.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a good grinder, I was hard on mine and it ...
reviews.reviewText:
It's a good grinder, I was hard on mine and it broke.
I've had it for 5 months. I use it a lot and I grind lots of hard and/or sticky herbs. The blades are screwed on with plastic threads. They stripped out, so now the blades just spin off and won't grind anything. I guess I will need to buy a grinder with metal parts.
I think if you only grind coffee, this will work fine for a long time. It is simple.
Good
It was a gift for my son, but he seems to really like it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Well designed, best value, built to last
reviews.reviewText: Had one of these for 10+ years and used it daily, lasted longer than my marriage and never once complained about me not doing the dishes or taking out the trash. Simple but effective design, extremely well built. As others posted, to adjust the fineness of grind, just pulse and/or shake it as you grind, and after a bit of time you will learn to how much time it takes and the sound it makes to get the right grind. I use a gold conical filter and rarely if ever have a problem with the coffee pot getting fine silt at the bottom, and I brew really dark coffee. It's also advisable to use a small brush every few times to clean the grinds that build up inside the lid and around the grinder bowl. This is true of any grinder. Also used with mediocre quality espresso machine and found it adequate, but if you spend $$$+ on an espresso maker and have the skills and/or desire to pull barista quality espresso shots, might as well spend another $250+ on a decent burr grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: He frolics about with the Krups device like Carmen Miranda
reviews.reviewText:
Our Uncle Hubert has a very primitive way of doing things. Sometimes he line-dries his collection of mohair t-shirts and rainbow colored socks. Loose teeth from the youngins in the house are tied to a string that stretches to the back of his Toro 34 horsepower sit-in lawn mower (The noise actually makes it quite painless). As for coffee beans, he used to pulverize them at the crack of dawn with the bottom of his wing-tipped heals, which date back to the Han Dynasty.

The problem with this heal-slamming of beans into grounds was that Uncle Hubie would have to begin at 4 in the morning. Sometimes he would not finish until "The Price is Right" would come on. How can we possibly watch a skinny Drew Carey without not so much as single cup of coffee in our digestive systems?

Lenora and I had to put our foot down. Not on the beans, but on our Uncle's rigid and unyielding grip on all things dogmatic and Nixonian. He still insists on Miracle Whip for God's sake! So we sat him down and told him about your Krups coffee and spice grinder. He hemmed and hawed but after playing a few rounds of Russian Roulette with the egg-beaters, he came around.

Well, let me tell you! Uncle Hubie now sleeps well past six. In less than a minute, the grounds are pulverized and ready. He frolics about with the Krups device like Carmen Miranda. He has pulverized cinnamon sticks, aspirin, and Legos as well.

Thank you for this liberating device. We are looking forward to the cha-cha sounds each day. Hubie plans to shred some dill weed soon, as we are expecting company. I might even give a go at pulverizing my Kaluha-spiced pumpkin seeds. It shall be done in lickety-split time.

We no longer watch M.A.S.H.
I bought this several years ago and works great ...
Not too loud, great for herbs & coffee
for my use it was a bit messy to handle. maybe i needed a bigger one.

Love this grinder. Absolutely destroys whatever I put in it, which is exactly what I want. I would NOT recommend coffee as this thing would turn it to dust, but for toasted spices, salt, or anything else you want to powderize, this is you baby.

Worked great since Nov. 2013. Now it has seized up and is not worth trying to get it repaired. The really sad fact is I used it for grinding grapeseeds and whole black pepper at the rate of once every 3 months. That's minimal use. I trashed it and will not recommend this product. It was obviously made to wear out very quickly!

If hold it for more than seven seconds it can bring some of it down to complete powder while the other pieces are all different too-large sizes. I have also tried various ways of pulsing and none of it works.

I am still trying to find a coffee bean grinder they can actually grind a decent coffee bean. My husband once purchased me a coffee bean grinder that was three times the cost of this one which she saw recommended by Alton Brown but that didn't work either. reviews.reviewTitle: Great in theory, Nonfunctional in reality. Please read the 1/5 reviews before making a purchase for this item.
reviews.reviewText:
I have never felt the need to write a review for any product I have ordered on Amazon.

However, I felt it was important that I post my experience with this Krups Coffee Maker, so as to save someone the time and money in trying this product.

The problems started IMMEDIATELY when I was following the instructions to clean the coffee maker. I filled the reservoir with water & loaded the pot on the warmer. I pushed the grind off button & it beeped, but nothing happened. (No water pumped) The instructions say the LED screen should show a flashing coffee cup and it was not there. I then gave up on being able to use that button on the machine and attempted to use whole beans to see if the machine functioned at all.

I was happy to see that when I selected the number of cups, strength of coffee, and coarseness of the grind the machine started to make coffee after pressing "Grind | Brew". The coffee brewed quickly and tasted great. I was happy to keep trying the machine even if I wasn't able to brew using the ground coffee option. (I had bought this for whole beans anyways). I went to bed after setting the auto-start function for 6 cups with whole beans for the next morning.

I woke up to the sound of the machine grinding down the hallway. The machine isn't extremely loud, but in my small apartment i was able to hear it while sleeping. This is not an issue and I actually liked hearing it knowing I would be having some hot coffee in 10 minutes when my alarm goes off.

I grab my 6 cups of freshly made hot coffee and pour a mug and put the rest back on the heater. The coffee again tasted great, and I finish my morning routine. After loading my travel cup with the remaining coffee I attempt to turn the heater off. Nothing works. I follow the instructions, and nothing works. The troubleshooting section is a joke. I am unable to press any of the buttons on the machine to make anything change on the LCD screen. It still blinks with the coffee mug (indicating heating) instead of turning off. I decide to unplug the machine like the troubleshooting section suggests. When I plugged it back, again nothing happened on the LCD screen. Again, none of the buttons did anything. I could hear a very faint buzzing noise within the machine. After several attempts of plugging the machine in to no avail I decided to give up on this machine.

The whole idea that this machine would allow me to use whole beans, and have freshly ground hot coffee at a set time when I wake up was what sold me on this product. There are plenty of comments like mine where the machine is great in theory, but in reality it is poorly made and does not function. I am returning this item tomorrow and will continue looking for a new coffeemaker. I am sad that this one did not work and has shown in its very short time with me several catastrophic issues. I REALLY wanted to like this machine.

Unfortunately, this item is a 1/5 for me and I strongly recommend AGAINST buying this.

I should have taken a look at the amount of 1 star reviews before making the plunge, and you should too. Don't just take my word for it.

While this does grind the coffee beans well it does have one flaw. The cord is really short for me. It would be nice if you could take the compartment that the grinds are in off of the base instead of having to turn the entire machine over to pour out the grinds.
Love it. I've owned this coffee grinder before and it is simply the best.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for BBQ, but did not last long at all
reviews.reviewText:
UPDATE: I am updating my review and downgrading to 2 star. This product worked great, but I honestly only used it about a dozen times before it stopped. I was using this for my BBQ spices (peppercorns, etc) and it worked great. My wife washed it out to use it for other ingredients and the internals must have rusted. The motor sounds like it is trying to spin, but the blade is just siezed. I can hardly rotate it by hand. I tried PB blaster, WD-40, etc. No avail.

Kitchen item should not fail this easily. I'm not sure if I just had a defective unit (bad seal somewhere or something). It is unfortunate because it worked great when it worked. I just opened the unit up and can't easily access the blade. Will have to find a new grinder.

ORIGINAL REVIEW
I use this thing to ground up spices for my BBQ recipes. All of the recipes call for 'finely ground kosher salt'.... and 'finely ground bacon bits' - well guess what? You can't just buy those things. I bought this and it works perfectly. It turns kosher salt into powder in about 5 seconds. I tried doing the same in my food processor to no avail.

The best part? This grinder is SMALL - it can just get tucked away in the back of a cabinet. It is perfect if you are only looking for something to use once every few weeks.

You simply throw in the coffee beans, hold down the grinding lever, and, voila, you have wonderfully smelling, fine-ground coffee for your coffeemaker in a matter of seconds.

Literally the best coffee grinder out there! I have had one for about a year and recently purchased one as a gift as well. It is inexpensive and gets the job done. There really is no need for a fancier grinder when this one works so so well.

This is a great coffee grinder, but too much stuff gets stuck. That is why I'm giving it four instead of five stars. It should come with a small, scraping spatula to clear the areas where grounds collect. We are actually using it to grind dog food, so it might perform better on coffee beans.
Krups has always satisfied. I had myasthenia one for many years and expect the same with this one.

Very good

I have had a few coffee grinders and this KRUPS F203 works like a gem. My previous grinder which was a Cuisine Art coffee grinder broke since I tried to grind rock salt (long story). I replaced it with this model and so far so good.

The weakness of these grinders is inability to get consistently ground coffee. Since there is no timer but a button to pulse and grind. You do eventually get a feel for pulsing for a few seconds. I shake my grinder for a few seconds to try to make the ground coffee as uniform as possible. Any more than 4 seconds and the beans go right through my re-usuable gold mesh filter.

I would recommend for simple coffee grinding. I have yet to try and grind pepper or other spices.

reviews.reviewTitle: So-so; makes me appreciate my old unit much more!
reviews.reviewText:
I've taken this for its first spin tonight, looking to take French Roast beans to an Espresso (fine) grind.

Using this really makes me appreciate my old unit. That unit is gone now, but I had no idea how good I had it before. :(

I bought this unit in hopes that it would perform on par with the old unit, and probably outlast it. Thus far, this unit's performance is sub-par, the lack of a removable grind cup (cited in another review) is a much larger issue than I anticipated, and the consistency of the grind isn't as good as the other unit.

I understand this isn't a burr grinder, but I wouldn't recommend this unit if you're making, say, Moka pot coffee.

UPDATE: If I crank on this for a six-to-eight second spin, yes, I can get a consistent and fine grind. BUT I'm probably going to end up using a dollar-store toothbrush to clean out the hopper, as I suspect using this for that long with old coffee grounds at the bottom of the hopper is a recipe for burnt-tasting coffee when old and new grounds intermingle. So, for me, the final verdict remains unchanged: it seems a fine grinder, but it is way too messy to be above about first third in the pack.
The old one's little slider on the side that makes it run broke - The new one should last as long as the first!

Highly recommend. The oval shape is excellent in terms of it's physics. The power of the grinder is strong & sturdy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Burning smell but working product that does what it advertises.
reviews.reviewText: The reviews for this product were really favorable and the performance grinding spices was just what I was hoping for. The longer you hold or pulse the grind button the finer things get until you have powder. The reason I'm taking one star off is that after 5-10 seconds of continuous grinding, or 20 seconds of pulsed grinding I smell burning lubricant from the motor of this device. I think it should have had a better way to ventilate it to keep the motor cool than just putting some holes on the bottom. I can prevent a lot of the burning smell if I blow into the vent holes to cool the engine while it's grinding, and this is why the motor itself should be pushing vent air. I can't be sure this effects the longevity of the product since I only recently started using it, but I know it doesn't help the smell of my kitchen when it's in use. Otherwise, it's a great grinder for the price and I recommend it over some other models that are much more expensive that do the same thing.

I purchased this after learning the importance of certified "bird-friendly" coffee, which I can only find locally in whole bean form. Coffee has traditionally been grown in a shady forest environment, but new mass-marketed sun-grown coffee plantations (Dunkin, Starbucks) are rapidly decimating the winter migration habitats of our songbirds. They clear the forests in order to grow more coffee faster. Birds flying to South America will not survive without their ancestral forests, and whole species are endangered. Birds can, however, thrive in the shade-grown coffee farms that supply certified bird-friendly coffee.
The grinder works well. Put down a dishtowel for easier cleanup: the transfer of grounds into a storage container can be messy. Use a small brush to move caked grounds from the grinder cup.
You can find ground bird-friendly coffee online: Audubon bird-friendly coffee Audubon Breakfast Blend Ground, 12-Ounce (Pack of 2)

reviews.reviewTitle: Blades get stuck and damages/breaks the motor.
reviews.reviewText:
There is no simple way to clean this grinder. The blades get stuck if there is residue under them (around the shaft) and the motor will get damaged due to the high torque. I tried using a blush so the bristles can clean under the blades but it doesn't seem to help.

This might be due to grinding things other than coffee beans such as chia seeds. I think a blade removal guide or procedure could help to clean it better and prevent build up under the blades. This is the second KRUPS grinder that has broken this way and it has been frustrating to find a fix.

I buy whole bean coffee ~ grind it ~ breathe in the fresh roasted aroma ~ brew ~ enjoy!!!

I have had this product 3 months. I used it to grind flaxseed once a week. After 3 months (approximately 12 uses), it doesn't work. The motor just "grinds," and the blades won't turn. Very disappointed! It worked well when it worked...
Good
Works great, love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use & does the job done!
reviews.reviewText: This is an affordable grinder that gets the job done. Very pleased with this product. It can grind a large amount at once. All the beans come out very finely ground.

I've used it thrice, and so far it's working alright. But don't get this grinder if you need any kind of consistency to your grind -- e.g. you're using a French press or cold brew. After pressing the button for a few seconds, I've ended up with still intact beans along with grounds that were too fine all in the same batch together (sort of like when your hot pocket comes out of the microwave steaming hot on the outside and ice cold on the inside). It also doesn't have a huge capacity -- about 3 ounces or so.
Just replaced old Krups, same model, with this. The first one lasted over ten years before it began to crack after daily use. Overall extremely well-built. This grinder has exceeded our expectations.

reviews.reviewTitle: KRUPS F203 Electric Spice and Coffee Grinder with Stainless Steel Blades, 3 oz / 85 g’, Black
reviews.reviewText: This item has very short life - TRY OTHER COMPANIES. I AM VERY DISAPPOINTING!!!! BROKE VERY EASY
Works good

reviews.reviewTitle: Dont do this to yourself, get the Hamilton Beach grinder.
reviews.reviewText: The item itself smells burnt when using it, not sure what it is. It's a simple button you press to grind and not all of the coffee beans grind equally. It feels really cheap compared to the Hamilton Beach one I just bought. It's more accurate and just feels better overall. I don't recommend this Krups model.
This grinder works great for my coffee beans. Haven't tried anything else in it but I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best whirlybird grinder, still working since 1986
reviews.reviewText:
Glad to see they're still selling the wonderful Krups grinder. Ours has been in use nearly every day since 1986 and still going strong. Now it's time to buy one for our daughter.

This grinder is fine for drip machine or french press coffee with a good filter. But it is NOT for espresso -- a rotating blade type grinder will not produce a uniform grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect solution at a reasonable cost
reviews.reviewText: Inexpensive, and works perfectly for grinding spices. I do a lot of barbecue and dry rubs, and one of the secrets is to use freshly ground spices... particularly pepper, which goes stale rather quickly once it's ground. This grinder has been the perfect solution!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well as a spice grinder
reviews.reviewText: We dont grind coffee beans at home. Our primary motivation to buy this product was to use it as an affordable spice grinder. After a month of use, we are happy with it. It does grind very well. The motor is relatively quiet and the grinding time is short. Cleaning is not the easiest but we have cleaned worse before. Recommend this product as a spice grinder.
My wife loved it!
Great little grinder

Don't bother buying any other spice or coffee grinder that uses a blade. This one is a champ. Powerful and durable, it grinds spice and coffee fast. I love it. I used it to grind a pound of coffee without the unit overheating or smelling. Others I have used wouldn't survive that kind of torture.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder for my whole bean coffee
reviews.reviewText: Replaced an old Mr. Coffee grinder I had. Works great and less time to grind. Takes 12 tablespoons of whole beans in the lid, which is about the max I would use.
Works perfect, easy to clean, super tidy to store! Grinds awesome!
Compact and does the job

This is a great product to have in the kitchen. Indian cooking requires grinding spices,grains,green chillies n cilantro a lot. It forms a fine powder or paste..Easy to use n clean. A must have. My mom liked it so much,that she wanted to take it to India but the voltage differences don't permit it!

Update:
I use it to grind flaxseeds and it works well for that.

---
A burr coffee grinder protects the grinds from becoming burnt...
I guess it's an ok little machine. Once I got to my house, though, I was wondering if our magic bullet would have done the same job. I used it for a couple days and may use it again (or for grinding other things, who knows) but I bought a capresso burr grinder and that one works MAGICALLY. this one is hard to clean. I'll hang onto it if I need it, though, as it was a wedding gift and it DOES work. It will give you a nice grind if you let it.
Quick, and effective grinder! A little on the loud side though

reviews.reviewTitle: it works great, it can grind them to really fine powder
reviews.reviewText:
I use it to grind spices and grains, it works great, it can grind them to really fine powder.
I used another customers advice; to grind some rice to get rid of any strong odor, and it works.
No problems
Love having freshly ground coffee for my lattes. Great product!
I love my Krups coffee grinder! Fresh ground coffee tastes much better. No grind adjustment besides just watching how long you grind for. Very reliable.
I use this to ground whole cardamom for use in cooking. Works well.

I bought this so I could grind up flax seeds for the full nutrition benefit. I was worried that all the seeds wouldn't get grinded but I was absolutely wrong. Operation was quick and easy, and clean up was a breeze. This is perfect for anyone looking for an effective, yet inexpensive grinder for nuts, seeds, and coffee beans.
Great quality. Love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good quality at a good price
reviews.reviewText: Used it as soon as I received it. Worked great

reviews.reviewTitle: and time to get a perfect grind every time
reviews.reviewText:
I was thinking about replacing my old one with one of the expensive burr mill types, but I just could not justify it. My old one served me faithfully for years, way longer than I ever suspected. Somehow I lost it due to a change in residence, so I purchased a new one. The basic trick I learned was using a combination of sound, feel, and time to get a perfect grind every time.
Note: This review is for the Krups F203.

reviews.reviewTitle: All you need in a grinder.
reviews.reviewText: Used it for years now. Zero problems. Perfect grind each time - coarse or fine. Buy it.
Love this grinder! Fast efficient and easy to use!

reviews.reviewTitle: I think it's a great price and easy to use
reviews.reviewText: I use this coffee grinder as my spice grinder. I think it's a great price and easy to use. Wish it was a bit easier to clean or had some sort of pouring spout when dumping out the ground spices, but is overall a good buy. Would buy again.

The Krups grinder works fantastic. I get my grind for my coffee pot in a matter of seconds. I'm giving this product three stars for a huge oversight. It doesn't seem to have bothered other reviewers but to me; it overshadows the grinder. The basket and blade is at the top of the grinder and the cord is at the bottom. The basket does not detach from the grinder to dump contents so you have to pick up the whole grinder to get out your coffee grinds and to clean it. I was planning on using this as my spice grinder also, which it does really well, but I have to unplug it and handle the whole thing to get my spices over to my cookware. It's awkward and annoying. I don't understand why the basket doesn't detach from the body. I just don't understand it. Seems like simple design to me.
Husband uses it every week

This is a very good grinder and for the price, it is great. The other reviews are correct that the ground coffee is not uniform due to the way this blender style grinder works. This results in powder and particles, so this is not a grinder for a perfection seeking coffee aficionado. But the coffee smell is wonderful and the taste is very good.
Perfect! Haven't used it as much as we would like but runs perfect when we do!

reviews.reviewTitle: So much better than other brands
reviews.reviewText: We bought this to replace a Mr. Coffee one that we had for about a year, which broke. What is great about this is that it has a larger oval button that is pushed in when you use it. Other brands, like the Mr. Coffee one have such a small one that gets jammed with grounds. This one is maybe a few dollars more, but is worth it.
really good grinder, recommend
Was a gift
Great product

reviews.reviewTitle: A little coarse but otherwise very good
reviews.reviewText: Overall this is a pretty good product. It’s my first coffee grinder so I have nothing to compare it to, but it leave the coffee a little more coarse than I was expecting. But other than that it’s a good product.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is excellent - delivers a very nice grind and is expecially ...

working very good
It grinds coffee, its cheap, it still works after roughly a year of everyday use.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a replacement for the one we got 30 ...

reviews.reviewTitle: ) It has a very nice design and it's not too loud

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it, I am glad I purchased this one.
reviews.reviewText: Great product. I love it. It was a replacement for a different brand that eventually broke. It is quiter, better, grinds my coffee to powder, I am glad I bought this one and am very happy with it.

Simple to use and nicely designed. Only flaw on this that the top lid is hard to open. The plastic top and bottom touches so closely that it creates a suction and it creates a problem to open it quickly. Otherwise it grinds very fine.
For that kind of price you cannot go wrong.

This grinder gets the job done very well. Its fast speed and uniquely-shaped bowl allow for as even a grind as you'll get for a portable hand-pulsed grinder. The grounds tend to stick to the bottom, but this is a problem I haven't seen one portable grinder overcome. In spite of its simplicity, it has a rather attractive look that will accent any kitchen.
Awesome! I love it! I can grind coffee and cinnamon to perfection! Love it!

I use this to grind up flaxseed to put in oatmeal. It’s not super noisy (for this use, anyway) and grinds the seeds into a nice powder, quickly.
Awesome!

Also, if you're doing a fine grind, it's sometimes hard to get very fine unless you fill it at least 2/3. But generally works well, and no problems with the motor.
The size is small; takes no space on a countertop, grinds coffee fine or coarse, depending on the time you permit it to grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: This coffee grinder is perfect for my needs
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder is perfect for my needs. I use it to grind flax seed that I put in my smoothies! I little messy, but what can you do? I just wipe it down with a paper towel.

reviews.reviewTitle: great counter size and grinds quickly
reviews.reviewText: Luv it!! great counter size and grinds quickly.

reviews.reviewTitle: It works well but is a bit hard to clean ...

Very efficient

I was rinsing it out after each use, but found that to be really annoying, so I just purchased a brush for it and that works much better. If you don't need to grind a ton of beans, this would work great.

reviews.reviewText: I bought this in July and only used it a handful of times and it stopped working. Was great when it worked but I don't understand how its not working now. It had not been dropped, exposed to water, cords never tangled, etc. Now whe yoy try to use it it only makes a humming sound.
Decided to start buying whole bean coffee for freshness and this grinder works very well.
Good coffee grinder.
This thing does the job. It’s a little hard to clean though.
Works great. The only downside which isn't that bad is there coffee grounds get stuck on the bottom of the grinder and you have to use something to scrape them off otherwise this thing is excellent.

It grinds well. The downside is that it's not the easiest to scoop out or pour the grinds out as the blade is in the way. The blade makes cleaning the grinder a little difficult as well. It would be great if the blade was detachable. It's not perfect but a great grinder and a great value.
Does the job

This product is outstanding. I purchased this over 6 years ago on Amazon. It faithfully grinds our coffee beans daily nonstop. It does a fantastic job. Why on earth would you buy anything else? I cannot endorse this product highly enough!

It’s fine if you’re in a pinch but this grinder underwhelms. Difficult to control the grind with some ground fine while there are still whole beans in the pile. Also difficult to see through the plastic and judge the grind once it gets going.
works amazing ! love it !
Grinds way to fine
I use this to grind my coffee beans every morning. I have used it for a couple of months and I have not had any problems. If your looking for utility and value go with this one.

Good ol' grinder, easy to use and let's you control the grind. Will make a very fine powder if needed (we like this for espresso). Also excellent as a spice grinder. Get two so your coffee doesn't taste like Indian food! :)
I've been using it for 2 years and still works great

reviews.reviewTitle: No more buying “older” ground coffee from the store!

I like this. I produces evenly ground coffee beans. It is a bit of a tussle to get the lid off but I am happy with it.
Nice grinder.
Quick and efficient, is a bit noisy but that to be expected.

I own 2 of these. The first one purchased 20+ years ago. One for spices one for coffee.

I have never had a problem with this grinder "overheating" the beans.
Easy to use and effective grinder for spices.
Highest recommendation.
Excelent piece.

I've owned this grinder for about a year now and it wonderful! My colleague and I use this everyday at work for our morning coffee and have had no issues whatsoever with quality or speed. I have one of these and love it for my coffee beans. I bought this one for a spice grinder. They work very well and easy to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does its job exactly as expected
reviews.reviewText:
Me and my fiance have been moving from pre-ground coffee to full coffee beans, so we naturally picked something that was inexpensive to test it out. After seeing the overwhelming positive reviews on Amazon, it was a no-brainer to pick this one up.

Operationally, this thing couldn't be any simpler; throw in coffee beans, plug in the device, and push the only button on it to grind. Cleaning is sometimes a hassle as there is little space between the blade and the bottom of the grinding bowl, but I don't think that there's any real away around it.

We use ours everyday for the last month or so, and have no real complaints.

A little loud (duh, it’s grinding beans but I am a little sensitive to noise) but an amazing, compact coffee bean grinder regardless. I have limited storage living in an apartment and genuinely appreciate its small sizing.
Loved this product, but only lasted 2 months. I don’t even use this product everyday. I went to use it yesterday morning and you can hear the motor running but no movement with the blades.

reviews.reviewTitle: Put cofee (or other bean) in top, comes out of top.
reviews.reviewText: There is no fine to coarse grind adjustment. It is just dependent on how long you leave it running. Did not like that. The beans go in the top, then once ground, come out of the top so there is a limited about of beans which can be ground up. It worked great however on flaxseed where other grinders did not.
Seem to go through coffeemakers every year. Like what we’re seeing so far. Time will tell...
put extra bucks and buy other one
Works great. Just try and dedicate each one you buy to its own spice/herb/bean.

This is my second one of these; my first one only lasted 8 months. I cleaned it using water (not while plugged in) and the blade stopped turning. I realize it's not meant for liquid so I'm not holding that one against the product. It's easy to use and quick. I only use it for coffee.
What I liked most about the Krups Grinder was the smooth and quick results of the grind. My coffee beans came out perfectly!

Good little grinder. Super easy to use and clean. Grinds coffee and herbs really well. It'll chop herbs in like 2 seconds and completely pulverize them in like 10. Works great for the price and does exactly what it says it will do. Works very nicely with the aeropress
East to clean and works like a charm.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compact and powerful grinder. By design, you might ...
reviews.reviewText: Compact and powerful grinder. By design, you might find a bean or two that haven't been ground - that will always happen with these rotary blades. I do not use it for coarse grinds (as used in a French Press, for example), but it works well for drip type grinds.
This grinder is quieter than my previous one, does the job for espresso grind, and wipes out easily.

We use ours for grinding up spices. We have been trying to cut back on salt and make our own taco and spagetti seasonings. We had it down but for spagetti we prefered the spices to be ground up more. This is perfect for doing just that. We don't use it that often so no problems at all yet.

I haven't really put this item to a test yet, so I can't honestly promote it. It does seem to be well-built enough to do what I have in mind and it would probably grind coffee beans well. I'm not going to grind coffee beans though. My intentions will not really be as bad hard on it as the beans anyways.
My wife loves this product.

I bought this to make Texas Gunpowder. It worked great! Now I can spice up my favorite dishes. One good way to clean it is to use a can or air. Be sure to wear a mask and gloves when working with ground up dehydrated jalapenos.

Love having one for coffee beans , one for spices.
I’ve got one for coffee and one for spices. Deserves every star

Works Great and not too loud. Thank you for such a great product.

Last year I purchased a De'Longhi EC155 15 BAR Pump Espresso and Cappuccino Maker and tried various pre-gorund coffees looking for that perfect coffee. While on my search I received a mailing with a free sample of Gevalia coffee. It had a wonderful taste that I had yet to find in any of my old favorites or any of the newer brands I had tried. The one thing I noticed about the Gevalia coffee that I thought might make all the difference, it was ground to a near-powder. I eventually got around to ordering this KRUPS 203-42 Electric Spice and Coffee Grinder with Stainless Steel Blades, Black. The grinder coupled with a bag of Eight O'Clock Coffee, 100% Colombian Whole Bean, 33-Ounce Bag made for......... WOW.
BINGO.... the taste of the Eight O'Clock Coffee, freshly ground to a near-powder, tasted just as good as the Gevalia at a fraction of the cost.

I ordered this just to grind flaxseed. It arrived today and I was fresh out, so this was perfect timing. Poured in the hole seeds and 7 seconds later I had extremely fine ground flaxseed.
