This grinder gets the jobs done. I have absolutely no complaints and I have used it a few dozen times. I love it.
Great Grinder! I use it to grind flax seeds. Works perfect.

This is my second Krups coffe grinder and will be my last. The first was used (given by a friend who purchased another) and lasted three months. I purchased the second one in Febtuary 2017. It stopped this morning after less than a year of use. Save your money.
I used this a few times to grind flax seeds. It works very well. It's a little tricky to clean; you can't really get it wet. I wipe it with a baby wipe, then a wet paper towel.
This grinds my coffee beans to a pulp! I got this Bc my dad had one of these for several years and no issues.
No problem with the products function, just know that it is small. It does however work very well and effectively grinds my beans. Great starter grinder for me, I feel.
Works well
High powered, sharp bland, perfectly grounded product. Easy to use, sleek and easy to store in the cabinet because of size. I love making French presses at home with my grinder!!

I live in an apartment and think my neighbors can hear me grinding my coffee beans every morning. I've had no complaints but this machine seems loud to me. However, it works like a champ. I would recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: it is super messy. When you go to take the lid ...
reviews.reviewText: I use this to grind my coffee and as it does that very well, it is super messy. When you go to take the lid off after grinding coffee beans, the grounds get all over my cabinet so it’s not something I would use every day like I did my old grinder. Like I said, it does a great job at grinding the beans, the lid is just not very ergonomically friendly

reviews.reviewTitle: So I am very satisfied with it
reviews.reviewText: I had an older one from a well-know company that took a lot longer to grind coffee beans. I would have to run it a few times to get rid of larger chunks of beans. To be fair, I think I bought it in the 1990s so it had a long life. This one works in seconds and it does exactly what I want it to do. So I am very satisfied with it.

This is a great little grinder. I like my coffee ground to fine powder, and this does the trick. 10 seconds in this thing, and I'm good to go in either my espresso machine or my drip coffee maker. I use the same grind for both. The fine grind allows me to use less coffee in the drip machine and still get really strong coffee.
Works as it should. I shake it to get extra fine grounds faster.
Good product.

I just got the coffee maker, it smells, has water inside but not outside or in the box, I am afraid somebody used it and returned it somehow, I use water to run it, I rinse out coffee residue, clearly, somebody used it to make coffee before
Overall good product. Just wish there was easier way to transfer the coffee grinds — felt like I really had to scoop between the blades to get all of the grinds out

I was looking to buy a coffee grinder for the first time. I wanted something that was: a) simple to use, b) easy to clean, and c) not too expensive. This product meets all of these requirements for me. All you have to do is dump in the beans, put on the lid, and press down on one button. You press the button for as long as you want, depending on how fine you want the coffee grinds to be. I've been using this coffee grinder almost daily for about two months and I'm happy I bought this one.

I used it less than 10 times as a spice grinder. I've had it for about 3 months. Now I plug it in and try to get it to work. It makes a buzzing noise but the blade doesn't move at all. Thus, it is just an expensive paper weight. Unfortunate waste of money.
Good product 👍🏻
As discribed

I'm very happy with this coffee grinder. It took a while to figure out how many pulses to create the perfect grind, but now each pot of coffee is flawless. I would also recommend not over filling it, since it works best when there's some extra room for the grinds to circulate.
Absolutely love this! Grinds my coffee beans super fast and easy to clean out
I have only had this grinder since May 2019 and it has already stopped working. I was under the impression that Krups was a good brand. Can I get a refund or a replacement?

reviews.reviewTitle: Really good product. Only think that keeps me from giving ...
reviews.reviewText: Really good product. Only think that keeps me from giving it 5/5 is that it's kind of a hassle to get the last of the grounds out of the product. It sticks and doesn't come out well. (I've only used it for coffee beans.)

I use this daily for grinding flax seed. It works perfectly in just a few seconds. I've also used it with dried guava leaves for tea and it works fine with that although you surely don't want to grind the leaves too fine. This device will grind things up to a powder if you're inattentive.

reviews.reviewTitle: I am happy to buy krups coffee/spice grinder
reviews.reviewText: I really like this grinder for everyday use .I like to put herb/spice in morning time tea its work very quiet and smooth its grind course to fine.I grind couple of blend spice everday for fresh aroma and smell for my food ,delivery as so fast i ordered today next day i got my krups both grinder.thanks amazon

reviews.reviewTitle: Effective and perfect size. Fine grind and a little loud.
reviews.reviewText: Quick and effective. Pretty loud if you run it on the counter, but if you pick it up and shake it as it runs, it grinds faster, more even and is much quieter. Gets a pretty fine grind, so be ready for some silt if you're using a french press or anything other than a paper filter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great tool! I grind the beans for 5 seconds
reviews.reviewText: Great tool! I grind the beans for 5 seconds. Works very well. I'm going to get another one for my Dad's Xmas present
Fine for the money. Not great. Motor stopped working after about a year. (I only ever used it to grind coffee beans.)

This was ordered as a replacement for one I've had for at least ten years. It gets used at least three times a week and the old one probably would have lasted forever if I hadn't insisted on cleaning it with soap and water so often. Even though I was very careful, eventually, moisture got into the bearings and it froze up. Won't treat this replacement the same!
Still, seventeen bucks over ten years is chump change.
Great grinder. Worth it

Haven't had a single issue with this grinder. Also, I couldn't recommend getting whole bean and grinding it fresh more if I tried. I'm not a food connoisseur by any standards, but damn does pre-groude Starbucks espresso taste like a pot plain coffee compared to grinding the beans myself.
Love it. I use it for seeds and it does a wonderful job. Great little grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good quality. Wish the cord was longer
reviews.reviewText: Very good quality. Wish the cord was longer. Like the design of the on/off switch. Seems quite safe, as this thing could easily take off a couple of your fingertips if you're not careful.
I'm really happy with this. I was using a chopper/grinder and it would leave my coffee in little chunks where as this product gets it nice and fine, exactly what I was looking for.

The last one lasted 30 years and I hope to get that long out of this one. I only use it for coffee beans. I like hihg oil coffee and it dies tend to stick in the corners, but it scrapes out easily with a regular spoon. When I do regular coffee for company, nothing sticks.
Bought as a gift

It's a great product for people who like to grind the beans and then brew it immediately.
Usually I like to grind a whole bunch of beans for a week then put it in a container so this one is a little too small for me.
It's definitely a nice product though.

reviews.reviewTitle: Save your money and buy this instead of an expensive burr grinder
reviews.reviewText: Small, simple, works fast, and grinds without heating up the beans like burr grinders do. You just need to experiment with how long to grind for your purposes. For French press, I use 3 short bursts, then shake the grinder and do another short burst (twice) for course grind.
Easy to use, easy to clean, not too noisy.

I use this to grind egg shells for the garden. Tried food processor and blender with okay results, but this puppy breaks them up into near powder form. Not near as noisy as my old (1980s) grinder. Love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well for Spices and is easy to clean.
reviews.reviewText: I use it for spices. It gets a nice fine grind, and is easy to clean. I haven't tried it with coffee yet.
Great

Works fine. Easy to use. I'd hoped it would do larger amounts at one time, but what it does is okay. Is a little more difficult to clean than an earlier coffee grinder I had., but it does a good speedy job of grinding beans for brewing. Have not used it on spices.
Disappointed. Used about 8 times in last six months and no longer works.
This thing is strong. You determine how fine your coffee should be by how long you hold down the on switch. Easy to clean and I can enjoy fresh ground coffee when I want to.
Very inexpensive but gets the job done with a press of a button. Coffee is ground evenly and very fine in a few seconds.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grab a wide container and you'll be all set with this one
reviews.reviewText: Used it regularly for the last week and really like it so far. The shape is a little awkward to work with and I suggest you have a wide container to pour the ground coffee into, unless you like making messes. Spins up fast and doesn't hesitate when processing a full load of beans. I am really happy with it so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: really pretty and makes great coffee
reviews.reviewText: Love this coffee maker, it works great and makes fresh coffee. My only complaint is that it goes through a TON of coffee beans, more than my last, fresh ground coffee maker.
used this coffee grinder for the last 3 years with no problem whatsoever it is a little loud but it gets the job done daily
Grinds coffee really well
This is a decent coffee grinder but not at all a spice grinder.

My favorite little coffee grinder! I first bought this model over 14 years ago and loved it. It finally went out on me and couldn't find it at the time.. went through a couple others in about 3 years. FINALLY thought to check on Amazon and bought it!

I bought this product, based on reviews at Amazon, to grind whole star anise. It works like a charm. Just be careful to not load up too many stars at a time as then comes out uneven in grind. Have had noproblems with cleaning it. Use sopa and water on the top and clean out grnider with damp paper towel or cloth
Love it
OMG yes it does it ,and so well I get powder ready herbs to backed with it grinds all herbs and nuts wow we love it

reviews.reviewTitle: For the $$ there must be better ones
reviews.reviewText: very unhappy I missed the return window: it puts coffee grounds in the coffee, hard to see how much water is in the reservoir. For the $$ there must be better ones

reviews.reviewTitle: ... all the coffee beans well but it does a great job I have not found one full Coffee Bean ...
reviews.reviewText: When I purchase this item months ago I was worried that it wasn't going to crush up all the coffee beans well but it does a great job I have not found one full Coffee Bean on the crush since I got it and I use it everyday

Bought this for my husband for Christmas and he just loves it! It's incredibly easy to use (one button operation!) Easy to clean as well. Plus it makes the kitchen smell great while it's grinding coffee beans :)

reviews.reviewTitle: It's great! Just be careful when cleaning it.
reviews.reviewText: This is a great coffee grinder. I use it to grind spices, not coffee. It's small so it doesn't take up much space and powerful enough to grind even hard spices. The only issue is that it might be a little hard to clean under the blade because it doesn't come off. Therefore, you have to be careful to avoid getting hurt.

reviews.reviewTitle: Burnt out motor after only 20 spins!
reviews.reviewText: I have not used this product more than 20 times (and only for grinding coffee) and the motor seems to have burned out. I'm pretty sure I didn't just overwork this thing; I drink coffee at home maybe three times per week. What sucks the most, though, is that I cannot get a replacement since Amazon's return policies establish 30 days for a return. Guess I just flushed my money down the kitchen sink!

reviews.reviewTitle: This grinder works just as we expected. My wife ...
reviews.reviewText: This grinder works just as we expected. My wife uses it to grind flax seeds and other seeds for her breakfast shakes and snacks. We have been buying ground coffee, but may switch over to unground now that we have this. Grinds very quickly and smoothly.
I didn't use this to grind coffee. But i did use this to make powdered "sugar" it came out super fine! Excited!

Priced well, sturdy dependable unit that looks good too.This product exceeds all others in it's performance. I really like it and will buy more as soon as I need it.

This product exceeds all others in it's performance. I really like it and will buy more as soon as I need it.
This is a horrible design, container is to small, has to be unplugged in order to pour ground coffee into filter.
Grinds my flax as needed.
dependable

Great for grinding seeds and coffee!
Small and doesn’t take much space on my kitchen! Love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Solid, simply, does it's job well.
reviews.reviewText: Very easy to use. I've bought 3 and had no issues with any of them. Gave two as gifts to kids who are also coffee addicts. They've been used almost exclusively for coffee and held up very well.

This is the best coffee maker I’ve ever had. If you use good beans you will get great coffee! Easy to set up and clean. You have to experiment with the setting of strength and grind size to match your taste, but you have the ability to tweak it so you can get it right.
Easy to make espresso grind but drip is hard as the beans do not grind evenly.

This is a nice little coffee grinder; it's simple and easy to use. The only concern I have is after holding the button down for a little while to grind the coffee, I get a distinct "electrical burn" smell from the grinder. The thing is still working properly, so I'm not too concerned yet.
Works great!

Super fast delivery! Packaged very well! Works as advertised. I used it for black peppercorns and made perfect fresh pepper. Cleaned it up and made some really tasty coffee. Grinds a lot of volume and very fast. Would recommend to anyone. Let’s just hope it last :)

reviews.reviewTitle: This does a really great job doing both
reviews.reviewText: I have use this to grind coffee and spices. This does a really great job doing both. The only difficult thing is cleaning it. You need to make sure it's completely dry when you're done so that the blade does not rust.

I've had several of these grinders and they are the bomb. I have two currently, one for coffee
And one for spices etc. I've had one for 20 years and it works as well as the new one. I have
Given several of these as gifts and they are always liked.

This grinder is awesome. It does the grinding extremely well, so don't hold the button for very long. You can get about 6 cups of coffee from one grind. It's quiet and easy to use. Button easy to press, even if you have arthritis.
Grider is a little loud but other wise best coffee pot I have ever owned.

reviews.reviewTitle: Kee you beans fresh and grind when your ready to use
reviews.reviewText: Very durable and easy to wipe out
works great

reviews.reviewTitle: It is good for regular uses
reviews.reviewText:
It is good for regular uses, but may cause you annoyed.
It grinds your coffee quite well, but you need to control the machine by yourself to get the right thickness of your coffee beans.
Also, the fine grinds of coffee beans stick to the bottom of the grinder, which makes you countlessly hit the machine to get it off.
If you are under low budget, you may buy this. But if you care what I wrote above and don't mind spending some more money for better quality, go for other products.
Works perfect! Just what I needed to grind flax seed and other herbs! Glad I bought this. Thanks!
Makes the daily grind manageable LOL
good product
Krups has always been a brand in my home and this is the first time I've purchased a grinder. Great product. Grinded the beans well and noise.
Stopped working after 3rd use less than a year old!
Great

I LOVE THIS GRINDER!! Easy to clean, quick, super fast grinding. Very powerful, just scoop up coffee in the lid to the grinder, dump it in, grind, flip it over, tap a time or two and voila a lid full of ground coffee. LOVE IT!!

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great little grinder
reviews.reviewText: This is a great little grinder. I use it as a compliment to my super automatic Espresso maker when I want to use a different bean than I already keep in the super automatic well. I works perfectly, cleans easily and looks good on my coffee bar.

reviews.reviewTitle: very good so far for my very light duty needs
reviews.reviewText: Grinding table spoonful of rosemary seeds into a powder. Works well and no strain, as expected. 4 stars only because my mom ground black pepper corns, filled about half way, and the machine did not last a year.
Good

reviews.reviewTitle: Just what I was looking for!
reviews.reviewText: So far this grinder has been great! No problem, and is easy to clean with a brush.

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrible product. The blade would spin when nothing was ...
reviews.reviewText: Terrible product. The blade would spin when nothing was in the grinder but when I put the beans in it would not spin at all. DO NOT RECCOMEND.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well but not easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: It works wells, I make hot peppers powder with it and it was good. The only problem is the cleaning. You can’t use water to clean it and since I used it for pepper everything else will be contaminated I’m
Love this Coffee Grinder. It grounds the beans in a matter of seconds.

We use this grinder every day and it does what it's supposed to do. No fancy settings or anything, but it grinds your coffee beans into grounds. Makes a good fresh cup of coffee. You will likely have to use a spoon to scrape some of the grounds out, but I assume this is normal.

reviews.reviewTitle: The thing I like is that it's fairly quiet
reviews.reviewText: Works perfectly and you can't beat it for the money. The thing I like is that it's fairly quiet, and larger than the average grinder. It's nice to be able to grind enough coffee for a few days rather than a single pot's worth at a time.

Coffee is fine. Carafe started to leak after 2 months of use (no mishandling). Contacted customer service, after providing my order information and product number as requested , sent me links to purchase replacement carafe. No more Krups products for me.
Works well. Have to pulse shake pulse shake. Works good but hard to get a coarse grind.
It’s frikn loud I should have gotten one reviewed as quiet. Pulverizes my seeds to dust though. I just hate that it’s noisy.
This is a perfect size, it's small so it won't take up a lot of space.

Nice little grinder. My only complaint is that the blades and areas exposed to the substance are not removable, so they have to be cleaned with a damp cloth. The blades are difficult to clean. However, for the price and compact size, this one is hard to beat.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product that should last for years!
reviews.reviewText: This is THE best grinder! I recently purchased this one, to replace the one I owned for over 30 years, that finally gave up the ghost..

I don't use this for coffee, just spices. It's quick and quiet. Very simple to use. Small and doesn't take up much space in the cupboard or on the counter. Easy to clean. Best spice grinder out there!
Broke after 6 months, and was only being used 2-3 times a month.
It grinds well, but the cup container isn't removable from the grinder base, making it a chore to clean and transfer grounds from the grinder to your coffee maker of choice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Recommend to anyone who is looking for a good grinder
reviews.reviewText: Great product, grinds well, easy to use. Had it for a month now.

reviews.reviewTitle: My second one of these and just as good as before
reviews.reviewText: My original Krups grinder that I had owned and used for years finally gave up the ghost so I got this as replacement. I wasn't willing to pay the price for a burr grinder -- I'm not that big a fanatic. This one works perfectly and is easy to clean. And for the price, hard to beat.

I see why people gave this machine such great reviews. I use it to grind Indian spices to make sure I get the freshest taste in my cooking. For the price, I was skeptical but the reviews were spot on. Buy this grinder if you are looking for a good, reasonably priced product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon box good manufacturer box bad
reviews.reviewText: Nice product, arrived dammaged but still works. Amazon packaging was undamaged, product box was broken and bottom of grinder is jarred open a little. It's probably OK and I'm planning to keep it because it appears to still function.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just enough for a fine pot of coffee!
reviews.reviewText: Works great!

reviews.reviewTitle: this is nice. similar to ones i purchased before
reviews.reviewText: this is nice. similar to ones i purchased before. gets the beans to proper consistency for our stove top coffee maker. small chamber.

reviews.reviewTitle: Could use better design when dispensing ground coffee
reviews.reviewText: Works OK. Could use better design when dispensing ground coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for grinding coffee beans or dried herbs
reviews.reviewText: Excellent product - I'm using it for grinding dried herbs from my garden, like oregano leaves and dried basil.
I don’t know how this coffee maker has so many good reviews. It’s very finicky. Impossible to make a strong cup of coffee.

The perfect simple, economical coffee grinder we use exclusively for grinding espresso beans. The oval design grinds the beans more evenly and finely than our everyday coffee grinder that is round. No matter how long we would grind the beans, there would always remain chunks too large for brewing espresso.

We just started using this grinder. There's nothing fancy about it. No settings to mess with. Just a simple grinder. I got this one after my Cuisinart "burr" grinder died after just 6 months. This grinder has a solid well made feeling to it and hopefully will last a long time. For the price I'm very satisfied with this purchase. Especially like how solid it feels. We use it to grind beans for our drip coffee machine. Hold the button for a couple of seconds and you should get a fairly fine grind. We also have an automatic expresso machine but sometimes you just need a simple cup of coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor quality! What to do now?
reviews.reviewText: I got it on April 2019, and today October 18, 2019 won't work, I used it less then 10 times for little amount of coffee, very upset 😠😠😠😠😠😠😠
Easy to use

My husband I and use this to ground coffee beans for our french press. It has worked wonderfully so far and easy to clean. We flip the main piece upside down like other reviewers have mentioned when placing the beans inside and removing them. No problems so far and very happy to have fresh ground coffee beans.

The Krups replaced a similar Braun I had for many years; it works great for my usage which is a grind for a drip coffeemaker. It quickly makes a pretty fine grind and I don't think you could get a consistently coarser grind by shortening the time.

Taking off the lid and dumping grounds into the filter is not nearly as messy as the Braun. Like most grinders it leaves some grind residue in the bottom but that's to be expected. The lid attracts very little grinds.

The only feature missing with the Krups is the wrap around cord storage which I had in the base of the Braun.
Great quality grinder! Love to use. Nothing bad to say at all. Perhaps the chord could be longer though, its only like 2-2.5 feet long
Works Very Well - Solidly Built!

I was surprised and wiered out about how cheap this grinder is, but after two years it hasn't let me and my gf down, we use it everyday sometimes twice a day to make coffee and it still works like a charm only bad thing is that it is a little hard to clean out.

reviews.reviewTitle: I would not buy this again. The design makes ...
reviews.reviewText: I would not buy this again. The design makes it hard to take the lid off without spilling the ground coffee. I would return it but I missed the opportunity.
I love it!!!!
Works great over a year no problems
Very marginal grinder. I would not buy again.
Love it

WOW is the first thing I said after my husband mixed up some spices for our dinner. I must warn you not to inhale too deep as sneezing may occur! I love how this powdery it makes our spice blends....and believe me I hand adversions to textures so this is perfect I love the flavor of onion but gag at the texture this is the answer for people like me :)
GoldDove
This little thing is great! It does a great job of grinding my coffee beans to whatever texture I would like. It is a little loud, but that is something that I don't mind. Highly recommend!

I have ground stick cinnamon, peppercorns, and flax seed.

The four star rating comes from the stick cinnamon; I could not get it completely ground and had to sift it.

The other items ground quickly and well, and I almost overground the pepper.

All in all I am very satisfied.

I've never been a coffee brewer before, this is all new to me. This grinder is the coolest tool in the kitchen . a couple of hits on the button and your coffee is ground to perfection and ready to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds up flax seed and coffee beans really well. ...
reviews.reviewText: Grinds up flax seed and coffee beans really well. Kind of on the loud side but not deafening by any means.
Good price. Have been using it for about 8 months now, still working and looks great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Even strong coffee tastes goodes smooth
reviews.reviewText: Recently returned from Europe. They take coffee seriously. We bought the Krups grinder/brewer for a better tasting coffee. What a difference!
Works fast

reviews.reviewTitle: We've been using this for a few months now with ...
reviews.reviewText: We've been using this for a few months now with absolutely no issues from a grinding perspective. It can be messy - especially in the early morning hours pre-coffee. But let's be real - for this kind of affordability, you can't expect a ton of bells and whistles.

reviews.reviewTitle: it only grinds fine--attempting to get any other grind leaves many large pieces and still makes some fine dust unsuitable for a
reviews.reviewText:
We've had one for years and it is reliable and does what it is supposed to do fairly well. As noted by others, it only grinds fine--attempting to get any other grind leaves many large pieces and still makes some fine dust unsuitable for a french press.

One frustration is that the grinding chamber is oval while the spinning blade clears a round space. This results in caked grinds in the ends of the ovals which must be manually cleared. A small frustration, but annoying when it could be fixed by a better design.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hard to clean because steel tin isn’t removable
reviews.reviewText: Tin irremovable

reviews.reviewTitle: always grinds, just dont overdue it, can powder ...
reviews.reviewText: always grinds , just dont overdue it , can powder as you want.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works like I thought it would
reviews.reviewText: Not much to say! Grinds coffee fast and uniform (for the most part). Like people say, there's no settings to adjust so you can't pick if you want fine/course, but since I have a drip coffee pot it works for me. If you have a french press, probably go with another model, as you can't get a uniform course ground. Only a fine grind.
Amazing product Thank you!!! wife loved them!!!!

This was my first grinder and it is just prefect for me. I use it solely for grinding seeds and spices, but I may start grinding coffee when my ground coffee runs out. You just hold the button a few seconds until it its as finly ground as you want. I do caution though that you thorougly clean the inside after spices so the next thing doesn't taste our small like that specific spice. Using a fine brush on the inside has worked for me, and washing the lid with soap and water. Five stars!!!
I love this grinder and use if for coffee and spices. It's basic and easy to use--which is just what I need for making cool drip coffee and grinding fresh spices:).

reviews.reviewTitle: Kitchenaid grinder is much more better than this
reviews.reviewText: hard to clean , makes a mess, Kitchenaid grinder is much more better than this brand
Always makes perfectly ground coffee. Easy to clean with a damp paper towel.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't grind to a fine powder.
reviews.reviewText: ALMOST able to make a fine espresso grind, which is a step above the coarse powder I can get. This would be perfect for nuts and seeds though.

reviews.reviewTitle: This grinder works well. The only negative is that ...
reviews.reviewText: This grinder works well. The only negative is that you have to hold it in place to grind and not just push a button and do other things.
This is a great product !

If you only need fine grind, this works well. Hard to get medium or coarse grind for a coffee press. And not hard to clean, which you should do before grinding a new batch. Not expensive4 and fairly quiet.
It grinds well. A bit noisy. I would have preferred a removable cup insert to wash so taste will not transfer. I have one for spices and another for coffee.
High quality product
it's great

reviews.reviewTitle: Occasional use - less than 5 months and it's dead
reviews.reviewText: After 5 months of OCCASIONAL use (less than once a week) the grinder stopped working all together. Save your money.
Very happy with this product. I ordered this product to grind coffee to put into re-usable filters instead of buying k-cups and it works like a charm.

Works great. Grinds faster than the one we were replacing. Only draw back is the grounds stick in the machine when you try to empty it into the coffee maker, causing you to have to unplug it and use your finger to remove the grounds stuck near the blades.
Very good product.

Great Coffee Grinder! The only complaint I have is there is no way to measure how much will be ground, so you have to guess on how much to grind for a specific cup size. Overall, it works really well!

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome grinder for a great price
reviews.reviewText: Awesome grinder for a great price. Has the perfect volume for about 1 pot of coffee (I like it strong). If you're looking to make larger batches of coffee you may want to get one with higher capacity but anyway, love this grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: User friendly, simple to use, low noise. ...
reviews.reviewText: User friendly, simple to use, low noise. To control the coarse, is just a matter of grinder more or less. I had a medium coarse for french press and there were a few bigger gorunds. But that's a matter of being used to it and shaking a bit?

This works great so far! We've used it to fine-grind oatmeal for our son's oatmeal baths.

My one complaint is that I wish the blades were not attached to the machine part. If they were removable it'd be a much easier clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job, but no removable pan
reviews.reviewText: This does the job quite well, but the lack of a removable pan makes the inside extremely hard to clean; the blade is is constantly in your way, not to mention a real danger to your fingers while cleaning, and of course you can't use much water or else risk shorting the whole thing out.
Love this product. I've been buying Krups coffee grinders for years. The last one lasted 20 years.
Works great

Does the job o.k. Slightly hard to remove all the ground coffee from inside, but we get it out with a small silicone spatula or pastry brush. This is our second Krups Electric Spice and Coffee Grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only last a couple of years and then gave out ...

On its third use the following occurred: during grinding the motor would slowed down; I could feel heat build up at its base; it emitted a burning smell. I immediately stopped using it. KRUPS F203 Electric Spice and Coffee Grinder with Stainless Steel Blades, 3-Ounce, Black

Going against the nearly 5Star rating will certainly turn heads, however, this product just doesn't live up to a decent secondary standard I require. Chopping, spinning, strong, smooth....YES! it is all those things, but is it better than the lowest priced grinder at Wallyworld? Not in the slightest. The best thing about this, was I didn't have to go out and buy it somewhere - it was just shipped. I'm lazy.
It grinds coffee very well, smoother than other ones five times as much....so if you want a great grinder, buy this one. However, if you want a CLEAN counter top, buy something else. Once you have mixed your beans/whatever up, there really is no great way to transfer without making a mess, or at least some spillage. So buy this if you don't mind the mess or don't be lazy and buy one from Wallyworld that makes spillage none-little.

I used to grind spices in a blender. When it burned out, I was going to buy a new blender. But I'm not a smoothy kind of guy, and I have a food processor for most other jobs a blender can do. But the food processor won't grind little seeds into ground spice. This coffee grinder will. And it's perfect for small batches that get lost in a blender. For some reason I can't bring myself to switch from my favorite pre-ground coffee to try whole bean in this grinder, but I've used it to grind black pepper and cumin seeds, and it works well. It gives off that familiar burning oil smell when it runs, which is true of most small kitchen appliances and, I'm sure, will diminish with time. This little unit is powerful, looks and sounds like it should last a long time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect spice grinder....probably works great for coffee too!
reviews.reviewText: We have had this Krups coffee grinder for 6 years and it still keeps ticking like new. I am not a coffee drinker so I haven't tried the Krups on coffee beans but it grinds whole spices beautifully (fast and grinds to a fine powder) and best of all is easy to clean. To clean, I usually throw the top in the dishwasher or hand wash. For the bowl of the grinder, I either pulse a few torn up pieces of stale bread or raw rice. The breadcrumbs or rice clean up all of the remaining spices, oils and odors and it's back to being good as new. If you love to cook and grind your own spices, this is the best spice grinder out there and an amazing value for your money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Like a 9 volt to the tongue!
reviews.reviewText:
I have been getting into Asian style cooking for a few months now and have been leaning towards the spicy side of things,so of course Szechuan cuisine and I have crossed paths. I keep reading about the "numbing" sensation that Szechuan peppercorns provide and have been very interested. I scoured the Asian markets near me (which in Toledo is not that many) and have bought them from three different places. All of them had a bit of a mild lemongrass flavor when chewed on but no discernable heat or numbing. I thought that maybe I just didn't have the capacity to perceive that quality to them.

Until I ordered these guys, that is. Not really think making about the ramifications of chewing on a single peppercorn, I tried one (just one small piece, really!) and holy bejebus, these peppercorns are the real deal. It still has a mild lemongrass taste but imagine that amplified by someone holding a 9v battery to your tongue...even after brushing your teeth and rinsing with Listerine.

These things are the real deal and intense in both flavor and red color. The ones I bought locally were all nearly brown, nothing like these. There may be other equally good or maybe better brands than these, but not that I have tried. If you are looking into trying Szechuan cuisine,you owe it to yourself to try these!

I suppose most grinders are noisy, this one is.

Wish it had a cord compartment, but no problems otherwise.

reviews.reviewTitle: The "old faithful" of grinders. Basic, but a good product.
reviews.reviewText: I've had a few of these over the years. They are very reliable and easy to use. Great basic kitchen gadget. Very powerful and reliable for its size.

At or near the foot of the price range, this machine grinds as fine as desired, quickly; and its hold is large enough to accommodate enough beans for about a dozen cups of Espresso. I had the same model once before and it lasted a couple of years before wearing out. Good value.
I used it for grinding spices. Never seen so good product like this. Very small and convenient.

I lost my original grinder during my divorce. It was made by Braun but I am positive the Krups version is the same. I don't have proof but I would gues my former grinder is still going strong and my new grinder is of the ilk. I am very happy with this product and plan to purchase another as a spice grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: really good grinder, came well packed and on time
reviews.reviewText: really good grinder, came well packed and on time, very happy. Just don't try wet stuff like raw ginger etc. i tried in desperation and had to clean it all out lol really great for coffee of course but also all dry herbs etc.

It is a good coffee grinder but the top is extremely difficult to remove. Once removed it makes a mess. I am buying another grinder, one with a removable dispenser. I would have expected better from KRUPS.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall good product, hard to get the coffee out
reviews.reviewText: My only complaint is that the transparent top is way too big to just unload the coffee on a standard espresso machine's filter, you need a tiny teaspoon to avoid spilling out the ground coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is what I gave her as I have one for myself and am pleased with it
reviews.reviewText: My daughter asked for a coffee grinder for Christmas. This is what I gave her as I have one for myself and am pleased with it. I don't drink coffee. I bought it for myself as a spice grinder.

Since I grind one pound of coffee at a time for my cold brewing system I thought this coffee grinder may have been too small. I was very surprised when it took less than 3 minutes to grind a full pound. Very satisfied with my purchase!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good -- But not for French Press
reviews.reviewText: Fantastic and durable grinder. But Amazon recommended this product for a French Press --- I highly recommend this product but not for French Press. It grinds too fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well for grinding my wife's coffee. Do not--under ...
reviews.reviewText: Works well for grinding my wife's coffee. Do not--under any circumstances--put this under water to wash it. Believe it's supposed to be waterproof. It's not.
Grinds evenly. Fast. Easy to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't like that it doesn't have a removable cup for grinds
reviews.reviewText: Don't like that it doesn't have a removable cup for grinds. It does a great job grinding, but I'm partial to a removable cup to move grinds from grinder to coffee pot.
After only using this a handful of times the engine has stopped working.

reviews.reviewTitle: Motor stopped working after a year and a half of casual use.
reviews.reviewText: In the last 16 months of ownership, I'd grind coffee beans maybe once a week but with plenty of multi-week gaps with no use. Never used it for anything else. Always wiped down with damp cloth to clean; always kept in dry climate.

reviews.reviewTitle: Interferes with radio signal, knocks out wifi!

When I use mine, all radio signals (TV, radio, wifi) are completely jammed until I stop using it.
As for coffee, it grinds just fine, but some coffee does become stuck in the oval shaped tray and must be scraped out each time.

Love it!
Easy to use, easy to clean, and makes great coffee.
Love the burr grinder

I have never owned a coffee grinder before but this one seems to work pretty good for the price. It creats fine grounds. If you continue to leave the grinder button on it will start to create a layer of wet grounds around the inside of the grinder, but I would assume that this would be the case for any grinder because of the revolutions. Not a big problem for me. I tend to pulse the grinder through my grinding periodand shake the canister a bit. Then you can turn the grinder upside down and tap the top of the grinder on the counter to release and stuck grounds. Great buy and would recommend.

Great compact coffee bean grinder. I have used it 10+ times already and it is quick and efficient. The only downside might be the noise, but I think that is probably true of all coffee grinders. I like the small foot print because I have so many kitchen gadgets already.

This item arrived on time. I used it for the first time this morning and was impressed that it ground the coffee beans very finely. It is easy to wash, small enough to store - not bulky, and is a powerful machine. I am glad I purchased it.
I shouldn't have bought it as it doesn't have settings, my fault for not reading the product information more carefully. I will probably just use it for spices.
This coffee grinder does a much better job of grinding the beans than the Mr. Coffee grinder. The reviews say that it lasts for many years unlike the Mr. Coffee which only lasted 1-2 years.

This coffee grinder has the kick and power! I have used various grindrs in the past and this little guy does a good/powerful job when it comes to grinding. Small and looks presentable in the kitchen...I recommend it!

I have been using this to grind my coffee for several months now without any problems. It has a great compact,clean design, and does a wonderful job grinding coffee and spices. It's affordable as well.

Works well for the price. It doesn't grind evenly if you want a coarse grind, but it works well enough for my coffee beans and spices. I wish it came with a little brush to clean out the grinder, but I'll buy my own.

I bought the grinder for my youngest son who loves different coffees. He says he can tell the differance from already grown from fresh. Krups makes the best coffee maker, in my option so that's why I bought Krups grinder.

It grinds spices better than anything I've ever tried. I used to use a mortar and pestal, but also tried different spice grinders. This one ground my spices very fine in no time flat.

We have another one for coffee. After experimenting with burr grinders, we came back to this model and are happy we did. It works!
Very Nice grinder

reviews.reviewTitle: Making fresh coffee is very easy and tasteful
reviews.reviewText: Making fresh coffee is very easy and tasteful . The only thing I can't figure out is how to get all the grinds out of the grinder. It sticks to the wall. I got a pastry brush and just brush it out.

This is the same coffee grinder my mom had 20+ years ago and I knew I wanted one of my own. If you're still on the fence, here's why I am a fan:
- You can grind it as course as you want: easy to control the size
- Super easy to use, easy to clean
- The volume of the grinder is just right: I usually fill it up with whole coffee beans and once I grind them I have as much as I want to brew 12 cups
- Can be used for spices, nuts and other things you want to grind up quickly

The only downside is that it once you grind your beans and lift the lid you might notice it spilling over the top and making a mess. I've perfected this process; here's my recommendation: once you finish grinding your beans, unplug the grinder and tip it upside down. Gently lift the base/machine with the lid on the bottom - this should avoid messes and make it easy to transfer your grinds into your filter/coffee maker.

I still have a $20 Mr. Coffee from 4 years ago but my coffee tastes a lot better because I'm grinding my own whole bean coffee using this!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for a blade style grinder
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this grinder to use for my coffee french press. Unless you are going to step up to a burr grinder, this is as good as I have experienced with a blade style grinder. The unit, like all blade grinders, does not produce a completely uniform grind. Its oval shape though, helps the beans to grind better than in units that are perfectly round and just tend to spin the beans without actually grinding them. There will be some trial and error involved in learning how to grind to your individual specifications, but the best solution is to be consistent with the amount of beans and learn how many pulses you prefer. The oval shape also makes pouring the ground beans into a french press easy and mess free.
Works really well! Perfect size! I didn’t want something to take up much space and it gets the job done!
The noise level is low other grinders I’ve used have been super loud
This little machine is really great. I can grind as much or as little, as coarse or as fine as I'd like! I'd buy it again for sure.

I've had this for two years without any issues. Put the filter on the counter, pour in the coffee, then put the filter in the coffee maker to prevent grounds in your coffee.
Do not use for espresso, as this grinder was not meant for it.
Does what it's supposed to do. I have no complaints with it.
Stopped working in a month. Keep in mind. Just a month warrenty so can’t even return.

The motor is quite powerful. When I first used it, I referred to this coffee grinder as the 'Binford 2000' of coffee grinders (which any Home Improvement fans might appreciate). It is well-made and durable - a good buy.
I also use it to grind spices but find it tricky to get the grinder clean and aroma-free. A little flaxseed residue is pretty benign but traces of fennel or coriander can be intense!

the perfect grinder to have at a great cost. You have to be aware how fine you grind but once you get the hang of it you will be a pro in no time. Plugs right in to wall and off you go to have fresher than fresh coffee each morning.

I've bought a few of these for both coffee and spices. It's a fine grinder, second only to my Braun (which seems to be out of production). I've used one for coffee for years, and use another for grinding horse medicine on a regular basis, so it can stand up to some abuse.

reviews.reviewTitle: Replaced my first one after 30 years.
reviews.reviewText: I replaced my first Krups after 30 years because the cord finally gave up the ghost. This one seems equally wonderful. I use it for grinding coffee and (a separate one) for grinding spices. Whizz Whirr!
Quality
Basic grinder by Krups. Had a one previously but kind of tore up the reservoir with years of abuse. Very solid though and works great, when used as designed, that is for grinding coffee beans.

I bought this Krups F203 grinder to replace one with the same model number that we've happily used for many years. (Note: some of the 5-star reviews on Amazon are for grinders that people have had for years; not for this newer version.) We got the new grinder yesterday and tried it once. The grind is completely uneven--some fine powder and some large chunks--and the motor makes a terrible
high-pitched screech. The new grinder, made in China, weighs 22.20 oz; the old one, made in Hong Kong, weighs 22.75. It seems that Krups has chosen to skimp on the product components at the expense of (at least this customer's) confidence in their brand.

The old grinder's button got inexplicably stuck in the ON position, so it grinds away when it's plugged in, even with the lid off. I called Krups customer service to find out what to do about it, and they'd never heard of that problem. I was going to return the old grinder to them so that they could figure out the problem for the benefit of other customers. Now I think I'll keep it and try to fix it myself.
I purchased because of cost and review. Serves its purpose but doesn't do a large or even smedium amount.
I USED THIS DAILY FOR COFFEE ONLY. ALTHOUGH IT GRINDS WELL, EVENTUALLY I BECAME TIRED OF HAVING TO SCRAP THE COFFEE OFF THE SIDEWALLS OF THIS UNIT. FOR ME, THE OVAL DESIGN LACKS IN ENGINEERING.

If I try, and push the cover on by forcing it, the cover then becomes too difficult to remove a second time and when I try, coffee flies everywhere.
My counter is a mess every time I grind coffee. I will look for another brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Classic design that is hard to improve on

It grinds fast, evenly. Clean up is a flash. I returned it because I thought my coffee was not tasty which after the return I found out it wasn't KRUPS' fault, but it was the coffee bean.
A powerful motor and sharp blades make this Krups coffee grinder a great buy! Very quickly grinds the beans down to whatever consistency you prefer.

I use mine to pulverize my daily seeds. It quickly whizzes them into a rough powder (the little motor starts to overheat if pulsing too long, but fortunately I don't need a uniform grind) and it cleans out easily by wiping with a dry paper towel.
I like this very much; my coffee taste even better freshly grind.

We previously had a Black and Decker, which stopped working after almost 10 years. This Krups grinder is about the same as the B&D: same noise level, same basic design, and same result. It grinds the coffee pretty well, and although it still makes quite a bit of noise when grinding, it isn't too bad. I do like that you don't have to line up the lid with the unit; the lever is on the lid, and once you have the lid on, you can just push the lever down to start grinding.

Overall, it's a good grinder, and does the job as well as my old Black and Decker.

With a few reservations, we are so far very happy with this purchase. I bought it on a black friday deal for my husband. At the time the coffee maker had very few reviews but all of them were good. Just before Christmas I returned to Amazon to look again at reviews and was so disappointed to see many people complaining about theirs not working correctly. I fully prepared myself to not like the coffee maker. I'm happy to say that my husband is completely blown away by the quality of coffee that comes out of this thing. Never having ground our own coffee before we're not sure if that's the main factor or if it's the maker itself. But either way he's beyond pleased. My only complaint like others have stated is that the machine in the grind phase is LOUD. Crazy loud. Much louder than a small hand grinder is. But I've been surprised to find that despite my husband getting up early to make his coffee the grinding isn't waking up myself or our toddler.

My biggest concern now is the longevity of the machine. I hope it lasts long term and that we're not dealing with a broken machine a few months from now.

perfect
small item but has great power, making all stuff become powder in less than a minute.

For the price, this is a wonderful little coffee grinder. It works very well, and so far we've been using it daily for several months. It hasn't had an issue yet. We usually wipe the inside clean with a damp paper towel after each use. You'll also want to be cautious when opening the product and when pouring the ground coffee out. When you open it, if you aren't too careful, sometimes some finely ground coffee will spill out. As long as you are cautious, this is entirely avoidable. Also, you have to watch that you don't clog the sensor with coffee grounds, otherwise some reviewers have said it may stop working. If you do manage to clog the sensor, it's an easy fix. Just blow it clean with either an air compressor or with the canned air you can get in most electronics sections at stores. It's the canned air used to clean computers and other fine electronics. Just blast a few gentle puffs of air into the sensor to blow out any coffee grounds that may be blocking it. Again, for the price this is a wonderful product and we truly love it. I definitely recommend this item!

We have used this brand for a spice grinder for several years, so when my daughter moved out and needed a spice grinder, this was our choice to get for her. She is very happy with it, as we have always been, and now wants another one so she can have one for sweet spices and one for savory. We use the Krups for our sweet spices and it handles cinnamon sticks very well. I crush them in half with pliers so that they fit in the grinder. Store-bought ground cinnamon just doesn't hold a candle to freshly ground cinnamon sticks. I used my Krups last night to grind the spices for a curry dish: cinnamon, cardamom pods, fennel seeds, coriander seeds, ginger root; it handles them all without any problems. (Cayenne, cumin seeds, and turmeric in a different grinder.) The Krups is well worth the price for the culinary rewards you get. I can't imagine ever going back to buying ground spices.

It grinds coffee just fine but the design is not well thought out. As an engineer, this annoys me. The base where the coffee is ground is not removeable so you have to scoop out your coffee grounds from around the blade. Since you can’t remove the blade/base you also have to run the entire assembly under water to clean it. As a result, there is definitely water getting under the base into where the motor is located. So far it still works after three washes so hopefully there are good seals underneath. Not sure why this is a best seller. Low price tag maybe? You can find something better.

I purchased this item just under two years ago and this morning the motor burned out while grinding coffee beans, like it does every other morning. And while the machine is now likely dead, this isn't the first time it gave me problems. Now I have to find another grinder. Needless to say I won't be purchasing this particular item or brand again!
Broke within 6 months!!!
I only gave this one star because it quit working after 2 uses! I really like the design, but after 3 uses the motor revs but the blade doesn't turn. Very disappointing.
I like it. It pulverizes stuff. It is a little bit difficult to clean though.
Received my coffee grinder today and used it immediately. Works perfect! Very compact, but grinds finely in seconds!
Works great! I'm so excited that I will never hand grind coffee beans again! Victory!
After many years, my prior coffee grinder stopped working very efficiently, so it was time to replace it. This KRUPS grinder does a very good job and I hope it lasts many years.

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the best for under $20
reviews.reviewText: We purchased this as a spice grinder and are very happy. The Krups came with high reviews in many cooking mags. I was skeptical when I saw the low price, but everything written is true. Fast, consistent grind, and quite.

I have used this model grinder for several years, but the last couple I have purchased didn't survive the burn in period? Thinking it was a cheaper switch on the newer model I took it apart and bypassed the circuit, no go? Will not be buying this grinder again.
Our last one only lasted 16 plus years so we absolutely replaced it with the same model. Does an amazing job.
Convenient and affordable price good for single or couple. Recommend!
I had the product for a couple of months. Used a total of 15 times and the motor locks up. Do not buy!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: JUNK. I have to smash it on the counter to get it to work.

Awesome product. Great design and looks really nice.
Destroys my coffee beans in no time to a fresh and soft ground.

Nice grinder. Works well. Easy to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: I wish I knew about this earlier!
reviews.reviewText: My first time ever using this or grinding coffee. So easy! Coffee is so much better and fresher! I love this size because it's only for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for what we need it to do
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for what we need it to do. Sometimes it seems a little loud, but it's grinding beans so it's going to be, and the fact I hadn't had my coffee yet - everything seems a little loud. I've had it about a month and it works great.
Does a great job. Has not broken after 18 months of light use as a coffee grinder.
Awesome buy! Grinds everything really well. Small batches might be an issue, but who cares! Great stuff!

reviews.reviewTitle: One year and over 30 lbs of coffee and it still works!

best grinder I ever owned.. makes the flax very fluffy

So the grinder works. It grins on one speed, fast. It grinds the coffee to powder. Great, right?

No.

You have to unplug the entire grinder and then pour the ground coffee (or whatever else your grinding), into your whatever your trying to get it into. The cord is less than 2 feet. Annoying. A good grinder should act like a blender....a removable cup that has the ground in it, and it clips into the motor attached to the actual grinder.

With this unit, you have to clean the grinder and the top cover.

Returned.
Great
Great

I specifically use this for grinding my coffee beans. It gives a nice fine grind in about 7 seconds. If you're using a French press, don't fear. If you hold the button for a few seconds it gives a course grind perfect for whatever you need.
Perfect for grinding spices and seeds.

Grinds very well, my only issue with it is that you have to manually wipe the container (moist paper towels work) since ground remains do not completely spill out. You cannot put water in the grinding container.

good

ok deal!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Would think better quality is a must for the price

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this grinder! Owned it since 2009
reviews.reviewText: I bought this item on November 12, 2009 and it is still going strong. I have used it almost daily since I purchased it. I have mostly used it for coffee beans, but have ground up a few other things, like dried goji berries and similar berries/nuts. It works better than any other grinder I've owned. While I recently stopped drinking coffee, I will be using this to grind wheat berries into flour. It's small, so it doesn't take up a lot of space and it works very well. I've never had any issues, but if it ever stops working, I will buy the same grinder again.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... you are an Indian and want to grind spices like Mustard or Poppy (Posto in Bengali)

reviews.reviewTitle: Problem of this may be a one off but, I will not try this again. I have replaced it with another brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: best grinder I have ever used
reviews.reviewText: lets start this off by saying I am a classically trained chef and have been professionally cooking for just over eight years. I have used about 6-7 different brands of lesser grinders for spices that I have never seen live past 6 months. in addition to not lasting very long, these other grinders do not grind very well (often resulting in overheating and a lessened life of the grinder). the krups grinder is efficient, often times getting about a 1/2 cup of spices ground fairly fine in a few seconds. I've never seen a grinder work this well, and I would highly recommend this product to anyone who wants a great grinder at a very reasonable price.
I use it every morning. Works great! I put 8 Tbsp of coffee beans in it. Takes about 10s to turn them into a fine powder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quiet grinder that does a good job
reviews.reviewText: I've been using the grinding attachment on my NutriBullet blender to grind coffee. The NutriBullet does a good job; but is extremely- possibly dangerously - noisy. I bought the Krups based on a recommendation from Cooks Illustrated. The Krups works well, is very easy to clean, and much quieter than the NutriBullet. My only complaint is the limited capacity of the Krups compared to the NB. In a single batch, I can just barely grind enough beans (about 60 gm) for our 40 oz. pot. Of course, you can grind multiple batches for larger pots when needed. A word of advice about using this style of grinder -- to get a uniform grind, grind in short pulses rather than continuously. Visually check the grind after each pulse through the clear top. I've found that this method assures a precise and uniform grind, with minimal coffee dust.
One of the best grinders on the market. This is my second purchase. I will use it to grind my flax, chia and hemp seeds. I use the first one to grind my almonds everyday. I highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not for the coffee "experts" - but "I love it"
reviews.reviewText:
NOT for snobs - everyone else = this is what you need!

I tend to only write a review when something is wrong with, or, the product excels.

This would be the latter.

Our bullet (#3) expired - why we bought THREE i'll never know...

So I went in search of a coffee grinder, and went with "old faithful" - I say that because it seems i've always had one (before the bullets) and I don't recall ever having a problem with one EVER...

... and of course you read the reviews (don't you!) and I found all the poor reviews were written by said "experts".
In the end I ignored this fixation with a Burr Grinder, and settled upon a product that has been around for 20 years or more - yes the design is slightly different, but it's basically the same.

Simple! Remove top (one hand) put a quantity of beans in the grinder, replace top, push down for as long as you wish - the longer the finer the grind "surprise surprise".

French Press maybe 5-10 seconds, Espresso maybe 30 or so.

The resulting grinds are very even, despite the complaints from the "experts"

Think about it anyway, even IF the grinds aren't perfectly ground - does it change the taste of your coffee?
No!

Ok to be fair I will find ONE "con" - you will need to find an implement to loosen the grinds that get stuck under the blade! That is all.

This is the perfect all round grinder, for a fraction of the price of one of those "fancy" grinders!

We have 2, one for coffee and one for spices, that way no worries about cleaning completely.

I highly recommend this to others, thanks for reading.

Unfortunately, this grinder does not include a settings control, so if you want your coffee (or spices) ground "coarse" instead of "fine," you need to "time" how long you grind it. Really?? Many cheaper, and just as well made, coffee grinders include this important feature. Shame on you, Amazon, for including this as a "combo" purchase with a product that requires a specific type of coffee ground (coarse vs fine). At least I was able to get this returned for a refund, but now I have to go out and buy a grinder so I can try out the coffeemaker I just received.

This product has so many reviews that it hardly needs me to add my hosannas; nevertheless, here I am. This is my third or fourth Krups grinder in about a billion years and only one replacement was actually due to deterioration. I have one grinder for coffee and one for spices. It is a simple machine and has always worked for me whether grinding for espresso, drip, French press, or even Arabic/Turkish/Greek (if I missed anyone, I apologize). My secret for happy use is to pulse rather than just grind away. I also stop occasionally and gently shake the grinder (holding down the lid, of course) to help achieve a more consistent result. This adds very little time to the operation. I don't clean the coffee grinder after every use, but a slightly damp paper towel followed by a dry one has always worked well for me. Like another reviewer here, I usually grind up a piece of bread in the Krups I use for spices--it not only leaves the machine clean, but absorbs the scents of aromatic spices. Really, why spend more if you, like me, are a simple soul who doesn't need or want too many furbelows for a cup of coffee or a little ground coriander?

reviews.reviewTitle: powerful little machine has its limit
reviews.reviewText:
After so many contradictory reviews, I have decided to give it a try on this controversial product, based on the fact that at least many of the reviews were good. I used it to grind ginseng (or chop as one of the reviewer indicated). On the first try, it was all good, powerful little machine ground well with the cup full of ginseng. On the second try. it was not so great. Like many reviewers pointed out, it kept humming and not working. But only the second use for a new machine made it really look bad. I then tried to use it differently until I found out it was humming because the blade was stuck. I had to remove the stuck ginseng and move it above the blade and then it started to grind. In summary, this product works fine if you put in small amount of "payload" and not get stuck. When it got stuck, stop the machine immediately. Keep the motor running while it is stuck can harm the machine. I have not ground any coffee so I can't say much of it but I would do the same:

1. Not to put too much in. Know its limit.
2. Remove the stuck from under the blade and try again.

Hopefully, it will then last a long time as many folks have had it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Quality Grinder, Could be Better
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this grinder to replace a Hamilton Beach 80365 model that had dropped on the ground and was not functioning. I didn't think there was much of a difference between coffee grinders, and reading all the rave reviews on this one, I went with the grinder that was a few bucks cheaper. The Krups grinder works as advertised and I don't have any complaints about its grinding capabilities. It makes quick work of coffee beans and you can grind as long as you like by holding down the grinding button. I have not had to use it for grinding spices yet but don't see why this won't work well too.

The downside to this grinder is that I find it leaves behind a lot of coffee grounds when I am done grinding. So there is always an extra task of cleaning up the grounds after grinding. A minor inconvenience, but kind of annoying since the Hamilton Beach grinder was less messy. The Krups also did not come with a brush to brush off the grounds that get stuck to the grinder, I am using the Hamilton Beach grinder's leftover brush for this purpose.
Finally, the Krups only has one grinding setting. Other grinders I have seen can grind finer to coarser depending on the setting that you pick (The Hamilton Beach used to have this feature). Again, a minor inconvenience but if you're ever looking to make drip coffee AND/OR expresso and need to finely grind your beans, I'm not sure this Krups grinder can get them fine enough.

The Krups is a good grinder overall and it works as advertised, but I would choose the Hamilton Beach grinder over this one next time.
Does the job!

NOW, That's a great grinder.

The KRUPS Coffee Grinder has been working very well for my needs. I am by no means a coffee connoisseur, (I just wanted to start buying whole beans) so I can't speak to the quality of the grinds. It grinds quickly, quietly and finely. To clean the grinder I bought a tint brush for under a dollar at a beauty store and that does the job just fine. If you make coffee just to get through the morning, this will work great.

I heard a lot of really good things about this coffee grinder on several different websites...including this one. Everyone was recommending this grinder over even the really expensive ones. Well I bought it, and I'm now a believer. This thing is as good as everyone has been raving about.

BTW, don't listen to the "fine grind only" yahoos. You can pulse grind with this, so you can make your grinds as coarse or fine as you like. I use it exclusively for my french press, and is works perfectly. I like a coarser grind for that, and sometimes let those half cracked beans fall in there too.

Buy it, and look back only to spread the love and leave a review!

reviews.reviewTitle: YOU CAN'T WASH IT . . . . Update: it corodes
reviews.reviewText:
I've had this grinder for almost 2 years and use it about twice a week. I use this to grind spices, and it grinds them well. However, you can't wash anything other than the cap. So maybe this would be fine for a coffee lover, but if you're grinding cumin you're going to have a hard time not getting cumin in whatever you grind next. My cap has also cracked, but since it's been working fine cracked for six months that's more of a "by the time it breaks I'll probably feel like I got my money's worth". So it's functional, but you'll probably going to be annoyed and have mixed up tasting spices. Personally, I'm going to be gifting myself with a new grinder soon and it will be something different.

Update:
I don't know why I haven't bought a new one sooner, but I noticed corrosion on the inside on what I thought was the stainless steel cup so it's in the garbage and I'm shopping for a new one. On the bright side, it did last 3 years.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stupid Design Flaw for Simple Product
reviews.reviewText: Bummer - I had my old one for at least 10 years but this one has an OVAL reservoir for blades which of course spin in a perfect CIRCLE, so the coffee gets ground too fine and gets stuck in the ends of the oval. This is why others have complained about the sludge in their coffee. The obvious solution would have been to make the reservoir ROUND, not OVAL. You end up having to use a brush to get out the ultrafine coffee trapped in the ends of the well. Truly idiotic, especially for a company like Krups, which traditionally made such beautiful products. So, I'm looking for another new one now. At least it wasn't horribly expensive, but still.....

reviews.reviewTitle: This coffee grinder is awesome and simple to use
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder is awesome and simple to use. It really gets the job done. We use this for multiple things also. I can use this to grind up herbs, seeds, and coffee. You can't clean it using water, but it's really easy to clean - just wipe away with a paper towel after each use. Or if you insist of using soap, just use a small amount with paper towel and clean out just the inside. I wouldn't get the exterior wet though. I've had this for a couple months now, so this review is much deserved. The speed is really fantastic, I feel like it's high quality grade - something they might use in a small coffee shop. Love it! Would definitely recommend to anyone who loves coffee and needs a coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grind your own spices fresh and you'll never go back
reviews.reviewText:
I use this mostly for grinding mustard, cumin and corriander seeds for various simple recipes and it makes a world of difference grinding them fresh. I can only assume that the spice companies remove the more solid parts of the seed husks to make their powders as fine as they are and that that makes a world of difference for the flavor. It's so easy with this that I just measure out the ingredients, put them all in the cup, grind them and just dump the mix in.

And a surprising bonus is that it's easier to measure seeds than powder anyway so there's less spilling.

I personally use a slightly different blade grinder which has settings and auto stops rather than a press and hold, very similar durability. It might be my imagination but I like the coffee I hand grind in a ceramic (conical?) burr grinder which crushes the bean into dust rather than slices to dust. It may just be the workout I get by hand while waiting for the water to boil that makes it seem better.

Either way, blade or ceramic crush, this grinder (blade) will grind fast and be a good buy to get your coffee ground.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only a shadow of it's former self
reviews.reviewText:
I was given a Krups model 203 in 1976. It worked perfectly, every single day... until I dropped it, two weeks ago. I'm getting it repaired now.

The replacement I bought, the 203-42, is not as good. The plastic is flimsier. The motor whines at a more irritating pitch, but is less powerful. The cord is shorter... inconveniently so. And the smell? Every time I use the grinder, the smell of burning rubber/plastic overwhelms the aroma of my dark roasted beans. I seriously fear a meltdown.

Let me say, the grinder does grinds the coffee beans. That IS the bottom line, isn't it? But it doesn't do it as easily, as pleasantly, or as conveniently as the original model for which I so patiently wait to return from the shop.

I purchased this one to replace my old, good, but broken-lid grinder - don't understand the good reviews - this grinder is impractical. The lid is very stiff to come out and even to put back in. The bottom (as on picture) part of the lid - the one that goes inside the grinder - serves like a cup, but a cup with its outer side rubbing against the grinder's inner wall, which is always covered with coffee. Effectively the "inner" (as viewed vertically) side of the cup (the one that touches the grinder's inner side) becomes the cup's OUTER side when you pull it out, covered with coffee particles that rub against the grinder's inner wall and make it very hard to both pull it out and put back in due to excessive friction, not to mention that having a cup that has its OUTER side covered with coffee just plain makes no sense. The "ingenious" (due to its simplicity - no hinges) design is bad - if you pull too hard, and you have to - due to friction of the coffee particles - the particles just get spread all over the place. 100% bad design, stay away.

It grinds coffee. If you apply power to the motor for about 15 seconds, it grinds REALLY fine. That's great for espresso and for use in an AeroPress. Otherwise, it's too fine. Like all blade grinders, the size of the particles is not uniform until the spices or coffee are ground to a fine powder. Trying for a coarser grind, say for a French press, leaves a lot to be desired. I've also tried this on caraway seeds and cumin seed. For anything less than a full tablespoon, the grinding blade won't even touch the spice seed, and even then does not produce a uniform result.
I can use this grinder to ground nutmeg, chia seeds, flax seeds, etc. It is fast and efficient.

This is a fantastic product!

I gave it 4/5 because I don't use it as a coffee grinder, and don't feel qualified to rate it that highly when I use it for a non-primary purpose. I use it as a spice grinder, in which capacity it works wonderfully. Home made garam masala is a cinch with this grinder that performs well and quickly. Everything from stick-cinnamon to cumin is pulverized (literally) by this efficient grinder.

My only nits to pick are these: it doesn't perform quite as well when you are only grinding, say, 1 tsp. of anything (it seems to need a little more in order to force stuff down into the blade; a Tbsp. always does well); and the clear cap which, I suppose, is to allow easy viewing of the ground material, couds with use. I don't know if it's from the oils in the spices or the abrasion of the little bits flying around all the time.

Super pros: great motor, durable parts. I had one for the better part of 5 years before I had to replace it (which I did with another of the same model). The blade is the only one I've seen that is angled up on one end and down on the other, allowing better agitation of material that has settled toward the sides. The Cuisinart and the Mr. Coffee both have blades that angle up at both ends, and I can't see how these would be able to reach down and convince the coriander seeds in the bottom of the grinder to come up and get powdered.

If you want a coffee ginder, I don't know how well this will do. But for a spice grinder this is an excellent choice.
Great product, very loud- but grinds my coffee beans in about 3 seconds. Super fast! I like to add a little cardamom to the coffee beans and it gives it a lovely flavor.

After reading the reviews, I thought I'd give it a try despite not knowing how fine to grind. It was super easy to use and I could make at most two cups of coffee for our pour overs. We traveled with it too grinding coffee at our MIL's house when we visited. Sadly, the grinder only lasted us 7 months. We can hear the motor trying to move, but it's just stuck. We tried cleaning it and to no avail, the blades don't move anymore. We thought some coffee grinds ended up getting stuck in it. I loved that thing when we had it. Even though the price is super affordable, we decided not to repurchase this item and get a hand crank instead.
What more can one ask for in a coffee grinder? Especially at this price, this is a great value for the coffee enthusiast who insists on fresh-ground beans.
